Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: staceyBBoyd
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful hotel, enjoyed every minute of my stay. The staff were so welcoming and added a very personal touch.

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: Outstanding service, genuinely helpful staff and a great location. We would endorse all the many other 'Excellent' ratings that Sirkeci Konak has received and would gladly recommend it to our friends. It is clear that the staff gety a real kick out of making their hotel as good as it can be. Impossible to fault.

Reviews.Title: “As good as the reviews would suggest”
Reviews.Author: likes_to_go_abroad
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on proximity to the tram, attractions, etc. Only then did I find the great reviews here, which are quite true. Service was excellent, staff was very helpful and knowledgable, and it was the overall experience that made the trip a joy. When I mentioned to a friend that I was to visit Istanbul, she asked where we were staying- I told her, and she said "Great, because I wouldn't let you stay anywhere else!" I didn't even know she had been to the city...

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: IshtiJaved
Reviews.Content: 4 point review -Located in the heart of Sultanment near the Basilica Cistern. Lots of restaurants and shopping within a few meters. There is also a tram station nearby - The rooms are well laid out with wooden flooring and a host of amenities. First time I've seen a hotel offering a brochure fulll of extra things that you can avail of! - The service is exceptional. They go out of your way to make sure all your requets are met. The parting gift is a real nice touch - It might be a tad on the expensive said @ 150 Euros a night (I booked at the very last moment), but well worth the stay. Lose yourself in their perfect hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: scottie98
Reviews.Content: Everything said about this hotel is true! Absolutely a pleasure to stay here, from the welcome drink on arrival, to the farewell gift as we left. We used their pick up service from the airport, and the friendly driver was waiting happily for us, even though it was over an hour from leaving the plane to reach the arrivals hall.

Reviews.Title: “An Unexpected Turkish Delight”
Reviews.Author: Margaret H
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the favourable reviews but even so we were surprised by the friendly but very professional staff who personally welcomed us to the hotel with a drink and a copy of the daily program which included free tours and in-house activities. The staff went out of their way to make sure that everything was as perfect as could be for us. Our room was comfortable and clean. The breakfast menu was superb and the restaurants attached to the hotel were more than adequate. We enjoyed the free cooking class and the walking tour of the Hans in the centre of the old town. The only downside was we had only booked for 3 nights and would happily have doubled our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific service deserves another mention”
Reviews.Author: GoldenBean
Reviews.Content: There are so many positive reviews about this hotel, it is difficult to offer anything different. However here are few examples of how exceptional this small, pleasant hotel was for us. We arrived after a very long trip (thanks to Air Canada's potential for strike) and my partner's luggage did not arrive with us. We were met by the airport transfer arranged by the hotel (and complimentary with our package) and after a short drive arrived at the hotel. We were immediately greeted by a pleasant young man who offered us a drink, gave us the rundown of the hotel and offered to follow up on the lost luggage. The diligence of the staff continued with this follow up frequently over the next day and the bag eventually was delivered to our room. There were so many fine touches over the course of our stay: A complementary wine and cheese tasting with ample quantities of both; afternoon snacks and tea in the lounge; excellent breakfast buffet every day with lots of delicious coffee; and a comfortable sleep after touring around this fascinating city. The staff greeted us and other guests with courtesy, offered to assist with all our needs, made recommendations for local seafood, and arranged for our transfer back to the airport at the end of our stay. We felt so comfortable and well cared for throughout our stay! Highest complements to the management of this excellent hotel - we will be sure to recommend it to others travelling to Istanbul. Note: as we were staying five nights, we took a package that included many extras including one-way airport transfer, wine & cheese tasting, cooking class (this was missed because we lingered at the Chora Church - a sight not to be missed), and first night dinner in the restaurant next door. This was terrific value on top of the great service we received.

Reviews.Title: “A really great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GSBC
Reviews.Content: Wouldn't fail to recommend this Hotel to any visitor to Istanbul. The staff, rooms, food are great but best of their service is exemplary. Nothing appears to much trouble and all staff members go out of their way to help if they can.... And just as importantly everyone appears to be smiling all of the time which makes a very pleasant change compared with some hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Wow What service”
Reviews.Author: jarkins99
Reviews.Content: Wow, what service. We had been in Turkey for two weeks doing a tour in which we stayed in 9 hotels of different chains. Some were very good most were good and only one was poor. On our return to Istanbul we finished our tour and moved to our new hotel closer to Sultanhemet. What a surprise this was. On arriving we were not treated as a number but as part of the family, come into our lounge, have some Cay (tea) and sit down and we will do the paperwork. Even thought our stay was only two nights we were able to participate in their free services which included Afternoon Tea each day, a cooking lesson on Turkish food and then we eat it in the restaurant with a glass of wine and the 4 hour walking tour of the Sirkeci area. All were free and when you add the great service, wonderful rooms and fantastic food, this hotel must be the best available. And to top it all off we were leaving we were given a gift. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “This is the best ! Don't dare to go to another !!! Best in town !!!”
Reviews.Author: BettyNYC
Reviews.Content: We are a familly from Dominican Republic . We wanted to go to Istambul and searched on Tripadvisor recomentations. After a lot of nights we picked this hotel.Comunication by e mail was excellent.Very good english. Asked for pick up at airport(FREE).We stayed for 4 nights from March 29 to April 2 2012- The hotel is very very well located, very safe, very clean.When you arrive they offer a free dinner...which is very good. We asked for family room..they gave us 2 conecting rooms. Rooms are not like american hotels, they are small...like Europe standards.Rooms were very good TV,nice shower, nice bed etc.Hotel is small but this is an advantage...they take care about you...and they are for you. The best of all for us was the breakfast, which is EXCELLENT. Its one of the best we have ever had...5 star. We had to take a plane at 11 pm and check out was at 1 pm..we asked for late check out....They let us stay on our rooms until 8 pm and no charge. We were the first Dominicans to stay on that hotel...All staff very friendly, manager etc. If you wish to contact us a.hernandez@codetel.net.do Thanks all you Sirkeci Konak....this is one of the best stay we had had. When we return to Istambul..WE WILL BE THERE AGAIN !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant service, as good as the reviews on Tripadvisor!”
Reviews.Author: CasCam
Reviews.Content: We booked because the reviews were so good, not sure that anything could live up to them, but I can't praise the service at this hotel enough, helpful, friendly, nothing was too much trouble. The hotel itself is clean, well equipped with lots of thoughtful touches, and it's in the perfect area for seeing the best of the old city, but it's the staff that set this place apart. It's like a family hotel where every member of staff is a member of the family, can't praise it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Its all been said before”
Reviews.Author: AhlanM
Reviews.Content: Writing a review for this hotel is rather pointless as everything that can possibly be written about it has already been written by someone else. I totally agree with all the positive comments that have been made. I also agree that the rooms and swimming pool are small - but then that is only to be expected from a hotel in this price category so close to all the major sites. I was initially dubious by the offer of 11% discount if I paid in cash, but I am glad I did as this is a significant discount. I have no idea why they offer such a large discount for cash - perhaps Turkish banks have expensive transaction rates - whatever the reason I recommend taking this offer. The offer of a complementary airport transfer and first evening meal was yet another bonus. Free Wifi from both rooms and breakfast/lobby area as well as access to PC and printer as well as complementary bottles of water every day was appreciated. I hate hotels that try to charge excessive amounts for these cheap items -sadly so many do. Fortunately not the Sirkeci Konak! :-) To avoid the huge queues at the Topkapi Palace & Harem as well as the Hagia Sophia - book your tickets on-line and print the tickets using the hotel's printer. The tickets are not time nor date specific so you can use them anytime. I have no idea why more people don't do this - perhaps they enjoy queuing for literally hours?

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with our stay and the free breakfast was excellent”
Reviews.Author: minijjeanie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 days. A great stay. The staff was exceptionally great with us (and our two kids). The entire staff was friendly and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Rfmckeon
Reviews.Content: All the staff were wonderfully friendly and super helpful. The location is ideal if sightseeing and has plenty of beautiful restaurants within walking distance. The tram stop is very close and is a great way to get round the city and avoid the notorious Istanbul traffic. Rooms are clean and the breakfast was suitable for those with a western palate. We combined a business trip with pleasure and the hotel was also a perfect base for business with free wifi in the rooms. An excellent hotel overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: alunwyn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sirkeci Konak for three nights in May 2011. Had good communication with the reservation staff prior to travelling, which included organizing an airport pick-up, great service at a good price. Warm welcome at reception whilst booking in, and enjoying a complementary cup of tea. The hotel is superbly situated within easy walking distance to all the major tourist attractions in Istanbul. The rooftop terrace was a lovely peaceful place to relax afetr a day's sightseeing. The one evening meal that we had at the hotel was not inspiring and expenxive, we had much better fare when eating out. Beakfast however was very good. The hotel staff are very attentive, they even noticed that my wife was celebrating her birthday whilst we were there and provided us with a lovely chocolate cake, However, I did find this attentiveness rather overbearing, especially when we were leaving, put it down to my British reserve.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in perfectly located hotel”
Reviews.Author: marco_fawcett
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The deluxe room was a good size with a nice balcony overlooking the park (sadly the rain prevented us getiing much use from it). Overall highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SunnyB64
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for five days last December and were very pleased with the location, the staff and the rooms. We were with two teenagers, 16 and 19, and I have rarely seen them so happy with a hotel (and we travel extensively). The staff made them feel welcome and really feel at home. We loved the mini-guided tours led by A. Okay and enjoyed the cooking lesson held in the hotel's kitchen. Can't wait to go back when they start their Istanbul tasting tour!! The location is perfect with views of the Topkapi gardens, a 5 minute walk to Topkapi and the Archeological Museum as well as a short walk to Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. There's convenient tram access to the Istanbul Modern and other locations. The only suggestion I have is to travel in late spring (April, May) or Fall. The weather in December was very cold and wet. Aside from that we were made to feel welcome in the warm, inviting hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite charm & impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingScot
Reviews.Content: Walk into the lobby of this gem in the heart of the old city, relax and enjoy the exquisite charm, delightful afternoon tea, delicious breakfast, and impeccable service. We thoroughly enjoyed the wine tasting. The staff members are 120% guest-focused and graciously bent over backwards to serve us for our 3-day stay. Turkish Delight welcomed us to our adorable room and the pool was refreshing at the end of a long day of sightseeing. Surprisingly quiet street. The Sirkeci Konak is is now another reason to make Istanbul a destination!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Perfect location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: simon r
Reviews.Content: Having seen the excellent reviews that this hotel has on tripadvisor, we booked a deluxe room for 4 nights. The room was as promised, spacious and on the top floor with a balcony providing views over the park and in sight of Topkapi Palace and Ayia Sofia mosque. The hotel location is perfect for sightseeing allowing you to easily arrive at the main tourist sites before the crowds descend and still be able to return to use the hotel facilities during the day. There is a tram stop just 2 minutes walk from the hotel door and its only a10 minute walk to the Ferrry terminal at Gallata bridge to pick up the boat tours for the Golden Horn and Bosphorous. Despite its central location the Sirkeci is in a quiet location and a welcome haven to return to at the end of busy day's sightseeing. The restaurants are very good and the food also, but most of al it is the staff who make this hotel such a nice place to stay. Everyone was charming, helpful and attentive and could not have done more to make our stay a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel recommendation”
Reviews.Author: JaneMJ186414
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four days (not long enough!) and thoroughly enjoyed every minute. All the staff were charming, efficient and professional, the rooms very clean and comfortable, and the breakfasts delicious and varied. The Hotel is in a quiet but very central location, within easy walking distance of many of the main attractions. This was our first visit to Istanbul and so the advice we received from the Guest Relations Representative was invaluable and helped make our visit such a success and one definitely to be repeated soon.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Istanbul, probably the world?”
Reviews.Author: drhatta
Reviews.Content: It's an excellent place and we highly recommend it. Location is perfect, staffs are super nice. Service is superb. Breakfast is good too. Do take their tours and cooking class. I wish all hotels are like this one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service - Exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Jemich
Reviews.Content: Sirkeci Konak is a lovely local Turkish style hotel with excellent service staff. I wish I could have extended my stay at the hotel! Very good location, walking distance to most old city attractions (e.g. Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, etc.). It also helps that the hotel is a minute walk away from Gulhane tram station, which makes it a breeze to travel around the city, given constant bad traffic conditions in Istanbul & taxi scams. The hotel went out of their way to make me feel comfortable - they adjusted the heater to air conditioning in my room, provided travel adapter. Even gave out a goody bag (filled with apple tea, Turkish delight & candy) when I departed. Breakfast is delicious and they attempt to modify the menu slightly every morning. You can also buy tram tokens from the front desk. I would stay at Sirkeci Konak again for my next Istanbul holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Most helpful staff, central location and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: b00jum
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with the Trip Advisor awards over several years on display. Staff will book tourist attractions and buy the tickets in advance.Cookery classes included and tour bus with guide to different locations all included in the price of your room. Overall a true gem with the most hepful of staff at all times

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: skinnspirit
Reviews.Content: From the moment of arrival, till departure, my stay here was superb. The hosts and service-desk folks were always gracious, even to the gift bag when I left. Tram tokens at the desk, information on how to go where, calling taxis, getting me a spare toothbrush, tea on demand, making reservations in restaurants--in everything these folks were utterly professional and good-natured. Excellent breakfast buffet. The room (I had a large room on the 4th floor with a balcony) was worth every penny. It was peaceful and quiet. The proximity to the tram station was a terrific plus, not to mention the location in the heart of Sultanahmet making most of the important sights within walking distance. Instant coffee, tea, and a Nespresso/DeLonghi/Segafredo machine made life very comfortable. A plate of Turkish delight and a basket of fruits, as well as a free meal in one of their restaurants the night I arrived, was greatly appreciated. I will certainly stay here again on my next trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: LibbyH1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great locattion within walking distance of most of the major attractions of old Istanbul. The staff was reasonably helpful, but they had trouble with understanding some of questions in English. The rooms were tastefully decorated, and they had an in room coffee service unlike many other Turkish hotels we were at. They did provide a couple of bottles of water in the room for us to drink. Afternoon tea was served daily as part of the guest services, and the buffet breakfast in the morning had a large select of foods to choose from. The odd things about the hotel were that we couldn't adjust the thermomstate as the staff claimed. When we explained that our rooms were just too hot, the management told us we should have just opened a window. In a large noisy city, we thought that was odd. Also, whe I was in the bathroom, I could talk to my children in the bathroom next door in very quiet tones. It was like they were in tha same room. For the most part, it was a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “â€œLocation - Location - Locationâ€�”
Reviews.Author: fly2it
Reviews.Content: I probably can't say much more than has already been said about this hotel. It is perfectly located for the main sights Haghia sophia, Topkapi palace, the Blue Mosque, the underground Cistern, spice bazaar and grand bazaar which are all within easy walking distance of the hotel. Gulhane tram station is just 50m from the front door. In my opinion it is the staff that make this an excellent hotel, they go above & beyond to help.The breakfast selection was excellent with a lot of choices. We tried the both restaurant at the Hotel which we highly recommend, the food and the service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Just brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Malachi C
Reviews.Content: Not only is this hotel within easy walking distance of nine of Istanbul's top ten tourist attractions but the staff are unfailingly charming and helpful plus all the facilities from the rooms to the sauna, perfect for city hotel. Nothing is too much trouble for any of the staff, there are computers and a fast, free wireless network. Complimentary afternoon tea is served with wonderful fresh sesame bread sandwiches and the buffet breakfast will satisfy anybody. You will not regret choosing this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lives Upto Its Reputation”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeNRI
Reviews.Content: Compact Hotel right next to the Top kapi palace , decorated in tradional Turkish manner . I was travelling for business , and was by myself . The taxi driver made circles around the Hotel trying to locate it .... he called the Hotel a few times and finally arrived . The front desk staff , quickly came out of the door as my taxi stopped at the entrance . He quickly carried my large suitcase inside and waited for me. The porter was busy elsewhere but took over my bag as soon as the checkin process was initiated . On my first ever visit to Istanbul , i felt very welcome as soon as i entered the Hotel . Check-in was very efficiently handled. They had available a higher category room available , which they were happy to offer to me . The room was on the top floor facing the Topkapi Palace with a small balcony . Room no 2502 , i loved the room , have not seen the others so nothing to compare to , but this one was good. The room was Large , clean , and well kept. The bathroom and room though designed in the traditional manner , was fitted with conveniences and appliances that you may need. The porter was very courteous and meticulously explained to me the various appliances in the room , and also about the various facilities in the Hotel . Every staff member I met was friendly and helpful. Nothing to complain about . They provide afternoon tea to all residents . I was never in the Hotel on time for it , but the set up looked interesting Located very close to all attractions of the old city. Less than 50 mtrs from the Gulhane Tram Stop. They truly deserve the rating they have on Tripadvisor

Reviews.Title: “what a result”
Reviews.Author: alex j
Reviews.Content: We chose the Sirkeci Konak because of the wonderful reviews we'd read, each mentioning its location, which was ideal, the condition of the hotel, which was spotless, and the professionalism of the staff, which was indeed the case. What I had worried about, though, was how warm the hotel would be. We were in Istanbul for four days in January when the temperature ranged 0 - 5C, with a spot of snow that later froze. Fortunately we were able to keep the room warm throughout our stay. Even better it never got too hot. This is a well made and well maintanied property and deserves the compliments previous writers have given. The daily refill of Turkish delight was one of many plusses. All in all a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Proud of its awards”
Reviews.Author: welshtrav
Reviews.Content: The hotel proudly displays it's four trip advisor awards that it has gained over the last 4 years. Staying here will allow you to find out why they consistently deliver in the highest of standards in all areas. It is a small hotel but it has everything a big chain could offer and more. It's unique staff give it the advantage over many hotels. With the warmest of welcomes and a reassuring explanation of everything, you are well set up to enjoy your stay here. Breakfast is a very good buffet served until 11.00 am. It has a great location and everything is within a 15 minute walk. The excellent tram service is about 20 paces away. We were met at he airport by the hotel car. A good move as it travels up a maze of streets to zig zag through the busy Istanbul traffic. There are presently two restaurants open as the roof terrace is open in warmer weather. We ate on our first night in the Turkish restaurant. The food was excellent as was the service and very reasonably priced. There is a small lobby lounge which is Greg for chilling outt in and hey serve afternoon tea with sandwiches daily between 4.30 and 6.30. There is also a small on site pool and the availability of a Turkish bath. This is our last evening and we are trying the fish restaurant tonight!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel”
Reviews.Author: AKholiday
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sirkeci Konak Hotel only one night -- but enjoyed it immensely. The service, rooms, breakfast, complimentary cooking class, and goody bag were all incredible. Thank you so much for an incredible stay.

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Fiona_Giovanni
Reviews.Content: A fabulous hotel close to all the major attractions. Right next to the park and close to the seafront for those who like to run! Very friendly staff for whom nothing is a problem - you experience Turkish hospitality as soon as you enter the hotel. Having a spa in the hotel with hammam, sauna and small pool is a real bonus and great way to unwind after pounding the streets of Istanbul all day. Excellent restaurants with authentic Turkish food and the added luxury of a little bowl of Turkish Delight in the room was a real treat.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: PhiladelphiaGypsy
Reviews.Content: I ended up here thanks to many enthusiastic trip advisor reviews and it still exceeded my expectations. While the location is wonderful and well situated a few blocks from the park and museums and the rooms are very clean and comfortable, as many other reviewers have noted, the staff and many extras makes this hotel. The concierges were wonderful, helpful, and insightful and happy to pick up the phone and make reservations and ask questions about food allergies for you. I was blown away by how caring (yes a strange word to use but somehow appropriate) the hotel was with us as well as other guests. They have a wonderful (free) tea time and the free morning breakfast is legendary and I think I can say the best morning spread I have seen in my life. We also attended a complimentary Turkish wine tasting in the hotel. They seemed to be the reverse of recent hotel and airline trends of adding on fees and taking away services with all of these unexpected extras included in a very reasonable price. I should add a special note on the restaurants affiliated with the hotelâ€”while generally somewhat wary of hotel restaurants we ended up eating at the hotel restaurant and other ones owned by the hotel group. I believe we even received either a deep discount or a free meal at the restaurant at our hotel on arrival. While I don't think I had a bad meal in Turkey the restaurants affiliated with the hotel had great food, the hotel's signature great service, and they were very accommodating and careful with food allergies. I can't recommend this place enough!

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't get any better...”
Reviews.Author: JumpthePond
Reviews.Content: On a whim we booked this hotel and as usual relied on Tripadvisor. I have to say that we never felt the need to write a review before this hotel. They really put a great deal of thought and time into their guests. Within the first 10 minutes I heard "complimentary" five times. It was refreshing. We even received a voucher for two free 3 course meals for our stay, which was 3 nights. It was by far the best meal that we had our entire stay. We stayed in 1309 which is their regular sized room with a king sized bed and it was spacious. We tried the Turkish bath and I had a massage - both were enjoyable and relaxing. The location could not be better, it is in within walking distance of major attractions and the tram line. To top off our stay, upon departure we received a gift bag with Turkish delights and other goodies. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the hype!”
Reviews.Author: jrs
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We chose it for a 6 night stay based largely on TA recommendations, and worried that it couldn't possibly live up. It did. Go for the best rooms, top floor overlooking the park - the back wall is all glass and the birds in the park are spectacular. So quiet... we could hear the birds singing. Our kids stayed in a small twin room across the hall from us. The staff went above and beyond, and treated our children like their own. They gave us great advice throughout our stay. We especially enjoyed having the hammam in the hotel - it was our first time using one, and it was a great experience. The breakfasts were interesting and had lots of local foods including amongst the more standard fare. As we were leaving, the staff gave us each gifts (turkish coffee set for the adults, tea and candy for the kids), and promised to bring the kids to see their favorite soccer team play if they came back to Istanbul. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel ideally situated.”
Reviews.Author: jcrewebrown
Reviews.Content: This quaint hotel is ideally situated in the old part of town. You literally step out of the hotel and the tram is right there. The rooms are comfortable and clean and the staff are very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “MUST stay here!”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl2517
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based off the WONDERFUL reviews other travelers had posted on tripadvisor...and SO happy we did!! Our flight was super late due to issues coming from Frankfurt and so our transportation that we arranged with the hotel was not there. We called the hotel and took a taxi...which they paid for when we arrived. The rooms were nice and comfortable...and the hotel was adorable! The breakfast that was included was amazing! Had just about everything you wanted...a great way to start off the day. Dinner was wonderful as well! Can't say enough nice things about the staff!! So kind and helpful. We really felt they went out of their way to make sure our stay was excellent--- and that it was! They offer a variety of FREE tours and tastings. We did a traditional Raki tasting. They provided the Raki (alcohol) along with a wonderful appetizer. The gentleman giving the tasting was so kind and helpful as well. Also... we paid cash when we arrived and received an 11% discount- plus a free welcome dinner. If traveling to Istanbul... you must stay at Sirkeci Knoak! The location is also unbeatable! We walked everywhere:) Thank you again to Sirkeci Knoak and it's staff for making our stay in Istanbul memorable!

Reviews.Title: “unbeatable”
Reviews.Author: surreymeadows
Reviews.Content: We were completely pampered and spoilt.Large room overlooking the park where storks were building their nests in the trees 100 meters away .Ideally located for the sights of old Istanbul. Would definately return and recommend it 100% to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “INCREDIBLY GOOD !!!”
Reviews.Author: derolle
Reviews.Content: There is nothing negative to write about this hotel. Excellent location in quiet area close to tramway station, perfect amenities and outstanding service. This hotel really is "the place to stay" in Istanbul. I travel a lot around the world as well for business as private purposes and the "Sirkeci Konak" belongs now to my top 10 hotels in Europe. Don't hesitate to stay there : it's wonderful !!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable hotel”
Reviews.Author: JacTehran
Reviews.Content: Six of us arrived at 10.00 am. Our rooms were ready and we were offered breakfast and a welcome drink. From then until the time we left, waved off by the owner and staff we couldn't have asked for better service. All of the staff were wonderful and couldn't do enough for us.The extras that this hotel offers ( cooking lessons, afternoon tea, wine tasting, film night etc) are truly wonderful. None of us would ever dream of staying anywhere else in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff & Location”
Reviews.Author: Altybe
Reviews.Content: The Staff was incredibly helpful and pleasant. We thoroughly enjoyed the service we recived from them. The location of the hotel is also great. It's very close to all the major attractions and restaurants. It's also about 100 meters from a tram stop which was very useful in getting to the New section of the city. The breakfast buffet was really good along with being open until 11AM in case you wanted to sleep late.

Reviews.Title: “More than AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: OurWorldas1
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 (including 2 young children) originally booked 3 nights at Sirkeci Konak because of the reviews on tripadvisor. We stayed for 7 nights not wanting to leave. This boutique hotel really knows how to make you feel like you've been invited into their family. They are amazingly hospitable, attentive to every need, charming, and that is just their service. The hotel itself is extremely centrally located, the sheets on their beds are the softest we've had in Europe, the haman and sauna and pool are perfect for exhausted afternoons (due to the kids not lasting all day touring this beautiful and magical city) and their food is just as excellent. We dined there for dinner (compliments of the hotel... thank you!) and naturally their breakfast was vast and delicious with plenty of choices for everyone. Many many thanks to this hotel and staff for making our trip to Istanbul so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME AND GORGEOUS (Dinner)”
Reviews.Author: aida_b1
Reviews.Content: We were for 5 days in Istanbul, actually in GÃ¼lhane Park Hotel, but we went to Sirkeci Konak for having Dinner (twice). The Location is also very good and in my opinion the best location to visit Istanbul as a tourist. The Personal was friendly, always helpful and with a wonderful behavior. Thanks to the best Chef and the Dinner-Personal!!!! The Restaurant was very clean and the Meal was AWESOME GRANDIOSE!! And comparing with other restaurants was it really cheap!! We've chosen to go next time to Sirkeci Konak Hotel! Thanks again!!

Reviews.Title: “My 3rd stay in Sirkeci Konak Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NabilSaber
Reviews.Content: It was an excellent stay for me and my family.They realy work as a family to satisfy the guest.Excellant food and they helped my to use the Recreation place for private family use after service hours. I recommend the place and I will book in Sirkeci Konak Hotel next time I come to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: lesyeuxverts
Reviews.Content: ! We have never stayed in a hotel where we would be treated with such attention and warmth. We just arrived to the hotel, and they offered us breakfast, which, BTW, was excellent and plentiful, even though we were not entitled to it on the morning of the arrival. The room was just wonderful, a bit small, but who cares if there is Turkish delight to welcome you and a wonderful view of the Topkapi and the park! They have free cooking classes, afternoon tea, rakia tasting (loved it with melon!), Turkish bath and sauna. But the best part was hotel staff- so helpful, friendly and considered of your smallest needs. It was cold in Istanbul, so we all were a bit under the weather and asked if they had vitamin C in their medicine box. They said they did not. However, while we were wandering charming Istanbul streets, they went to a pharmacy and bought two or three kinds of vitamin C. When we got back, they offered it to us without charge. Such consideration and genuine strive to help is pretty remarkable.

Reviews.Title: “Sirkeci Konak is the ONLY option for accommodation in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: alexandrosg
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days in Istanbul last week because of our wedding taking place there, at the Patriarchate. I am really lost for words... The guys working there are, simply put, out of this world. All of them with a huge smile on their face. Not a single one was sad or grumpy. Probably the most hospitable personnel I have ever come across.. I really want to point out here the ultimate help of Ezgi and Agah who have definitely exceeded themselves in satisfying me and the rest 15 people of my group! The hotel is ideally located next to Ayia Sofia and Blue Mosque, 10 minutes away from Grand Bazaar and 10 minutes away from the Spices Market. There is a tram stop at 1 minute away from the hotel, taking you to Dolmabahce and Taksim as well. Free transfer from/to the airport was included in the rate, as well as free dinner on the first night. (Free) Breakfast was also delicious, rich and had everything! Rooms were decorated in a traditional way and the hotel lobby was so cute and cosy (I can't remember how many apple teas and Turkish coffees we had there!) In a nutshell, next time we are in Istanbul, we will be heading straight to Sirkeci Konak... Ezgi, Agah and rest of the gang thanks so much for everything!

Reviews.Title: “what a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Carrie C
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Istanbul in winter; snow on the ground; freezing temperatures; but what a warm welcome at this hotel. Nothing was too much trouble. The room wasn't large but had everything and was toasty warm. It is perfectly located for the main sights (Haghia sophia, Topkapi palace, the Blue Mosque, the underground Cistern, spice bazaar and grand bazaar) which are all within easy walking distance of the hotel. The hamam (scrub and massage) at the hotel at 30 euros for about 45 mins was very good value and so convenient to pop up to the room. We didn't eat in the hotel restaurant (apart from breakfast (excellent)), but did try a number nearby and would recommend the Faros Hotel restaurant which was close by. The staff were very friendly and could not have been more helpful, the tea was plentiful - you can't go wrong with this place!

Reviews.Title: “What an understated hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnOB-12
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights. Coming from the UK, we were slightly taken aback how different it was to Europe. Fortunately, the hotel ran a tour the next day ran by Okay Alkan, manager of the hotel, who took us as a group through the old city, it was a tour de force, not only setting up the whole trip but giving us a fantastic panorama of historical significance. This initial Image created a momentum that fulfilled a wonderful holiday. The hotel staff and hospitality was understated but is thoroughly recommended for its traditional ethos and lingering efficiency. We felt relaxed, profoundly reassured among kind staff. The hotel is situated near all the main tourist attractions but it's main selling point is its gifted staff.

Reviews.Title: “Winter warmth”
Reviews.Author: thomoto
Reviews.Content: We chose the Sirkeci Konak because of the wonderful reviews we'd read, each mentioning its location, which was ideal, the condition of the hotel, which was spotless, and the professionalism of the staff, which was indeed the case. What I had worried about, though, was how warm the hotel would be. We were in Istanbul for four days in January when the temperature ranged 0 - 5C, with a spot of snow that later froze. Fortunately we were able to keep the room warm throughout our stay. Even better it never got too hot. This is a well made and well maintanied property and deserves the compliments previous writers have given. The daily refill of Turkish delight was one of many plusses. All in all a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a result!”
Reviews.Author: layerliz
Reviews.Content: We had booked into another hotel in the same group as the Sirkeci Konak, the Erboy Hotel. On arrival, they upgraded us to this hotel as they had a party of 117 schoolchildren at the Erboy and felt we would prefer an upgrade - too right!!! (See review on Erboy posted today). The staff throughout our stay have been very helpful and professional. Everything at the hotel is perfect, we can not find anything to be negative about. Maybe a small chest of drawers in the room would be useful but we managed by using the bedside tables to store our clothes. Complimentary tea and coffee and water were appreciated and the bed was very large and comfortable. We would recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Istanbul as it is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “An unforgettable and wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: r4321r
Reviews.Content: We had heard so many good things about Istanbul and Turkey, in general, that we felt it was time to experience this area of the world. We consider ourselves seasoned travelers and recognize a quality place when we see it. Staying at Sirkeci Konak exceeded our expectations in so many ways. We were picked up at the airport around midnight and the cheerful driver was right there to greet us. The hotel staff checked us in immediately and our bags were taken to the room. We booked our hotel for three nights in the least expensive category. We felt that after substantial jet lag and just getting acclimated it would not make any difference where we stayed. The room was decent sized and extremely clean. The decor of the room was indicative of what one would experience in Istanbul rather than the homogenized room one would find in any of the chain hotels. We traveled to Izmir, Ephesus and Cappadoccia by plane and returned to the same hotel for another five nights. This time we took the deluxe room which was considerably larger. It had a beautiful view facing the Topkapi Gardens, On the terrace we had a beautiful panarama of the city and a view of the Bosphorous Sea. The room was immaculate and thoroughly cleaned each day. The staff was helpful beyond belief. The gentleman at the front desk "A-Okay" could not have been nicer and genuinely concerned about our stay at his hotel. He exhibited similar behaviour with all the hotel guests and was very knowledgable about Istanbul. The breakfast was very good with a bountiful variety of food items. The wait staff was very professional. The hotel has two excellent restaurants, as we tried them both during our stay. The hotel is in a quiet section of the historic district and a short 10 to 15 minute walk to Topkapi, the Blue Mosque, the Cistern, the Haggia Sophia and the Spice Market. One could not ask for a better location. The tram was a few blocks away as well. If you need to make arrangements to other parts of Turkey there is a travel agency, Volare, right across the street . Their prices were fair and the owner was very competent. He arranged a lot of land tours for us while we were in other parts of the country. The agency can also assist with local venues in Istanbul. By the time we were about to leave the hotel, we felt as though we were a family member. We have stayed at high end hotels around the world. This matches and surpasses some of the best in terms of service and quality. If you enjoy immersing yourself in local culture and getting a sense of what Istanbul is about, Sirkeci Konak Hotel would be the perfect choice.

Reviews.Title: “NO WORDS TO DESCRIBE....”
Reviews.Author: vicky v
Reviews.Content: The sirkeci konak hotel was just amazing....everything was grate and the staff was fantastic.We felt like our home.The room was very big, comfortable and the most immportant very clean.Every day the crew changed our sheets and they cleaned our room.Breakfast had many traditional plates to choose and also international.All the plates was very fresh and the diiner very delicious.The best of all was the roof garden..very romantic for all ages..Something very helpful was that Sirkseci was next to the central station of tram.We want to send many regards to our friends of the hotel..cause we feel them like our friends..and we hope to see you all again very very soon.JOHN & VICKY

Reviews.Title: “The definition of hospitality”
Reviews.Author: BrassMD
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on the reviews and ranking on tripadvisor. I found it quite difficult to believe how highly ranked it was. However, I have just returned from a 9 night stay and can say without a doubt it is one of the most welcome places i have felt in my life. People might not give top marks for the food or rooms, but what makes the place exceptional is the staff. Everything was carried out in a very efficient, very friendly way and at the end I felt they had gone beyond even high expectations. We were even given a spare room after we checked out since our flight home left at midnight. Would i stay here again, undoubtebly. Would i recommend it as a place to stay? I was so impressed by the staff that I almost dont want to recommend it for fear prices go up or it gets booked out consistently. All the high praises are spot on!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stop Over”
Reviews.Author: Patrick N
Reviews.Content: We had a truly wonderful couple of days at Sirkeci Konak en route home to South Africa from the USA. It made for the perfect pit-stop and broke the journey to make it bearable. The hotel facilities and staff, as well as meals etc all go beyond what we expected. The indoor pool and in-house Turkish baths were absolutely brilliant, and a great way to finish the day. It is also about as well situated as can be, with an abundance of restaurants close by, and the tram to everything literally outside the front door. All in all, if you are making Istanbul a stop over, you will not be sorry if you choose to stay at Sirkeci Konak

Reviews.Title: “Made our stay”
Reviews.Author: Umba
Reviews.Content: I probably can't say much more than has already been said about this lovely little hotel. In my opionion it's the staff that make this an excellent hotel. They go above & beyond to help, everyone is friendly & chatty and very knowledgable. The hotel has thought of everything you might need from umberellas in the lobby area to robes & slippers to use in the rooms. I hope to go back to Istanbul one day and if I do then I will always stay here.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: simonduarte
Reviews.Content: Everything was great, The breakfast was excellent. Everything was excellent. Price great. I recomend this to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Best Value hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: jmnes12
Reviews.Content: Was there for a 10 night stay through Xmas and NY's. Staff were extremely helpful, the room was nice and clean, the location was excellent, just steps from the light rail. Close to the sites. Everything was perfect for the price. I'd challenge the 5 star hotels to provide this level of comfort and service.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the best”
Reviews.Author: Miranda D
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful surprise this hotel was! We stayed for 3 nights between x-mas and new year. To start with, we were given a transfer from the airport free of charge. The check-in was hassle free even though we came very early in the morning. We were offered breakfast and were given information on the city by Summit, from the hotel staff. We had booked a superior room but were upgraded to a deluxe one as there was no availability of a superior. The room was huge, with a jaccuzzi and a balcony with views on the gardens of Top Kapi and the Bosporous. One morning, after housekeeping, we found the bed made up with real flowers scattered on the sheets! What a touch! Breakfast was very good, (orange juice was freshly squeezed), the variety of breads being my top favourite as they bake their own bread on the premises. On the first night we had dinner in one of the hotel's restaurants which was included in the price we had paid for our stay. Very nice! Of course the location of the hotel is excellent, we didn't use public transport at all, everything, the sights, the restaurants, the grand bazaar are within walking distance. The hotel also organises activities like cooking classes and tours, we chose the walking tour to the fruit market and the greek area which was guided by Okay, one of the hotel's receptionists. A special thanks to all the staff each one of whom were polite, cheerful and warm. If we go again to Istanbul, which I hope, we won't look further than this hotel! Top, top, top!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a first visit to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: msv19650916
Reviews.Content: I just stayed for 4 nights between December 27th and 31st with my wife and 3 kids. The location is perfect for first time visitors to Istanbul, within walking distance to several of the main places to visit. This is a boutique/family hotel with a very cosy and friendly environment. Staff very nice and quite professionel. Although located in a busy area the hotel is very quiet. Very clean and up to date when it comes to the premises, rooms, etc. Excellent balance between price/location/quality of service. I will stay there again and certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Carol W
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we were made to feel that we were staying with friends where nothing was too much trouble. The staff went way beyond our expectations and our room was beautifully appointed, spacious, quiet and overlooked the gardens near the the Topkapi Palace. It is extremely conveniently located near the tram which made it easy to get around. Breakfast was delicious, especially the halva. Make sure you stay here, you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “A place to fall in love with.”
Reviews.Author: Zwulf
Reviews.Content: This is a most pleasant, charming oriental boutique hotel at the best location in Istanbul, just behind the garden of the Sultan's palace. We were made very welcome, got upgraded to the best room and truly enjoyed the hospitality and friendliness of the staff. A place to fall in love with.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: JennMar
Reviews.Content: We initially booked at Erboy but on arrival we were upgraded to sirkeci konak which was a few blocks away, and we are very happy that they did because konak hotel was one of the best hotels the 2 of us have ever stayed at. We stayed for 4 nights in middle of December. The most notable thing was the very friendly and helpful staff that made our stay very pleasant. They gave us advice on what to visit, where to eat, and where to buy things. The free guided tour organized by the hotel was also one of our favorite events in istanbul, when our tour guide Agah took us and several other guests to a side of istanbul that tourists could only see with a local guide. Additionally, I asked Agah about different restaurants that I read about on istanbuleats dot com and he highly recommended Zubeyir (grill house) and he reserved a table for us. Agah made sure we have a great experience at the restaurant as he reserved a table for us next to the grill where I sat almost next to the chef as he prepared my food. Agah prepared a special menu for us with a really delicious selection of food. When we arrived at the hotel, they not only checked us in, but sat us down with a complimentary tea and described to us the major attractions of Istanbul on a map. Our room on the 1st floor was very nice and clean with wooden floors. There was a dish of turkish delight waiting for us in our room which we really enjoyed =) The hotel has a small pool, sauna, and turkish bath. We didn't bring our bathing suits so we did not use the pool, but they provided towels that we could use in the sauna and turkish bath. A very nice man from the hotel staff showed us how to do the turkish bath properly as it was our first time. For breakfast, they had a very extensive selection of food that we enjoyed. They also had a nice selection of different teas. From 4:30 to 6:30 pm they offer complimentary drinks, but there was so much to do in Istanbul we never had time to come back. The hotel is centrally located in the historical district of istanbul, right next to a tram stop that can take you easily into the european part of istanbul. It is ~ 10 min walk to topkapi palace, ~15 min to hagia sophia, and ~20 min to blue mosque. It is ~ 15 min to Eminou dock where you can take the bosphorous tour or ferries to other parts of istanbul. When we left the hotel they gave us a complimentary gift including turkish delight, apple tea, and candies. I recommend figuring out where they buy their turkish delight because the ones we purchased for our family back home were not as delicious. I highly recommend staying at Konak. They staff will help you with anything and will suggest things for your trip that will really make it memorable, you should take advantage of this if you stay here! Additionally I also recommend going on their free guided tours which really shows you a side of Istanbul that a normal tourist doesn't see. I also recommend going to Zubeyir grill house (~130 TL for 2 ppl with 3 appetizers, 3 mains, and red wine). Another restaurant recommended to us by the hotel was Asitane restaurant which was also one of our favorite restaurants. It is next to the chora church which has nice mosaics. The restaurant specializes in ancient ottomon cuisine (~110 TL for 2 ppl with 2 appetizers and 2 mains). Other information that might be useful to you: We arrived at SAW airport and took the havatas bus to karikoy dock (8TL) and a ferry to eminou dock (2TL). From the dock it is walkable to the hotel ~ 15 min. You can also take the tram 2 stops as well. Another option is to take the havas or havatas bus (two different companies) to taksim square, take the funicular (its underground), and then take the tram to the hotel. Both options are quite easy and the people of istanbul are very friendly if you get lost (though they may not be able to speak english).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Amazing Room”
Reviews.Author: erinjilek
Reviews.Content: Very nice and original place to stay. The rooms are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Davo55_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations many times over. It's like staying at a family home but with more freedom. Staff such as Agah and Turker are obliging, friendly and eager to please. The establishment is clean and quiet (the double-glazed windows help). We were upgraded at no extra cost. The rooms are not large but they're very comfortable, with a bowl of turkish delight waiting on the bed. Bottles of fresh water were supplied at no cost each day; in fact, there were lots of 'freebies' - transfer from the airport (what a relief), cooking lesson in the hotel kitchen, tastings of Turkish wines and cheeses. The breakfast provided was a real treat. We really couldn't speak more highly of this hotel, its staff, and the effort they make to ensure that one's stay is really memorable.

Reviews.Title: “What more can I say?”
Reviews.Author: Sandra G
Reviews.Content: If a hotel can set the mood and outcome of a trip, Sirkeci Konak made my third stay in Istanbul most enjoyable. I accompanied my husband on a business trip and I appreciated the comfortably warm swimming pool for my exercises, Golden Horn visit, cooking classes and wi-fi connection in my room to surf if I was not out walking. The regional Turkish food served in the restaurant was excellent. I felt thoroughly at home pampered by attentive staff and will surely come back if I return to Istanbul again. A tip for future travelers, exchange rates get better as you walked up Sultanahmet and from Grand Bazaar onwards.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: MancaSal
Reviews.Content: This Hotel made my first Istanbul adventure really special. Even there were good reviews on Trip Advisor i did not expect much. But when i received great hospitality from this amazing Turkish people i was amazed. Stuff was so helpful for me. The had answer on all my questions. I wanted Hotel located close to all main sights, so that is what i got. This place is walking distance from Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. And food is delicious. One other needs to be point out - WiFi signal is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further”
Reviews.Author: gaillaw
Reviews.Content: When I saw the outstanding reviews, I expected to be disappointed in the actual experience. On the contrary, I was pleasantly surprised to find the service, location, and the hotel itself to be delightful. You will not get better service anywhere, at any price. I've stayed in some of the best hotels in the world and I can say that Sirkeci's service is comparable. My husband and I walked to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Spice Market, Grand Bazaar, and Topkapi without a problem. The location is excellent. One suggestion, which has been made by others, and which I would endorse, is to have the hotel arrange airport pickup. We grabbed our own cab at the airport, and he had trouble getting us to the front door of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best customer service EVER!”
Reviews.Author: monicamonica000
Reviews.Content: Wow...! We felt like 2 princesses in this hotel, what excellent customer service! Beautiful and super clean hotel on a perfect location. Will certainly be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Our return visit”
Reviews.Author: PalmettoLady07
Reviews.Content: Following a Black Sea cruise ending in Istanbul, we booked several days at the Sirkeci Konak. We had stayed here about two years ago and had been greatly impressed with the hotel and their service. After two years, it not only equaled the previous visit but exceeded it. They have now added daily free events for their guests including a tour of the Fatih Farmers Market where normal residents can find anything they want from food to underwear. A. Okay Alkan at the front desk led the tour and went above and beyond to make our stay memorable. As my husband and I prepared to depart, the staff lined up in the front lobby and shook our hands and we left! We felt like real guests! Not just paying cusomers.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alastair G
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 days at the end of November. Recent posts here say everything I would say, so I won't write at length, but I wholeheartedly endorse the compliments that have been written. This hotel is outstanding, and the staff were thoughtful, efficient, responsive and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “These people know the meaning of the word Hospitality...”
Reviews.Author: Phoebe M
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend in Istanbul, never been before, so trusted trip advisor in our choice of hotel. From beginning to end we enjoyed faultless delivery of true hospitality. Online reservation system is detailed and efficient; communication from the front desk immediately after reservation starts the attentive care we experienced throughout. As soon as we arrived we sat down with the concierge (Ramazan - who speaks excellent english) for a brief yet detailed chat of how to make the most of our short time in Istanbul. Arrangements were made for us to be part of the Turkish cuisine cooking lesson, which was great fun. Breakfasts were extensive and substantial, rooms were extremely comfortable and the whole hotel immaculate. All staff were so friendly, and surpassed themselves by surprising my daughter with a lovely present and cake for her birthday. Larger hotel chains could learn a lot from the ethic of Sirkeci Konak, where the guest definitely comes first.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing But Excellence”
Reviews.Author: CJ G
Reviews.Content: The Sirkeci Kokak is my new go-to home in Istanbul. From the pool / spa attendant to the front desk to the wait staff in the restaurant, service was fantasticâ€”friendly, helpful, personable, and above all just super-nice. No reasonable request goes unfulfilled, and even some unreasonable ones get fulfilled too. The location can't be beat: walk to Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque, Spice Bazaar, Grand Bazaar, and almost anything else you want to see. The easy-to-use and inexpensive metro is almost right out the front door, allowing you to get anywhere you can't easily walk to. The rooms are spotless and well-appointed (mini, bar, flat screen TV, complimentary wireless Internet). Yes, the bathrooms are a little small, but hey, get out of the bathroom and go see all the history that Istanbul has to offer. I will definitely return to Sirkeci Konak on my next Istanbul trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Style Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: brunello_fan
Reviews.Content: To start,we had booked the hotel based on its reviews on trip advisor. We were not disappointed, the hotel and staff surpassed our expectations! We stayed for 5 days over US thanksgiving when crowds in Istanbul were noticeably low. Due to the length of our stay, an airport transfer was included along with a complimentary dinner. The airport transfer was great as the chaos at the airport was a little more than I wanted to handle after traveling 24 hours from California. Upon our arrival we were notified of being upgraded to one of their Balcony rooms (2501). We then enjoyed complimentary beverages in the lounge area while they summarized the top tourist attractions, discussed the extra offerings of the hotel and familiarized us with transportation and a map of the city. Of the Hotel's extra complimentary offerings, we signed up for walking tour in the fatih market, the wine and cheese pairing and the cooking class. We participated and enjoyed all the extras. We thought this was a nice touch and made a difference in our stay. We also enjoyed 2 dinners at their restaurants, both of which were comparable to trip advisors top choices for istanbul. Unfortunately the roof top restaurant was closed for the season, but the views were still great. My wife also took advantage of the turkish bath and massage(extra cost), which she stated was a highlight of her trip! Our upgraded room was perfect. It was spacious, simply decorated, bed was comfortable and a nice view of tokapi palace/garden and the golden horn. I could hear the call to prayer in the mornings, but had no issue with street noise. I was actually surprised how quiet the area was. Enjoyed the turkish delight that was in our room as well! Location was perfect, steps from the Tram and walking distance to all major sites in old town. All the staff was fantastic! They were friendly, helpful and dedicated to making sure we enjoyed our time in istanbulâ€¦informative walking tours and even playing backgammon with us at happy hour! We met many other guests through the extra offerings and over happy hour which makes traveling more enjoyable as well. This boutique style hotel has a unique offering which worked for us. We highly recommend Sirkeci Konak to other travellers!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgetable hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Jim T
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived until the final farewell as we were transported by a private car arranged by the hotel, the friendliness and hospitality was extraordinary.In addition the rooms are excellent ,comfortable and spotlessly clean.The breakfast had many choices, some changing daily. It is ideally positioned in the heart of the old city in a quite spot close to the tram.The complimentary cooking class was an experience not to be missed.We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “A second wonderful visit”
Reviews.Author: catwoman6
Reviews.Content: My second visit to the Sirkeci Konak was as pleasant as the first. This time, I chose a room with a shower - re mobility issues- and it was perfect. My room overlooked Gulhane Park, with a tiny balcony and a window box with flowers. As it was the first week in November and not too cold, I never turned the heating on, and left my window open most of the time. The room was average sized, with a king-sized bed, a chair, and an upholstered stool to sit upon. The bed was very comfortable, and had an array of pillow types from which to chose. I had no issue with noise, but, I do travel with a White Noise machine, as I am sensitive to sound. The bath was adequately sized, and this time, I used the towel warmer, ...a treat for me. The bath products were the spa-type, with different scented soaps. As I am fairly short, the towel shelf was - literally - a bit of a stretch for me. Breakfast is an adventure, with both familiar and different dishes. Although many cereals and toppings were on offer, they paled compared to the Turkish breakfast items available. The dishes are freshly prepared, and tasty. Spinach and cheese borek, little balls of cheese rolled in a mild red ground pepper, or in sesame seeds. Different kinds of olives, and breakfast breads. Scrambled eggs, some sort of bacon, and other items Iâ€™ve forgotten. Croissants and other bread items to toast to your liking. I made sure I went to breakfast first, then got dressed for the day, in order to have an appetite for lunch. The hotel thoughtfully offers dinner the first night as part of the room charge, as many guests are exhausted from the long flight. I availed myself of this option, and ate at the fish restaurant. The fish soup could have been paired with a salad, to make a meal in itself. I chose the sea bass - grilled, which was accompanied by mesclun salad greens, in the lightest lemony vinaigrette imaginable. Both the fish and the salad were wonderful. I passed on dessert. Guests never go hungry at the Sirkeci Konak. Tea is offered in the afternoon, with tasty little sandwiches on simit bread rings. Many of the guests partake, and enjoy the conversations which spring up. The hotel location is perfect - 50 m from the tram stop at Gulhane Park. Tokens for the tram are available at the desk, Guest relations spend time with each guest upon arrival, offering maps and information, and answering your questions about the hotel, and the city. No matter how much effort the hotel owners place into the physical hotel premises, - and things are quite nice...the best part of the hotel is the staff. It was literally â€œold home weekâ€�, as the staff and I greeted each other. No question is too strange, and is always answered with kind professionalism. Itâ€™s easy to understand that the staff cares that their guests enjoy their stay at the hotel, and in Istanbul. After being so gently spoiled, I cannot imagine staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Sirkeci Konak Hotel easily surpassed our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Susan L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were traveling for 7 weeks, mostly in Turkey and Greece, including Cyprus. I had researched many hotels in Istanbul and finally decided to opt for this hotel and book directly/online to take advantage of its great package. Hotel packages are often not worth any extra cost, but the package at Sirkeci Konak Hotel was terrific! We stayed at the hotel 5 nights in late October/early November and were very happy throughout. The hotel picked us up at the airport, which was very convenient (included in the pkg), assigned us a comfortable and spacious room with a small balcony (nice decor, Turkish delights, and good housekeeping), provided delicious and generous buffet breakfasts each morning (also included in the pkg), a welcome dinner at its fish restaurant (also in the pkg), and a discount for paying cash, which we did. The hotel has a terrific spa where we had our first Turkish bath and massage. The masseuse (Mahmed) was terrific too. Afternoon tea/coffee is complimentary, which was a treat. Last but not least, the hotel's location is ideal....not only is it within a few minutes walk of the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Aya Sofia, the Archaeological Museum, and the Museum of Islamic and Turkish Arts, but also it's a minute walk away from the tram to the new town and Belogyu, etc, well worth visiting. We also used the tram (and metro) to go to the airport for 4 Turkish lira per person, which is about $2.50 at today's exchange rate. Hotel staff is helpful and courteous. In summary, we hated to leave our home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: nizaq
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect boutique hotel with real people and genuine feelings, every problem we faced they tried to solve with a smile, every one we talked to said "if you are not happy we are not happy". The hotel is so clean its spotless, so warm especially if you have tea or coffee in the late afternoon in the lobby, and after your long walks around the old city of Istanbul do go down to the small inside pool and relax have a sauna or a Turkish bath you will love itâ€™s what I did with my daughter to keep fit for the next day schedule. It is a few meters away from the nearest metro station which connects all parts of Istanbul. This hotel has a good fish restaurant besides its Turkish food restaurant, excellent breakfast Buffet. Last but not least the service they offer you is exceptional, I cannot remember all the names but I will never forget Okay and Shukri the managers who became part of my family the maintenance Aref who helped us with the ramp for the bathroom for my wife wheelchair and above all the owner Farouk who should give lectures to the likes of Hilton and Hyatt and Sheraton on why service for a smile and how to be unique I and family should know since I am a Gold member in Hilton and a preferred member in Sheraton and Hyatt

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable !!”
Reviews.Author: UsakoPakistan
Reviews.Content: The hospitality of all staffs was amazing. Super comfortable cozy clean high sense room made me relax indeed. Especially, the owner of this group was greeting his guests at each table in the morning. I was so impressed with his warm welcoming policy. I respected the policy of this hotel group, so tried another hotel in the latter half of my holiday. It was Neorion Hotel, very near from this hotel. It was also amazing. Both have beautiful clean hamams (turkish bath). The massage of therapist was wonderful"!! I went there almost everyday. Of course, the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “"Guest is everything!”
Reviews.Author: greywanderer2
Reviews.Content: ...indeed they are. Opened only a few years ago, the Konak, a converted Ottoman mansion richly deserves its rapid rise up the rankings. From the friendly, low key helpful check-in and introduction to the city to the the final farewell, one feels special. The decor, comfort, facilities, ambience and service are excellent. The breakfast buffet is very wide ranging and caters for all tastes and diets. (The hotel's 2 restaurants: one Anatolian cuisine, the other fish, have interesting menus and the staff are willing and able to make recommendations re. food and wine. Also, very good value) Staying here can be a truly Turkish experience with cookery lessons, wine tasting and a traditional hammam on offer. Situated in a quiet side street, it is minutes away from the main historical sites in Sultanahmet and a similar distance from the waterfront area for further exploration, and the various transport links. Cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Superb boutique hotel with warm personal touch”
Reviews.Author: MaryLizzie
Reviews.Content: Smallish boutique hotel in Sultanamhet, well situated for sight-seeing. 5 mins walk to Topkapi Palace; 7 or 8 to Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. Across the street from the haven of beautiful Gulhame Park, if hustle and bustle of the city gets to be too much. Our room was relatively large, beautifully appointed; lovely bed linens; flat screen TV, window seat/divan And a small bed-side bowl of Turkish Delight. What makes this place special though is the warmth and graciousness of the hospitality -- a welcoming cup of tea on arrival in the lounge as you sit and discuss your stay with the young "guest relations" person. Plus free tours of the area, and even a free cooking class. Breakfast excellent; restaurant dinner: ditto.

Reviews.Title: “Great City and Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brenda s
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sirkeci Konak hotel in September, 2011. It is superbly located, the staff knowledgable and extremely helpful. We were able to walk to all the sights of Istanbul. The food excellent as well as the food in the two other restaurants owned by the group. Our room was on the top floor with our own balcony. We overlooked a park as well as being able to see the busy street beneath. The lovely touch at the end of our stay was to be presented with a box of Turkish Delight.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeLb
Reviews.Content: I have travelled with my wife and baby daughter (10 months old) to Istanbul on November 2011 and stayed at the Sirkeci Konak hotel for a week. Since the day we made the booking, we received an email from the hotel staff briefing us on many useful information concerning Istanbul. Furthermore, we have emailed them several times asking for specific questions and each times they have answered us without reluctance. Moreover, when we arrived to the Hotel and throughout our stay there, the staff was always helpful and showed genuine interest in making our stay as pleasant as it can be. We have never seen during our stays at other hotels a similar treatment. You can rest assure that every employee at the hotel - from the front desk manager to the concierge to the waiters, etc- is always smiling at you, trying to help you in any mean and most importantly finding satisfaction in doing so. Therefore, even though the hotel had some issues like the sound insulation and the water in the shower fluctuating between hot and cold, we would rate our stay there as EXCELLENT. P.S.: We have also tried both restaurants in this hotel and found them both to be among the best in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Small, welcoming, very comfortable and superbly located”
Reviews.Author: nomads999
Reviews.Content: I chose the Sirkeci Konak for a recent trip to Istanbul because of its good Tripadvisor Reviews and we were not disappointed. We wanted a hotel within easy walk of the main sights of old Istanbul - just underneath the walls of the Topkapi Palace, this hotel is hard to beat for central location. We also wanted a hotel with a real Turkish flavour - not just one of a chain. Again, the ambience and decor were very attractive. We also wanted a good restaurant - this hotel has two and the meals were very good with excellent service. The buffet breakfasts were also everything you could ask for. I think we must have been given one of the smaller rooms because that really was our only complaint - we didn't have enough space for our suitcases and there was not enough hanging space - we were at the start of a two weeks holiday and the space was more suited to a weekend break type of luggage. Apart from that, the hotel was clean, comfortable and well appointed. and the staff were attentive and extremely helpful. We found both the restaurant and the hotel to be very good value for money for this quality in Istanbul and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Welcoming and Centrally Located - Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Canuckexpat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over Eid in November. We selected the hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews and were not disappointed. From the initial welcome email - offering complimentary airport pickup, right through to the 'thank you' gift of Turkish Delight on our departure, the hospitality and warmth of the staff was second to none. Every kudo for this hotel is well earned. The staff couldn't do enough for us. They made every phone call on our behalf (reservations and tickets), and even had tram tokens available for purchase at Reception. Service was bar-none. The hotel itself is centrally located and every local point of interest is within walking distance. We were in Istanbul for 5 days and didn't have to take a single taxi. We booked a standard room, which was small (think "European"), but comfortable and clean, with a teeny balcony overlooking the street below. Quite lovely. As added bonuses, on arrival we were offered the complimentary cooking classes, walking tours and free dinner in the hotel (!!) - but perhaps the best surprise was the offer of an 11% discount on our room rate for cash. Unless you're set on staying at a 5-star hotel at double the price, the Sirkeci Konak is the place to be in Istanbul. *TIP: get the concierge staff to order your admission tickets to the Hagia Sofiya and any other site that requires admission. It saves you AGES in the queues.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great”
Reviews.Author: Ken2322
Reviews.Content: Hotel was well located, very good, staff very helpful & accommodating. Istanbul is just overpriced and although we knew this going in, it kind of grates on you as you must be constantly struggling to not feel like everything is just another rip-off. Sirkeci room was very good sized, balcony was nice with sideways views of Golden Horn and Mosques the other way. Elevators small and a lot of trashy roof stuff on adjacent buildings took a little of the glow away considering one is paying nearly $350/night. In house restaurant was reasonable compared to other options we tried. Istanbul eateries can really gouge with wines often marked up over 1000% and I already hate it in the US and elsewhere where it is 200-300%. Must be better values if you have time to research more.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Cyrus g
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel base on the review from TripAdvisor, so when I arrived to this hotel I had high expectation. However, not only this hotel met all of my high expectations, it exceeded them. This is a very beautiful hotel located superbly, in a lovely and quite street, adjacent to Golhane and 3 minutes walk from Golhane Tram station and few minutes from all major historic sites, lovely restaurants, shops, and whatever else you would need. You just can't have any better location. The Service is superb. Upon arrival, we were sited in a lovely lobby and offered drinks of our choice, while painlessly getting checked in. Meanwhile, a lovely and very knowledgeable lady (Lazgi) informed us of what our all placed closed and open and a list to the same effect, and oriented us to all major activities in Istanbul, and welcomed all question, and eager to help. The room was very beautiful, and we were lucky to have a very nice view of Golhane. All we needed (drinking water, tea, coffee, WiFi, Toiletries, Slippers, Safe, etc.) were available complimentary. The guys who carried our luggage explained all stuff in the room in detail. Excellent WiFi signal, no matter where in hotel you connect. The Bed was extremely comfortable and of high quality. There are many kind of pillows that you can choose from a menu and request at no cost(I love the Plume pillow, so I ordered it). The breakfast was the best I ever had in any hotel in Turkey. I am not kidding! The hot selection was changing daily, prepared fresh and nice. Excellent selection of cereal, (excellent hazelnuts available, if you like me like to add it to your cereal). Very nice selection of cold cuts and cheese . Fresh Orange juice, and other natural juices. Fine bread selection. Coffee and Tea served at you table. The receptions are very friendly and eager to help. Each time we were waiting for anything in lobby, Mr. Sukuri, the receptionist, would come by and make sure everything is OK and if we need anything and offered us drink. There is pool and Turkish bath, which we never got time to use. My only complain was the shower was very low water pressure in my room, and the water temperature would change, if while you I was taking a shower some one would flush the toilet. On the whole, this hotel is well deserved to be the number one on TripAdvisor, and if I go back to Istanbul, I would never use any other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Trip Advisor overrates this hotel”
Reviews.Author: RichardQ61
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here for four days and while it is ok, It does not live up to its reviews. A lot of the staff are very young and inexperienced. They dont have a lot of anwers.
