There are two men, both concierges that are very good but the front desk is not well staffed. The buffet breakfast in the morning is ok but the service every single morning was terrible. The room was ok , except for the fact they turn off the air conditioning and it was too hot and I left my window open 24 hours a day so that it would stay cool. i would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at sirkeci konak”
Reviews.Author: Patrick J
Reviews.Content: We had three very comfotable nights in September at the Sirkeci Hotel in Istanbul. The hotel was centrally located with good transport links. The service was excellent & staff helped to advise & book trips & restaurants which were very good. The group of hotels had roof top terraces which gave good views. We plan to go back sometime.

Reviews.Title: “'Treated as one of the family'”
Reviews.Author: Gloucs
Reviews.Content: Everything is done with a courteous and warm smile and nothing is too much trouble. Travelled with a friend and we felt safe in the area and location is excellent , close to tram lines to cross the Bosphorous or to stroll to major sights like Hagia Sophia. Room was very clean and gave us a good nights sleep.( No view but you can pay extra for that.) We ate in both hotel restaurants of an evening and the fish, in particular, is excellent value. Breakfast too is very substantial with a wide choice to suit all tastes. This is not a big corporate hotel but has a genuine Turkish feel to it - with apple tea served in lounge late afternoons we were able to chat with fellow guests comparing what sights we had seen. There is so much to see in this big, cultural and historical city we only really scratched the surface. But it was a lovely, comfortable 4 night holiday thanks to the SK - I must get my husband out there next time!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Seismo_mid
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Sirkeci Konak hotel following a cruise. The staff is very welcoming and helpful. The breakfast is very good. The rooms were comfortable and very nicely finished. One slight issue that we experienced was that the bed was made up without a top sheet, only a comforter. Even though outside temps were cool, our room was too hot to sleep under a comforter. We had the heat completely turned off and the A/C had already been shut down for the season. Our solution was to leave the balcony door cracked open. The next day we asked for and received another sheet. The staff arranged for a car to take us to the airport, as we had an early departure. The driver was on time and transported us quickly and safely to the airport. The discount for payment in cash is an added bonus! All in all, Sirkeci Konak is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at this excellent hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: JASAS
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel for four nights from 29th October 2011 on a bed and breakfast basis.I selected the hotel based on the many very positive tripadvisor reviews and because its location was where we wanted to be to walk to the main attractions. In reality the hotel is perfectly located if you want to visit the main attractions, namely the Topkapi Palace, the Agia Sophia, the Blue Mosque and the Grand Bazaar.All are within a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel. The double room we had on the first floor faced onto the road which was relatively quiet.The room could ideally have been a little bigger but this was not a problem. I had requested a shower instead of a bath and this was fine, albeit the "bathroom" was fairly small.The air conditioning system was specific to the room and worked very well.You can even select from a choice of pillows! We decided to have dinner in the hotel on the first night at the Neyzade restaurant and this was so good we had dinner the following night in the hotel's adjoining Balikcisi seafood restaurant. I recommend you have dinner at least once in both restaurants because it will be hard to find better quality/value elsewhere. Also make sure you make a reservation well in advance because both restaurants were full on the night we ate there with many diners coming from outside the hotel. Breakfast in the hotel was fine with a good choice. Outside the hotel the Imbat restaurant, in the Orient Express Hotel (part of the same Hotel Group) and only a few hundred yards way, is also excellent and highly recommended for dinner or lunch. From its 7th floor the Imbat restaurant has great views over the city and Bosphorus. All the staff in the Sirkeci Konak hotel were very welcoming and friendly and keen to offer advice or assistance, and their standard of service could not be faulted. This was a big plus for what is a relatively small hotel.The hotel also has two free internet terminals for guest use. In summary this is a great hotel for a 2-4 day stay in Istanbul. We would certainly not stay anywhere else if we return to Istanbul and we are a couple who have stayed at many of the best hotels in the world.So if you are thinking of staying in Istanbul primarily to visit the attractions do what we did and try the Sirkeci Konak Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel - Very Well Located”
Reviews.Author: Curlytoo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 6 night stay at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel. We could not have been more pleased with our choice to stay there on our first visit to Istanbul. The hotel is walking distance to most of the major attractions, and the tram which can connect you with much of the city stops less than a block away. The hotel is tastefully decorated and very charming, as was our room which had a modern bathroom and a small balcony. The breakfast buffet was abundant with many choices. Another factor which so enhanced our experience was the staff. Every person with whom we had contact was pleasant, friendly and very desirous of being helpful, whatever our question or request. Agah Okay Alkan, the Front Office Manager and his staff made us feel very welcome and comfortable, and told us Sirkeci Konak was our home in Istanbul. Agah researched questions about places we considered visiting, answered our myriad inquiries and provided all types of assistance to make our visit to his city as pleasant as possible. The hotelâ€™s complimentary offerings of cultural experiences to guests called â€œExperience Turkish Cultureâ€� are very innovative and generous on their part. We participated in a cooking class with the chef in the kitchen and got to eat our delicious efforts. Another great highlight was the Wednesday morning â€œTaste of Life in the Golden Hornâ€� tour led by Agah Okay, who took us to the Mosque of Mehmed the 2nd, then to the largest open air market in Turkey where the locals shop for basic household items, fruits, vegetables, spices, etc. We then went to the Greek Orthodox Patriarchate for a visit which is the base of Greek Christian Orthodoxy. Agah was a great guide and everyone who participated thought it was a very special and worthwhile experience. We ate in both restaurants at the hotel and found them to be very good, and also dined at the Imbat Restaurant which is located a few blocks away in the Orient Express Hotel, one of the sister properties of this small group. That was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A really excellent friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: GuineaThePig
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in this hotel in mid-October. From the moment we arrived, we were made to feel welcome - the staff and the service really can't be faulted. The location is ideal, as it is only a short walk to the Aya Sofya and Blue mosques, the Topkapi Palace, the Grand Bazaar and the Galata Bridge. Despite its central location the hotel is surprisingly quiet. The two restaurants provide good food and excellent service, and the small bar/lounge is very agreeable. The hotel answered email requests before we arrived (about booking us a car from the airport - which they provided at no charge) and followed up with an email after our visit asking for our comments. We'll definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in busy Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: stlouistraveler007
Reviews.Content: We feel lucky to have found the Sirkeci Konak! All of the great reviews on Trip Advisor are true! The staff is the best. We too arrived after a 10 day cruise, and the staff made us comfortable, got us into our room by 10 am, and took care of all of our needs. They provided us with great advice and maps, and helped us purchase tickets on line to the major attractions, so we skipped the giant ticket lines at the sites and were able to enter immediately. This was a huge time-savings. They booked our dinner and airport taxi reservations, and we paid for the taxi with our room. Cash payment gave us an 11% discount on the room. They were able to change all sorts of currencies (dollars, Euros, Turkish lira, etc). The room was nice, very large, with a clean and lovely bathroom. We were facing the (tiny) street in front of the hotel, but it was totally silent in our room. Wi-fi is free, and there are 2 computers for guest use off the lobby. The included breakfast is abundant and very nice. Dinner in the hotel restaurant was very good. We could walk to the main attractions in the old city. A great choice for sightseeing in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NCtraveler10254
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the Sirkeci Konak. Terrific customer service. They answered many emails from me ahead of my arrival. They even sent me directions in Turkish so my taxi driver could find his way. Excellent location for touring in the old city. The hotel is charming, warm and friendly. They made us feel like old friends. Wonderful tea and breakfast. They even provided us with breakfast to go at 4 a.m. when we had an early flight. I would definitely stay there again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel and Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Villadaluz
Reviews.Content: Great location and exceptionally helpful staff. Well appointed bedroom and good dining experience. Facilities first rate. Our number one choice for Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service !”
Reviews.Author: Carlos248
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Sirkeci Konak has been fantastic ! We have stayed there for three nights. Although the room was not very big, it was spotlessly clean, very well-maintained and it had everything we needed for a very comfortable stay. Walking distance to Sultanahmet Square and to Eminonu-Spice Bazaar Area. There is a tram station at 50 metres (Gulhane) for line T1. But the real highlight of this hotel is the FABULOUS SERVICE. We felt at home from minute one till they greeted us goodbye with a box of sweets as a present when we left. They are willing to help at anytime, make good suggestions (we went to a couple of restaurants they suggested and these were really good); they even provided the jetons for the tram when we asked where to get them. They are prepared for anything ! We used the swimming pool and had a turkish bath in the hotel and found this a very pleasant experience. The reviews from other guests do reflect the kindness and attention we received. It is true, the staff of the hotel are doing a GREAT job ! We will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: zappy1
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay in a "name brand" hotel in the historical part of Istanbul, but discovered that there weren't any. A bit of searching on Trip Advisor turned up this hotel and I was really pleased with my selection. The location is superb, walking distance to all the tourist sites that I wanted to see, and lots of cafes and restaurants also. The room that I had was lovely with a nice balcony off it. The staff were really helpful and polite with advise for everything from eateries to assisting in purchasing admission tickets on line. As I was travelling alone safety is of concern, and this hotel and it's location ticked that box.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of Sultanahmet: authentic hospitality”
Reviews.Author: annybenetou
Reviews.Content: I love small boutique hotels and always choose this kind of accomodation. But this one is one of a kind! You really feel like you are a guest not a client: this is their goal and they succeed extremely well! The people who work there, speak english and smile and greet you and see to your needs. Breakfast is excellent, food in the Neyzade restaurant is excellent, the location is perfect, the standard double room spacious and nicely decorated with "turkish touch". And you are treated all the time, ( tea, coffee, dinner, turkish delights) as a real guest. And last but not least, there is a small relax area, with a small pool and a small sauna and hammam where you can relax after the sightseeing. If you like small boutique hotels and you can afford the price, don't think about it a second time. All the reviews are absolutely true.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service from the moment we arrived”
Reviews.Author: miwinelover
Reviews.Content: After being on a cruise ship for 12 days, we arrived at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel, before 0930. Our hopes were just to be able to leave our luggage at the hotel, until our room was available (we had arrived berfore the posted check in time). The second our taxi approached the front door, the bellman opened the hotel doors and assisted us with our luggage. A warm welcome, and an inquiry if we had eaten breakfast greeted us. We were offered a complementary breakfast,, which was fantastic. Within a short period of time we were told our room was available, and that we had been upgraded to a suite overlooking the Topkapi Palace gardens. Information regarding Istanbul was given to us, recommendations on what "not to be missed" and assistance with dinner reservations was all handled before we ever saw our room. The customer services was fantastic. During our stay we utilized the Hamam (turkish bath), and pool. Both a very relaxing treat. Unfortunately we only had one night to stay at this fabulous hotel, but will definetly return and we know exactly where we will be staying: Sirkeci Konak Hotel. The location is fantastic, with easy walkable access to all major sites in the historic district (Topkapi Palace, Hagie Sophia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar, Oldest hamam in Istanbul, Cistern). We also walked to the modern section of the city without complication. (Note there is a tram station within one block of the hotel for those wanting to ride instead of walk). THANKS YOU FOR A WONDERFUL STAY, we hope to spend time with you again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: romababy2010
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Sirkeci Konak for 5 nights in the middle of October, 2011. We can't praise this Hotel enough. The staff, were all very friendly, courteous and helpful, all with a smile. Lots of choice for a very good breakfast. Our room was lovely, and spacious. It was a little noisy in the mornings sometimes (one of the windows didn't fit properly)..We reported this to the desk, and they made a note of it. We enjoyed a good free meal in the fish restaurant of the Hotel on the night of our arrival (because we had booked on- line directly with the Hotel). The Hotel is in the Old Town, 10 minutes walk from the Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque etc. We were round the corner from the tram which takes you over the bridge and into the other part of Istanbul. There are lots of restaurants nearby. When we left for the airport, the staff all came out to see us off in the taxi. One of the nicest Hotels we have ever stayed in. Just read everyone's reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Jerry M
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five days and loved it! Extremely comfortable and clean with warm, caring staff. Excellent breakfast buffet and restaurants. Location can't be beat -- this is a winner!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marsbar2
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after reading reviews on this web site. The hotel is like a boutique hotel, but not overpriced as some boutique hotels are. I had high expectations for this hotel and it certainly didn't disappoint. The staff were very helpful and polite. The rooms were spotless, towels and bed linen changed daily with a lovely touch of bottled water and turkish delight for free. When we left the staff on duty waved us off and presented us with a gift to remember our stay. The location couldn't have been any better, the weather wasn't brilliant whilst we were there but the hotel even provided brollies for guest use. Breakfast was lovely, we were offered a complimentary cookery class which we would have used but spent our time sightseeing eating and drinking in a fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently excellent”
Reviews.Author: TripAv
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel on 2 occasions - September 2010 and October 2011. The hotel has been perfect both times. The location is excellent, within walking distance of most of the Sultanahmet historic attractions, and a reasonable walk from the Galata/Beyoglu area. The staff are welcoming and friendly, and go out of their way to be helpful. The standard of room-cleaning and hospitality is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service in the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Avymac
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was a delight, welcome, staff, rooms,and food right through to departure all was handled with efficiency and friendliness. The location of Sirkeci Konak was perfect for many of the historic sites in Istanbul, make sure you take your walking shoes.An amazing place, We had dinner in both the Sirkeci Konak and also the rooftop restaurant in the Sirkeci Orient Express, they are located quite close to one an other, the fish was wonderful, washed down with a good bottle of wine , the bill was very reasonable. We will certainly be back to Istanbul and would very much like to go back to Sirkeci Konak.

Reviews.Title: “enhanced our stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: molar42
Reviews.Content: Ideally situated in Sultananahmet District close to many of the main attractions and a 5 minute tram ride to the Bosphorus, This hotel is more like a town House. and does not feel like a Hotel Overlooking a Park in a quiet side street. Very well appointed bed rooms & public lounge. Wireless internet access avilable in all rooms. Very helpful & friendly staff who could provide any information needed about Istanbul and seemingly arrange anything required. Excellent in house resaurant and also hotel has several other restaurants within walking ditsance whichh all proved to be verty good. Complimnetary Turkish Delight in room (yum!) Complimentary Walking Tour to non Tourist parts of Istanbul led by OKAY was a highlight of our visit His obvious rapport with the local people and his knowledge of history made for a very rewarding mornings outing.All the staff were ever smiling, polite and helpful- a very good Advert for Turtkey. We will definitely return. Bar on roof with fantastic views(open subject to weather)Thank you everyone for providing such an enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AnneK16
Reviews.Content: My second time at this hotel and I wasn't disappointed. Excellent service and the location is great. We also ate dinner at both restaurants in the hotel and I would recommend both of them.

Reviews.Title: “A great welcome in an ideal location.”
Reviews.Author: Ivan1944
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoy city breaks and have stayed at quite a few hotels in Europe, the US and Africa. The Sirkeki Konak is, without doubt, the friendliest hotel we have ever stayed in. The service is also very efficient, the rooms are of good quality and the location is ideal for many of the historic sites in Istanbul. Also worth mentioning that the hotel arranged a car to collect us from/take us to the airport, at a fair price. This helped make the beginning and end of the break stress free. For us this hotel offered an ideal mix of a atmosphere, value, service and location.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Denver-Rosie
Reviews.Content: You are welcomed from the moment you walk thru the door. Just returned from a night at the Sirkeci Konak - we stayed one night at the beginning of our cruise and one night at the end. If you are cruising from Istanbul I would strongly recommend staying extra nights at this hotel - it was too late to change our plane reservations but after the first night I regretted not being able to take part in everything the hotel has to offer. Check the hotel website - they offer a free wine tasting class, a free cooking classes and a free walking tour. Now free is always good but when it's free and excellent . . . it can't get any better. The wine tasting class was wonderful - excellent wines, great cheeses and the instructor very, very good - we learned alot, were able to ask alot of questions and just enjoyed the experience. The food at the hotel will not disappoint you - breakfast (included in room price) included both Turkish and English/US options. The buffet was fresh, the selection was large - we kept going back for more. We ate dinner twice at the hotel as the food was authentic and delicious. I'm looking forward to my next stay at the Sirkeci Konak! P.S. The rooms are lovely We stayed in two very different rooms and both were lovely spacious - comfortable beds - quiet. Decorated beautifully.

Reviews.Title: “Top flight staff”
Reviews.Author: Wolverine73
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel with helpful staff, fluent in English, in a convenient location, this is a great choice. The room itself (a superior room) was clean, but relatively spare--although there was plenty of closet and storage space. The bath was spacious and very nice. The staff was always ready to help with any request, and gladly made dinner reservations for us. We tried the seafood restaurant in the hotel one night, and were really pleased by the food, which was excellent, and the good local wines (although the service was a little slow, but we found that in other restaurants in Istanbul also). Breakfast was fine, nothing exceptional--except for the coffee, which was excellent, but it was hard to flag a waiter for a second cup for some reason. On a map, the hotel looks like it is a short walk to the Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia etc--but you find there is a train line and/or a wall and a high hill separating you, and no access. The hotel is a short walk to the Galata bridge and waterfront, and is located in a nice area well stocked with restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort in Istanbul”
Reviews.Content: I feel like a broken record because I will say what has been said before. This place is wonderful - very comfortable, accomodating and welcoming. Our room was very nice - not huge - but well appointed with the most comfortable bed of the trip. We had more than enough room and although we only stayed 3 nights, we would have been happy staying a month! Our "welcome dinner" (complimentary when you book direct with the hotel) was an excellent fish dinner. For us this was wonderful as we don't eat meat. I partook in their free-to-guests cooking class which was a blast! Again, one of the dishes contained meat and they set aside a special no-meat portion for us. Breakfast contained everything you might want - breads, egg dishes, meats, cheeses, olives, borek, yogurt, honey, fruits of every sort, juices . . . I'm getting hungry! The staff always had a smile on their faces and went out of their way to help or answer questions. They do a FANTASTIC job taking care of their guests and making everyone feel special. This was a nice place to come "home" to after hectic days touring Istanbul. We'd highly recommend the Sirkeci Konak and hope we come back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is KING in this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chefdulce
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, good location and customer service is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelkat631
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying 5 nights at Sikeci Konak. Great place. Convenient in old city. Wonderful service. Staff was incredibly helpful. Can't say enough positive. You won't be disappointed if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “They really understant the meaning of Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Frones
Reviews.Content: I spend around 100 nights a year in hotels and you know that if you go to Big American chains you'll get the standard high quality CS, but what is tough is to find is the personallised CS, like the one in this hotel. Nothing pretentious like in GL hotels but helpfull and always thinking on the guest. When you arrive they invite you to a drink and offer a complementary drink plus advise on what to do, but not trying to sell you anything. Every day they offer a free activity for the guest, like a cultural visit, a cooking lesson... Location was excellent, the room very nice and super clean. At the basement there is a hamam, a small swimming pool, sauna and a gym, and again all very clean. They do great massage, much better than in the tourisitc hamams around the old town. Very recomendable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a dissapointment...!!!”
Reviews.Author: Zufuhrstr
Reviews.Content: I'm coming back with my critics about the hotel personel. Imagine you're traveling to a foreign country with your gf. Imagine that her passport was stollen. Can you imagine what will it happend if you'll try to check-in in the hotel??? They will not allow you in!!! Just because without her passport you just can't prove if you are or not married and they don't allow non-married couples in the hotel!!!!!!!!!!!! Can you imagine that? But the far more shocking experience was that they called and announced they rest of the hotels not to let my gf in, if not present a document!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I had such an amazing feeling and memories from the hotel the previous time. I thought that they where the most exemple-to-be hotel policy that I have ever experience. In both case they prove me right! They are so capable to both worst and best! Though I'll remain with the worst...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ANA640
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Sirkeji Konack is a wonderful place to stay as it is within easy walking distance of all the main historical venues in Istanbul. It is very attractively decorated in Ottoman style and our rooms were clean, comfortable and well equipped. The breakfast was excellent and the service we received from all the staff throughout the hotel was exceptional. Nothing was too much trouble and all the complimentary extras, such as drinks on our arrival, tea in the afternoons, helpful advice on how to make the most of our few days in Istanbul, and even gifts of Turkish Delight when we left, were most welcome. The owners and staff are to be congratulated on running a really outstanding hotel. We would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Rex027
Reviews.Content: The Sirkeci Konak Hotel is a terrific place to stay if you want to spend time exploring the great sights of Istanbul. It is just a couple of hundred metres down the road from the entrance to the Topkapi and within easy walking distance of the Blue Mosque, the Cistern and other historical venues. The hotel is Turkish owned and has a high priority on service. We were greeted with a drink when we arrived, booked in without having to do anything much at all, shown to our room and it was so easy that it was a delight. The staff were consistently eager to assist and when we left, about seven of the front of house people came out to wave goodbye, having given us a large box of Turkish Delight to take with us. The hotel offers a range of unusual services, including Turkish cooking classes. We would recommend this highly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service & Location”
Reviews.Author: janniefr
Reviews.Content: There is a reason this is so highly rated on trip advisor. Fabulous service, great location, wonderful public spaces (including rooftop deck), very comfortable rooms (standard is small, what I consider a New York City size rooms but enough space for our suitcases and lovely good size bathroom. We also stayed at their sister hotel Neorion, also a boutique hotel in old town. Still a great, walkable location, service MAYBE one notch below Sirkeki and slightly bigger rooms for same price. I'd happily stay in either again.

Reviews.Title: “Impossible but true... Better than expected!!”
Reviews.Author: jrovero
Reviews.Content: Perfecto in every way! But realy do try to get room 2501 or 2502... Nicest romms in the house. We reserved a satandard, asked for an upgrade and we got it.. Personally, any first timer in Istambul should stay here..

Reviews.Title: “ISTANBUL TRIP”
Reviews.Author: WILSAL
Reviews.Content: Excellent quaint (but modern) hotel in GulhanePark/Topkapi Palace area of Istanbul. Perfect location for sights of old Istanbul. The staff "breaks their back" in providing complete guest services. A truly outstanding hotel in all aspects! We stayed on 5th floor that provided balconies w/ spacious rooms. Food in the fish restaurant delicious! Stay here...great hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: LMR29
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September for two nights; this was our not our first stay at Sirkeci Konak hotel and will definitely NOT be our last! I agree whole heartedly with the previous reviews and cannot really add any more, except from the moment you arrive until the moment you leave you are treated like you are the only guests in the hotel, the service really is first class. The rooms are extremely comfortable and nicely furnished, though sometimes bathroom are tiny, but hardly a problem! The little things have really been thought about, from a welcome note & complimentary Turkish delight in your room, to the welcome meeting The hotel is in a perfect location, with the Blue Mosque & Topkapi palace just a few minutes up hill, the tram station a stoneâ€™s throw from the hotel entrance and the Bosporus only 5 minutes downhill.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: Alan W
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a friend who stayed here last year. I was not disappointed, in fact, I was totally impressed by the outstanding service, friendliness of the staff, the hotels warm ambience and also its perfect location to all the tourist sites in Istanbul, yet it is in a side street away from the hustle and bustle of the city traffic. Everything is within walking distance however, the tram stop for those who wish to travel further afield, is less than 75 metres away. Truely a perfect place to stay in Istanbul and without the hefty price tag of many other hotels. My room was spacious, compared to European standards, nicely furnished in a more traditional way, and included a small balcony overlooking the Topkapi Palace walls and gardens. The bathroom was excellent and the internet was free in the lobby - and included wifi in all rooms. The restaurant on the rooftop was wonderful with extensive views of the city, Bosphoros, Topkapi Palace and local area and with an excellent menu and wine list - all at very reasonable prices. There is also a seafood restaurant within the hotel on the ground floor level. One-way transfer to or from the airport is included in the room price. As a retired Flight Purser who has travelled the world for more than 40 years, I have stayed in some of the best and worst hotels. This is one of the nicest boutique hotels I have had the pleasue of staying in and I can thoroughly recommend it for those who don't wish to stay in the Hiltons, Sheratons and Holiday Inns. I was made to feel like part of the family - important as a single traveller. Tip 1. If this hotel if full - try their sister hotel, the Neorion Hotel - equally good. Tip 2. Make sure you know where the hotel is as many Taxi drivers are unaware of the location - it is about 75 metres from the Gulhane tram stop and within easy walking distance if the Taxi drops you at this tram stop. Good luck, I hope you enjoy staying at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel as much as I did!!

Reviews.Title: “Sensational”
Reviews.Author: Bkm555
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about this hotel. From the lovely welcome to the location, it's a great place to spend a week. If you can reserve on the 5th floor on the palace side, you'll have a lovely patio and view.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Belief”
Reviews.Author: gbagen
Reviews.Content: In our extensive travels, we have never had a more hospitable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quick night's stay”
Reviews.Author: emily31778
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in this hotel on my way home from a long trip. The staff was friendly and the location was EXCELLENT. Also, I had a flight at 5 AM - they scheduled my taxi and arranged for breakfast to be delivered even though the kitchen was normally closed. If I went back to Istanbul, I'd stay here for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Service with a Smile”
Reviews.Author: jfrworld
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel while traveling to Istanbul for the first time and I was not disappointed. This is a wonderful hotel in a prime location and with the most friendly staff. Here are the highlights and my comments: Highlights: 1. Staff - The warm, friendly staff provide amazing service and are one of the main reasons this hotel is so highly rated. Having never been to Istanbul before, I emailed ahead and inquired about airport transportation from IST to the hotel. I received a prompt response with various options, rates, and next steps on how to proceed. The hotel booked a car and when I cleared the baggage claim, my driver was waiting. As soon as I got into the car, I was handed a brochure on the hotel along with some helpful hints about visiting Istanbul. The driver was very friendly and was pointed out sights along the way. Once we arrived at the hotel, I was promptly greeted by the Guest Service manager who escorted me to the check-in desk and offered me a beverage of my choice as they checked me in. It was almost as if she was personally awaiting my arrival. My bags were delivered to my room and in the room there was a dish of turkish delight waiting. Throughout my stay, the members of the staff were always smiling, kind, and very friendly offering "Hello" and "How are you, sir?", when walking through the hotel. They were always willing and happy to answer any questions or assist with anything that I needed including arranging transportation and helping me get to various parts of town. When I did check out and leave, the front desk staff on duty walked me out to the waiting car and handed me a goodbye gift and each personally said their goodbyes. This was a nice, personal touch that I will most remember. 2. Service - Based on the above, I see staff and service as almost one - both amazing. I did have one minor issue while staying at the hotel and when I informed the staff they promptly resolved the issue and also exceeded my expectations in the resolution. A measure of excellent service in my opinion is not just how a person or team conduct themselves when things go well, but also to the how they address and resolve issues when they do arise. In the area of Service, I give the Sirkeci Konak the highest rating. 3. Location - The Sirkeci Konak is located within easy walking distance of the Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, the wonderful Sultanahmet neighborhood, and the Bosporus. I was able to walk everywhere. There are many, many sidewalk cafes and restaurants within easy walking distance. 4. Value - The room was comfortable and clean. Breakfast was included which also added to the value. Comment - When I return to Istanbul, I will stay at the Sirkeci Konak again without question.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: MichFran
Reviews.Content: - Good location for the main sights and tram. - Excellent and friendly service from the pick up at the airport, the staff at reception and restaurants, the ladies who clean the rooms... - Very good trips twice weekly to non touristy areas of Istanbul with a very nice chap. - Fun cookery class with the hotel chef. The standard rooms are very comfortable if a bit small but with so much to see in Istanbul, we did not spend much time in the room anyway. Breakfast was plentiful and tasty. Information, maps and help are provided with genuine attention. With all the praise from clients on TA, the hotel is busy but the staff takes time for all guests. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “In love in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Traveling-gramps
Reviews.Content: Thismplace is truly amazing. We only stayed 1 night in their deluxe room on the 5 th floor overlooking the Topkapi palace park. They let us check in at 9 am and arranged a late check out of 6 pm as we had a late flight (11 pm). The reception, service, assistance and friendliness of the staff is outstanding. And The location is perfect, literally 5 minutes from the palace, Blue Mosque and 30 seconds from the tram! We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Well worth staying at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel - September 2011”
Reviews.Author: Cynsel
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful stay at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel where the staff go above and beyond to make it a perfect stay. From the time we arrived the staff were warm, caring and could not do enough to make us feel welcome. From the tea, sandwiches,apples available in their lobby to their delicious breakfast we were delighted. The rooms are typically Turkish style but spotlessly clean and very comfortable. We had a charming room with a balcony overlooking the Palace gardens. Restaurants were recommended, booked and asked about when we returned to make sure that we were satisfied with their choices. We were taken on a private complimentary tour of the diamond setting and gold pouring workshops through markets and places where most people would not bother to go to. We unfortunately missed the cooking class that was offered but have heard those that attended enjoyed it tremendously. The roof patio is very attractive with a restaurant weather permitting overlooking the Palace Gardens and the Mamara Sea. We used the Turkish Baths and pool (although it is deep and I could not stand) and were glad to experience the service. The hotel is situated in a great location next to a tram stop, within walking distance to all the major attractions in the old city and close to the bridge to cross to the European side. As we had stayed three nights, we were offered free transportation to the airport and left very early but the staff who were on duty, could not do enough to see that we were happy. They even offered to get us something to eat and drink at 5:30 am. When we left we were given a box of Turkish Delight as a gift which was the cherry on the top to perfect service. Thanks for everything - we will highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of all things Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: workingitmom
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a lovely trip to Turkey that included a stay at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel. It is a very helpful, friendly, generous hotel. We were welcomed with a drink of our choice and a personal orientation to the many opportunities offered at the hotel and the major tourist attractions in Istanbul. There are a variety of activities at the hotel that are offered at no additional charge to guests. We par took of the meze tasting which was not only delicious but most informative about the culture and customs of Turkey. The meze offerings were more than enough to satisfy any dinner hunger. We also took a cooking class and enjoyed the meal we prepared. In addition they offer if you book on line a free dinner at the hotel and transport from the airport to the hotel. The rooms are well appointed although some might say small, but who cares there is no time to spend in the room when Istanbul awaits. Welcoming you when you arrive or stop to take a break is a dish of fantastic Turkish Delight that magically lasted our entire stay. The breakfast buffet was large and we never got bored with the offerings. Fresh and high quality food. Also it would be remiss not to mention the fantastic location. Within walking distance to many of the top attractions in Istanbul. Overall the best of the hotels we stayed at on our trip and one which we would definitely return to next time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place!”
Reviews.Author: slp1978
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the sirkeci konak hotel for the first few days of our honeymoon. It was recommended to us from someone on tripadvisor. We absolutely loved it! It's location is amazing because it's walking distance from the blue mosque, and grand bazaar areas and it is right at the gulhane tram station so you can go anywhere you need to go. The staff was absolutely amazing! They were sooooo friendly and helpful. We were treated like royalty. We would definitely go back there the next time we're in Istanbul. Thanks for the recommendation Peggy!

Reviews.Title: “Superb in every way”
Reviews.Author: buxton_fan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely first class. From the moment you walk through the discreet doorway of the town house (Konak) you are met with warmth and genuine hospitality. Everyone went out of their way to make our stay memorable - and it was. Yet the service is never intrusive. It is simply genuine and thoughtful. For a hotel of only 52 rooms it is well staffed. The wellness centre with its pool, hammam, sauna, massage and gym is a great way to ease away the aches of walking through this fascinating city. Our romm was comfortable, quiet and with an excellent shower! The location is ideal. 100 metres from Gulhane tram stop yet on a quiet side road with little or no traffic and the tress of the park in front. Great position for enjoying everything that Istanbul has to offer. It is very close to the Sirkeci station (Istanbul Gar) and the waterfront to get boats to the Asian side, the new town or the Bosphorous and Princes Islands.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and hotel to experience Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: rockport
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home late last night...after 3 wonderful days in Istanbul. We chose to stay in the Sultanhamet district since I knew we'd want to be doing a lot of walking to the major historical sites on this first trip to Istanbul. I made my decision on the reviews I had read on this hotel and was not disappointed. Staff are very friendly and helpful. We splurged on the bigger room with king bed, top 4th floor with a private terrace. The room was VERY spacious and had a couch that could have likely been used for a single bed. The bathroom was modernized with nice ceramic wall tile and 2 showers (one stall and one in the tub). The room itself had a nice authenitic Turkish feel. I did not think we'd have time to use the private balcony...but I was wrong. All 3 days when we arrived back to the hotel around 5pm we enjoyed sitting outside, with a view of the park next door and/or looking down below at the side street activity. Each morning I woke up, I also went on the balcony for a bit and could see the Bosphorus in the other direction distance...the cruise ships docked. The tramway line was at the corner so convenient although we never used it. I found the area to be very quiet in the evening...the front entrance is located on a side street. We enjoyed a supper at their fish restaurant next door and also a roof top dinner at the sister hotel restaurant, Imbat, on our first evening which was excellent. Prices were all reasonable in my opinion. My only complaint with the room is the fact that the king bed did not really have a true king "flat" cover sheet....it wasn't long enough and easily got untucked from the bed. We got used to it the 2nd night but perhaps something that could be improved. It is almost as though the sheet was made for a Queen bed. The quality of the bedding though was very good. The breakfast was very good. The day time concierge was excellent in helping us each day in getting my plans sorted out. He always pointed us in the right direction, made our dinner reservations each evening and suggested a wonderful Nargile place not too far from the Grand Bazaar to experience a more "local" place to experience a smoking pipe and some tea. Thanks to all the team for making our 3-day stay in Istanbul a pleasurable experience. P.S. if you are looking to take out Euros at an ATM machine...try the HSBC machine near Hagia Sophia ...we tried several in different locations to no avail but this one worked with our Royal Bank Canadian debit card. The hotel will give you an 11% discount if you pay cash so it was worth looking for one. SaÄŸ ol !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: delawareSydney
Reviews.Content: Sorry for my stupidity. I/D118585614 I hope you can make the alterations and if not, let me know and I will do it all again. John Talbot.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Epectitus
Reviews.Content: I can't speak highly enough about our experience at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel The service was superb (Samet was particularly helpful), the rooms comfortable, clean and well appointed, the food excellent, and the downstairs hamam relaxing. And it was wonderful that the hotel is literally around the corner from the Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and Agia Sophia (and within easy walking distance of the Grand Bazaar, Spice Market, and Galatea Bridge. Do yourself a favor when in Istanbul and stay at the Sirkeci. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Such a totally cool place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: sarahbelle77
Reviews.Content: I have never experienced such a genuinely lovely place to stay - very special - a big thankyou to all the staff who made our week in Istanbul something else - just read the other reviews for more detail - it's all true! xx

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: DavePowles
Reviews.Content: If you are spending time in the awesome, but totally manic, city of Istanbul then you'll probably want a hotel that offers so much more than just somewhere to lay your head at night. You'll need help to get around, to pick the best trips and pick up the best tips and somewhere to relax and unwind after a day out and about. And Sirkeci Konak is exactly that place. My wife and I have just come back from nine amazing days in Istanbul to celebrate our first wedding anniversary and would recommend this hotel to anyone planning to visit. From the minute you step through the front door they can't do enough to help you. The hotel itself is situated in a really good spot. Just a couple of minutes away from some of the main sights, such as Topkapi Palace and the Blue Mosque, but equally not in the most touristy area. That means less hassle from the sellers and restaurateurs and less noise in the evening. The rooms are fairly standard in terms of size, but decked out in a very warm Turkish inspired style. But it's everything else about the hotel that makes it so amazing. Firstly the staff. It seems the owners of this group, which owns a handful of hotels in the city, have carefully handpicked the staff who work here. Each one is always cheerful, always friendly, very knowledgeable and so helpful. And rather than just have people who man the front desk, the hotel employs several members of staff whose job is simply to provide advice and guidance. When we arrived we were immediately sat down by one of them and given a lowdown of where was best to go and when and how. It was interesting to learn later in the holiday, when chatting to one of the staff members, that they are given amazing levels of freedom from their bosses to go above and beyond for guests. When we arrived there was a 'Happy Anniversaries' (sic) note in our room, along with a fruit bowl and bottle of red wine. We also received a free meal at their fish restaurant and a box of Turkish Delight as a leaving gift. Speaking of the restaurant, this is part of what also makes this place so special - the extras it offers. It has two, very nice and very reasonably priced restaurants, one which doubles up as a picturesque roof top bar, a gym, swimming pool, sauna and Turkish bath, which offer the much-needed chance to unwind. But also they offer around half a dozen complimentary experiences, of which we made sure we did five - and loved every single one. These included a market tour, Turkish afternoon tea, Turkish wine and cheese tasting, Raki tasting and a Turkish cookery class. We couldn't believe our luck when not only did we get to cook a Turkish meal with one of the head chefs, but the group were then sat down at the end of the lesson and allowed to enjoy the meal in full. Meanwhile the 5pm Raki tasting heralded the start of what became a very drunken, but very good, last night! Istanbul is very expensive (but worth every penny) so to get the chance to enjoy these things for free makes a real difference to the holiday. Price wise, this hotel is not the cheapest (it's not the most expensive either) but it's no exaggeration to say that it was worth every penny. I can't see how any hotel in Istanbul could better this one - and that pretty much says all you need to know.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best!”
Reviews.Author: WLandJH
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sirkeci Konak hotel for 5 nights in early September 2011. It was the best hotel experience we have ever had. The hotel is impeccably clean and charming. The food from the breakfasts, the drinks and nibbles after 4 pm (included in the room rate)` were first class. But what really sets it off are the warm, kind and efficient Sirkeci Konak staff. They could not do enough for us. They .were happy and friendly and went out of their way to make our stay truly memorable. There were special surprises that you would not expect. We very much valued and enjoyed the walk around the local market the hotel organised for us, ably led by Okay and Ezgi in their gentle and friendly manner. Where else in the world would the hotel put on a class in Turkish cooking in their well run kitchen for their guests ! (organised by Ramazan and taught by the head chef). When we departed we were like true friends and were truly overwhelmed with the exceptional warmth and generosity shown to us by Birol.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Look forward to going back!!”
Reviews.Author: WHSM80
Reviews.Content: Execellent hotel. Staff are lovely and go out of their way to help you. Great location, 5-15 mins away from the major sights (all walking distance from hotel). Good breakfast buffet, big selection. Afternoon tea is good tea. Had dinner at the fish restaurant on the first floor that we got part of the deal we bought, lovely!! Staff always greet when they see you around the hotel. Artur in particular was very helpful. Defo would stay here again if we go back to Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: skoddehauk
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently to Istanbul on business, and this was my first time at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel. I decided to try the hotel after reading the reviews here on Tripadvisor and I am happy to say the praise is well deserved. From the check in to check out I recieved excellent service and I will absolutely choose the Sirkeci Konak again when returning with my wife for some R&R next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hakan_Hanni
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with a very friendly and professional atmosphere. Quality in every detail. Very clean rooms. Superb breakfast. Very close to the Topkapi palace, the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. 30 m from the tram line that connects to the asian side of Istanbul and also connects to the AtatÃ¼rk airport (to get to the airport you have to change to the Metro; takes in all ca 1 hour from the hotel to the airport). Don't forget to join the tours of the city that the staff is providing (free of charge) twice a week - they are very interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and superb service”
Reviews.Author: LondonUKPhil
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel to move to from another after reading the Trip Advisor reviews. All were accurate. I was disappointed by the size of the room, having paid Â£220 per night, but had I read the reviews in detail I would have seen that this was remarked upon by others. The hotel service though is superb. From the initial greeting and information to the free evening meal on our first night the staff worked tirelessly to make our stay a happy one. Always eager to help with free use of their internet and booking advance tickets to avoid the many queues at the main attractions you will have to look hard to find a group of people who try to help more, without being intrusive. The location is idea,l being central to the main historic attractions of old Istanbul (Topkapi, Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar and Bosphorus Cruises). I have visited Istanbul on 4 previous occasions and stayed in the 5* Grand Hyatt in the Taksim area. I saw more in 3 days staying at the Konak than I have seen in all my previous visits. I can recommend this hotel and would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anna H
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent week staying at this hotel and can't say enough about the enthusiam and helpfulness of the staff. We asked for a change of room (lack of cupboard space) when we first arrived and a very satisfactory replacement room was provided with no fuss. The hotel provides complimentary walking tours of the less touristy parts of Istanbul which we very much enjoyed. I also enjoyed the cooking lesson. The location is very good, both for the ferry points and was very close to Gulhane tram stop which gets you around the city quickly and efficiently. The hotel is also very convenient for the Sultanahmet area with the Blue Mosque, etc. The Group also has a very good restaurant at their sister hotel nearby. We would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel does not disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: gpmansf
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in, the staff made us feel at home. The location is within easy walking distance to the major attractions but is on a quiet street. The tram stop (blue and red lines) is about 1.5 blocks. The rooms are small but clean, and the bathrooms are well-supplied and modern. This is a hotel which goes out of its way to make a guest feel welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “The right place for dreamy vacation”
Reviews.Author: panade
Reviews.Content: It's by far the best experience ever!!! Me & my wife we are 100% pleased from the kindness & professionalism of the personnel as well as the high standards of the hotel facilities & room. Staff gave us the idea that everything is possible and made our stay there like a dream come true!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly!”
Reviews.Author: FigiMon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. Rooms, albeit on the small side, are attractive and kept very clean. All sorts of pleasant surprises popped up during our stay - complimentary dinner on arrival, free transfer to the airport, discount on the agreed rate, departure gift etc. Above all the staff are extremely friendly and eager to help with everything.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel near everything”
Reviews.Author: CATravelingfamily
Reviews.Content: I meant to review this hotel last fall, but well, you know how that goes. I do want to say our stay was amazing. The first night we had drinks and dinner on the rooftop, what a way to start a trip in Istanbul! Of course we visited all the amazing sites and the hotel provided us with information and directions, but here is what made the Sirkeci Konak OUTSTANDING. We attended their cooking class. So fun to go into the kitchen and learn to make a turkish meal, then they set up the dining room just for us and served us our meal. We loved tea and backgammon lessons in the lobby, we ended up buying a board and playing everyday throughout our time in Turkey. But the best was that the hotel arranged for my husband to go across the street and get a haircut, the barber didn't speak english but the straight edge shave and haircut was one of the most memorable moments of the trip. (He used a lighter to singe the ear hair, need I say more). The little touches meant a lot. Umbrellas were at the door when it was raining, every question answered, and every need met. Needless to say it was a fabulous time in Istanbul. Be sure you "like" the hotel on facebook and you will always be reminded of your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel”
Reviews.Author: sajagal
Reviews.Content: Very clean, comfortable hotel with very good service. Definitely recommend

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel. Wonderful Staff, Overlooks Gulhane Park”
Reviews.Author: Mark W
Reviews.Content: We truly felt like family on this four-day trip. The staff was fantastic in every way. Our room was spacious and nicely appointed. upon arrival at 6:30 in the morning, they allowed us to use a small room to nap and freshen up and then offered us the complementary breakfast buffet. On top of being a great property, they offered a substantial discount if you paid for your room in cash.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Tk116
Reviews.Content: The Sirkeci Konak Hotel proudly displays it's 3 Trip Advisor awards in it's lobby area, and rightly so. This hotel oozed class and service from the minute we walked in the front door. Check in was fast and friendly. We had the bonus of being upgraded to a wonderful Topkapi Palace park view room. We were then offered a complimentary arrival drink while we were given an overview of the area and activities / tours to consider. The hotel offers a daily program of free activities, so we immediately signed up for the free cooking class. We spent our first night at their terrace restaurant enjoying the best meal we had eaten in Turkey. This arrival dinner was also free. Ours came to over 100 TL, drinks were extra, but at 10 TL for a glass of wine, who is complaining! We booked a couple of tours through the hotel, both were great. Breakfast was also wonderful. Another bonus of this hotel is the free afternoon tea consisting of Turkish / Apple tea, fresh lemonade with semet. We attended our cooking class and then got to enjoy the spoils of our effort in their restaurant - essentially another free dinner! The hotel sauna, pool and hamam were also great. I can not recommend this hotel highly enough. If you are going to Istanbul, you MUST stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience!”
Reviews.Author: carinissima
Reviews.Content: At the time I walked in the hotel, I had no idea how impressed I'd walk out, 5 days later. Everything, from the overall aesthetic of the lobby, the rooms, the bathrooms, the extraordinary staff, the great food, the terrace, the pool, sauna, everything exceeded my expectations. It was luxury treatment without the luxury price. The daily brunch, which was included in the room cost, was fantastic! I just don't have anything negative to say about it. The hotel has two restaurants, one with seafood on the first floor, one traditional at the top and the rooftop terrace, which has an amazing view. The wait staff seems to read your mind. And I could go on and on, but you must have gotten my point by now.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Small hotel in a giant city”
Reviews.Author: Charmingqueen
Reviews.Content: Very charming hotel, warm welcome, smiling and helpful staff. Hotel is ideally situated near to all touristic places of Istanbul. Perfect for those who look for a quality hotel in the heart of a historic city without paying crazy prices

Reviews.Title: “Sensational Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: Kitty163_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at Sirceki Konak, and had a wonderful holiday. We arrived early from our cruise ship, and while we had to wait a short while for our room to be ready, we were given coffee and cake and a friendly staff member told us all about Istanbul sightseeing and gave us a good city map. We were made to feel so very welcome, which was a good start for our holiday in Istanbul. In fact, all the staff were very friendly and exceptionally helpful. We would recommend you upgrade to one of the rooms on the top floor with a balcony. We stayed in room 1407, which was a large room where we could enjoy our morning cup of tea on our private terrace overlooking beautiful Gulhane Park.The buffet breakfast was quite adequate and delicious. We also enjoyed a wonderful relaxing massage in the Spa. You can walk to Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque, the Haghia Sophia, the Basilica Cistern and The Grand Bazaar, or if you prefer get the lightrail which is 2 minutes walk from the hotel. We dined at the Seafood Restaurant at the hotel and the food was sensational. Dinner on the rooftop restaurant is also very good with a lovely view of the lights of Istanbul, at night. Sirceki Konal offer cooking classes and wine and cheese tastings among other extras. We had fun at the cooking class and afterwards enjoyed eating the food we had prepared.The merchants in the same street as the hotel are very friendly and reliable too. We received the beautiful vase we bought from Ceres Gift, 2 weeks after we arrived home. Excellent service! The staff at Sirceki Konak can organise all your tours for you and also a private car to the airport for the same cost as a taxi, and more reliable! We highly recommend you stay at Sirceki Konak in Istanbul, it may not be 5 stars in decor but it is 6 stars for service.

Reviews.Title: “Have not experienced such warm hospitality before”
Reviews.Author: amnahussain
Reviews.Content: Firstly-location...Hotel is situated near all places you would generally visit (topkapi palace, blue mosque, spice and grand bazaar etc.) at a short walking distance. Tram stops are about a minute away. However different to the other hotels in the area, it is on a far less noisy road and you feel comfortable instantly walking around to and from from the hotel without hoards of people that are seen on other nearby streets. Hotel itself-Well, wow. I've stayed in a few somewhat fancy hotels but never encountered such kind and genuine hospitality (without over intrusion) as experienced here. The staff were always willing to facilitate, professional and very helpful with directions, guides and recommendations. And the hotel itself didn't have that underhanded "I want to charge you for everything" feel that you get at so many places. Probably the best collection of staff I've met in any hotel. The decor itself is quite tasteful and understated, the bedrrom was more than nice with a great bed and lovely extra touches here and there. The only thing I would say is that the bathroom was alittle small, so if you like your space, get a bigger room. In spite of that, the bedroom was lovely with a little balcony overlooking the street below where you can stand drinking coffee in the morning and be a nosy neigbour watching the family run shops open up in the morning and the shopkeepers sit on the street playing backgammon just living life at a leisurely pace. The roof terrace is lovely has loads of greenery and comfy soft furnishings Breakfast has a nice variety and is more than adequate, I didnt try the restaurants but the food smelt great. Overall, if this is your first visit to istanbul and you want a cert for a pleasing and relaxing hotelling experience and prefer a more personal family environment then stay here. I can't really fault it. So singles, couples, elderly would really love it here..

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that prides itself on it's hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: KGilo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel In mid-august. It was our starting point in Turkey and we couldn't have chosen a better place. The location is excellent and the staff are professional and also friendly and approachable. Our room was very comfortable with plenty of space to move around in. It was a but tight in the bathroom but we didn't mind: it was clean, modern and more than enough for someone on holiday. We enjoyed the indoor pool, found it ver clean and a nice place to cool off and relax after a day on istanbul's hectic streets. We ate at the terrace restaurant one night and really enjoyed our meal and the service was excellent. There are lots of little touches that also make this hotel stand out. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “All round excellent hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: Patrick W
Reviews.Content: We went for an anniversary treat. The welcome drinks on arrival were followed up by complimentary fruit and wine in our room as an anniversary gesture- a very nice touch. Similarly, my wife was Turkish delighted to receive a going away box of the traditional sweets. The standard of hospitality and efficiency is very high, with friendly staff who will organise bookings and taxis as needed. We ate in each of the hotel restaurants and were very well looked after in each. The seafood restaurant was particularly enjoyable on our last night there. The breakfast selection is very wide and very enjoyable. The location is excellent. A short stroll down the street and you're in Gulhane park and the Islamic technology museum is just opposite the hotel. A further short stroll through the park is the cafe overlooking the sea, just below Topkapi Palace. The main tourist attractions are easiy accessible on foot and for attractions further away the trams are very easy to use to get around.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic in every way!”
Reviews.Author: skip487
Reviews.Content: Sirkeci Konak epitomizes hospitality. Staff falls over themselves to cater to guests. What pleasant people! While rooms are somewhat small...they are nicely appointed, and the location of the hotel is excellent. Nice addition is the free airport pickup which is huge in Istanbul .A+++ in every way!

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: Richard M
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest hotels we've stayed in anywhere in the world, and certainly the friendliest. The entire staff goes out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. For instance, one evening we particiipated in a cooking class with the chef and ate the results. Location by the Topkapi Palace is great, and only a short walk to the tram that provides easy access to much of European Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Tradesman's entrance!”
Reviews.Author: CKCK2011
Reviews.Content: Not a bad location but the entrance is down a side street full of local tradesman's shops and full of delivery vans to and from! The hotel staff was helpful and attentive and our 1st evening meal in the hotel was also enjoyable. The Apple Tea in the afternoon was refreshing and the buffett breakfast was plentiful. The swimming pool in the 'basement' is very small and it did not appeal to us at all what so ever! The bed was comfortable enough given the bedroom was fairly narrow! All in all, we enjoyed the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Everything the reviews have said...”
Reviews.Author: TomIm
Reviews.Content: I don't have a lot to add to the other reviewers other than to confirm this is a great hotel for the price. Location was excellent, between walking and public transportation, could easily see the historic sights and access the nightlife in the newer sections of Istanbul. Room was very clean and comfortable, and breakfast was a treat---every day had a different Turkish traditional dish to complement the normal European breakfast. I would note that the hotel appears to be in more of a working class neighborhood, but my daughter and I always felt perfectly safe--our only danger was that we might have bought a carpet from the numerous sellers that my wife would not fancy...

Reviews.Title: “Like staying with you favourite relatives!”
Reviews.Author: Jessie_0402
Reviews.Content: Sirkeci Konak is smack bang in the middle of the Old City, walking distance to most of the sites in Istanbul. The staff were exceptional!!! I literally could not fault them. ANYTHING... and I mean anything that you need, they are more than happy to help you with. The hotel provided unlimited bottled water, which is a huge plus in a country where drinking tap water is not advised. One night.. my mother and I ate dinner on the roof top (must do) and the wind picked up and it got a bit chilly all of a sudden. The next thing we know... the hotel staff are offering pashminas around to make sure everyone was comfortable. Sirkeci Konak also run FREE daily activities for guests. The only thing that could be improved is the breakfast... it is a bit of a mix match of food from around the world and we sometimes struggled to find things we liked. I have done a lot of traveling and this is (by far) the friendliest hotel I have ever stayed in... it was sad to say goodbye.

Reviews.Title: “Clean with a great location... a rare treat!”
Reviews.Author: COOPER152
Reviews.Content: At the beginning of August 2011 my family ( husband, wife, and two teenagers) stayed at the Sirkeci Konak for two nights while on our first European vacation as a family. Although we were not staying for long, the hotel provided an activity nearly everyday for people who may be tired of sightseeing. From Turkish cooking lessons to alcohol tastings. The rooftop restaurant provided a beautiful view of Old Istanbul, the hotel is affiliated with 4 restaurants in the area with guest receiving 10% off the meals. The hotel provided an amazing breakfast buffet free of charge and even arranged an early breakfast for our family at 5:30 a.m. when we had to leave to catch a plane to Paris. Most importantly the hotel was clean. With a city that has an extremely wide range of people, those living in extreme poverty to those affording 30 million dollar water front houses it is important to find a hotel for the right price with the standards of the upper class. It was well kept, had many amenities, friendly staff, and although it lacked the name, seemed to have just as much class and the Four Seasons located only a few minutes away. Istanbul is a city that had 3 029 mosques, one of which was located directly out of our window (within arms length). Chances are that there will be at least four surrounding any hotel you chose...so remember ear plugs. You will regret it if you don't and wake up at 4 a.m. to the Muslim call to prayer. The hotel was a treat, located in the heart of one of the most historic cities, but tucked away from the hustle and bustle it contains.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: donna b
Reviews.Content: Our family of 8 stayed here for 6 nights in June and we were happy with every aspect of the hotel. We had deluxe rooms which were quite large and had modern very nice bathrooms. The service was outstanding and helpful and the staff greeted our grown children, who traveled to the South of Turkey ane returned to the hotel for one additional night, like long lost friends. The food was outstanding and the room for breakfast was lovely. The location was perfect for sightseeing; it was an easy walk to the Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque, the Grand Bazaar and the Spice Market among other attractions. We made use of the convenient tram which stopped a short block away.

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bruce P
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this Hotel & were treated like "part of their family". We were greeted with warm welcome smiles that made us feel really at home. We enjoyed a much appreciated drink whilst their staff told of all the sights to see, how to use the local transport, and all the useful things you need to know when visiting a new city. The rooms where very comfortable and contained everything we needed - beds very comfy. Every time we left & entered the hotel we were greeted with friendly smiles & greetings that were genuine. When we departed they shook our hands and stood outside waving when we drove off in the taxi. I felt sad to leave. This level of genuine service is hard to find. No tips were expected but you would gladly give one.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: MalarMohan
Reviews.Content: My 14-month old daugther and I tagged along with my husband on his business trip to Istanbul. Initially we stayed at a 5-star Hotel on the Anatolian side of Istanbul, but found it practical to transfer to the European side to continue sight seeing the rest of the trip. We booked into Sirkeci Konak, not knowing whether it would fit our baby. The taxi driver had difficulties finding the hotel and that gave us a fear that we may have picked a hotel in the wrong location. We were wrong! It is most definately in the heart of the Old City! While carrying my baby in my arms, I could easily walk to all the major sights without feeling tired. The hotel is in the vicinity of Gulhane Park Tram station,which could easily get you to further sites. As for the room, we found our Deluxe room a little too small for our walking baby - the hotel staff upgraded us to a bigger room for the same rate! Their guest relations officer took time to introduce us to their hotel, their indoor activities and how to get around Istanbul. We participated in their Tukish cooking class, free of charge.We used their swimming pool, sauna room, had dinner at the Roof Top Terrace Restaurant ( posing a view of the city and Gulhane Park) and even received a parting gift of Turkish Delight. My daugther was given a new doll each day of her stay in the hotel and the friendly staff named her the 'Cookie' guest ! On the whole, at Sirkeci Konak you get 5star service and location - saves time and transport hassle if you are visiting the main sites, which make up for any less in facilities like children pools or kids play area and activities for them.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: MrsVUK
Reviews.Content: As a family of four we stayed in a twin standard room and a deluxe with balcony for 7 days. Both rooms were very clean and the deluxe had plenty of space with a nicely furnished balcony. We asked for candles and were provided with lanterns and the offer to take them home if we wanted! We were meeting a friend who lives in Istanbul and a member of staff helped me order flowers which were delivered the next day as promised to our room. All staff were very friendly and could speak good English. No request was too much trouble for them. There was a personal letter in our rooms from Faruk the owner who would sort out any problems if the staff had not managed to do so. He also spent time one morning introducing himself to us and others. The hotel location could not be better and the tram stop was a short walk away. The afternoon tea was enjoyable and the cooking class fun for my daughters. One way free taxi and free dinner was all very nice to have as part of the booking. Turkish Delight in our rooms and free water relpaced each day was a very nice touch. Also an email upon our return to see if we had any complaints. They seem to think of everthing! We would recommend this hotel and return. We had meals in the hotel and their sister hotel serving Ottoman cuisine both very nice.I cannot say much more than has already been said by other guests.The reports are spot on! The girls were given large boxes of Turkish Delight upon leaving which they were very happy with!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: OscardogAustralia
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with great staff. The room was comfortable and very clean. Hotel is located within walking distance of all major attractions and transport.The hotel restaurants were very good and well priced. As was one of the sister hotels ( Orient Express). We really appreciated the free guest activities provided 6 out of 7 evenings. We took a guided tour to the Farmer's market and surrounding Greek area and participated in the cooking class. The hotel provided a free afternoon tea in the lounge area. These activites were great for meeting and chatting with the staff and other guests. I would certainly return to this hotel. Ask for a room with a balcony if you want to smoke. It is also good for people watching. The road is closed to most traffic and the windows are double glazed so you get a good night's sleep. We were also impressed that a room was available for an 8am check-in.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Simsalabim54
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home after 1 week in Istanbul.Our stay turned out to be different and longer than planned . We decided to have a long weekend in Istanbul as it was our 30th wedding anniversary. The day after our arrival I had a nasty fall 15 mins. into our sightseeing. It resulted in multiple fractures to my left ankle and ligament damage to my right. The staff at Sirkeci Konak immediately send me to the American Hospital in Istanbul where I was given the option of being operated on the same day. I had no second thoughts and took that option. One of the staff from the hotel (Ramazan) followed me and my husband and lent us invaluable support and assistance throughout my admission and also post-operative . It was truly service beyond the call of duty. In fact service and kindness was what we were met with from all the staff. My husband stayed on in the double room but only paid the price of a single room for the rest of the stay. The day before my departure home, I was discharged back to the hotel. We were offered the use of a room for the disabled. So now I've also tested the room the hotel has to offer for those with a limb impairment. The wheelchair just about managed to fit the lift. However that this is a small, charming boutique hotel was what made us pick it in the first place. I haven't tested their other facilities just their fish restaurant which was excellent. We arrived at the hotel 10 mins before the kitchen closed but was made to feel very welcome nevertheless. I leave Istanbul with a very good feeling despite my unfortunate accident. i have a lasting souvenir from Istanbul in my left leg but what will always remain in my memory is this fabulous little hotel. I'll be back as soon as I get better to see Istanbul properly. If anyone need some more information, feel free to drop me a line.

Reviews.Title: “Well Deserved Winner Travelers Choice 3 Years Running”
Reviews.Author: chrisplusros
Reviews.Content: The Sirkeci Konak Hotel encompasses all the qualities required to make it a top boutique hotel. All its outstanding qualities have been praised by other reviewers, perfect position, friendly staff, high standard of decor and fittings, and complimentary afternoon teas. I would also like to praise the other complimentary extras for internet bookings which include airport transfers,first night dinner, wine tasting cooking classes and local tours. Also highly appreciated was the letter from the owner Faruk Boyaci giving his personal mobile phone number promising that any problems or concerns would be dealt with personally and would be resolved. How many other hotels make this promise! I look forward to returning to Istanbul and the The Sirkeci Konak Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worthy of rating”
Reviews.Author: Bernler
Reviews.Content: Before I arrived I was suspect of how this hotel received all the praise on the Internet. I have stayed in many hotels around the world and many times have not agreed with reviewers. For this hotel I can definitely state that the praise is well deserved. First and foremost because of the staff.
