I can say I have never stayed in a hotel with a more dedicated wonderful pleasant staff. Every single employee is fantastic! Location perfect. Do go to this hotel you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Feeling Welcome in Istanbul at the Sirkeci Konak”
Reviews.Author: phredude
Reviews.Content: We are a family from Vermont who spent several days in May in Istanbul as the first and final leg of our family tour of Turkey and the Greek Islands. I have to admit that I had reservations about traveling with our two young kids, ages 7 and 10, when there are some obvious tensions in the world. However, my worries were completely unfounded and our time in Istanbul could not have been nicer. We really enjoyed being there, and a large part that was due to our stay at the Sirkeci Konak. In addition to being one of the nicest hotels that weâ€™ve ever been in, the people there made us feel incredibly welcome from the get-go. I canâ€™t recommend this place enough, and we loved it so much that we stayed there on the final leg of our trip, as well. It made our stay in Istanbul so special that I personally canâ€™t wait to go back. I know Iâ€™m not alone. The hotel arranged transportation to and from the city, and that made things easier because trying to get a taxi in the big city is always a bit of a chore. You never really know if youâ€™re being taken, especially if you donâ€™t speak the language. We were ideally located in the heart of the old section of Istanbul, within walking distance to the river, countless restaurants, shops, and many of the sites that visitors will want to check out, including the Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque. There is a really nice park directly across the, and we arrived during some sort of massive tulip blooming whose colors were amazing. Really beautiful, and a nice introduction to the city. The hotel offers tours of the city, as well as cooking classes. How cool is that? They can also arrange for transportation throughout the city, and the light rail passes within 100 feet of the hotel. I highly recommend walking and taking the train. The helpful people at the front desk can help you with every aspect of this, and offer plenty of helpful advice on where to go. The hotel itself was amazing, and the rooms were very clean and simply beautiful. We could have spent our entire time inside, though we didnâ€™t. Itâ€™s actually a resort and spa, so people go there for a romantic getaway or to just be pampered (not our thing). They have a pool, sauna, gym, and a spa where you can get a massage or have a Turkish bath. We spent a lot of time with the kids in the pool and Turkish bath after a day of exploring the city. The food was awesome. When you travel with kids, you really have to think about things like safety and comfort, and part of that is knowing where youâ€™re going to eat, because kids can be picky. The restaurant at the Sirkeci Konak had incredible food and the service was impeccable, though maybe a little upscale and sophisticated to eat ever day. We couldnâ€™t wait to wake up just so we could go and eat at the breakfast buffet, which was very elegant and had a wonderful selection of foods, including freshly made bread and pastries, eggs and breakfast meats, fresh fruit, and all sorts of nuts and sweet treats. They really do a nice job with the food, itâ€™s an experience in and of itself. Again, the service is amazing. There was an afternoon tea time which was nice transition into supper. The guests in the hotel sit together and chat, or you can choose to simply sit quietly and enjoy your tea, either black tea or apple tea. They also serve complimentary sandwiches, or you can order any sort of beverage or cocktail, and there is a light food menu. We really felt at home, an important consideration when youâ€™re with your kids. Despite the fact that the hotel is a resort/spa, the kind of place where people normally seek out elegance and refinement, they were very warm to our family and really enjoyed having our kids there. FYI, they love children Istanbul, and showered our kids with attention and even small but thoughtful gifts. I could go on for days about how much we loved Istanbul and the Sirkeci Konak. What a wonderful place to visit, and I honestly canâ€™t wait to go back. The dollar is still relatively strong to the Turkish lira, about 2:1, so you can get good deals. Definitely check out the big sites, including the spice market and grand bazaar. I actually met a family from New Hampshire at the spice market. When we sadly had to leave, the staff at the hotel all came out to the lobby to say goodbye, and I felt like I was leaving part of my family behind. They even gave us a departing gift, which really made the trip special. Istanbul is a big cosmopolitan city that is culturally unique, and a great middle ground between Europe and Asia. There is a push to gain entry into the EU, so they are working hard at being taken seriously on a global scale, and I think theyâ€™ve accomplished it. I would encourage anyone who has even the slightest inkling to see Istanbul to go, and to stay at the Sirkeci Konak. We simply loved it there.

Reviews.Title: “A truly superb hotel - it had everything”
Reviews.Author: FranDoherty
Reviews.Content: A perfect place to stay in Istanbul - very centrally located, clean, superb hospitality with friendly staff going to all lengths to make your stay a perfect one. The activities are great and the Turkish bath facility is a must. We consider this hotel to be worthy of a "very highly recommended" label.

Reviews.Title: “There's excellence .... and then there's the Sirkeci Konak ...”
Reviews.Author: HomedicMunes
Reviews.Content: There's Excellence ... and then there's the Sirkeci Konak. This was our second visit to this beautiful country. We had fallen in love with its people and culture 2 years ago and this time decided to stay at the Sirkeci Konak. I, along with thousands of others had read the reviews, the accolades the Sirkeci receives. And I confess I did wonder: are they true or inflated as I suspect some reviews may be. Our experience supports the former. In our travels we have stayed at many beautiful hotels and some whose reputation for service is also well deserved. However where Sirkeci excels is in its philosophy of service and hospitality offering guests an authentic taste of Turkish life. Whether it's the efficiency of the dining room servers, the willingness of front desk staff to help with your itinerary or the encouragement to participate in their activities, the emphasis on service comes first. Upon arrival at Ataturk we were met by our driver and driven to the Sirkeci, compliments of the hotel. Even though our jet lagged bodies didn't want to cooperate, we were anxious to settle in and explore this beautiful city. The reception we received was wonderful. We were immediately invited to sit in a comfortable sitting area nearby and offered our choice of refreshments. Soon after we found ourselves relaxing on the balcony of our lovely 5th floor suite overlooking Gulhane Park watching ships as they moved along the Bosphorus. A lovely fruit basket, a bottle of wine and a dish of Turkish Delight had been placed on the table. Our room was quite comfortable and we enjoyed a glass of wine on the balcony each evening before dinner. The Sirkeci had thought of everything to make our anniversary a special celebration. By the time we had settled in it was getting late, jet lag was taking its toll and we were hungry. In the dining room we enjoyed a very nice 4 course dinner which was also complimentary if you stayed at least 3 nights. On our first visit 2 years ago we had discovered how much we loved the flavors of Turkish cuisine and the meals at Sirkeci didn't disappoint. The next day we attended the free 45 minute cooking class in their immaculate kitchen ... more demo than class ... but it was great fun. There were 7 of us and under the direction of our female chef we chopped and sliced till we had finished an appetizer and main course. Afterwards we were led to the dining room where we tucked into our culinary creations. With the chef's help we had created an entirely edible meal! On Wednesday morning we decided to take advantage of the market excursion and after breakfast were driven to a traditional Turkish neighborhood. Okay, our guide, was very knowledgeable about Turkish history, culture and politics and as we strolled through the neighborhood streets he told stories, pointed out historical sites and patiently answered our many questions. What a super guy! At one point, we stopped and briefly visited a tiny but beautiful mosque. For most of the morning we wandered about taking pictures, tasting treats and buying souvenirs in the busy market nearby. Later, after stopping at a local bakery to buy some traditional breads, we took a short ferry ride back to our own neighborhood and enjoyed lunch in a typical Turkish restaurant patronized by locals. Before returning to our hotel Okay invited us to visit a sister hotel just minutes away from the Sirkeci which had opened the week before. After a cup of apple tea in the public room he showed us one of the bedrooms and we then headed back to the Sirkeci. In contrast to the Sirkeci this hotel was of contemporary design but also quite nice. It will undoubtedly have the same philosophy as its sister hotels ... one of superior service to its guests. Our market tour was fabulous, an authentic taste of Turkish life we might never have discovered had it not been so generously offered. Many, many thanks to our guide and friend, Okay. You made an ordinary day very special indeed. As anyone who has stayed at the Sirkeci Konak knows, it's their service that's truly outstanding and we thank the staff for their kindness during our visit. It really does deserve its exceptional reputation. I have only described a small portion of what the Sirkici has to offer ... there's lots more. Check it out. You won't be disappointed. Unfortunately our visit ended on a sad note ... we didn't want to leave. I'm beginning to research our next trip now and trying to figure out the route ... via Istanbul. We'll be back and there's no question where we'll stay. The Sirkeci Konak is in a class of its own.

Reviews.Title: “Location, staff, facilities - EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: Hambledon
Reviews.Content: I am very slow in uploading this review... but this place was so good I did feel it was important I got it done, even if I am a little late. Travelled in mid May. Four night stay. Summary: Every bit as superb as the reviews on Tripadvisor inferred. We booked via hotel website as we found this the cheapest. Tariff included both a private car collection from airport and a good quality three course meal in restaurant (which was an excellent option on first night). An 11% discount is given if you pay your bill in cash. Overall - superb value. Location is the key factor: 100m from the nearest tram stop, facing the walls of the gardens round the Topkapi Palace, EVERYTHING you could want to see on a short trip (Blue Mosque, Cisterns, Grand Bazaar etc) is within walking distance. The hotel is in good condition and well maintained. Lovely roof terrace with good views. Rooms well equipped and stocked with endless supplies of bottled water upon request. Staff are lovely - always smiling, helpful and there are specific members of staff available to answer tourist questions and they know their stuff. Enjoyed an excellent (and FREE) session with the hotel's chef, trying out some local cooking in the hotel kitchens. Very reassuring when a hotel is confident enough about its hygene standards to allow guests to come and see the staff at work. Although food was excellent you are so close to the main heart of the city there are lots of other restaurants nearby - so only had one meal at the hotel except for breakfasts which were substantial and avoided the need for eating much at lunchtime! One small tip: Forget the tourist cruises - simply catch the ferry with all the locals across to Kadikoy. Not much to see there but as 30 minute ferry costs just 1.75 TL, it is fantastic value and gives a great view of the old city from the sea.

Reviews.Title: “An experience to remember and recorded in our travel diaries”
Reviews.Author: beans070
Reviews.Content: We have travelled from Patagonia to Odessa. Your boutique hotel has the rarity of combining every element that made our stay memorable : a warm welcome, sincere smiles, impeccable manners and efficiency. Our room was perfect, a cosy, tasteful and comfortable retreat. We loved the breakfast, we thoroughly enjoyed the Happy Hour in the Lounge Bar and, after hours of walking and sightseeing, we appreciated the " simit " sandwiches and the excellent wines Turkey produces. And the location is fantastic, we felt the heart of Istanbul ! Congratulations to all of you at Sirkeci Konak ! Gule Gule !

Reviews.Title: “Quite outstanding, family friendly hotel in the heart of old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: TackleTart
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Turkey (with which we were extremely impresed) and by the time we reached Istanbul we had already spent a week on the Ionian coast, two days visiting Epehsus, and a long weekend in Izmir. We had selected this hotel on the basis of previous reviews - for which thanks - and were not diasappointed. The excellent service started even before we arrived and had to change our travel plans from a train journey to a flight from Izmir. An email to the concierge was all it took to have a complimentary car waiting for us at the airport. After being shown our room and given time tofreshen-up we were treated to a warm welcome, apple tea and explanatory talk from the charming duty manager. Complimentary afternoon tea and cake is served to guests every afternoon. There are also free events like backgammon lessons, which my wife enjoyed, and treats for a minor fee - like a genuine Turkish bath and massage. The hotel is in a fantastic location, very near the Topkapi Palace, and an easy walk or short tram ride to the principal mosques, the bazaar and other historic attractions. Don't miss a visit to the Byzantine cistern that featured in one of the Bond films (can't recall which one). The rooms are not huge but neither are they too small. We were given adjoining rooms with a shared internal door so we could share spave with our children. Everything was very clean and well-maintained on a daily basis. The food is very good. The breakfast buffet is extensive, varied and plentiful. Afternoon tea is a delight. We ate at various city restaurants most evenings but we had dinner on the hotel roof terrace one evening and it was a very enjoyable experience. Staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Top tip is to be ready to pay in cash (Turkish lira or Euros) as you will get a significant discount off your bill. We really enjoyed our sightseeing holiday in Istanbul. I would recomemnd the beautiful city and this excellent hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “we love it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: johnvickyAthens
Reviews.Content: First of all we want to say <a big thank you>to all team of Sirkeci hotel.The staff was perfect and very helpfull.Rooms was very clean and when we go inside we feel like as our home in Greece.The breakfast was excellent and with many delicious dishes.I want to say more but believe us there is no words to describe this magic.It was like a dream...Thank you everybody and see you very soon. John & Vicky from Greece.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: JanaLyons
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here for 3 nights during a short stop in Istanbul. I have traveled all over the world and can say that Sirkeci Konak ranks at the top of the list. Great service, terrific rooms, great location and superb value. A really nice surprise...can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional experience!”
Reviews.Author: Alanw99
Reviews.Content: When you read all the reviews about this hotel, you wonder what can possibly make it so special. But it really is! Yes, it is scrupulously clean; it is central to all the main sites so that they are within very easy walking distance; it is tastefully decorated and equipped to modern standards; our room was lovely and, after all the miles that we walked, the â€˜Jacuzziâ€™ bath was just wonderful! Yes, the food is excellent - breakfasts started with real, fresh orange juice and there was an array of different dishes to choose from; in the restaurants attached to the hotel, the menus were good, quality of the service and cuisine high. With the 10% discount card that you were given both for the hotel and nearby restaurants in the chain, they represented very good value. No, what made this hotel special were the people! Prior to the visit, they had dealt very efficiently with my queries and requests. When we were there, nothing was ever too much trouble; their patience and courtesy were limitless. In all the hassle of Istanbul streets where everyone wants to sell you a carpet or a tour or some sort of souvenir, the hotel was an oasis of calm, tucked away just off the main tram route. Complimentary is a word you hear very often in the hotel â€“ excellent wi-fi, bottles of water, Turkish delight, tea and snacks from 4:30 pm. But the hotel also offers a range of activities on different days of the week; you might not feel like taking part, but we made the effort and were very glad that we did. There was a cooking class on Turkish cuisine, which was a lot of fun and we got to eat the food afterwards; there was a cheese and wine tasting and best of all, a four hour guided tour of a Farmers Market and a delightful part of Istanbul on that we would never otherwise have seen. This was led by the charming and highly professional manager, Mr Agah, a man dedicated to looking after his guests. We also made some good friends through these shared experiences. We have never been to a hotel where we were made to feel so special â€“ a gift when we left and half the staff turning out to wave goodbye â€“ and I can't believe they only did that for usâ€¦..! And Istanbul? A fascinating and romantic city that has so much to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Baghdad-Sal
Reviews.Content: It would be difficult to find fault with this hotel. On arrival one of the members of staff greets you and gives you a helpful guide to the city while you enjoy a welcome drink. The hotel is ideally located close to the Topeki Palace, Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia with a number of nice restaurants close by. As a bonus the hotel runs a variety of short workshops (for free) each afternoon. I attended a wine and cheese tasting and a cookery lesson. Both were great fun and very educational. My room was very comfortable, not large but more than adequate. Very nice bathroom with great toiletries. The breakfast was top class, great variety of international as well as local dishes. The staff were friendly and helpful without exception. I would stay at the Sirkeci Konak again and would have no hesitation recommending it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Louisvilletravelers
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. Convenient location, friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience - can recommend highly”
Reviews.Author: Tony K
Reviews.Content: Loved: Free airport transfer on arrival (or departure by choice) Lovely clean room & bathroom Delicious fresh breakfast Excellent location near historic attractions and tram Friendly, courteous and remarkable service Guided walking tour on Wednesdays highly recommended; other activities organised Pool and hammam downstairs - massage/gym available Seafood restaurant in hotel; rooftop terrace/bar

Reviews.Title: “I have been in many hotels but this I like the best”
Reviews.Author: mopjepopje
Reviews.Content: Last week I went again to this hotel, I have already been twice in this hotel. Every time I go there it is amazing how the staff is doeing his best to make your stay a real dream. I have been in many hotels, all over the world, but the way the staff of this hotel is doeing it's best for you is incredible. The sky is the limit. The rooms are perfect, it is very very clean everywhere in the hotel, the food is perfect and the neigbourhood is very nice. Easy to go all around the city by tram. This is really the best hotel to stay if you want to visit Istanbul. I hope to see them all again soon.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: bjos
Reviews.Content: Not much to say that hasnt been said. The hotel and the staff are simply the best!

Reviews.Title: “A quaint boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: bmj54
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Sirkeci Konak Hotel in June! It is a truly charming boutique Turkish hotel. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful during our 6 day stay, and our room just delightful - spotlessly clean, with a very comfortable bed and a little balcony overlooking the park with part-views of the port. The hotel is in a great location, just walking distance from the Sultanhamet and major attractions of Istanbul. After a very busy day exploring the wonderful city we would look forward to returning to the lovely hotel, sometimes for the complementary afternoon tea! We hope to return to istanbul one day, and will definitely be staying at Sirkeci Konak Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little oasis in the middle of Sultanahmet in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: ZurichPizazz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is extremely well situated; within walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, Spice Market, and the tram line. But after a long day of walking in the heat we always looked forward to stepping into our little oasis where the friendly staff would great us and a lovely pool refreshed us. We had 2 connecting rooms (one with a North-American-style Queen-size bed and one with 2 single beds for our daughters). This was a plus and not something you often find in Europe. These rooms were impeccably clean and well-decorated. The roof patio was great for a little early evening drink with my husband before dinner. We tried both restaurants and preferred the fish one on the ground floor. Breakfast is copious and there is something for everyone's taste. The wellness area is a plus; steam bath, sauna, and pool. We took advantage of it every day before dinner and it was fantastic. The staff is extremely welcoming in helpful and made our stay in Istanbul that much more special. The only thing that did not run smoothly is that the (complimentary) driver was not there when we got out of the arrivals door at the airport but after one quick call to the hotel he managed to find us and we were on our way to the hotel within about 15 mins waiting. A minor glitch that did not affect us in any way. In summary, I can say that I highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again should we ever return to Istanbul. We stayed at a 5 star resort near Antalya that left us wishing we were still at the Sirkeci Konak in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, amazing service, total comfort”
Reviews.Author: briguy2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sirkeci Konak for five nights in mid July and had a wonderful time. I will admit that when we first arrived there, I wasn't totally wowed because the lobby struck me as a little "old school" compared to the more modern designer boutique hotels we usually stay at (plus, the airport transfer we'd arranged through the hotel had been kind of flaky, so I wasn't in the best of moods at that point). But once we started interacting with the very helpful staff and saw our beautiful room (Deluxe Room w/ balcony on the top floor), we were convinced we'd selected the right place to stay in Istanbul. After walking the hectic streets of Istanbul every day, our room came to feel like a tranquil oasis that we looked forward to escaping to. It helped that our terrace overlooked Gulhane Park, where Topkapi Palace is, so instead of looking down at noisy traffic and crowds, we gazed at lush greenery, as well as the Golden Horn in the distance. The hotel location is perfect. It's centrally located to all of the major tourist sights (Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar), but it's on a quiet side street, so as soon as you round the corner and see the hotel, it's almost like you're in a totally different city. And as I mentioned before, the service is exceptional. Nearly every staff member we came across went out of their way to assist us. I'd also like to strongly recommend the hotel's spa services. On our last day we both booked the 90-minute Sultan's Massage, consisting of a scrub-down with an exfoliating brush, a thorough lathering-up with soap, and an oil massage. What a perfect way to end our trip! And the rooftop restaurant is great...amazing views and very good food. We never tried the hotel's seafood restaurant on the first floor (because we always wanted to dine al fresco), but it's supposed to be very good as well. My one quibble with the hotel was its breakfast. Out of the four hotels we stayed at during our trip (the other three in Greece), this hotel's breakfast offerings were probably the weakest. Much of it was standard continental breakfast fare, but many of the pastries and breads were stale and the fruit selection was pretty lackluster. But maybe I was just desperately craving a huge bowl of healthy oatmeal and fruit after three weeks of scrambled eggs, sausage, and yogurt. But the breakfast was just one minor hitch in an otherwise exceptional hotel experience. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Turkey”
Reviews.Author: LauraClare
Reviews.Content: My cousins and I stayed at Sirkeci for 5 nights in July and I would say it is easily on my list of top five favorite hotels (and I travel a lot for business and fun). The staff treats you like family. They are helpful and friendly. The hotel is extremely clean and charming. The location can't be beat (even though most cabs can't get to it easily so learn your way around because you may need to give them directions). This is not a large hotel but what it lacks in size it makes up for in charm.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: TVictor53
Reviews.Content: We loved our visit to the Konak Hotel! It was like being a part of the family! The hotel itself had wonderful beds and pillows! Very important! Spotlessly clean and maintained! Exceptional maid service, great attention to detail! They welcomed us with a complimentary dinner in their fish restaurant on the first night - what a delightful surprise! The hotel also has amazing facilities - Turkish bath, gym, plunge pool, massage on call, everything you could need! At 5pm everyday they would hold a complimentary afternoon tea which was such a special touch! They even conduct free city tours! The hospitality was second to none. We were personally looked after by "Okay" who went above and beyond to take care of us and our every need. We loved him! We had the best time and can't wait to visit again! Thanks to all!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel and would go back.”
Reviews.Author: lindasummey
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on tripadvisor and it was rated third in Istanbul. It was a wonder small boutique hotel with an excellent staff. We had pick up from the airport and a complementary first night dinner. The food was great and so was the location. We could walk to most sights. Our roon was extremely clean and a very modern bath. It exceeded our expectations. I would highly recommend this hotel. Linda Summey Asheville North Carolina

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: src31
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and superb staff. i arrived in Istanbul very motion sick. When i arrived at the Hotel they could see how sick i was and gave me a room to lie down in even though i had not checked in yet or even given my credit card. This has never happened to me. When i inquired about the lottery in Turkey they sent a staff member to buy a ticket for me because the store to buy it was far away. Best food i had in Turkey was at the Hotel's own restaurant. The free buffet breakfast is great. Rooms were clean and great. They even gave you free Turkish Delight candy in the room every day and gave both of us a free box to take home when we checked out. The Hotel's location is great and is within walking distance to all of the major sites.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly small hotel in great location - great for those fed up with anonymous chain hotels”
Reviews.Author: AndrewS60
Reviews.Content: Located within 10 - 15 mins walk of all the top sights in Sultanhamet, this small 4-star hotel is in a quiet street, just outside the walls of the Topkapi Palace estate. Quiet, friendly, traditional Ottoman style decor. We had booked via the Internet, and with a 3-day stay were offered a complementary dinner on our first night in the fish restaurant of the hotel (excellent grilled fish, huge portions) as well as complementary transfer to the airport at the end of our stay. We also took advantage of 11% discount offered to clients booking on the internet site for payment on arrival in cash - a remarkable offer! As it happens we were given a complementary upgrade on arrival to a balcony room with huge double bed. The room was comfortably furnished, minibar, and smallish but quite adequate bathroom with shower and jacuzzi bath. Their rooftop restaurant offered partial views over the Bosporus, and excellent food. There is a small spa with pool (really only a plunge pool rather than a swimming pool) and hamam as well as sauna and small gym. But the real delight of the hotel is the friendliness and attention of the staff. Without exception they were all courteous, and could not have been more helpful. It really did feel like a home from home. The facilities in the hotel are no doubt comparable to others - although we thought the quality of the food was particularly good, but for individual travellers who like necessary comforts AND a human touch, this is a good bet - and, we thought, at a not unreasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms, great service”
Reviews.Author: AussieNarelle
Reviews.Content: My 13 year old son, my boyfriend and I stayed here from June 24-26, 2011. The hotel si centrally located near the tourist attractions of SUltanahmet, but it is so quiet when you walk through the front doors. My son had a standard room and he loved it and had sufficient room. My boyfriend and I were upgraded to a deluxe room on the top floor with a great view over the park. very peaceful and could look to the Bosphorus and hear the call to prayer each morning. My son was located one floor down. Loved the balcony and the ability to open the windows as prefer fresh air. Breakfast was nice and a good variety. Pool and hamam were nice to have at the end of each day. It would be nice to have someone to lie in the sun as the pool is in the basement - not a huge deal as most of the year you would want to be able to use the indoor pool. Can see why this hotel was an award and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “So friendly”
Reviews.Author: PeterNoble
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel in May and I can safely say that this is the friendliest hotel I have ever stayed at. From the moment we walked in the door the staff looked after us so attentively (from the welcoming cup of tea, to advice on how to make a train trip and the wonderful experience of a guided visit to a local market and mosques). This hotel is really well situated (near the "must see" vistor attractions (Topkapi Palace Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque etc and also close to the bustling ferry area of Eminonu with the Spice Market). The restaurants at the hotel and its sister restaurants serve various varieties of fantastic Turkish fare - our (free) tour of the gastronomic delights of traditional Turkish dishes on the first night was one of the best meals we had... The accommodation is really comfortable and the public areas are a delight. The swimming pool, hammam and sauna are a bonus. I woudl recommend that anyone visiting Istanbul stays here. You will become an instant fan too. We shall certainly be returning!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: monicadavydov
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Sirkeci konak.hotel is very clean.rooms are OK, not very big. breakfast was very good.Location is good too. but the best thing about this hotel is Staff!!! they doing a wonderful job!!!!!I will defenetly go back!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Greatly exceeded our expectations in every category”
Reviews.Author: ChrisDaCunha
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Sirkeci is like staying with family. The friendly staff and personalized service is better than the Four Seasons. Great location in the old town (near Topkapi Palace) but on a relatively quiet street. Beautiful well appointed rooms with all the amenities you would expect from a top notch hotel. Delicious food at both restaurants as well as the other family owned properties. My family just returned from our first visit to Istanbul, Turkey and I have to say it's become one of our favorite destinations among the 20+ countries we have visited. The staff at the Sirkecki Hotel played a key role in our experience. On the first day we went on a complimentary hotel sponsored tour with Okai to the local farmers market, a mosque and a Greek Orthodox church. We loved strolling through the less touristy streets of Istanbul and meeting the locals (mostly moderate Muslims who are genuine and incredibly nice people). We also participated in a complimentary wine tasting event at the hotel which morphed into a Q&A discussion about life in Istanbul. I can't remember the name of the woman who ran that event but she was amazing. We also met the owner and you can tell that the culture of an organization really does start at the top. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic -- wholeheartedly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: map617
Reviews.Content: I can't compliment the staff and hotel facilities enough. My fiance and I arrived early in the morning after taking a red eye flight, so the staff upgraded our reservation (to a deluxe room on the top floor!) so we could take a nap and get showers right away. The room was lovely, spotlessly clean and had a balcony with a nice view over Gulhane Park and the mouth of the Golden Horn. Despite being in an excellent central location, the room was very quiet and there was hardly any traffic on the street outside. We were also given a voucher for a free dinner in the hotel's nice fish restaurant. Our meal there and in the hotel's rooftop restaurant were both very good. We also had an opportunity to use the hotel spa, which includes a small version of a Turkish bath (free for guests), which was immaculately clean, relaxing and inexplicably deserted. The breakfasts were excellent and the staff really went out of its way to make our stay a pleasant one. The Sirkeci Konak helped make our trip to Istanbul wonderful and I have already recommended it to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to stay in old own of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Manchesterambler
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after looking at the the reviews on trip advisor and it surpassed our expectations. A relatively small, quiet, boutique hotel with modern Turkish style and modest, but flawless accommodation. Very clean and comfortable. Close, but not next to,( ie away from the noise) all the important old town sights... Blue Mosque etc. Right in the heart of the old town. A personal letter in our room welcomed us, and asked us to call the owner if there were any problems.... on his personal cell phone number. (this was a first for me!). We got a very nice intro talk about what to see, from the guest relations director, shortly after checking in, and then went to lunch which was very good, served by a very courteous, friendly waiter. For booking online we were given the option of a free meal in their seafood restaurant. We considered heading elsewhere out on the town, but after sightseeing all afternoon we were tired and took them up on their offer. A very nice set menu of soup and fresh fish. All we paid for was the Turkish wine. Both were very good. Breakfast was fine and covered the spectrum from Turkish to Western. Then off out on another day of sightseeing. Went to the "Metropolis" restaurant for lunch (#1 restaurant trip advisor Istanbul....great don't miss it, not far from the hotel). All around in the afternoon and to the "Imbat" terrace restaurant just around the corner, for supper, booked by the hotel. This is the #4 restaurant on trip advisor in Istanbul and is part of the hotel owner's small chain! Also excellent. Very good meal ( and staff) while you look over the city and watch the light show on the bridge over the Bosphorus. The next morning, as we left, we met the owner. We chatted for a while while we waited for our car, and then he came out and waved us goodbye. A remarkable experience. Stay here if you go to Istanbul and want to experience Turkish hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel close to the Bosphorous - service with the personal touch”
Reviews.Author: RoySingh
Reviews.Content: This is an exceptional family managed boutique hotel close to the Topkapi Palace and park. Exceptional attention to detail and great service can be attributed to the hands-on management and professional staff. The staff were very pleasant and always willing to assist with requests; directions; currency etc - which made the stay so pleasant and enjoyable. Although this may be a small hotel/group, it still offers great value for money; is well located in Sirkeci, close to the local tram stop of Gulhane. The main ferry point for trips across the Bosphorous (east side) and the railway station are within walking distance. Other attractions are the Spice market; the bridge across the Bosphorous; the park and the Topkapi palace and the Hagipasha (art and dance) . Other attractions and historical sites are accessible via the tram (current tokens cost 1.75 tl per trip - obtainable from the hotel desk). The food and breakfast at the hotel was also great and there are variations to the daily menu

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could take them home with me!”
Reviews.Author: Terri65
Reviews.Content: I left the Sirkeci Konak Hotel this morning am still in transit home but I am anxious to relay my thoughts as I found other's reviews so valuable. I cannot say enough about my wonderful experience at this hotel. After sailing from Athens to Istanbul we arrive at the hotel quite early in the morning. We were greeted with the biggest of smiles and warmest of welcomes. Since the room was not ready, due to the early arrival, they kept our bags for us and gave us information of where to find the double decker tour bus we wanted to get an overview of the city. It was our first time in Istanbul and we really had no idea of what to expect. We were blown away by the incredible hospitality of the people in the city, but the staff in the hotel took the cake in that department. Thye really do treat you like family and they made us feel doted on: no request was too small or too big. It is their absolute pleasure to help you with whatever you might need. In fact, they gave us a larger room than the one I originally booked. We paid cash and got an 11% discount. We were there for 2 days and 2 nights. Both nights we ate at the restaurants of the hotel family where we enjoyed the 10% discount. They were both in easy and short walking distance to the hotel. The meals were great with wonderful service! The hotel is in an excellent location. To be honest, I booked this hotel largely due to Trip Advisor reviews and their #2 Recommended Hotel status on the site. I didn't really have the time to research ideal locations, etc... Well, I can tell you my husband was praising me up, down, left and right on my choice of hotel. He couldn't believe how well we were located to the major sights. Our room overlooked the Topkapi gardens and the entrance is steps away. The Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern are all within an easy walk. As well, there is a tram (street car) stop steps from the hotel. The tram is about $1.65/ride and can take you all around where you need to go. There is a subway but we didn't get a chance to use it since everything was so accessible by foot, in the main. I can't recommend the city and the hotel enough. We were very sad to leave and I wished I could take some of the staff home with me; The people there have really taught me a lot about hospitality. Istanbul is completely safe and buzzing with energy. It is larger that NYC and busier. There is commerce going on in every nook and cranny. Fascinating! Don't be bothered by people who start talking to you randomly; they probably have a store they would like to show you. I usually hate that sort of thing, but these people are not pushy and they will listen if you tell them that you just aren't interested. Treat them with respect and they will not be insulted by the rejection.

Reviews.Title: “Great in every way, will certainly return”
Reviews.Author: gobabygo1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our stay in the Sikeci Konak for many reasons and the first was the friendliness and cooperation of the staff. The room was very clean and spacious and the bed super comfortable. At 4:00PM, tea time, we commented about the delicious apple tea that we were served to one of the staff. Soon after he returned with a bag of apple tea for us to take home. Another plus, the hotel was in walking distance to all main attractions of Istanbul, such as The Grand Bazzar, Spice Market and the Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in very way!”
Reviews.Author: kellysully
Reviews.Content: My husband and I choose this hotel so that we could "recover" from jet lag for our first two nights in Turkey before traveling on. The hotel is a well-done beautiful respite not only for weary travelers but also for those seeking to make this their homebase for seeing Istanbul. We were greeted about 10:30 p.m. with enthusiasm from the staff, the room was exceptionally clean and comfortable as well as the bathroom. An exceptional value for all you get! Stay here! Near the spice market, Galata Bridge and fairly close to Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar and Topaki Palace. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A nice little hotel in the wonderful Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: kreni
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights there in April, prior to our trio to Cappadocia. The staff are wonderful and helpful. To be honest, I don't remember I've even been in a hotel with better staff, that is the best thing about this hotel. The hotel is cosy and nice, it reflects the spirit of Istanbul. Another good thing is that the hotel is just a few minutes of walking from major sites in Istanbul. Don't forget to ask the staff for advice about local restaurants, they are perfect!

Reviews.Title: “What's not to like!! Great staff”
Reviews.Author: traveltrocity
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sirkeci Konak in June. From the moment I stepped in I felt I was amongst friends. The location was amazing. Just a short walk from Topkapi Palace. The nearby tram station was steps away, which meant I could be in the middle of Taksim in 10 minutes. I walked to all destinations in Sultanahmet including the Blue Mosque, Ayasofia, the crazy Grand Bizzarre, and the Spice market. The rooms were immaculate and quiet, and the complimentary breakfast was a great way to start the day. And at the end of walking all day you could relax in the Hamaam in the basement. But the most important reason to stay here is the staff. They went out of their way to make sure I had the best possible experience. No request was too small and was honored with a smile. Ask Agah at the front desk to recommend the best places to eat and he will send you to places he goes. Places you will not read about in a book. He sent me to Hatay Sofrasi. By far the most authentic and delicious meal I had in my week in Turkey. This is the place to stay in Istanbul. If I have the good fortune to be back in Istanbul, This is where I shall be.

Reviews.Title: “the Best small hotel in Instanbul”
Reviews.Author: MMonroeTexas
Reviews.Content: I was more than surprised by this hotel. From the time I walked in, was greeted, given tons of information, maps brochures and a dinner card, I had nothing but At experiences. This hotel Is attractive, clean, the staff is really "ON TOP OF THINGS". and the large breakfast - wonderful and varied. the restaurants are both great and the hammann and small pool are really added benefits. The rooms are nice and quiet, -- no tram noise- and the roof top terrace is a great place to watch the herons landing in the trees of Gulhani park. Cant say enough about this gem. I have stayed in Istanbul 6 times, and other than the 4 Seasons or Chiragan palace, I would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, would return!”
Reviews.Author: R0d_man
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with 2 more friends and spent a week on it. Overall, I was very pleased with the stay. HereÂ´s how it went: THE GOOD - The check-in/reception people are awesome. Very helpful and speak good english (we had no trouble with it at the tourist sites and restaurants). - Location is very good! Quiet street, close to metro lines, restaurants and sight-seeing spots - We did not eat at hotelÂ´s restaurant, but other guests said it was nice - Breakfast was good and complimentary - Pool is on the basement, but it was hot and well maintained. THE AVERAGE - Rooms are small, as in rest of Europe - Beds are just OK. Not bad, not good. - Too few channels on Cable TV. THE BAD - At night it is very easy to hear the noises from the corridor or your neighbour. Hope you donÂ´t get a loud one!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, nice extras but not great”
Reviews.Author: galtons
Reviews.Content: Good location in the old part of town from where you can easily walk to all the main sights - Topkapi palace, Blue Mosque, old Turkish baths etc. However, the immediate area lacked charm, in fact most of the surrounding area did despite being overloaded with hotels. Our room had a pretty sad view, looking on to the back of a run-down business where empty boxes adorned most of the windows. Some of the rooms would face the gardens of the Topkapi palace but these views would mainly be of the fortress wall. (The palace itself has wonderful views of the water and is well worth a visit.) Our room was clean, well appointed, good size and the bed and all furnishings were very comfortable. The style of decor seemed to be traditional, local style and quite luxurious but overall the hotel was a bit too dark and heavy in feel. The bathroom was on the small size but still very nice. Despite being next to the lift, we did not hear any noise at all and similarly, the double glazed windows protect you well from the surrounding noise (including the early morning call to prayers). Many other reviews rave about the service; we found it a bit hit and miss as two of the reception staff although meaning to help, had only limited English and could not understand our questions properly. A couple of other staff were really helpful. There were lots of nice touches - free collection from the airport, welcome dish of Turkish delights, welcome dinner, free internet computers in the lobby lounge and free wifi throughout, free afternoon snack and tea, complimentary activities, and a farewell gift. The pool and gym are both quite small and basic. The breakfast buffet options were very extensive although the coffee was adequate only. We enjoyed our stay there but must say that we are surprised that it is rated No. 2 overall; it is certainly above average, good value for money but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SydneyAnne27
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It is within walking distance of all the attractions in old town, many restaurants within a few minutes walk, tram at the corner. We found our room to be very quiet and comfortable - fresh flowers and turkish delight in the room added a nice touch. Breakfast and the seafood restaurant were also very good. The best part of this hotel, however, is the staff. They were all unfailingly polite and friendly. We were very surprised on our departure to receive a box of turkish delight as a gift and then the porter and girls from reception all stood outside and waved goodbye to us! We couldn't believe it. This would have to be the friendliest hotel in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly wonderful hotel with friendly and impeccable services”
Reviews.Author: cascadefoothills
Reviews.Content: Luxorious in all the right ways for an excellent price. My family and I felt cared for in all matters, from the welcoming smiles and offers for any assistance to the beautiful rooms and unbelievable breakfasts. The complimentary meal was a fine dining experience and unexpected gift. This hotel was centrally located and easily within walking distance of all the important things we wanted to see with only 4 days open to us in Istanbul. A real sanctuary in a bustling city - we were given all the resources and recommendations to make our trip a real success.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sunseeker390
Reviews.Content: This place is completely at ease with itself and as a result guests can really relax and enjoy their stay. The whole experience was marvelous. We had a massive room on top floor with balcony and views over Gulhane Park; to the left the Bosphorous; to the right Ayia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. Quite simply the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. Great little pool and hammam in basement. They even gave us a Turkish cookery lesson in the hotel kitchen. The staff are fantastic and on our departure even gave us an umbrella because it was raining. Breakfast was excellent (choice and quality), loved cutting the honeycomb. Ate once in the evening and again great food was served. Only minor complaint is that the wine appeared a bit expensive relative to the food. Don't be in any doubt, stay here if coming to Istanbul, you won't regret it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great service but don't arrange a tour guide through the hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuvsTravel2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sirkeci Konak for 4 nights & really enjoyed our time. The rooms are nice & clean. Service was great & the breakfast was wonderful. In addition to our stay, we added transfers (only way to get back and forth to the airports), spa treatments, etc. I found the front desk really helpful. Only issue we had with the hotel... we arranged a 1/2 day tour through the front desk. While the tour guide was licensed & knowledgeable, he pushed us through the historic sites quickly so we could visit his friend's carpet store. We were prepared for this tactic from our research... however, after we refused to buy anything, the guide tried to change the cost of the tour. Quite annoying! Normally I don't hold the hotel responsible but they might want to vet the guides better.

Reviews.Title: “Best service and staff of any hotel I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: grampus
Reviews.Content: This smallish hotel is ideally situated in the Sultanahmet (old part of the city). It is on a quiet street within easy walking distance of all the main sites and the ferry services. There is a tram stop just up the road which gives good and easy access to most parts of the city. The rooms are of good size, well equipped, well decorated and spotless.The restaurants serve interesting food at very reasonable prices. It is however the staff that make this hotel what it is - quite outstanding. I have stayed in hotels all over the world, but not many can match the staff of the S K for friendliness and efficiency. Recommended without reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kimbo2102
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here for 2 separate nights only, which was not long enough. We found the Hotel was very central to everything we needed and the rooms and facilities were excellent. The staff were particularly friendly and very helpful and made us feel at home and very welcome. We dined at the rooftop restaurant both nights and found both the food and service to be excellent. The buffet breakfast downstairs was also great, We will definitely return to the Sirkeci Konak Hotel and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fully deserves its reputation for best service in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Keen101
Reviews.Content: We expected a lot from this hotel and the service met or exceeded it. For a small hotel it provides full services with a personal touch. airport pick up, free dinner, free internet,etc etc. Any request was immediately actioned by Sukru and Okay at the front desk. It included providing us a staff member to take us to a friend's car about 10 minutes away (private cars are not allowed inside the old city area). We hope to go back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and highly recommend it staying there!”
Reviews.Author: mrbg
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the positive reviews we had read on the tripadvisor website. All positive comments were true!! What a wonderful hotel. The hotel is well located within walking distance to a lot of the major sites. We were greeted upon arrival with a cold drink and check in was very smooth. Our room was quiet and overlooked the city wall and park. The bathroom was well appointed with soap, shampoo etc. Breakfast was great and the hotel rooftop terrace restaurant was lovely and had good food. We had a traditional turkish bath in the hotel hamam and found it great experience- so very relaxing. The hotel offered a free cooking class and it was fun. We met the hotel owner who is often onsite. You will be very happy here!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: FussyTravellers20
Reviews.Content: This hotel is superb, located in the heart of the Old City but in a quiet spot. The staff couldn't have been more friendly or professional. The room was spotless with a very comfortable bed, fantastic bathroom, air conditioning which was effiicient but could be turned off at night, and no traffic noise. Try to get a room overlooking the park, herons and parakeets from the window. Breakfast was excellent as was the range of complimentary extras (afternoon tea, Turkish cooking lessons, wine and cheese evenings etc). Best of all it's within a 5 minute walk from Aya Sophia, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, and just 10 minutes from the Bosphorus. Probably one of Istanbul's more expensive hotels but worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “You must stay at this hotel. It is wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: MWilson35
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sirkeci Konak in June 2011 for five days. This was our first trip to Turkey and we had a wonderful time thanks in large part to our stay at the Sirkechi. The hotel provided a ride from the Ataturk Airport. The reception we received at the front desk was very warm and welcoming. We were given a welcome drink and told that we would receive a complimentary dinner on any of the nights that we were staying at the hotel. We were given a list of activities that the hotel offered to their guests free of charge such as wine tasting and a cooking class. Our third floor room was spacious, very clean and beautifully decorated. It had a small balcony overlooking the Gulhane Park where we would sit and relax before going out for dinner. I loved that the window in our room opened allowing for fresh air to come into our room as well as the sounds of birds from the park. The buffet breakfast each morning was delicious with a wide variety of hot and cold food to choose from. The two dinners that we ate at the hotel were excellant as was the service and, as an added bonus, the hotel gave us a 10% off family card that we could use at any of the Sirkechi Group restaurants. Every day the hotel offered tea and appetizer size sandwiches in the late afternoon which was a lovely reprieve after a busy day of sight seeing. The owner of the hotel stopped us one day to ask our opinion about improvements he wanted to make to the hotel's website. The following morning he was seen introducing himself to his guests at breakfast and welcoming them to the hotel. We also saw him on the streets of Istanbul and he greeted us warmly. He and the rest of his staff really did make us feel like we were part of the Sirkechi family. We walked to many of the major sights in Istanbul from the hotel - Blue Mosque, Underground Cistern, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, Spice Market, Gulhane Park, Archaeological Museum as well as the Bosphorus Strait - but there is a tram stop minutes from the hotel for anyone who prefers this mode of transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about another hotel in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: TravelJoe43
Reviews.Content: If you are planning a trip to Istanbul, this is the place you need to stay. Sirkeci Konak is in a great location in Old Town. You can walk to all the big attractions in 5 minutes. The rooms are very nice and clean. The staff of the hotel is the best I have encountered. They are very helpful and friendly and make you feel genuinely welcome. When you arrive, they have a consultant sit with you to go over the amenities of the hotel and the local attractions including open and close days of the museums. How can you argue with that? They make your vacation beyond easy. Where you stay can make a huge difference in your vacation. Book this hotel. You will not be sorry. Great hotel and great staff. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: ValPoa
Reviews.Content: I found the Sirkeci Konak hotel on the web and to choose it, first I read a hundred reviews. I have no regrets about my choice. From the moment we arrived, everything was perfect. I had arranged a transfer from the airport to the hotel and it worked perfectly. Our room was spacious, clean and had everything that we needed. It was our 10th anniversary and they were so kind that they left a gift by the bed and some fruits and wine. All our questions were answered promptly and gently. I strongly recomend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: METraveler11
Reviews.Content: This "boutique" hotel is located within walking distance of most of the historic and interesting sites in Istanbul. The service is excellent and the rooms are charming. They even offer a selection of pillows. Our room had a balcony overlooking the park. A full breakfast is included. The rooftop restaurant had a nice view of the park and the water. Staff was very attentive, there is a "Turkish Bath" in the lower level as well as a pool and exercise room. Only downside is that it's expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: smb2_11
Reviews.Content: Collected from the airport by hotel car - a very good start, much more relaxing than finding our own taxi. Hotel location is quiet, but within very easy walking distance of Tokapi Palace, Haghia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. Our room, spacious and with a very comfortable bed, overlooked Gulhane Park and our balcony gave us great views of the storks nesting in the trees opposite. The swimming pool was a bonus after a long day's sightseeing, as was the excellent massage in the spa. Food was very good; huge choice in breakfast buffet. All the hotel staff were, without exception, courteous and helpful. They were very keen for us to enjoy their city and nothing was too much trouble for them.

Reviews.Title: “Home in the Center of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: amk2f
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located as centrally as it gets and despite that in a very quite side-street, far away enough from the traffic & tram line not to hear their noise. The service is very friendly and polite. As for the rooms and the building itself - it is a small hotel with all its pros and cons coming in a single package. Design & interior are nice and feel very homely though with some aristocratic touch. The rooms are well equipped and comfortable. As for the disadvantages - the window in the standard room is too small to my liking, which caused a lack of natural light in the room, and the building is somewhat "noisy": banging doors, stomping neighbors and talking guests were sometimes heard through the walls a little bit too much. The breakfast was very good. Laptop with Internet in the hall was useful. We also appreciated free transfer from Ataturk Airport, free welcome dinner & sizable discount for cash payment. There are things at Sirkeci Konak, which are totally amazing! First, the fish restaurant Sirkeci Balikcisi is one of the best fish restaurants I have ever been to! The fish & fish soup are absolutely delicious. Second, the SPA is absolutely worth visiting! Excellent facilities - the pool, the sauna, the hamam and the gym and almost no people there at any time! That is what I call a relaxing atmosphere. I also recommend to have a massage or two! Third, terrace of the Neyzade restaurant on the roof has a great view over the city center and is very cozy. As for the restaurant itself - I liked salads and yogurt soup a lot, but meat was not very much in my taste. There are much tastier and cheaper kebabs out in the city.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it very much and we always would come back”
Reviews.Author: green040
Reviews.Content: very good service nice room with air-condition always clean bathroom terrace on the roof for relaxing and/or excellent night-diner overlooking the town and bosporus and GÃ¼lhane Park rich breakfast very friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely!”
Reviews.Author: DavidStern
Reviews.Content: Returned to Istanbul after last visit in 1979. This hotel is everything it promises to be. It sure does what it says on the tin! Good surroundings, comfy beds, lovely staff and good food in the restaurant without being overpriced. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. It made our stay in Istanbul quite special.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: jccmd
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel in Istanbul after a cruise from Greece to Turkey. We chose this hotel after reading Trip Advisor reviews. Our cruise line had a hotel package at a hotel that cost twice as much and was not walking distance to the sites of Istanbul. After booking the staff was most helpful with information about getting to the hotel from the port. We were told to just catch a cab and were even told what we should be charged. This was helpful as the cab driver initially wanted twice what we were told is appropriate. Upon arrival we had a staff member give us detailed tour information-set us on our way . She was so helpful we couldn't believe it-and she was not trying to sell us anything! We walked to all of the main sites-all easy walking distance from this hotel-some both during the day and at night to see them in lights as well. The first night we were given a complimentary meal in the hotel restaurant-the food was excellent-traditional Turkish fare. We enjoyed the sauna, pool , and Turkish bath each afternoon before dinner-very nice facilities. On our departure day the hotel set us up a shuttle at 4 am-we were surprised they were so willing to do this at such an early hour but we had a 6 am flight. The driver was there right on time and the hotel staff were so king and friendly setting us on our way.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality, Location, Service and Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fieldingmelisch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sirkeci Konak for 8 days in May, 2011. Our room was lovely, but one of the smaller rooms, overlooking the street. It was quiet and the room had all the amenities we could ask for. The bathrooms are well equipped but small. The location of the hotel is difficult for many of the Istanbul taxi drivers to find. However, it is well situated for seeing some of the major historic sites of Istanbul. Accross the narrow street in front of the hotel and behind a high wall is a very lovely park surrounding the Topkapi Palace, The hotel has a lovely roof top sunning and restaurant area which overlooks the park lawns, flower beds and incredaible bird life in the park serenity in the heart of the frenetic old town area. Breakfast was an increadible spread with freshly baked breads, local cheeses, fresh fruit, yoghurts and freshly squeezed juices. What was most remarkable was the hospitality of the front desk staff. Restaurant advice was great and reservations and transportation arranged flawlessly. Staff go the extra mile to make sure guest are taken care of. One staff member took us with another couple on a tour of the Fatih Wednesday market and then through some neighborhoods off the beaten tourist track winding up with a ferry ride back to the hotel stopping for lunch in a local kebab house. Our last night we requested a really authentic restaurant where locals go. The owner of the Sirkeci Group which owns the hotel on his way home dropped us at one of his personal favorites which was a family restaurant with regional cuisine from a part of Turkey near Syria. It was fantastic! The Serkeci organization has pioneered the redevelopment of the old town in Serkeci and has developed an organization which is founded on sincere hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay and nothing changed. Excellent Staff.”
Reviews.Author: WildCommonwealthBoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sirkeci Konak last May and were so impressed, we came back this year with our 2 sons. The Staff make the Hotel. They are amazing and always greet you with a smile. Good location within walking distance to everything. Not much more to say, other than you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service and great location”
Reviews.Author: dublin_boy
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the strength of its Tripadvisor reviews and was not disappointed. It's well located within walking distance of the main sights and just metres from a tram stop. The area is quite touristy and quiet at nighttime but that makes for a good night's sleep! Our room was not overly lavish but was very comfortable. The breakfast was excellent, with a large selection of interesting choices. They also provided free afternoon tea with little sandwiches, which was very pleasant after a day's sightseeing. There is a lovely roof terrace with comfortable sun loungers, tables and chairs. The most exceptional about the hotel is the service. It had the most helpful staff I have ever come across, happily making bookings for us and offering advice. Most notably, there was no attempt at hard selling tours or particular restaurants. One final tip - I booked via the hotel's own website and provided my credit card to guarantee the booking. On check in I was told that the booked rate would be reduced by 11% if we paid in cash - so we did.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel we ever visited!”
Reviews.Author: Istanbulfan10
Reviews.Content: My husband travels a lot for business, both domestically and internationally, and he said that the Sirkeci Konak was "extraordinary, just the best" of any other hotel he has stayed in over the past few years. It's location is fantastic [close to all the important sites in the Old City] yet still whisper-quiet -- like an oasis from the storm when you enter the foyer. And what can you say about the staff -- only that you wish they were your family! Every need is attended to, many without your even having to ask. Fantabulous and ginormous breakfast included in room fee, so you can eat then get out and about early in the day and not have to refuel until night. Out of 10, I'd give the Sirkeci Konan an 11.

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect!”
Reviews.Author: jevrard92
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Sirkeci Konak hotel and we enjoyed our journey. This hotel is certainly one of the best in Sultanahmet : location was perfect (near Topkapi & Aya Sofia, next to Gulhane tram station), the staff was incredible (kind, helpfull), our room was clean, quiet and roomy, breakfast was really good. We also enjoyed the swimming pool and the Turkish bath every day.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel and we would gladly stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: slpconnecticut
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Istanbul, and having read many positive reviews about this quaint hotel, we decided to stay there. As soon as we arrived, we were graciously received by the hotel staff. A personal concierge sat down with us and offered us drinks on the house and inquired about our travel plans in the city. The concierge was most helpful in answering all our questions regarding sites and giving directions to them. All the staff was extremely polite and helpful. The room was very comfortable with a modern bathroom. The hotel also has an excellent restaurant and the fare for food was reasonably priced. The price for the room was considered to be very reasonable, and also included an excellent breakfast. In addition, amenities such as a turkish spa was also located on the premise. The location was within walking distance to the Grand Bizaar and Spice Market. So if you are visiting Istanbul, be sure to check out this wonderful hotel. Cindy R from Connecticut

Reviews.Title: “A stay with friends”
Reviews.Author: gtpurchase
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here 2 years ago and really liked it, we chose the hotel again for a special birthday celebration for my mother. The hotel couldn't have been any nicer to her - she had flowers, fruit basket, presents and a fantastic chocolate cake. She liked it so much, that she said afterwards that this was her best birthday ever. The staff at the Sirkeci Konak are not only extremely friendly and helpful, they go out of their way to make your stay truly memorable. So again, thank you very much guys - we are sure we will be back !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel: six star service”
Reviews.Author: richamar
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four days. The welcome was extremely courteous and friendly. The room had a lovely small balcony overlooking gardens. The breakfast buffet was very good. We had dinner in the restaurant three nights...it was that good, and after busy sight-seeing days this was a blessing. The guest relations staff and front desk were so helpful in assisting in onward travel planning.....so patient and great attention to detail. This is one of the best "small hotels" we have come across...not just in Turkey but the world. The quality of service is second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Mayke
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 days in Istanbul and stayed in the Sirkeci Konak Hotel. It was our first trip to Istanbul and the city is great. We enjoyed our stay in the Sirkeci Hotel very much. Friendly people, great service and the food is excellent. Breakfast is a real treat and also the restaurant is really good. The Family Card which gives you a 10% discount in 4 other restaurant belonging to the Sirkeci Group is a nice feature: we had dinner in two sister restaurants and the food was very good. The restaurants are at walking distance. The only point to consider is that the hotel is located in the old city centre (very close to Topkapi Palace) which means that street noise can be an issue for those who want a very quiet location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: andians
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the recommendations in Trip Advisor and were not dissappointed. The hotel is extremely comfortable and the staff truly exceptional. We have stayed in numerous 5 star hotels around the world and have not found better hospitality or service. Nothing is too much trouble and everything is done with smile. The hotel is very well located for all the major sites with easy access to trams and ferries. We had an excellent stay in Istanbul and would thorougly recommend the Sirkeci Konak

Reviews.Title: “Best Boutique Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Coffou
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable hotel in the perfect Istanbul location for touring. I have nothing but praise for this lovely small hotel with exceptional service, your wish is their command.

Reviews.Title: “Extremly friendly and helpful staff; Perfect Location; Private atmoshere;”
Reviews.Author: PDKHamburg
Reviews.Content: Freundlliche BegrÃ¼ÃŸung mit ErfischungsgetrÃ¤nk und ErlÃ¤uterungen zu Haus und Umgebung. Aufmerksamer Service; Besonders freundlicher Umgang mit den GÃ¤sten und sehr hifsbereit bei Fragen oder WÃ¼nschen. Alles sehr sauber; schÃ¶ne Dachterrasse. Umfangreiches FrÃ¼hstÃ¼ck; Ein perfekter Platz fÃ¼r erholsamse Tage

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: WatfordWanderer2
Reviews.Content: We had read the reviews of the Sirkeci Konak and were not disappointed. From the moment we stepped into the hotel until the moment we left everything was excellent. We were greeted with turkish tea and were given a comprehensive guide of the city with information of opening times, how to use the trams, where to get the boat etc. The hotel is within walking distance of all the major sites and Istanbul is very easy to navigate around. The service at the hotel is excellent, very discrete and not at all in your face. We asked to change rooms as we felt our room was rather on the small side - no problem at all. The hotel staff were happy to book restaurants for us and gave us many helpful tips. Breakfasts were very good, although don't have the cappuccino if you are use to the real thing! The ordinary coffee is much better! The afternoon tea was very welcome after long days traipsing around Istanbul. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service with a personal touch!”
Reviews.Author: gcburch
Reviews.Content: The moment we arrived at the hotel all the staff made us feel so welcome, and a special thanks to 'Okay' for the tour he took us on and helping us to get to understand Istanbul and its people so much better. we loved the 5 star service but from within a small intimate hotel atmosphere. we also think that the free hotel tours and experiences are a great idea and wished that we had the chance to try the other ones out on the list! thank you again for an excellent stay and we certainly hope to back with you again soon and will be recommending you to our circle of friends. best regards Geoffrey & Amanda Burch

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: swenru
Reviews.Content: We spend 3 days here and decide to stay this hotel because of reviews on Trip Advisor. Great service,nice room and comfortable,it is in the old city but near everywhere

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: Illybilly5
Reviews.Content: stayed here twice. was excellent each time. staff bend over backwards to help. rooms spacious and clean. nice breakfast. central location. highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SavannahDon
Reviews.Content: Great location, good food and wine, very well run, excellent service and very friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “The best in town”
Reviews.Author: DavidandNorman
Reviews.Content: What a find. Fantastic location on the doorstep of all the sights. The hotel is small and perfect, everything you would need is there. The biggest plus is without doubt the staff. Very friendly and very professional. You truly felt a guest at their home.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mkslack
Reviews.Content: I had read all the great reviews on Tripadvisor, but until you actually stay at the Sirkeci Konak it is only words. There are no adjectives that can equal the superior service at this hotel....from the meeting at the airport by our driver to the staff lining up at the curb when we were departing, with a gift in their hand. There was nothing they wouldn't do to try and accommodate you. The breakfast is wonderful; varied and tasty. We ate in the restaurant the first night after being given a voucher upon arrival. It was very good; however, one of the sister properties, The Oriental Express' rooftop restaurant (Imbat) was exceptional. We ate there twice - the food and service is impeccable but the view is to die for..... I had requested a deluxe room at the Konak and was not disappointed. The balcony overlooking the street and Topkapi Palace grounds was a definite positive. Room 2502 had a great view of the Bosphorous and we enjoyed many a glass of wine on the balcony. Thank you Sirkeci Konak for a great stay in Istanbul! If we return, we will definitely make this our hotel! Your staff is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Epitomizes Turkish Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Patti222
Reviews.Content: I was largely influenced by the other reviews and am so glad that I chose this hotel. The free airport transfer after a 17 hour trip was invaluable as was the free first night's dinner. The restaurant was wonderful and the breakfast's we enjoyed each morning were amazing. The staff was helpful and friendly and truly accommodating. Don't neglect to utilize the hamam downstairs as it was one of the best we tried! We were so impressed that we tried to book for the last leg of our trip but, alas, they were full. The location is perfect, too. Steps from the major sites and sights yet far enough off the Sultanhamet that we weren't once approached by carpet salesmen in the hotel's immediate vicinity. All in all a great place to stay to enjoy an amazing city!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: UKManzy
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple room for 4 nights during the Turkish F1 Grand Prix. Unlike many hotels, the triple room was purpose built for 1 large double and 1 single. We have stayed many times in double rooms with an extra put-you-up bed and very little space. The first floor room had two windows and was at the front of the building directly over reception. The only negative thing I would say about it was the bathroom could do with a bit of updating - the suspended ceiling was a bit of a mess. The toiletries were spa quality and included conditioner, often missing in hotels these days. From the welcome drink on arrival to the wave good bye on departure the staff were friendly and accommodating. There was one embarrassing hiccough when we were expecting our first night's meal to be compimentary as per the hotel website and as we hadn't been given a voucher on arrival the waiter's were unable to honour it. They were very apologetic but didn't seem able to liase with the reception desk to sort the problem out. The next morning we had a word with reception and they gave us a voucher for the following night. We ate in both the fish restaurant (excellent meal but a bit pricey) and the turkish restaurant, both of which were very good and seemed to be well frequented by non-residents. We would suggest making a reservation for the turkish restaurant as we could not be accommodated one evening. As per other comments the buffet breakfast was very good. We didn't get much sight seeing done as we were there for the Grand Prix so will definitely return to the hotel, in it's excellent location, this year and sample the spa.

Reviews.Title: “Five very happy ladies”
Reviews.Author: suzannebascombe
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay here with my sister and three friends, it being my 50th Birthday Bash.
