From the moment we entered the hotel until the very last wave as we left, we where all treated to wonderful service, all of the staff without exception were lovely and nothing was too much for them. Our rooms although not large where lovely, breakfast excellent, location perfect. How can I not recommend this hotel after such a wonderful time was had by all. Thank you Sirkeci Konak Staff. From a very happy Suzanne of Twickenham

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Hospitality at its Best”
Reviews.Author: haggisholidays
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel based on the most amazing reviews and although we had a hiccup on our first night (they had overbooked the hotel and we had to stay around the corner), we were not let down at all! even with the overbooking, the hotel went out of their way to make up for it, and they did more than what you would have expected. The location was excellent and the rooms very nice and traditional. We also enjoyed the spa area and had amazing massages. What really makes the hotel are the staff. generally speaking, we did not find many freindly people in Turkey, but this was one of the exceptions. They are so helpful and friendly and even waved goodbye to us and gave us a present when we left. We also did a cooking class which was inlcuded and lots of fun. The other good thing is the food. They own several restaurants and we tried a few of them and they were all excellent. 5 stars without a doubt! thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in an ideal location, great food and lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: carlylp
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Sirkeci Konak for a week and from the moment we arrived, the staff went out of their way to make us feel at home. We were collected from the airport, we were offered a welcome drink on our arrival and then a free welcome dinner which was delicious. Our room was small but overlooked the beautiful Topkaki Palace grounds. It was in a brilliant location for all of the major sights in the historic quarter. The hotel helped to book various dinner reservations and a visit to see some Swirling Dervishes. We also enjoyed the complimentary afternoon tea - Turkish or Apple with Simbit's - small seseme rolls. The only downside was the poor weather, it was freezing cold. Would definetely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as reviewed”
Reviews.Author: exlancs71
Reviews.Content: We chose the Sirkeci Konak on the basis of previous reviews and we can only agree with everyone else. Whilst the weather in Istanbul let us down, the hotel did not. From the patience of the driver who met us (we had arranged a paid transfer with the hotel) after a very long wait - delayed flight and horrendous queues through visa and passport control- to the unexpected free 3 course welcome dinner, to the friendliness and professionalism of the staff, there was nothing we could fault. This excellence was also reflected in the restaurants run by the group where we enjoyed delicious meals. The location is ideal, on a quiet pedestrianised street, just 30 metres from the tram stop. The hotel was a major contributor to the success of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “YOU MUST STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: pucas15-squan
Reviews.Content: Words can not express, how much my mother and I loved this hotel. We actually decided to stay at Sirkeci Konak after reading all of the Trip Advisor Reviews and they could not have been more true! The staff is the absolute model for professionalism and hospitality. They make your feel like family and we will forever remember them standing on the side of the street, waiving to us, as we departed. Sirkeci Konak is centrally located and is basically within walking distance of everything that you need. In addition, the breakfast is spectacular and I can not reinforce enough, how truly clean this hotel is! Also, every day, we loved coming back to the hotel in the afternoon for some apple tea. This hotel and its staff is wonderful and I can not praise them enough!

Reviews.Title: “welcoming, comfortable hotel with great added value”
Reviews.Author: stevejoe88
Reviews.Content: From the welcome on our arrival to the parting gift, the staff could not have done more to make our stay a pleasure throughout. The free activities we tried - the farmer's market with return boat trip, the wine tasting and the Turkish cookery lesson, are all recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best service I have ever had they made us feel like family as nothing was too much”
Reviews.Author: pearce201209
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights ( would have loved to have stayed longer) ! The room was very comfortable and and quiet even though we faced the street. Our balcony looked into the Palace grounds across the road and we could walk to the majority of cultural sites in Istanbul. It was my Husbands birthday on the last day we stayed and prior to us leaving for a very special dinner the staff presented us with a birthday cake and sung happy birthday. When we arrived back from Dinner they cut the cake and gave us a complimentary drink (also gave us one on arrival). I couldn't speak more highly of this hotel but it is the staff that make it such a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: seetheworld23
Reviews.Content: The welcome you receive from this small hotel is wonderful - you are made to feel so welcome. The hotel is in an ideal location in Sirkeci, so close to the tram stop and walking distance to all the major attractions. You are by the Bosphorous in under 10 minutes and it isn't much further to the Blue Mosque and Haghia Sophia. The hotel seems very cramped on a main road, but when you walk in it is like an oasis of peace and calm. Our room overlooked the front and it was a bit noisy at night but the bed's comfort was to die for. All the amenities are there and the bathroom, although "compact" was perfectly adequate with fluffy large towels and a super power shower and plenty of hot water. Unless you pay a fortune to stay in Istanbul i.e. The Four Seasons you could not get a better hotel than this. Well done to all the management and staff at the Sirkeci Konak.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel in the center of the Old Town”
Reviews.Author: AlliBalli
Reviews.Content: My 21year old daughter and I visited Istanbul for a week and stayed at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel. We couldn't have made a better choice! From the moment we set foot in the charming hotel, we were greeted by the concierge who offered us a beverage and sat down with us to be of assistance in any way. She gave us maps, offered to make reservations for us, and answered all the questions we had. We were treated to a first rate dinner in the excellent restaurant at the hotel. Our room, complete with hardwood floors, was comfortable, very roomy, and perfect with wonderfully comfortable beds. The breakfast each morning was extensive and delicious with a lot of choices. We have traveled all around the world and have stayed in many five star hotels. I have to say that out of all the hotels we have ever stayed in, this one is my favorite. The customer service is beyond outstanding and we were pleased with every aspect of the Sirkeci Konak Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RuthyNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sirkeci Konak hotel twice in April 2011, for a total amount of 8 days. During both our stays we found the rooms well appointed and spacious, and very clean. The bathrooms were very nice and comfortable. The staff was outstanding, friendly and helpful, and always ready to serve us. The hotel is in a very central location, close to the Sultanhamet district. The restaurant in the hotel is excellent, and the hotel offered us a free meal both times we stayed there. In addition they picked us up from the airport twice at no charge. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Istanbul, and we will definitely stay there next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Staff, Service, Location”
Reviews.Author: BrianNewYork_NewYork
Reviews.Content: Once again Trip Advisor as a source for finding hotels in a foreign city came through. There is always some trepidation heading into a new country not knowing the language. Will everything work out satisfactorily? We found the Sirkeci Konak on Trip Advisor. As part of our 7 day package, we were picked up at the airport. Knowing we would be met at the airport provided peace of mind and more importantly when we landed and cleared baggage claim, the driver was there. We chose a room with a balcony. The room did not disappoint. It was quite comfortable, large by European standards. The room overlooked the park surrounding Topkapi Palace and provided a view of the Sea of Marmara and the top of the Sofia Mosque. We were a 10 minute walk from the Palace entrance and Sofia, 15 mintes from the Blue Mosque. Many of the staff were fluent in English, which was great as Turkish is not an easy language. With their help we even took the tram a few times; it was half a block from the front doo and, runs frequently. You can take it to a stop closer to the Blue Mosque, down to the waterfront near the Bosporous ferries or across the river. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I should note the hotel may not be for everyone -- it is not inexpensive. We on the other hand plan on returning to Istanbul and staying there,.

Reviews.Title: “Majestic Istanbul, majestic Sirkeci Konak !!”
Reviews.Author: stasika
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this wonderful hotel for 4 days.. And each of this days was special! Fist of all, the locationis just ideal! Secondly, the service was on a very high level,, friendly staff was always there to help you and all the time with a smile!! food was just awesome! - really - no comments!!.. I will definitely come back to this place,and take my friends with me. Strongly reccomend Sirkeci Konak Hotel to those who'd like to spend cool holidays in Istanbul,full of pleasure and joy!

Reviews.Title: “Best treatment i have ever had”
Reviews.Author: VRIBEIRO
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is very well located at Sulthanamet area, near the metro station, and main attractions are walk distance, from the moment you arrive the staff makes everything they can to make your stay the best, a lot of complimentary things, great restaurant, very nice tea time, and the rooms are really ottoman style. If i would recommend a hotel in istanbul would be there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Ateam_2011
Reviews.Content: The Sirkeci Konak Hotel combines the comfort and professionalism of the chains with the personalised service and nicer atmosphere of an independent hotel. It is located in a side street 50 metres from a tram stop and 10-15 minutes walk from Topkapi or the river. Friendly and informative staff, charming decor, comfortable beds, great shower, free safe in the room... everything worked, big choice breakfast (honeycomb!), excellent food and reasonably priced wine in the restaurant, with service, in the evening, a welcome afternoon tea with little sandwiches (no charge) after a hard day's sightseeing, as well as tea/coffee facilities in the room. We stayed for over 3 nights and got a free airport pick up plus dinner on our first night ! We would definitely choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Glynis031
Reviews.Content: I can only echo the sentiments of so many others who have stayed at the Sirkeci Konak! Their policy of "GUEST MEANS EVERY THING" is lived and breathed by every member of staff, who are all utterly delightful and helpful. We reserved a standard room for 4 nights, and wished we could have extended our stay. Our room (1107) was not large, but there was sufficient space to store two large suitcases on luggage racks, and spacious built in cupboards with plenty of draws and hanging space. We had a lounge and a desk with a chair. Free wifi throughout the hotel had a strong signal, and there were computers in the lobby for guests to access at no cost. The beds were extremely comfortable, and the pillow menu was excellent â€“ a choice of silicon, plume, ergonomic, orthopaedic, or visco-elastic. The location is superb â€“ on a small quiet street in Sirkeci just 50 metres from the Gulhane tram station and within easy walking distance to just about everything in the old city. The area is undergoing lovely gentrification, with paved brick streets. We were offered a free dinner on our first night and werenâ€™t expecting much. We were blown away â€“ the best meal so far, and we had been in Turkey for 16 days!!. We had a starter â€“ 3 types of rolls with delicious olive oil and hummus, and were told we could choose any entree, main and dessert from the extensive menu! We chose a large vegetarian mezze plate (15 TL) and the pan fried, marinated sliced eggplants with cheese and fresh herbs and yoghurt (11 TL) to share; and had now had elegant sufficiency; followed by the fish (a huge grilled sea bass, which my travelling companion, who is very picky, described as 'superb", accompanied by a large rocket and tomato salad with other bits and pieces (23 TL), and grilled meat balls on an eggplant dip sprinkled with parsley (20 TL) served with what looked a bit like Israeli couscous. We were now bursting but my friend decided to sample 2 desserts â€“ wedding helva (semolina havla cooked with orange and walnut and served with home made ice cream (7.5 TL), and soft dried apricots stuffed with fresh almonds, also with ice cream (7 TL). We had a large bottle of San Pellegrino and 2 glasses of wine each â€“ and thatâ€™s all we paid for! Breakfasts at the hotel were plentiful and fresh. The only missing ingredient was eggs "cooked to order", but I'm sure if one asked, that wouldn't be a problem. We signed up for the free cooking class, held on Monday afternoons, and the free trip to a local market, held on Wednesdays. We went to our cooking class at 5 pm â€“ down to the spotless kitchen where we donned white gowns, chefâ€™s assistantsâ€™ hats and rubber gloves. I had expected a demonstration, but no, it was hands on participation! We each had our bench space, chopping board and a large sharp knife. Our menu was Kisir and Kuzu Kavurma. Our first goal was to chop parsley and spring onions, then onions and tomatoes, then green peppers, and finally diced lamb. The chef did the rest of the preparation. Unfortunately, I managed to cut through my glove when chopping the onion, and we couldnâ€™t find the piece of chopped rubber, so my portion of the onion had to be discarded!! When the dishes were prepared, we were led to the dining room to be seated, offered the wine list, and served our food â€“ piping hot!!!! So, we have enjoyed another free dinner, but, to be honest, our own cooking wasnâ€™t a patch on the previous nightâ€™s offerings! On Wednesday morning at 10.30 am, we met Okay (pronounced Okai) from the Front Desk and Aylin from Guest Relations in the lobby, and with 3 other guests, were transported to Fatih and dropped near the Fatih Mosque complex, which is located on the highest hill in Istanbul. Okay and Aylin were fantastic guides. We visited the tomb of Mehmet II, known as Mehmet the Conqueror, and then walked to the local street market, which was just wonderful - not a tourist in sight! Everything was super cheap - olives, fruit and vegetables, shoes, vacuum cleaners, cheeses, butcher shops, you name it - everything! We all purchased something â€“ T shirts and soap for me; pine nuts, peppercorns and dried aubergines for my friend; organic strawberries at 3.5 TL/kilo for Okay etc. We then walked down a very steep hill where Okay bought simit from a wood fired bakery. Then we walked to the complex which houses the Head of the Greek Orthodox Church in the world!! And within the complex we visited the Church of St George, an ornate Greek Orthodox Church, and a seminary. And nearby is a Greek Orthodox school. Then we had apple tea and the simit at a little cafe, before catching the ferry at Fener for the ride back to Eminonu, and a walk back to the hotel. Okay passed around the kilo of strawberries on the ferry and we ate the lot! The excursion took 4.25 hours. And what did this cost? For me, 2 TL for 2 apple teas and 1.75 TL for the ferry ride!! This excursion is just another of the offerings from this amazing hotel. The night before we left, we found two gift boxes of Turkish Delight in our room. And in the morning, when we went to pay our account, and the front desk staff and owner had become aware of a less than ideal experience at another local restaurant owned by the hotel, they insisted on refunding the cost of the meal, and presented rach of us with another gift. Needless to say, we were speechless. And then I was driven to the airport in a very comfortable car, again gratis. I opened the gift on arrival at my hotel in Sydney. It was a velvet case enclosing two beautiful Gural porcelain Turkish coffee cups and saucers. What more can I say!! I will be back, hopefully sooner rather than later!

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL IN ISTANBUL BY FAR!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel1968
Reviews.Content: I went with my mum and sister to Turkey for a 6 day self drive holiday. Our first 2 nights were at the Sirkeci Konak and all the staff were brilliant. We had mum's kidney dialysis machine with us and the dialysis liquid boxes were all set and waiting for us and the staff helped us move them and nothing was too much trouble. Unfortunately, the machine was broken in transit and this meant our whole holiday had to be cancelled. Mum had to go to hospital and we had to get her home quickly! The "silver lining" on the cloud was the fact that the Sirkeci staff helped us out so much. We had to extend our stay and they let us stay in the same room so we didn't have to move mum. They got ice and tea when we asked, they took messages from the medical emergency team and we even shared a brithday cake too! They were all so kind and considerate in the middle of a very stressful situation that I don't think my sister and I could have done it all by ourselves. Other than the staff, the food was excellent especially Teatime in the lobby each day! The breakfast and the evening meals were delicious. The rooms were very clean and the box of turkish delight to nibble in the room was the icing on the cake. No praise is high enough.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in old town, Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Ingleseitalianato
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent five nights here last spring: for first-time visitors to Istanbul, the hotel was ideal, close to all main sights (Topkapi, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, markets) and on a convenient tram line. The room was extremely comfortable, although a bit dark; the breakfast buffet delicious and more than abundant; the staff helpful and polite. Although I might stay in a less touristy area on my next visit, I would recommend this hotel highly to anyone on their first trip to Istanbul, and who wants to be able to walk around the historic areas of the city easily, both day and night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer care”
Reviews.Author: angelanaylor
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights, and were totally impressed by the excellent service from friendly, helpful staff who went out of their way for us. Dinner on the first night was included in the package and there is free tea/coffee and sandwiches 4.30 -6.30 pm each day - great after a hard day on the tourist trail. The food is excellent with 10% discount on dinner in the restaurant, but also on the hotel's other restauarants in the city. They give you a discount card. Every morning over delicious breakfast there was a little newsletter with items of interest on current exhibitions/events plus an article on Turkish food or history, a discount voucher for a shop or an entrance fee, and a couple of Turkish words to learn. SK is 5 mins walk from the Archaeology Museum, and the Topkapi Palace (10 if you stroll through the Gulhane Park , complete with nesting storks (!), which our room overlooked . The Blue Mosque and Aghia Sphia are 10 minutes direct walk. At the top of the road (1 minute) is a tram stop. We found it easy to walk down to Eminonou to catch ferries and get trams or buses for other parts of the city. Can't recommend this hotel enough - particularly for a first visit to Istanbul. On arrival every guest is personally welcomed, and over a cup of tea the facilities of the hotel (includes a small pool and hammam), its location and how to get around Istanbul are explained. We were able to borrow Akbils (equivalent of an Oyster card) for use on the trams and buses.

Reviews.Title: “Very coz y and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lma731
Reviews.Content: Very warm, friendly and helpful staff. Good location, next to Topkapi Palace but far from traffic jam. Our room had a view on the Topkapi's wall and gardens.

Reviews.Title: “magnificent, warm and hearty hospitality in charming environment”
Reviews.Author: kategno
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sirkeci Konak hotel from 10 to 13 april 2011.Our standard room in 4Â° floor was very comfortable. The breakfast was outstandingly rich, plentiful and varied. All the hotel features are well complying with a 4-5 star classification. During our several trips in many countries and cities, it is the first time that we experienced so magnificent, warm and hearty hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel does everything right”
Reviews.Content: It has a top location for sightseeing, the staff is warm and friendly without overdoing it, and it offers terrific value. It's well priced and has all kinds of extras like a great breakfast, afternoon tea, dish of turkish delights in the room, use of hamman and sauna, free airport transfers for 3 nights or more, AND they give you a lovely gift when you leave. I couldn't believe it. Also, it's a great choice for people traveling alone as you feel right at home and other guests are friendly. I can't find anything to criticize.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Staff was extremely attentive, room was very clean and location was ideal for visiting the sultanahmet area. On the slightly negative side, the hotel street was under construction during our stay which made our room pretty noisy but this should soon no longer be a problem. As a side note the age group of this hotel is in the 40+ range so don't expect avery lively atmosphere at night. However you can get plenty of it out there in the new city (north of golden horn)!

Reviews.Title: “Superior service and staff”
Reviews.Author: umcharles
Reviews.Content: A few steps from the tram line and within walking distance to Sultanahmet features, this hotel serves an outstanding breakfast (included in room fee). The staff is completely helpful, warm, friendly and were so kind it made our trip even more enjoyable. This was my 3rd time in Istanbul (first 2 times at larger far more expensive hotels) but next time I will head straight back to the Konak again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: LearningItalian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sirkeci Konak for just one night, but I wish it were several more! The rooms were very nice, the price was great, the breakfast was delicious (the fresh OJ and the honeycomb were just the beginning), and the staff was very accomodating. The call to prayer came very early in the morning, but was the most beautiful I heard in my entire time in Turkey - a lovely solo in the hallway, rather than over a loudspeaker. We moved from here to the Hotel Amira, and while both were very nice, I would say that our experience at Sirkeci Konak was better overall.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic luxury choice in Istanbul's old city”
Reviews.Author: taramurphy98
Reviews.Content: Sirkeci Konak surpassed my expectations. First, the staff was unbelievable- warm, helpful and patient with a young child as well. Second, the food was superb with lavish included breakfasts, wrapped lunches for us to take on our boat ride, and the dinner restaurant was of good quality and reasonable prices. Lastly, the room quality was of international standard. I travel 30 weeks per annum on business and this boutique hotel was on par with hotels in the US and Europe but with more charm as it was definitely a smaller boutique. The maid and room service were both excellent and it was fun to have a hammam in the hotel too. The small serviceable pool was a godsend with a young child in tow.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: patt8011
Reviews.Content: The Sirkeci Konak is absolutely lovely and immaculate. The staff are just as charming and kind as other reviewers have mentioned below. The location for the historical sites, and the easy-to-use local tram was the best. As far as the complaint by another reviewer below: the road in front is being re-paved but all the taxi's we used in our 4 day stay were able (and willing!) to drive right to the front door. The re-paving should be complete within a couple weeks. That reviewer is also incorrect in stating the hotel provides airport transport and free dinner to all guest: it is only for three or more night stays. If that reviewer had checked the website they would have been aware. This is a darling place, by U.S. or any other standards. I just regret that they cant accomodate us on our return trip thru Istanbul this weekend :(

Reviews.Title: “Turkish hospitality abounds!”
Reviews.Author: Ottawachanson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Istanbul for 6 days and stayed at the Sirkeci Konek. The weather in Istanbul was not the best (cloudy and some rain) but the atmosphere at the hotel was bright and cheery. The staff were always available, provided excellent advice and service. The room was large with a nice view of the City walls, a park and the Bospherus. The king size bed was comfortable and the double set of pillows were excellent. The hotel and the room were kept very very clean. We were out touring during the days and upon our return hot tea and little sandwiches awaited us. Very nice ambiance in the lounge where they were served. The breakfast provided is ample and there were good choices of fruits, breads and hot and cold entrees. There is a restaurant at the hotel and because of our extensive day touring (and the weather) we chose to eat most of our suppers at the hotel. Consistently high quality food with good presentation and friendly service. The hotel has many extras available (cooking classes, Turkish bath, spas etc). The location is excellent for walking to sights and a few steps from the tram if you need to travel farther. I must say the staff were exceptional. My husband and I have travelled extensively and these folks are definately among the best for providing not just service but sharing their hospitality like you would with family and friends. We commend highly the Sirkeci Konak!

Reviews.Title: “Stop Searching, this is the hotel to choose”
Reviews.Author: thomNewYork
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nIghts and from the minute we set foot inside the attention paid to you by the staff was second to none. They offered US a drink and then sat with us for over an hour to chat about our plans and to assist us with the finer details of our sight seeing plans and supplied us with a great map. The food is great and reasonable , location is spot on and bedrooms of a high standard. Feel free to pm if you have any queries. I overheard many guests compliment the staff also. Thanks guys you were great.

Reviews.Title: “good!!”
Reviews.Author: nicoitaly
Reviews.Content: nice and clean rooms good hospitality fantastic for the location

Reviews.Title: “Reports are true - friendly, cosy, charming and wonderful”
Reviews.Author: NickPapa
Reviews.Content: We arrived with the road dug up, but a couple of short blasts of the horn brought the porters runnnig and had has safely esconsed in the Hotel. The greeting was great with Turkish coffee and a hotel PR lady explaining the local sights and offering maps. The rooms were perfectly adequate knowing what you paid for. The only complaint I would have is the doors could do with a bit more sound insulation - as we could here what was going on outside. The Hotel was perfectly situated for pretty much all the sightseeing in the Old town - with futher excursions made easy with the tramway stop being so close. The food was standard fare, plenty of fruit/yogurt/coffee and fresh sesame rolls. Full breakfasts catered for but with such good food being offered in the city for lunch and dinner - it wasnt needed. The concierge service was brilliant - they were eager and helpful - top marks. The little hamam was perfect to relax in at the end of a long day sightseeing - a real bonus to have, we didnt eat lunch/dinner there - but made full use of the 10% discount at their sister hotel/restaurant Pasazade - which too was very good local food and value. after dinner coffee/drinks were quick and nice to know you could have after making your way back to the hotel. Thoproughly recomend for local immersion in a outstanding city.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: AllieNYC1
Reviews.Content: Based on the glowing TripAdvisor reviews of this hotel, I booked a room for one night, as a stopover on my way home to the U.S. I had high expectations, but ended up disappointed overall. I called a few days ahead to confirm my reservation, but no one told me about the free airport transfer which they apparently offer, so I took a taxi from the airport. Unfortunately, not only had the driver never heard of the hotel (which surprised me, since it is ranked #2 for all of Istanbul on TripAdvisor), but he had to call the hotel many times -- luckily I had the phone # -- before he sort of found it. I say "sort of" because the entire street in front of the hotel is being dug up for some kind of renovation, so there was no car access and he could not even get close to the hotel. We had to wait 10 minutes, in the rain, for the hotel porter to come get me with all my bags, and then walk several blocks to the hotel. Now, if I had not called ahead to confirm my reservation, maybe I could have overlooked the fact that no one from the hotel had bothered to warn me about this. But since I had called, I felt they should have told me, so therefore by the time I arrived , I was quite annoyed and frustrated. The porter was as nice as can be, and and tried to make me feel better by offering me a free drink and a plate of fruit on check-in, and later he returned to tell me that he had "scored" me a free dinner at the hotel that evening. Again, I was not aware that this was offered to all guests, so I thought he had done something special for me, until I read the reviews more closely after my stay. After that, I almost feel like he pulled one over on me, though in his mind I suppose he was just trying to cheer me up. The decor of the hotel is beautiful, and the room was exactly as pictured on the website -- except it was too narrow, and there was literally no place to put my two suitcases. The bathroom was also very small, and I almost burned myself on the towel heater getting out of the shower. Also, you can hear the noise from the bathrooms next door (or above), as well as the construction noise from the street. I didn't understand what was so great about the location, at least in terms of the street on which the hotel is situated. There are some nice stores, but mainly auto parts, and it is not at all charming. I also found the food in the restaurant (both dinner and breakfast) to be very average, even less than average, though beautifully presented (i.e., it looked much better than it tasted). Also, the website and the staff boast 24/7 room service, but when I checked the menu, it was extremely limited, just two short pages, and there was almost nothing for vegetarians or fish lovers. That said, the staff were very pleasant, and the massage from the spa downstairs was one of the best I've ever had. I just wish they had paid more attention to guests accessing the hotel, especially when the street in front is under renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel, excellent, friendly, service”
Reviews.Author: smithgs
Reviews.Content: What a great place! We had a long weekend here and were really impressed from the moment we arrived to when we left. We were picked up at Istanbul airport and on arrival, given tea and a friendly briefing on the hotel and Istanbul. All the main sights atre within easy walking distance of the hotel, the tram stop about 100m away, and the Emionou ferry quay (for Bosphorus trips and the Asia-side, Kadakoy) is 10 mins walk. Our standard room was very comfortable and quiet. Turkish delight, water and tea/coffee all included. As we'd booked three nights we were given a three-course dinner (and the pick up from the airport) free - on the first night. Breakfast buffet was also excellent. But the really outstanding aspect was the friendly and helpful, personal, service from ALL the staff. A rarity in any hotel. Nothing was too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel,Woderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: nancymd51
Reviews.Content: I made reservation for this hotel the night prior to departure from USA . I really did not expect such a wonderful hotel with most amazing staffs. The location is also great. I even received a cake,candle and a gift for my birhtday and also a departure gift. I highly recommend this hotel to anybody who travels to istanbul. This was my 5th and the best trip to this city partly because of Sirkoci Konak Hotel staffs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfect staff!”
Reviews.Author: FRETZHO
Reviews.Content: Great stay ! The location is perfect, close to restaurants, cafes, tramway stops and walking distance of the main historic sites of Istambul. Staff was extremely welcoming, friendly and available to us during our stay, feels great and it changes of huge unfriendly and cold business hotels. Our room was comfortable and sporless with all required facilities. defenitely recommend that place to all future travellers at istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karl080
Reviews.Content: All facilities we needed, very comfortable room and superb restaurant, but most of all we enjoyed the warm hospitality of all personal at the hotel. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: shirazgol
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sirkeci Konak for 5 nights and it was one of the best hotel experiences ever. We were greeted by the lady in charge of tourist info upon arrival and she gave us some very helpful information about places to visit and how to get there, providing maps and info about the trams and public transportation. We were also told that Internet access was free in the hotel and we could use the laptops in the lobby whenever we wanted. Also, guests were given one free 3-course dinner on the night of their choice. In addition, guests could get a 10% discount at the hotel and any of the three other sister restaurants that were introduced to us. We had meals at the Sirkeci Konak and Imbat restaurants and they were all excellent. We were also told that guests could take part in a number of activities provided by the hotel free of charge. We signed up for two of them. First, the cooking course with the hotel chef where we learned how to make a Turkish appetizer and a main course. It was really fun and they served us what we had made later in the hotel restaurant. Second was a guided tour of the Fatih Marketplace. Agah, the very kind front desk attendant, took us on this tour and we were able to see a bit of the real Istanbul which many tourists might not have a chance to see. After the market, he took us to some charming old neighborhoods and showed us a beautiful old church while providing interesting info about the places we visited. I highly recommend both the cooking course & market tour to anyone visiting. The room we were given was really nice. It faced Gulhane Park and was very clean regarding sheets, towels, bathroom, etc. There were vases of fresh flowers and also a bowl of Turkish Delights for the guests to enjoy. Also, every day between 4:30 to 6:30 p.m. fresh Turkish samovar tea and sandwiches were served in the lobby free of charge. All in all, the Sirkeci Konak is a charming hotel with very friendly staff who are always willing to help you with a smile. The location was excellent (steps away from Gulhane tram station & walking distance to many major tourist sites) and the food was very good. Thank you Sirkeci Konak for making our stay such a pleasant one. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting, Fantastic, Cozy & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: camelshiraz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sirkeci Konak Hotel in Istanbul for 5 nights and had an amazing time there. Let's start from the very first: As soon as we arrived, they served us some delicious Turkish tea and gave us a couple of useful maps for sightseeing while explaining how to get to all the sites from the hotel. Everyone at the hotel knew English and were always ready to help. Our room was cozy and stylish. There was a dish of delicious Turkish Delights in our room which we enjoyed eating everyday. The view from the window was nice, too, since we faced Gulhaneh Park. The sheets, bathroom,...were very clean. No problem with the water drainage or hot water no matter how long your shower takes. Breakfast was excellent with a variety of bread, cheese, olives, yogurts, fresh fruits, .... you name it! We had our free dinner on the first night and two more meals at the hotel and they were all great. The hotel also introduces 2 other restaurants with a 10% discount. We went to one (Imbat) and again we had a delicious dinner. Everyday from 4:30 to 6:30 the hotel serves freshly made samover Turkish tea or apple tea with little sandwiches in the lobby.....and it's all free! Make sure you sign up for the tours and activities the hotel offers. They're all free & great! We did the cooking class and the Fatih Tour and had a wonderful time at both. The chef taught us to make a delicious appetizer and even more delicious food. Agah, the kind front office attendant, took us on tour to the open local market and to one of Istanbul's old neighborhoods which was very interesting. I would highly recommend both activities to anyone who is interested in cooking and/or seeing the real Istanbul. Location-wise the hotel couldn't have been in a better place. Walking distance to many major sightseeing sites and also very close to Gulhaneh Tram Station. From there you can get to other parts of the city like Tophaneh, Taksim, Civahir Shopping Mall,.....Each token for the tram or metro was 1.75 TL. I'm not sure if I can say enough about how great this hotel is. The hospitality was so amazing that we felt at home and at ease at all times. There's always a smiling face around. At the end of our stay it was one of the staff's birthday and that was something we will remember, too. What a nice surprise it was....and what a delicious cake! And it doesn't finish here!! They gave us farewell gifts and we were practically escorted outside when leaving. Thank you Sirkeci Konak for making our trip to Istanbul so memorable. We will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Warm reception, home away from home, excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: AYasin3
Reviews.Content: We were four friends together for the first time in Istanbul. All well travelled and with different tastes, we ll equally enjoyed this wonderful city and the excellent hotel. I arrived at 6am but the warm reception coupled with the surprise of a available room (I was told by the company I booked through that the room wouldn't be available until the afternoon) was an amazing start to a unforgettable weekend. I am definitely returning an would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, the location is excellent as i could walk to all the major sites, and pop back to the hotel for a break whenever i needed one. The location, service and food was wonderful, and even though i spent most of my time out enjoying Istanbul, the hotel really felt like home.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: Tristam123
Reviews.Content: I arrived on my birthday and the staff were so welcoming. While we were in reception enjoying our welcome drinks the lights went off and the staff presented me with a birthday cake and sang for me! The staff could not do enough for us during our three night stay. I can't recommend this hotel and their amazing staff enough. If you go to Istanbul it would be a crime not to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Sirkeci Konak Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: sepe2011
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Sirkeci Konak Hotel was wonderful! We spent five days in Istanbul, and we felt like at home. We think the hotel has got a great team! Kindness, competence, helpfulness are the words we would use to describe the team.The staff of the concierge and of the restaurant, the Chef, Mr Mohammed, Mr Haga, the reception girls, the waitresses, everybody has been friendly and kind!

Reviews.Title: “what can I say that hasn't already been said”
Reviews.Author: 15ian20
Reviews.Content: Honestly, it is one of the best hotels I have stayed in. I don't want to say too much as it might spoil your experience. The staff are so friendly and helpful and seem geniunely happy to be there

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: simchaf
Reviews.Content: This hotel is better than I thought. The service is great. I asked the front desk clerk about the hippodrome and he gave me a tour book as a gift. The breakfast was amazing. Lots of cheeses, breads, cereals, eggs. My kids enjoyed going in the pool and the hamam. The kids also liked the complimentary afternoon tea and sandwich's. The rooms were beautiful. Very spacious and our room even had a balcony. I have been all over the world but this hotel was at the top.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PijuDo
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel. It's within walking distance of many of the attractions and the tramcar station is just around the corner. The sister hotels / restaurants have wonderful food and wine. I'd thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Treatment of customer as guess”
Reviews.Author: Juanjo44
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were received by the customer service manager and offered a free drink while explained hotel facilities and services available to customers. They are extremely friendly and professional. The best example about how they care for customers is that all the staff came to say goodbye at the door when we were leaving for the airport. They also sent and e-mail the day after to check if we arrived safely at home and asked our opinion and suggestions for improvement about the hotel and their staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family-run atmosphere with great service”
Reviews.Author: timbo59uk
Reviews.Content: Really a repeat of previous positive reviews - nice front desk people (like Okay and Dilhan), helpful (provided 2 different pillows on request), good gym and pool (at a suitable warm temperature), made bookings for 2 dinners for us, recommended boat tour etc etc. They offered to move us to a different room at the rear when road work started out front. we ate at sister hotel Orient Express's restaurant Imbat, which would have had a good view of the City if it wasn't pouring with rain; and at Topaz on Inonu Caddesi near the Stadium, which is the place to go if you want to splash out - excellent. It's one minute from the trolleybus stop which is easy to take across the bridge and costs little.

Reviews.Title: “This must be the best hotel in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: manofvision
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Istanbul - but not our last. We loved the city. We were recommended the Sirkeci Konak Hotel and it proved to be an excellent choice. It is in the heart of the old city and about 50m from the nearest tramway station so getting around the sites on foot and by tram was very easy. We felt safe wherever we went. The staff were very welcoming and went out of their way to help us. At one time my wife asked the brand of Turkish Delight they served as she wanted to buy a box to take home. A few minutes later she was presented with two boxes with the compliments of the hotel. When we left they remembered and gave her another box, fully gift wrapped. It was the attention to detail that really impressed us. The hotel facilities - small swimming pool, sauna, turkish steam bath, exercise room - were all spotlessly clean as were the restaurants. The food was delicious. I could go on - we travel fairly frequently but this must rate as one of the best hotels that we have stayed in. Thank you everyone at the Sirkeci Konak for making our short stay so enjoyable. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “True meaning of service and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: RieenJa
Reviews.Content: This hotel (group) really has an outstanding service. We encountered a (personal) problem upon arriving at an other hotel from the same group. The staff there helped us to try to find a solution. They came up with a possible stay at the Konak: an excellent alternative. The hotel is clean, on a quiet street, yet on walking distance (5 min.) from Aya Sophia, Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque. Metro on 2 min. Inhouse restaurant Neyzade is very good; but if you like to go outside for dinner try the Imbat. Also from the Sirkeci group and with a stunning view over Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lucyfaraway
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I see glowing reviews and I usually say, "Yeah, right"... But sincerely, Sirkeci Konak is definitely one of the absolute best hotels I have ever stayed at. The staff is professional, attentive, and very friendly. They greet you with a smile, ask you how you are doing and actually care! And when you leave, they stand outside and wave goodbye to you. It really felt like you were a guest in someone's home rather than a hotel. The breakfast buffet is a definite added value. It is large with plenty of options and best of all... All You Can Eat! The restaurant offers very delicious meals presented beautifully. The hotel is about 10 minute walk to Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque, about five minute walk to Topkapi Palace and Archaeological Museum. The tram stops at the corner of the block, you can take it all the way over the Galata Bridge and go to Dolmabahce Palace in 15 minutes. The ferry stops are about ten minutes walk. Grand Bazaar about 20 minute walk give or take, and Spice Market about ten minutes walk. This hotel is truly in a great location if this is your first time in Istanbul and looking for a central location to get to the main sights easily. Again, the hotel staff were absolutely grand, very eager to assist in any way possible, the rooms were beautifully decorated and very clean with all of comforts you would expect. I highly recommend a visit to the Turkish Bath downstairs and take a dip in the pool. It is a wonderful way to relax after a day full of sightseeing. I can't wait for my next trip - I will definitely stay at Sirkeci Konak again.

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY Recommended - Could not have been happier with the experience!”
Reviews.Author: emilyduvbar
Reviews.Content: I have absolutely nothing negative to say about this hotel. They exceeded expectations by leaps and bounds the whole time we were there. Everyone from the managers to the front desk to the restaurant staff to the spa staff were hospitable and made me feel like my happiness was their genuine priority from the moment we arrived until the end of the trip. Any help we needed, there was always someone available and happy to help, from sightseeing recommendations to providing a translator when one was needed to helping with money, anything. Lovely touches like fresh flowers everywhere and a large complimentary breakfast buffet were appreciated. The restaurant food was great - fresh and flavorful - we had dinner there twice even though we usually like to explore more because it was so tasty the first time. And the location - right next to a tram stop, literally right next to Topkapi Palace, and so close to Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque, pretty much walkable to all the sights (Grand Bazaar, New Mosque, Spice Bazaar, etc), but if you don't want to walk, the tram is right there and its clean and easy to use. Some cute restaurants right around the corner if you don't want to go far after a long day of sightseeing and dont want to stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Really Exceptional Experience”
Reviews.Author: Hardingly
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a very enjoyable week at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel (booked through British Airways Tours) and we were genuinely impressed with the warmth and generosity of the hotel's service. We felt that the treatment from the front desk, to the restaurant, to the cleaning staff was simply exceptional. We warmly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: AAAUs
Reviews.Content: We decided to travel to Istanbul for a few days and stayed in Sirkeci Konak Hotel, the hotel staff there were very polite and tried to go out of their way to make us feel comfortable. Food was very good in the hotel restaurant and they were not over-priced like some other places that we stayed before. We were staying in a triple room and there were plenty of space to move around and the beddings were very comfortable as well. The room was very clean and we would stay there again if we return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “What a people!”
Reviews.Author: Zufuhrstr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is amazing! Very clean, very well located! Rooms with lots of tiny details that will surprise you positive. From the soaps in the bath till the different size and hardnes pillows on the bed. Very cozy feeling. But the most amazing of all, is the personel. So kind and ready to help you on ANYTHING! I have asked them directions for the Taksim place and a guy that was going off at that time, he offered to escort me till there. Even further he paid the tram ticket for me all the way!!! What a man!!! Next day I had a visitor, we had breakfast together and they charge NOTHING for the extra person!!!! How often do you find that in a hotel? A M A Z I N G !!!! At the check out I asked for two small bottles of water. Same story. No change!!!! The staff was waiting at the door while leaving with a little present from the hotel! What an amazing experience! This people do know how to treat people and how to run business! Many -many congratulations to all of them! Can't wait to go back again...

Reviews.Title: “Centrally placed, helpful staff, good accommodation.”
Reviews.Author: PatFowler
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is ideally situated on the peninsula of the old town of Istanbul. The major attractions were within a few minutes walk and others easily reached by means of the tramway. The food - breakfast and afternoon tea - was excellent and after a day sightseeing it was lovely to come and relax with tea and sandwiches which were provided free. There was ample bottled water - if you ran out you only had to ask. The staff were very friendly and eager to please. The room was clean and supplied with hairdryer, fridge and teamaking facilities. Our room overlooked the palace walls. The only thing we didn't like was the plumbing which was rather loud but we got used to that. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of coming to visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: LFKaplan
Reviews.Content: My organization hosted a two week conference in Istanbul at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel. The staff could not have been more helpful or accommodating to the many requests of our group. The location of the hotel and the breakfast buffet are also excellent. I would highly recommend this hotel or the other hotels in the Sirkeci Group to both business and pleasure travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic people & location”
Reviews.Author: Cali_Cake
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at the very last moment (our tip to Egypt was cancelled, so we diverted to Istanbul). We knew nothing about the area & trusted Trip Advisor for hotel & guides. Worked out beautifully. From the moment you walk into this hotel, you're greeted like a family member. Honestly, EVERYONE that works here is so friendly and happy. The staff greets you, asks you to have a seat in the beautiful lobby area & gives you an orientation (if you're up for it). You really want to do this, they have a bunch of information - plus some great freebies the hotel offers that you can sign up for. We opted to: - do the Turkish wine and cheese tasting - Cooking night with the chef - Backgammon Unlike some hotels that really nickel & dine you, this hotel spares no fret over a few dollars to make your stay perfect. The front desk even has tram tokens so you don't need to hassle with getting them yourself. The wifi is free & strong (even in your room, and for all devices), the breakfast is free & lavish, and the on-site restaurant is absolutely wonderful. You also can't beat the location. Just a few tram stops to the Blue Mosque, The Sophia & The Grand Bazaar. Or a 5 minute walk to the spice market, the bridge to Euro side, or the ferry to the Asia side. The best part is it's an easy hotel to find in a city that is very foreign & easy to get turned around in. Just walk/follow the tram line & when you get to the part that it passes the ancient wall - voila, you're home! Fantastic neighborhood of shops, restaurants & attractions. Geared to tourists? Yes, but face it, you ARE a tourist! enjoy every minute.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality in a well organised and very clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hughesy_11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were extremely impressed by this hotel during our 4 day stay. Nothing is too much trouble for the staff and they are always friendly and courteous. The location is quiet but central to all attractions in the old city. The wine and cheese tasting was great as were the cooking lessons that the hotel offers free of charge. The hotel also provides afternoon tea free of charge to guests every day. Transfers to/from the airport were arranged by the hotel (one free of charge and the other at a small fee of 20 Euros). The breakfast buffet is impressive and would satisfy most appetites. Overall, this would be one of the best hotels that my wife and I have experienced anywhere on the world.

Reviews.Title: “Serkici Konak Hotel in Istanbul - elegant, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: JanLesley61
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at this hotel. It is perfectly situated to see the sights - 10 minutes walk one way to the Haghia Sophia, Blue Mosque and Topkapi palace, 10 minutes the other to the waterfront. Also very handy for the tram. Room was large and had all we wanted. The staff are delightful - very friendly and wanting to do their best to ensure we enjoyed our stay. We ate a couple of times in the restaurant which was excellent and we also visited the terrace restaurant of one of the Serkici sister hotels which has a marvellous view (and a 10% 'Sirkeci' discount). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Top Value for Money -extremely friendly staff, clean rooms, nice breakfast, good location”
Reviews.Author: Bumblebee046
Reviews.Content: I don't usually write reviews, but I had such a pleasant stay at the Sirkeci Konak that I have to recommend it to everyone going to Istanbul. What made all the difference was the extremely nice staff, the clean rooms and the great location -all the old sights are within easy walking distance. If the primary interest is going out to bars and clubs at night, a hotel near the Taksim Square would be better. Otherwise: I'd stay here again any time!

Reviews.Title: “The best service we have experienced at any hotel anywhere”
Reviews.Author: doorlight
Reviews.Content: Our original was at the Erboy, which was closed for renovations. We were shifted to the Sirkeci Konak, owned by the same group and rather a step up. Perfect location -- a few yards from the tram -- walking distance from all major sites in Sultan Ahmet. We were given a fine complimentary dinner our first night, complimentary afternoon tea every day, excellent complimentary breakfast. The staff were unfailingly polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent personalised service from the heart!”
Reviews.Author: salsacapri
Reviews.Content: I have travelled extensively, both for business and leisure. Never had i came across such warm and sincere service from the staff, they took pleasure in making sure that you experienced genuine Turkish hospitality! Because itz a vacation, the group of us took our time leisurely every morning at breakfast, surfing the free wifi. Never did the staff stop us from having late breakfast after 10, they may apologetically invite us to the lobby after 11am if we lazed too long, they need to turn the restaurant around for lunch. A friend had her birthday yesterday and their manager literally told me to have her back in the hotel around evening as they had a surprise for her. Indeed, all the front desk staff gathered to present a cake with candles, sang her a song and also a traditional Turkish cup and saucer set! We were kinda late and their manager was off duty but he stayed behind just to make sure that this gesture was done. Absolutlely helpful in services, we also got our reservation at 360istanbul restaurant and transport in a breeze! A fantastic recommendation to indulge in one of the best for a birthday celebration! During our checkout earlier, all the front desk staff saw us to our car and even presented farewell gifts of Turkish Delight! What a great experience of true Turkish hospitality! Highly recommended for anyone visiting Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! The reviews are totally spot on”
Reviews.Author: Tim100fromlondon
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in a hotel like this! everything is excellent, staff super helpful and friendly all the time.Restaurant excellent. Location ideal for historic area. Look through the reviews, I could not find 1 poor one.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Almost Everything”
Reviews.Author: TNSunshine79
Reviews.Content: There were 4 in our party; we were picked up by the hotel van as arranged-no cramming 4 plus bags in a small car hardly any room for baggage; the hotel is small by American standards but has everything, especially excellent service. The concierge lady was excellent. She went out of her way to book our bus tour, find us good restaurants (even other than in the Sirkeci chain) and provide us with general information about the area. The seating area off the lobby is very comfortable and the apple tea delicious. The owner of the hotel visits regularly and came to chat with us one late afternoon. The rooms were very comfortable, spacious and clean - even a heated tile floor in the bathroom. Hardwood in the room - no dirty carpeting. The location was excellent - we could walk almost anywhere in the old city. The only problem we had was the temperature of the room; we like it cool in the evening. Despite the chilly outdoor temperature, the room was too warm and could not be cooled to our preference without being specially programmed. Then it had to be reprogrammed for heat the next day. This was the fault of the programmed temperature; the staff was willing to help us even at midnight. Otherwise, it is the perfect place in a city of many contrasts. We would return to both in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “a different hotel”
Reviews.Author: turcodelarana
Reviews.Content: They really made us feel at home with constant suggestions,advice and useful tips about Istambul;besides the food is superb and they even have a progam with activities for their guests like cooking courses or wine and cheese tasting.Very good value on an ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “An Outstanding Experience at a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Busy-retired
Reviews.Content: As the previous 900+ reviews confirm, this is a particularly unique property. While we are budget travelers, occasionally we treat ourselves to a night in a luxury hotel, and on this trip to Istanbul we elected to stay at the Sirkeci Konak based on the outstanding reviews. We had a five star experience with a price tag much less than the Four Seasons. Located at the edge of Gulhane Park, the Sirkeci Konak is near all the ancient sights of Sultanahmet. It is also only about one block from the tram stop, meaning much of Istanbul can be reached via public transportation with virtually no walking. We really enjoyed walking around in the Sirkeci neighborhood, which is evolving into a charming place. We found the shops less expensive than Sultanahmet and the salesmen far less aggressive. The many restaurants and the pedestrian street with sidewalk cafes are very welcoming. The hotel itself is designed in understated elegance. Rooms are tastefully appointed. With luxurious linen, quality furniture and a choice of four types of pillows. It would be difficult to imagine anything other than a perfect night's sleep. The bathroom was beautiful and there was an abundance of hot water and huge luscious towels. Rooms are appointed with a flat screen TV and a good selection of English TV channels. The free Wi-Fi we enjoyed was among the most reliable we experienced in Turkey. Little touches like a filled candy dish and fresh flowers added to the harmony of the guest room. Two elevators eliminate the need to climb stairs. The Sirkeci Konak, however, is much more than a hotel. It is an entire experience. After registration one is ushered into the seating area of the lobby and the guest manager or day manager asks about plans and provides specific directions to reach each location. They offer maps and literature about the city. If you are a first-time visitor with a few jitters, this little get-acquainted meeting leaves you ready and anxious to tour the city. Tea is served every afternoon in the tasteful lobby. Over glasses of tea and little sandwiches guests share daily experiences. Often the owner of the hotel joins the guests at this afternoon reception. As one would certainly know from the quality of the hotel, he is charming, but unpretentious and is sincerely interested in each of his guests. We enjoyed the cooking class. We had great fun preparing our evening meal. The chef was delightful, and meeting other participants was enriching. Everyone wore a chef hat and coat and we all took lots of photos. After the meal had been prepared we went to the dining room where we ate the dinner we had made. It was a lovely experience. Other cultural offerings at the hotel include backgammon lessons, a trip to the weekly market in Fatih and wine and cheese tastings. The Sirekci Konak not only provides luxurious lodgings, but they also introduce guests to many unique offerings in Istanbul. The hotel offers two excellent restaurants and the complimentary breakfast is superior with many choices including standard Turkish fare of vegetables, olives, yogurt and bread as well as fresh fruit, freshly squeezed orange juice, several other juice selections, tea, filtered coffee and several choices of meats. The breakfast server is personable and charming. The hotel also offers a nice indoor swimming pool along with a complete spa facility where one can enjoy a Turkish bath experience. A rooftop terrace is available during appropriate seasons, where one can enjoy a beverage and view of the city. I lack the words to describe the hotel staff. From the manager to the maid each person is completely charming. We were greeted with smiles and as much conversation as we wished to experience. Clearly the staff is well-educated, and carefully trained, but each person also displays delightful and hospitable personality. We truly felt valued and pampered by every employee. We only had one problem with this hotel. The room was so lovely and the staff so charming and the on-site restaurants so good and the cultural experiences so rich that we did not want to leave the hotel. We left late and returned early and really had to force ourselves to go out and explore the city. I often write that one does not go to Istanbul to sit in a hotel room, but the Sirekci Konak is an exception to that statement.

Reviews.Title: “hiddentreasure”
Reviews.Author: Chris00001
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel very helpful and friendly staff. Food was very good

Reviews.Title: “A SUCH WARM CHARMING HOTEL : THE BEST WE KNOW IN TURKEY”
Reviews.Author: Hakke
Reviews.Content: Dear travellers, Wtih my wife, we used to travel more often than it's possible. We already staid in TURKEY 46 times (yes, fourty six times) in different areas. Last years, we went to Turkey 4 or 5 times per year. We just came back from 5 days stay in Istanbul. This country is unique because of the exceptional hospitality. Turkish people are mainly men and women of their word and are characterized by their heart sharing culture and their real hospitality. You can go to Turkey with complete confidence : please, don't mix up Turkey with arabic countries. We already staid in SIRKECI KONAK hotel in Istanbul more than 12 times. It's probably the best hotel we know in comparison with all other hotels in Turkey. Well located closed to historical area SULTANAHMET : 5 minutes walking from museums and mosques, 200 meters from the tram and thanks to it less than half an hour from the modern area TAKSIM in which you could find so many restaurants and shops. All in SIRKECI KONAK hotel is perfect : cleanliness, well decorated and such comfortable rooms (some of them are a little small but who spend his whole time in the room ?), wonderful breakfast, 2 lovely restaurants (one anatolian cook and one fish restaurant), a very warm lobby, not expensive drinks prices (one beer around 2.40 euros) and above all a unique welcome from any people especially frontdesk Mr. AGAH ALKAN, relationship manager Ms. EZGI and Ms. DILHAN. They are ever looking to help you. If you have the chance to meet the owner Mr. Faruk BOYACI, you'll be surprised by his unpretentiousness and his warm welcome. Included in the room price : sauna, hamam, swimming pool, cooking lessons, weekly market visit in typically turkish area FATIH, your one way transfer from the AtatÃ¼rk international airport, the free first dinner (if you stay minimum 3 nights) and so on. In summer, you could have your dinner on the terrace. From Sirkeci Konak, 500 meters away, you could have a drink in Red River Pub which is one of the Sirkeci Group. Endly, if you are looking for any information for instance restaurant, they will recommand you such famous turkish not far from SIRKECI KONAK. As you can look on the hotel's website (www.sirkecikonak.com), the rooms rates are reasonable considering the quality. We recommand you this hotel especially if you are opened mind travellers who are looking for contact with local people and reach Turkey civilization and culture. We wish you a lovely travel in TURKEY and a wonderful stay in SIRKECI KONAK. Fabienne and Jean-Pierre from France ( we are not turkish and have no professional interest in Turkey).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Joolsforester
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel for two nights before leaving on a a seven day cruise. We were greeted as if they knew us personally. Tea was served in the lobby as well as little sandwiches for anyone who needed a little snack. Turkish delights were always around for those who needed a little sweet treat. Our rooms were very nice and clean. The food in the restaurant was delicious and the staff was very friendly. The location was perfect and centrally located. I have stayed in many hotels around the world and would say this was the best overall experience with staff, clean rooms, food and overall experience. They run a very nice hotel and I would return in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite service”
Reviews.Author: Awolinsaudi
Reviews.Content: I arrived *really* early off my flight, and hoped that the hotel would accept my bags for early drop-off while I went on a walking tour of the city until the room was ready. Not only would they take the bags, but the concierge apologized that the room wasn't ready and offered me a free full buffet breakfast! From that initial moment on the hotel was exemplary. Staff couldn't have been nicer, the rooms were well appointed, the facilities (including the Turkish bath) were wonderfully relaxing. The concierge and bellhop's recommendations for places to eat and visit were exactly right. The hotel location is precisely central to all of Istanbul's historic attractions - nothing is more than 10 minutes stroll away. It is also less than 200 meters from the tram running from Istanbul Ataturk airport. Highly recommended for a long weekend getaway in a very cool city. Thankyou - I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “The staff makes the difference!”
Reviews.Author: matissp
Reviews.Content: Have been travelling extensively for the past 15 years in all continents; seen it all; never wrote a review... But the stay here made me finally do that! Not because of the hotel itself, but because of the staff that demonstrated what every hotel staff around the world should look up to! Of course, one can find fancier hotels, bigger rooms, huge breakfasts, state of the art facilities, spas etc. but the combination of the above at SK was just perfectly balanced - clean, nice rooms, good breakfast, spa with turkish bath & small pool (but very good spa procedure upon request), excellent location if you are on siteseeing (next to everything and 2 min from tram), free transfer one way, free tours and activities every day. The difference was the staff and service!!! We travelled with our 4 year old son and he made friends with virtually everyone. Believe me, he has seen many places as well, but none like this! His every wish was fulfilled in an instant - they taught him playing backgamon, gave toys and books, tought some basic Turkish, watched football game together, fed cats on the street, even had an immitated sword fight with breakfast knives. Forgive me that I do not recall all the names... but, of course, Okay, was a gem - his tours and help and knowledge about the city and history; and his attitude towards our son. On the depature we were surprised to receive some small present as a memory from the hotel and really moved being followed by some 6-7 staff outside to the car to wawe goodbye! Keep up the excellent work! Okay, please, pass our regards to the others! And definitely see you next time!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: DazLaw
Reviews.Content: I have travelled all over the world and stayed in hotels of every shape and size, and can honestly say that this was the best Hotel I have stayed in. The Hotel itself is clean, quiet and comfortable. The room we had was a deluxe room and was fantastic with great views from the balcony of the Topaki Palace gardens. The thing that set this apart (and above) all of the other Hotels was the staff and the attention to detail. When we arrived at the airport the driver collected us and as he did not speak great English, we were given a printed guide detailing places of interest on the route to the hotel. On arrival at the hotel we were taking into the lounge to enjoy a free drink, while someone checked us in. We were given an overview of the hotel facilities and once checked in taken to the room. The room had fresh fruit and a gift from the hotel (our anniversary). The room was large and very comfortable (heated floor in the bath room, shower and bath, high quality shampoos and soaps etc.) It was also my birthday while staying here and without prompting they produced a cake with candles on and sang happy birthday on our return from the day out sightseeing while enjoying a glass of apple tea. These are just a few examples of the attention to detail and real care the staff take to make sure you are happy and comfortable. I would totally recommend to anyone to stay here, and will be returning for a spring . summer trip in the near future

Reviews.Title: “Well sited for walking tours in the city, clean, friendly and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: clemobluegrass
Reviews.Content: Was made very welcome. Hotel is clean, comfortable and compact. Next time I will visit with my wife and ask for a larger room. Ideally situated for walking to all the major tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: jieheerah
Reviews.Content: Sirkeci Konak Hotel is really the best hotel in Istanbul. It is located right next to Topkapi Palace. You can actually see the old wall and the garden of the historical palace which makes you feel like a sultan. Beside being in the wonderful location, the rooms are very cozy and comfortable. In other hotels in Turkey, I have always felt a bit of chill when I first stepped in rooms although all of them become warmer as you turn on the heater. But rooms in this hotel had none of that initial chilly air. Bathrooms are even warmer because it is separately heated with a hot radiator. After staying in a bit chilly cave hotels in Kappadocia for 3 nights I was very glad. Staffs in this hotel go out of their way to be nice and friendly. I was interested in buying a Turkish tray (lokum container) used in the room so I asked the staff what the name of the tray is. I was planning to buy it in Bazaar later. But I did not have to. The hotel provided the tray for me as a present!! I was so happy!! I never stayed in such a friendly place. If you're planning to go to Istanbul, definitely stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further!”
Reviews.Author: CBrandtWright
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a wonderful 2 night / 3 day stay at this wonderful property. The staff are some of the most helpful in the world and will make every effort to help. Excellent included breakfast and great location.

Reviews.Title: “the best!”
Reviews.Author: mobilmac
Reviews.Content: I relied on the great reviews in Tripadvisor when I decided to book at the Sirkeci Konak for 5 nights prior to a cruise in November. Simply put, we had a great experience. The hotel is in a great location, the deluxe room was fantastic, and the staff could not have been nicer or more accomodating. We enjoyed tea in the late afternoons, a cooking and a backgammon class - all included in the price. An example of their commitment to their guests ... I broke a shoelace on my flight to Istanbul and asked where I could buy a replacement pair of laces. They told me they've handle it. Sure enough, I got a call in my room the next morning asking me to bring my shoes down to the lobby - the staff had brought the "shoelace man" to the hotel with 20-30 different types of shoelaces from which I could select. He put the selected pair on my shoes and I went off to enjoy my day. Truly accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “ideal hotel for Istanbul visit”
Reviews.Author: Victoria02
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, very good staff, facilities, restaurant

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel with the friendliest staff you could meet.”
Reviews.Author: LaManche131
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived the staff were incredibly friendly, polite and helpful. They really made our stay one of the most enjoyable we have ever experienced. Our room was really comfortable with all we needed including a view of the Topkapi Palace Gardens and a distant view of the Bosphorous. We were well placed to visit all the main sights and the hotel itself had excellent facilities. We particularly enjoyed the food and two meals at the sister restaurants which were cheaper and better quality than many others that we had been exhorted to visit. The organised events were surprisingly good and not ones to join in normally we tried all but one. The highlight was a trip to a local food market and the Greek quarter with one of the staff. His knowledge and enthusiasm for the city added another dimension to our visit. It was quite a wrench when we had to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull staff, great place, and very cozy .”
Reviews.Author: mj_sut
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel based on the reviews. We totally loved the stay because of the following points: 1) The staff were very friendly and caring. We enjoyed a half-day sightseeing, Great place by one of the greatest hotel staff. When he understood we like the restaurants, he introduced a few good ones and even arranged the dinner for us in a special place, where we loved the experience. 2) The location was great, just 2 mins from the tram station while no noise. 3) The room was very clean, well-designed, comfortable, and with no issues. 4) There was a swimming pool as well as a sauna where we could relax at the end of our busy day. 5) We arrived at 6:00 am on the arrival day and did the early check-in and left at 9:30 pm on the last day and kept the room till last minute.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and Service”
Reviews.Author: verokaro
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Istanbul in mid November, the weather was excellent! The Hotel is fantastic: first the location is very good (next to the Topcapi Palace and Agia Sophia Church), second the service is excellent (from the reception to the kitchen staff, all were friendly and very accomodating), third the breakfast was fabulous (full of turkish sprecialities!!!) and last the hotel was super clean and the rooms very spacious! I will definitely go back there!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect blend of the professional and the personal.”
Reviews.Author: Hullite
Reviews.Content: Delightful staff give this hotel the x-factor. It provides excellent facilities, a very good breakfast and complimentary afternoon tea but aside from the excellent service what i liked was the fact that I felt I was in Turkey. So many highly rated hotels feel they have to be "international" to the extent that you could be anywhere and when I have paid to fly somewhere to experience the culture I don't want to stay in an anodyne "hotel-u-like". Turkish produce and culture are showcased although not obligatory and the decor incorporates vernacular features. We normally stay in cheaper hotels but my partner was treating me for my 40th birthday and it was definitely money well spent. It would be an ideal hotel for the solo or nervous traveller as we overheard staff patiently fielding endless queries from certain guests. On our last day the staff very kindly gave me beautiful birthday presents and gathered round to wish me happy birthday which was a lovely touch. I would go back in a heartbeat. Oh and Istanbul surpassed even my very high expectations. Just stunning, such variety and the most friendly and hospitable people. I know I we will return courtesy of Easyjet.

Reviews.Title: “Finest Hotel I've Experienced.....What a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Mauiseeker
Reviews.Content: I selected the Sirkeci Konak based on the reviews I read in Trip Advisor in October 2009 and had such a wonderful stay, I was eager to return to Istanbul and the Sirkeci Konak again this November. My first visit was alone and this trip i was accompanied by a friend. Located just outside the walls of the Topkapi Palace, the neighborhood is pedestrian friendly and exceptionally well located for sightseeing of the many attractions of istanbul-the Cisterns, Grand Bazzar, Hagia Sophia, etc.When you enter the front door of this hotel, you immediately know this will be a unique experience.
