Instead of a big reception desk with a counter separating you from the hotel employees, you first pass through a small parlor setting and continue to the desk where you are graciously offered a chair and a cup of tea. Signing in or registering is a delight and sets the tone for your entire experience. Passing the restaurant, home to the best breakfast buffet I have ever had at a hotel, you can take one of the easy chairs or sit at a banquette which seems more like a large family living room than a hotel. There are computers and printers for the guests to use and a great selection of Istanbul guidebooks. This is a wonderful location for lounging or meeting friends. Complementary tea and snacks are offered every afternoon. The rooms are very nicely arranged and absolutely clean and well maintained. In addition to the excellence of the food and surroundings of the hotel, the warm and friendly staff are unsurpassed. I think I was personally greeted by each and everyone of the maids, waiters, bellmen, as well as the concierge and even the corporate CEO who frequently joined the guests in the living room/parlor to take tea and chat while offering any assistance with bookings needed. It is the fine quality of the hotel furnishings and service, but what really sets the Sirkeci Konak apart from run of the mill hotels is the personal touch...each guest is treated like a valued friend or family member visiting. I spend about 1/3 of the nights of the year in hotels all over the world and I have never experienced the personal connection and friendliness of the staff of this property who all are eager to provide outstanding levels of service as well as convey a real sense of care for the wellbeing of all of their guests. I cannot wait until I have the opportunity to return "home" to the Sirkeci Konak in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: Betsy75
Reviews.Content: The Sirkeci Konak was a great experience. The lobby was very welcoming, the afternoon tea was excellent. The staff was extremely helpful. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. The location was perfect for seeing so many of the interesting sites of Istanbul. I would highly recommend this hotel for everyone. When I return to Istanbul I will make sure I stay here. The owner was very interested in all of his guests and was extremely gracious.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: moniclio
Reviews.Content: A small gem. This hotel has a great location, in an area of many other small hotels. It is smaller than what it looks like in the pictures, but that proved to be a good thing. It is beautifully decorated with local authenticity yet trendy. Exceptionally clean and cozy. Nice breakfast. The best part of the hotel however, is the stuff: They speak very good English, and are incredibly helpful, even at matters that usually I will not expect or ask. They really turned our trip into a pleasurable one.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Jandee1970
Reviews.Content: The overwhelming feeling we have about the Sirkeci Konak Hotel is the wonderful friendliness of the staff. From the housekeeper right through to the concierge they couldnâ€™t do enough for us. Never once did we receive a negative response and were always greeted with smiles. At one point the front office attendant offered to go out and buy tram tokens for us while apologising that they had none left at reception! We were in Istanbul to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary and having been let down by Interflora I sent a last-minute email to Dilhan in Customer Relations to help me and of course she had flowers ready for me to present to my wife at the appropriate time. Need I have worried? â€“ never! Queries about directions, tours, shopping advice etc. were met with enthusiasm - maps and brochures were produced instantly and were marked and written on to make sure we understood. The advice was excellent. Along with their normal room presentation of Turkish delight and tea/coffee facilities we also had a display of fresh fruit and bottle of wine to help us celebrate. Secretly, we think they upgraded our room because of our anniversary. When we were leaving we were given a present which turned out to be Turkish Delight! On our arrival at the Hotel we were offered a welcome drink in the lounge while we checked-in. It was so relaxing after coming through Attaturk Airport which was packed with returning holidaymakers and their expectant families. Our room was excellent and laid out to give a great sense of space. The comfortable bed had a pillow menu and the en-suite bathroom had a Jacuzzi bath with shower. The adjoining balcony has views over Gulhane Park and the Bosphorus is partly visible to the left. The room was quiet and restful and at night there was no street noise while the 4am call to prayer was never heard. Breakfast consisted of an extensive hot & cold buffet and every table had a daily pamphlet (The Sirkeci Daily Express) with interesting facts on Istanbul and most important, the dayâ€™s weather forecast. Serving lasts from 7am to 11am â€“ so thereâ€™s no worry about missing breakfast after a late night out! In the afternoon tea and salad bagels are served, free-of-charge in the lounge, most welcome if youâ€™re returning from sightseeing or shopping trips. There is free wi-fi throughout the hotel and other free facilities include the swimming pool, sauna, turkish bath (hammam) and gym. While the food in the hotelâ€™s two restaurants is lovely and well presented, we took a liking to the Imbat restaurant in the Sirkeci Konakâ€™s sister hotel the Orient Express, which is around the corner, about one hundred and fifty metres away. There we were met by head-waiter Cemal who looked after us superbly with excellent food and lovely wine. On our final night in Istanbul he produced a tasting menu of 3 main courses and invited us to give our opinion as they were about to make changes to their existing menu. All three were absolutely brilliant, one better than the other. When we were leaving he presented us with a bottle of wine and refused to charge us for our meals!! How do you respond to that? The hotelâ€™s location is very good. If the street may not be the most salubrious in Istanbul, the proximity to the tram (2 minutes) and all the major sites is terrific, while at night all is very quiet. With Gulhane Park just across the road, the entrance is just 5 minute away and the Topkapi Palace a further 5 minutes walk inside, passing by the Archaeological Museum on the way. The Haghia Sophia is only 10 mins. from the hotel while the Blue Mosque is a further 5 mins. Walking to the Grand Bazaar takes around 20 mins. and the Spice Market would take about half-an-hour. With a trip on the tram - just up from the hotel, followed by a short run on the funicular underground railway, access to Taksim Square and the main pedestrianised shopping area is very easy. We found the people of Istanbul very friendly everywhere we went and the city bustling and full of atmosphere. As a pair of 60-somethings we walked all over the place and arrived at some of our destinations more by accident than design. At no time did we ever feel threatened or afraid and were totally comfortable everywhere we went. We would highly recommend Istanbul as a place to visit and most definitely the Sirkeci Konak Hotel where we always felt so welcome and at home.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Istanbul, and the welcome and service that we received at the Hotel was second to none I've experienced.”
Reviews.Author: Bobby_Duncan
Reviews.Content: Definitely stay at this hotel again if / when we return to Istanbul. Location is excellent, and levels of service were also superb.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cma5110
Reviews.Content: We were more than pleased with this hotel. We were greeted upon arrival and welcomed with tea and coffee while A. Okay informed us of our location, local attractions, and how to get around. Then we were brought up to our room which was beautiful! It was very spacious, with hard wood floors, large bathroom, and balcony overlooking Gulhane Park. We were in a great location and just be exiting the hotel and walking right you are instantly at Old Istanbul Village and a quick walk up to the Blue Mosque, Sophia, Cistern, Bazaars, and many restaurants, cafes, and even Starbucks!! The Breakfast buffet was so delicious! We never missed it! It had every breakfast item you could think of! The staff were even so helpful as to helping us bring breakfast to our room so we could enjoy on our balcony since the weather was surprisingly warm! Since we stayed over 3 nights we enjoyed our first dinner at the hotel restaurant which was excellent food and service. We also ate at their sister hotel's restaurant, Imbat. You can receive 10%off the bill by staying at Sirkeci. We went back to this restaurant since we loved it so much! We just can't say enough how the stay went out of their way to make our stay comfortable and worry free. We were also loving all the Turkish Delight, afternoon tea, and airport transportation that was offered all complimentary! This is the only place to stay in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “The ethalon of Turkish hospitality”
Reviews.Author: doravadasz
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel - clean and beautyful. The staff was absolutely friendly and helpful. They were always smiling and did their very best for the guests. The hotel is located next to Topkapi Saray and within walking distance of the Grand Bazaar, the great Cistern, Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. Public transport (tram stop) is just around the corner. If you want to know what hospitality means for Turkish people you only have to visit Istanbul and stay in Hotel Sirkeci Konak. And last but not least - the breakfast buffet was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hospitality”
Reviews.Author: suesamara
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are second to none - everyone without exception were amazingly warm, friendly and attentive. The restaurant was superb, breakfast very good and well organised. The rooms exceptionally clean. The hotel is very well located so that you are within walking distance of the most famous sights. The only hint of criticism was that the standard double room was slightly cramped, but this is outweighed by the quality of everything else the Sirkeci Konak has to offer. We will return and cannot wait to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “The best little hotel I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: janet405983
Reviews.Content: My husband wanted to go to Isbanbul for his 50th birthday so I got onto trip advisor to choose a hotel. Sirkeci Konak had fantastic reviews and had won the tripadvisor award two years running. I e-mailed the hotel directly and they could not have been more helpful. On arrival at the airport they sent a taxi to meet us and we were delighted with the position of the hotel right in the middle of the old quarter where all the main attractions are. Our room was small but beautifully decorated with a little balcony wwhich boasted glimpses of the Bosphorous and the Blue Mosque. Also in the room on arrival was a complimentary bottle of wine and turkish delight. We ate that night in one of the two hotel restaurants and enjoyed fabulous authentic Turkish cuisine. All the staff could not have been more helpful and on the following night, which was my husband's birthday, the waiters came out carrying a cake and singing happy birthday. They even gave him a present of two china cups and saucers. Although the hotel is small it manages to squeeze in an indoor pool and large turkish bath and one of our favourite touches was complimentary apple tea and sandwiches between 4.30 and 6pm. When it was time to go the staff all came to bid us farewell and gave us a present which turned out to be a box of turkish delight. Quite honestly I have never come across such service in a hotel before and the staff made every effort to make our stay memorable. I could not recommend this hotel highly enough. Shame British Airways could not in any way match Sirkeci Konak for customer service as they let us wait seven hours in the airport on the way home before cancelling the flight and subjecting us to a night in an aiport hotel before rather unwillingly re-booking us onto a flight the next morning. And guess what there was no refund for any expenses incurred! Shocking!!

Reviews.Title: “Not one of the best, the very best”
Reviews.Author: peterbs28
Reviews.Content: For comfort, service and location, this hotel cannot be equalled. It is tucked away close to the outer wall of Topkapi Palace and outside appearances are misleading. (Taxi drivers do have trouble finding it, so have the telephone number handy). You enter a different world of friendliness and helpfulness. The first night you are presented with a complimentary meal in one of the two restaurants. (there are a number of others in the chain of hotels at which you get a 10% discount.) Every weekday an event is organised including wine tasting, Turkish cooking, a visit to a market and so on - all part of the package. The hotel is close to the Blue mosque, Hagia Sophia, the palace and the Basilica cistern. A tram stops only 100 metres from the hotel. What other hotel would examine your account carefully at the end of the visit and offer a refund because the booking agency had made a mistake? Istanbul is clean, safe for pedestrians and everyone is very friendly and non-threatening. Go there!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel stay contributed to a memorable family holiday”
Reviews.Author: Rabbithat
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights at the Sirkecki Konak Hotel for a family holiday in November, 2010. I specifically booked the hotel based on its excellent Tripadvisor reputation, and I'm pleased that it lived up to expectations and contributed to a memorable family holiday. As we booked on the website, we received an airport pick-up and free 3-course dinner the night we arrived. The hotel has someone from their Guest Relations department welcome all visitors to offer maps, tram route card, discount card for Sirkecki restaurants and general advice, which is a nice touch - this was particularly helpful as we were there during the Eid Holiday and the opening times for some sites are different to usual (on her advice we went to the Grand Bazaar the next day, as it would be closed for the rest of the time we were in Istanbul). We booked a triple room, with the window couch made up as a very comfortable bed for our 10 year old. The room was nicely appointed and of a reasonable size, with a view of the treetops beyond the wall of the park opposite. All the staff at the hotel were welcoming, professional and responsive, and spoke good English. This would appear to be the case for the other Sirkecki hotels nearby as well - over the week we ate at several of the Sirkecki restaurants, which were excellent. The hotel is a short way down a side street, but close to restaurants, shops and a small supermarket. There is a tram stop at the end of the street, and the trams are inexpensive and frequent. The main tourist sites (Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, etc) are easily within walking distance of the hotel, or via the tram (Grand Bazaar, Ferry Docks, Dolombache Palace, Land Walls, 1453 Panorama [a highlight!] etc.) The attractive Gulhane Park is also close by, which was great as we could take the kids for a run around or a kick of the football. I would highly recommend this hotel, and would also consider the others in the Sirkecki group which would appear to have the same ethos instilled in them, based on our visits to the hotel restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming Introduction to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: abbitfd20
Reviews.Content: Never having been to Istanbul before, we opted for a pricier, more full featured hotel than we would elsewhere in Europe. We arrived early and they welcomed us with some tea while our room was prepared. Room was huge. They catered to our every whim. Great breakfast buffet included. Two restaurants in the hotel (ate at the regional Turkish one, it was good and gave hotel guests 10% reduction). If you stay two days (I think) they'll give you a free ride to the airport. A couple of Internet computers for guest use and free wi-fi. Nicely situated to the old city sites (across the street from the Topkapi palace back wall). Tram stop a block away. Quarter mile from train station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: yk1978
Reviews.Content: All in all I was pleased to stay in that hotel. However the wireless connection was very slow in my room which was very surprising and annoying. I liked the steam room very much but the swimming pool is so small that I shouldn't call it swimming pool, you can't really swim. The breakfast was not really varied over the days, that was also pity so varied food lovers, pay attention to that. Otherwise everything was good, the staff was nice & the location was just perfect

Reviews.Title: “Splendour in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: AlexCessnock
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a fabulous location in the old part of the city within walking distance of all the tourism highlights such as the spice markets, grand bazaar and sultans palace. Close to restaurants and shopping. The hotel staff are extremely hospitable and helpful, the rooms are very clean and the rooms on the 5th floor are very spacious and comfortable. Nothing was too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Tormead
Reviews.Content: If you are loking for a small, friendly high quality hotel right in the heart of Sultanahmat, this is the one for you. Go for the top floor rooms with a great little balcony and views over Gulhane Park and the Bosphorus. Very helpful staff, and a terrific fish restaurant made this hotel a perfect location to explore Istanbul. It was my wife's birthday, and they rustled up a cake and a lovely gift.......5 stars to Sirceki konak.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like family - best hotel experience in years”
Reviews.Author: BStiller
Reviews.Content: From the warm welcome I received upon arrival through to my departure, staying at this hotel was an exceptional experience. No matter which of the hotel staff was on duty, they knew me and my preferences. The owner, Faruk, takes a personal interest in the satisfaction of the guests and the staff responds with helpful suggestions, directions, recommendations and whatever is needed. Rooms are comfortable, with all the usual and necessary services. Restaurants are delightful and tasty and the breakfast buffet quite lavish. Events such as cooking classes, wine tastings and walking tours are organized at no charge by the hotel staff. Guests receive a discount card for neighboring restaurants in this small chain, although their prices are already quite reasonable even without the discount. Istanbul is a fascinating city, but I must say that my visit was greatly enhanced by the family feeling at the Sirkeci Konak. It was difficult to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Wish I was there”
Reviews.Author: catskierMichigan
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on Trip Advisor. I am so glad I did. was thinking about the 4 Seasons. But too expensive. This was what we were looking for. I booked us the deluxe room ( it has the balcony) every time I walked into that room or 1st thing in the am & before bed I went out and looked over the river & the park. Smelled the food cooking across the street ( we ate there for lunch because it smelled so good). It was so worth the extra money. The room was large, the bed so comfortable. The bathroom beautiful. I had a turkish bath, what a great deal!! It is not for the bashful. He scrubs your body, all but your bikini bottom area. I enjoyed it, the way he made the bubbles.... All the floors were heated and I was never cold (except when he poured cold water over me) Which is part of the enjoyment? The breakfast you can not even imagine how good it is. I need my breakfast in the morning. Free Wi Fi, Tea time. Some people are put off my the location (by car parts store) I am glad it was there, it helped us be sure we were on the right street home. All the streets are interesting in Istanbul, so this was not out of the ordinary. Most of all the best thing as stated by others: the staff. Every time we needed anything, making change, they did not have what I needed exactly so I owed them for later. Most places would have just said go to a bank. Making sure we knew where we were going, where to eat. Most of all I had a severe crisis while at the hotel. I Do not want to go into details as it is a private matter. But only to say the night time clerk went above and beyond for me. I felt he was may guardian angel that night. I do not think a "chain" hotel would have done what they did for me. I am forever grateful. If I ever get back, that is where I will stay, and if anyone wants to know where to stay, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Personal service and engaged staff.”
Reviews.Author: Family006
Reviews.Content: We appreciated especially the very personal service, the generosity of the hotel and the quality of the rooms. Also the spa was very nice. The hotel is located in the center of the old town, within walking distance to all major sites. However, the street was a bit shabby. The decoration style is oriental and the breakfast is great. We were offered a free dinner for the four of us upon arrival which was a big surprise and a nice experience. We also participated in the cooking class which was offered complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal place to stay combining convenient location and excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Rachel186342
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from Istanbul which is a really enjoyable short break. The Sirkeci Konak is close to all the main sites in the old part of the city, making walking around really easy. The tram stop is just a few seconds away so access to other parts of the city is also really easy. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful, from first greeting and orientation with one of the very helpful guest relations staff. They also offer a free meal at one of the hotel's restaurants plus a discount in the hotel and its sister hotel - a really nice touch, which we should have taken advantage of (in hindsight). The hotel is very comfortable and has a small, friendly atmosphere to it. We had a deluxe room and felt that it was worth spending the extra money for the space and balcony. The small pool, sauna and hammam in the basement were a really welcome relaxation after a hard day's walking and sightseeing - not something that you get in many boutique hotels and an excellent facility. We should have tried eating in the hotel (other than breakfast) as we found eating out a bit disappointing. Thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “another extremely satisfied customer”
Reviews.Author: researchernow
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves all the accolades it got from other travelers. the location is wonderful as it's a 10 minute walk to everything and one block from the tram which takes you anywhere you want to go but slightly out of the noisy center.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a gem”
Reviews.Author: Daves1234
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for the Sirkeci Konak because of its positive reviews, but the hotel far exceeded my expectations. From the minute my friend and I were greeted by Ezgi, we felt at home. Our room was elegant, comfortable and quiet. The breakfast buffet was delicious, and we thoroughly enjoyed the dinners we ate at the hotel. The location can't be beat, literally across the street from the wall of Topkapi Palace and a few short blocks from its gate. But, as many have said, it is the staff that makes the difference. Without exception, staff members were friendly and professional. They responded to our requests immediately and were always willing to do more than we asked. This hotel truly is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “For a seasoned traveller this was one of the best experiences I have had”
Reviews.Author: foggy058
Reviews.Content: The hotel ticks most of the usual boxes but it is was all about the staff and their focus on it being all about the guests. Made a real positive impression for the hotel and the city. I will return. P.S. Our room was adequate but the rooms facing the palace with balconies on floor 4 had fantastic views.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & hospitality”
Reviews.Author: PeterandAnne
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed five nights at the Sirkeci Konak in September. We booked to stay there because of the rave reviews on Trip Advisor. Those reviews were spot on. All of the other guests also had nothing but praise for all aspects of the hotel. The difficult thing is to decide which is better, the location, the meals, the free afternoon tea or the wonderful hospitality. Firstly, its location is within 20 minutes walk of all the major attractions - including the Grand Bazaar, The Spice Market, The Blue Mosque and the hotel overlooks the gardens adjacent to the Topkapi Palace. The meals in both restauarants, the ground floor seafood or rooftop garden, are excellent as is the service. Their sister hotel - The Orient Express - 5 minute walk around the corner, also has a good rooftop restaurant. When you you arrive do not be "put off" by what appears to be a dingy lane - some shops open during the day and at least it is quiet at night and no trams to disturb you. Speaking of this laneway, we had 3 large Turkish plates shipped home to Australia from one of these shops called "Ceres Gifts", the proprietor is Ali, and all arrived perfectly in tact - boxed within foam. The most outsanding feature of the Sirkeci Konak is its hospitality by all of their staff. The reviews on Trip Advisor bear this out. They speak good English and are always eager to help and offer any assistance. The wonderful Ezgi and the staff make you feel welcome and treat you as a special guest rather than simply another tourist passing through Istanbul. We accidentaly left a small back pack in the front lobby - during the free afternoon tea. They sent it back to us in Australia - at no charge. We have stayed in many hotels over the years but not one hotel can match their wonderful hospitality. Well done Sirkeci Konak - you deserve your number 1 rating on Trip Advisor. The eals in the ground floor and rood top restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay !”
Reviews.Author: Mootsie10
Reviews.Content: There is not much more that I can add to the already glowing reviews posted here. Sirkeci Konak is a charming hotel with an ideal location. We splurged on the deluxe roms which were very well appointed. We made good use of the hammam and enjoyed scrub downs and massages from Oktay. We were made to feel as though we were at home thanks to the wonderful staff - we will definitely come back !

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: packingprincess
Reviews.Content: But wait, that is not the best part of this sweet little hotel. The best is the extraordinary service level of all the staff from the smiling coffee-pouring waitress at breakfast to the front desk. No task was too difficult to be managed instantly and with a smile. From restaurant reservations to directions to tourist sites, they were our on-site guides. Many others have talked about the excellent breakfast (which we agree was terrific) but we loved the location. With only a few days to see Istanbul, we wanted to be close to all of the major historic sites and this hotel is across the street from the Topkapi Palace walls, how much closer can one get? While more upscale and chic hotels exist in other parts of Istanbul, traffic is abysmal and it can take hours to go a short distance by cab. We simply walked out the door and went on foot or by tram to most of the highlights. Sirkeci Konak also offers great value with the breakfast included, afternoon tea, free wifi plus computers in the lobby, and free airport pick-up and complimentary dinner in the hotel restaurant to guests who stay three nights or more. My only downgrade to this hotel was the actual comfort of our room. The lighting is poor and not conducive to reading. We would have preferred a room with a table and chairs to make our touring planning easier but none were available at check-in. Save your desire for a hip hotel for another city, book Sirkeci Konak for the most practical location along with superb staff and enjoy Istanbul without the hassle.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: dutch_globetrottor
Reviews.Content: Our family was received most warmly by the staff of this hotel, we have enjoyed our three nights in this stylish hotel with great pleasure. Also we loved the mediteranian restaurant above the Orient Express Hotel (of the same hotelgroup, 2 minutres walk) with its great terrasview over all Istanbul. We were lucky to experience from this restaurant the great fireworks during Reblublicday on 29th of october. We will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “first rate hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: sluggy17
Reviews.Content: We stopped here for a 4 night visit to Istanbul, and the hotel facilities, level of service and positioning must make it one of the very best places to stay in the city. We didn't book direct with the hotel, but before our stay they were happy to help arrange airport transportation for a very reasonable fee (much cheaper than an airport taxi); and on arrival we were offered a welcome drink, a free 3 course meal in the hotel restaurant for that evening, and a full run down of the hotel facilities - the perfect start to our stay! The location of the hotel, is only 50 yards or so from one of the main streets, but it's just far enough away to be perfectly quiet. The room we were originally given must have been one of the smallest rooms in the hotel - it was only just about OK, and had we being staying for just one night it would have been fine, but as it was a longer stay we asked if we could move rooms. The hotel was full for that night, but they offered to move us in the morning. This was all done without any fuss at all, and they were happy to accomodate the request. It's been mentioned before, but the level of service here is exceptional - it's not overly prim and proper, the staff are all very happy to engage in a laugh and a joke with you, but their attention to detail and efforts to make your stay a happy one is obvious in everything they do. Other good points - breakfast has a vast array of choices, the meals in the hotel restraunts are excellent, afternoon tea is lovely, the drinks in the lobby are the same price as the bars in town, room service menu is well priced (didn't try it though), the daily supply of turkish delight in the rooms is a great touch, and the whole hotel is perfectly positioned for the major sights and a tram stop is only 50 yards away. On leaving the hotel and waiting for the car to take us to the airport we were given presents to take away (a presentation box of turkish coffee cups and saucers, and a box of turkish delight!), which put the seal on a memorable stay in a first rate hotel. All in all, it's hard to imagine what they could have done better; their trip advior awards are well deserved!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally friendly and efficient service in the heart of istanbul”
Reviews.Author: chedrob
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel for our half term family holiday (children aged 10 & 12) due to the excellent reviews in Istanbul and the hotel lived up to our very high expectations. This was our first trip to Istanbul and the location of the hotel was perfect for being able to walk to almost all of the key attractions. We had connecting rooms and whilst they were not the largest rooms we have ever been in, they were perfectly fine for our needs and the beds were extremely comfortable. Having the pool and the turkish baths in the hotel was a real bonus and there was no stuffiness so the whole family enjoyed it That said, the best thing about the hotel is the genuinely friendly and helpful staff who make it a real pleasure to stay at the hotel. We went on the free market trip with Okay and he made the trip interesting and fun for all of us and even bought gifts for the kids and bought umbrellas for the other guests when it started tipping down with rain. Nothing appeared to be too much trouble for the staff and they did this all with good humour and fun. Istanbul is a great city and we would have no hesitation in recommending staying at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “memorable experience”
Reviews.Author: liz_will
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in an ideal location. Nice, clean rooms at an attractive price. The breakfast was delicious and sets one up for a busy day. Complementary afternoon teas and turkish delights in the room are nice touches. Most highly recommended. But what make this hotel so truly special are the very special hotel staff and manager. Especially, Ezgi is the most guest-friendly staff we have met, making calls for us, letting us work with them on her computer and even providing aspirins when we ran out! We would like to congratulate the hotel manager for his success in uniting such a qualified staff together. The service was just "first class", we know for sure where we will be staying next time we are in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of the Best!”
Reviews.Author: flypeople
Reviews.Content: An excellent and charming hotel! Situated in a picturesque and quiet little street,though only 10 minutes walk from places of interest and hot spots. The front staff was an amazing help,very friendly and professional and everybody in the hotel went beyond the call of duty.Rooms are beautiful,clean and quiet. The breakfast is lovely and has many different flavours to choose from. Next time we go to Istanbul,this will be our place to stay! Special thanks to Sikri and Hakan who gave us a warm welcome when we arrived in the middle of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: stellian
Reviews.Content: This is the only place to stay in Istanbul. Location, amenities, food, staff all wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in a modest side street”
Reviews.Author: LaCenterentola
Reviews.Content: This hotel for me ranks very high among those addresses I would really recommend. It is located perfectly, just next to many cultural hot spots, but also very close to the ship transport options at the Golden Horn. On top, there are many nice restaurants close by. The food is wonderful - amazing brunch selection. The wellness area is clean and charming. The hamam is so big that you can actually do this part of your experiences in Istanbul at the hotel... . I think the Spa area is a bit too small, mainly the rest area for the time after the sauna. Could be improved. The service is just stunning. So very friendly and helpful and hospitable. The reception lady welcoming all guests personally covers all your needs and questions regarding the sightseeing - whatever you wish to visit. She is spectacular. Many thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bikercats
Reviews.Content: We only had one night to spend here but would have loved to been there longer. The staff is wonderful, the hotel and the rooms are beautiful, clean and comfortable. The pool is a must see - it is amazing. The location is fabulous - near the Topaki Palance and a number of other sights.

Reviews.Title: “this is a real Gem!”
Reviews.Author: judyumcer
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended this little gem and we loved it. The hotel is very nice, great location and the most wonderful staff we ever encountered. Everything they promised in our reservation was met and then some. Lovely breakfast included. We travel often & felt like we were welcomed like family here. they couldn't do enough. Stayed 3 nights & highly recommend this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: IMMCK
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a small, quiet and comfortable hotel in the centre of Istanbul this hotel is just perfect: the rooms, the staff, the food, the hamam/fitness, we (experienced travellers to Istanbul and Turkey) liked it all very much.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: jmactravelbug
Reviews.Content: Charming, lovely, intimate, attentive, wonderful location. I cannot say enough about this place. I was traveling with my mom and we had a room with two double beds. The rooms were not spacious but certainly big enough for the two of us, we did not feel cramped at all. I loved the decor and everything was very comfortable and clean. Not only was the location within easy walking distance of all the historic sites but it was very quite at night, even with the window open and we felt very safe walking around in the evening too. After each hectic day, I would drag myself to the rooftop for a quite beer or appetizers. It was a godsend and overlooked the gardens of Topkapi palace. People were friendly and the food in the fish restaurant which is run by the hotel was very good as well. We did not have enough time to really explore the city as we only had two full days, but if I go back, this will definately be the place I stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique Hotel in the old city of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: seascay
Reviews.Content: We found the Sirkeci Kohak Hotel online thru Trip Advisor but we were not sure what we would find. We had come from a Silversea cruise and upon arrival found our room was ready for us. We noticed a few guests were checking out to join the Silver Cloud and so we felt more relaxed. Our room was lovely, large and had everything we needed. The Hotel gave us a very welcomed complimentary dinner. We joined another couple staying in the hotel also from our cruise (co-incidentally). Each night we had complimentary drinks and canapes. The staff were extremely helpful and knowledgeable,especially DIlhan. They could not do enough for us. Many of the sights were within walking distance and also great restaurants were just around the corner. Upon our departure, they drove us to the airport (complimentary) gave us a lovely gift and all waved good bye as we left. It was a truly memorable stay. A BIG thank you to the excellent staff. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, very friendly staff, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: brisbanebruno
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a most enjoyable stay at the Sirkeci Konak in September 2010. This was our first visit to Istanbul, and our entire stay was a wonderful experience. The service from the hotel staff exceeded our expectations - particular thanks to Dilhan for her warm welcome and helpful attention at all times. The breakfasts were great, and we also enjoyed the cooking class. We have no hesitation in recommending this very well-located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: NajibSydney
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel. Staff are very very helpful and pleasant. Nice Turkish coffee. The tea and Simeet filled with cheese in the afternoons are great. Staff showed me around and gave me directions. I will definitely do my best to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - a real gem”
Reviews.Author: biketrekker
Reviews.Content: Along a narrow street parallel to the Topkapi Palace's ancient outer wall upon which the Parade Pavilion is perched nearby, one who is unfamiliar with the area will have to do some searching to find the dark, innocuous wooden door which opens into the Sirkeci Konak Hotel's cosy lobby. The friendly, enthusiastic, multi-tasking staff at the Front Desk are as good as - if not better than - any we've encountered at some of the best hotels in major cities. The prompt and pleasant check-in process includes a helpful briefing accompanied by welcome drinks, finger sandwiches, maps, discount card and complimentary dinner coupons. Ms Ezgi Kepsutlu of the Guest Relations Team attended to us personally and cheerfully answered all our questions, while her colleagues did the same with other arriving guests.. The warm reception we received set the tone for our two stays at this hotel in September and October. We were not expecting much from the complimentary dinner so were delightfully surprised at the hotel's Sirkeci BalikÃ§isi Seafood Restaurant. Even though we had not yet stayed the required number of nights, each of us was able to select from a menu that offered excellent grilled whole fish, fresh from local waters. The heads and tails were attached, which suited our tastes perfectly; for more fastidious diners, the fish are filleted or de-boned before being served. The buffet breakfast offers an extensive range of breads, cheeses, nuts, yoghurt, fruits, cereals, juices, etc, and is one of the best we encountered during our holiday in Turkey. We also dined at the hotel's nearby sister restaurant, Pasazade, and thoroughly enjoyed the Ottoman Cuisine. During both stays, we were assigned non-smoking rooms per my online bookings. Beds are large and comfortable. Bedroom slippers, bottled water, teas, Turkish Delight and WiFi are free. The rooms are quiet, clean and tastefully furnished, featuring electric kettle, flat panel TV with cable access, mini-bar fridge, writing table, chairs, twin night tables and side tables. Wardrobes are full-sized and house an electronic safe. Lighting is good and there are adequate electricity sockets for charging cameras, mobile phones, laptops. Ensuite bathrooms are relatively small but well-appointed, with wall-mounted hairdryer, mirror, heated towel bar and a good range of amenities. The jacuzzi bathtub is a nice touch but probably underused. Istanbul's landmarks are within short walking distances: SogukÃ§esme Sokak (5 min), Blue Mosque (13 min), Hagia Sophia (10 min), Yerebatan Sarnici Basilica Cistern (11 min), Hippodrome (12 min), Spice Bazaar (18). Umbrellas are provided free based an an honour system for guests to return them. We were welcomed with free appletea whenever we returned from our excursions. Requests for assistance were always handled cheerfully and expeditiously by the staff. When checking out, we were presented with an unexpected giftbox of Turkish Delight. Faruk Boyaci, owner of the Sirkeci Konak Group, and his employees have succeeded in making the Sirkeci Konak Hotel a real gem.

Reviews.Title: “Best hospitality we've ever had!”
Reviews.Author: Abs082
Reviews.Content: Location was centric -- right by the metro and within walking distance of Topkapi Palace (10 minute walk), Saint (Hagia) Sophia (12 minute walk), Blue Mosque (12 minute walk) and Spice Bazaar (15 minute walk). Plenty of options for dining either at the hotel or in the vicinity. Breakfast buffet was great with its variety of foods, freshness, and best fresh juices I've had! Room amenities were very nice with slippers, thick Turkish cotton robes, welcome basket of fresh fruit. Employees were genuinely interested in helping out (not just for the tips). One employee kept entertaining all of our daily questions about the culture, language and pronunciations as if this was the first time he's ever had to answer that when we knew he's had his fair share of people asking the same questions. Ezgi was extremely helpful; always willing to help out -- from guidance on negotiating at the Grand Bazaar to finding a weird electrical adapter. When we checked out, they gave us very nice parting gifts and all employees came out to say goodbye. I only wish we could clone this hotel, its employees and hospitality and place them wherever we go next.

Reviews.Title: “More excellent than all these excellent reviews!”
Reviews.Author: browdl
Reviews.Content: So much praise has already been posted on TripAdvisor that I am hard pressed to embellish further. My wife and I stayed for five nights at the end of our Turkey vacation, and it exceeded our expectations. We had a deluxe room that was spacious and clean, and equipped with everything we could want. The bed was sublimely comfortable. The bath had a Jacuzzi tub with shower, as well as a second stall shower. The balcony overlooking the park was spacious and provided a wonderful refuge at dayâ€™s end. Our only hesitation prior to booking was the potential lack of a nice view, but the greenery of the park and the long distance view to the Bosphorous were perfect respites at the end of our daily sightseeing. The rooftop restaurant provided the best meal weâ€™d have in Istanbul, and the breakfast buffet was generous and thoroughly satisfying. Dining at the sister restaurants Imbat and Parazade also provided memorable meals and ambience. And I have not even yet mentioned the level of service. No amount of gratuity could adequately compensate the staff. Housekeeping is immaculate, and the concierge service provided by the delightful Ms. Ezgi Kepsutlu was beyond any past experience. This was the perfect end to our Turkey vacation, and we miss it still!

Reviews.Title: “Accommodating and charming- a great taste of Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: ErinM7
Reviews.Content: This was the first of several hotels on a two week trip of Turkey for two friends and me. Our first three days as well as our last four were spent in Istanbul and I wish we had stayed here on both occasions we were in Istanbul. Upon arrival, we were greeted and introduced to the hotel and served a refreshment of our choice. This was very welcomed after a long flight. The service is great, the only thing I would caution against is be very clear in communication- we booked a "Bosphorous Cruise" through the front desk and ended up on a bus tour through a completely different company than the brochure that was given to us by the front desk- the closest we came to a boat was seeing one docked as we drove by. The rooms was small but adequate, well appointed and comfortable. I can not recommend the fish restaurant on the main floor of the hotel. We dined there our first night in and none of the three of us could finish our food. We did not get to try the upper restaurant. Breakfast was a large buffet spread, very different for the American palette, but nice. There is wi-fi on all floors of the internet and all three of us were able to connect in all of our rooms easily. This hotel is a great example of Turkish Hospitality. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond expectations,absolutely fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: Brenbarry
Reviews.Content: What a welcome.!!Selected through reviews in trip advisor, and certainly not disappointed! The situation re trams and sights perfect. The staff extremely helpful and patient with advice and suggestions. (Even able to purchase the tram tokens from them, and when they had run out, rushed to the kiosk to get more.) Our deluxe room was magnificent, but due to 2 days of rain unable to use the balcony over-looking the gardens of the Topaki Palace. 2 computers available for guests in the lobby. Afternoon tea included and most welcome during a break from sight-seeing. I had a birthday whilst there and the hotel provided a cream cake, candles and a superb gift,at tea time, enabling me to share the cake with other guests--making it into a party. Have recommende this hotel to other friends, and I have only been home 2 days.

Reviews.Title: “An Incredible Experieince”
Reviews.Author: EnjoyingLife
Reviews.Content: This is a rare gem in today's World. True old fashioned service and courtesy, the way it should be, but unfortunately not the way you find it these days. From the moment you enter the hotel you are made to feel like a welcomed guest. The staff from top to bottom are so attentive to your needs and even anticipate them. The rooms are lovely, the restaurant dining is excellent and the breakfasts don't leave you much room for lunch! The Guest Relations are spot on beginning with an introduction of the facilities and the surrounding things to see and do. Location is perfect within walking to most all of the major things to see, yet set on a very quiet street. We never had to use a taxi or the tram to get around town. Don't miss their own Turkish Bath and swimming pool right on the premisis, trated like a Sultan!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service that goes the extra mile”
Reviews.Author: Ilikecheesealot
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the old part of the city and is 10-15 minutes walk to the major sightseeing attractions (Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, Topkapi Palace, Egyptian Spice Market, Aya Sophia etc). There is a tram right outside. I have no idea if this is noisy or not because I was in room 1109 which is on the first floor and faces the park. My room was very quiet and I got a good night's sleep. When we arrived we were offered apple or Turkish tea which was very welcome after the 45 minute drive from Ataturk airport. I also saw on another day, some people arriving really early during breakfast time and the Customer Service Rep offered the newly arrived guests to help themselves to the buffet breakfast which is very generous. The service is really good and the staff are super-friendly. They have a library full of Lonely Planet and other brands of guide books if you forget yours as I did. They have a complimentary small pool downstairs, small hamam and steam room and gym in the basement. The complimentary afternoon tea from 4.30-630pm consists of apple or Turkish tea (both lovely!) and sandwiches (not great). It's the same thing everyday but it's nice that they offer it. The rooms have duvets and I felt comfortable sleeping at night as the room was spotless. The room is a bit dark (as are 98% of hotel rooms I go to) but there is a small flat screen TV which is sufficient for the small amount of time one spends in the room. There is a kettle and some tea / coffee. They also give you some Turkish delight in the room which is nice and a free box on check-out. I am allergic to cow's milk and requested soya and they were very helpful and provided it for me at breakfast no problems. Dilhan is very friendly and took us to our cooking class (you have to book ahead and it's 5pm for 50 minutes), It's not a very serious cooking class but it's fun nonetheless. You chop up some spring onions and tomatoes and beef and make two courses (starter of cos cos and tomato paste and cumin etc) and a stir-fry beef dish. The chef is very friendly and it's good to see the kitchen as it is very clean. Class size is limited to about 8 people. The class is free and held on Mondays and Fridays. The service really stood out for me. The staff are just so friendly. I would return. Oh also there is free wifi and breakfast is included in the room rate. If you pay cash you get an 11% discount.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in a sea of Chaos”
Reviews.Author: SJ-Travels-2010
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights here and chose it based on trip advisor recommendations. Our room and the motel generally was very nice, plush i'd say; quiet, clean, very comfortable and well appointed. This motel is part of the Sirkeci group of motels and restaurants - all in the local area. The restaurants offer a 10% discount to guests staying in their motels. The motel has a sauna, pool and turkish bath which we used several times. It was clean and well looked after. Two bottles of complimentary water were provided in your room daily as the local water is not suitable for drinking. That said you'll still need to buys lots more. Each day between 4:30pm and 6pm complimentary apple tea and sesame rolls are provided in the lounge area. This was regularly a welcome relief after a busy day out and about. The restaurant food was good and based on local produce. The motel staff were always very friendly, polite and helpful. Linne changed daily with the option of every second day. The location of the motel in the old city is excellent and most of the sites are within easy walking distance. The tram is nearby too but we didn't both with it much as it was almost always packed! The train station is about 10minutes walk away - we used this once, it wasn't modern but it was satisfactory for where we were going. By taxi the motel is about 30 to 40 mins from the airport depending on traffic. The local neighborhood was geared for tourists with plenty of shops and restaurants offering a variety of choices.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: GoToTurkey2010
Reviews.Content: I could blab on and on about how great the customer service was (they recommended two amazing restaurants to us, and made the appropriate reservations), were happy to help with anything, gave us free tea daily and always with a smile. For me, the extreme hospitality of the hotel came after my stay. I had done some shopping in the neighborhood and accidentally left one of my rings at a jewelry store around the corner. I called the hotel, and without hesitation the gentleman offered to walk over to the store and try and locate my ring. I called back a bit later and he offered to have it mailed to me in Athens. Their level of customer service is excellent and by far the best I experienced in Turkey. Their amazing location and level of service will surely keep them busy for a very long time. Thank you so much for such a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is an excellent example of Turkish hospitality”
Reviews.Author: CrudenBay
Reviews.Content: Group of 12 collected from airport late evening- given apple tea and warm welcome. Rooms delightful in modern Turkish decor + very clean. Beautiful buffet breakfast and also enjoyed an evening meal in the seafood restaurant.. Very convenient for major sights and ferries. Staff very nice and helpful without exception.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel of Ottoman Konak Style and Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Sacromonte
Reviews.Content: Arriving by train from Budapest at Sirkeci Station, it was a short walk to the hotel with porter in tow with my luggage. I was greeted warmly by reception and immediately ushered into my lovely room overlooking Gulhane Park. I slept comfortably for the next 12 hours! I awoke to the delightful sounds of life on the Bosphorous - much like San Francisco with seagulls and horns of passing ships. A dedicated guest relations team is ready to assist with suggestions and answering questions. The chairman of the hotel is usually present inquiring as to the satisfaction of his guests. All the major sights of Sultanahmet are within easy walking distance. I took advantage of an in house Turkish cooking class with the executive chef one evening. Another evening I had a backgammon lesson in the salon while enjoying complimentary refreshments. My last evening I dined on the rooftop terrace with wonderful views to the Bosphorous and Gulhane Park. My meal was excellently prepared and the domestic wine was the perfect complement. After five wonderful days at the Sirkeci Konak, it was time for two weeks of sailing the Turquoise Coast and then on to magical Cappadocia. My kind regards to the entire staff.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific service, hospitality, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: BonBon46_10
Reviews.Content: Courteous, welcoming, friendly staff. Special thanks to A.Okay Alkan, Front Office Attendant, who took two pieces of my clothing, stained due to getting wet inside my suitcase, home to HIS MOTHER, to clean and press! Incredible generosity. Delicious breakfasts, buffet style, wonderful fish dinner in their lovely dining room. Elevator. Clean, comfortable room done in Old World, Turkish style. Very centrally located, within walking distance of Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, restaurants shopping, even Grand Bazaar. Right on a tram line. Absolutely ideal!

Reviews.Title: “The best choice I made!”
Reviews.Author: melody1068
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Istanbul. The staff at the hotel were extremely nice and hospitable. Its location is great close to Hagia Sophia. Breakfast buffet was delicious. Had both European as well as Turkish foods. My room was nice and clean. Their restaurant is absolutely amazing. I recommend this hotel who is looking for a stress free stay while at Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Courteous, friendly and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: skanepog
Reviews.Content: This hotle exceeded our expectations from the moment we stepped into the reception to the moment that we left. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff and the room, lounge, pool, sauna and dining areas were comfortable and spotless. The food was excellent which together with the location made for an excellent stay. Two tips: the hotel printer is unbelievably slow; there is no notice on the sauna to tell you to place a towel on the benches there!

Reviews.Title: “outstanding; highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: griffo023
Reviews.Content: Visited with my 10 yr old daughter and septagenarian mother, treated like royalty by the uniformly charming and helpful staff. Ottoman inspired elegant decor, excellent hygiene. Delicious and well presented food with inclusive afternoon tea, we chose to dine here too in the evenings. Lots of small details to maximise comfort and enjoyment, eg lovely bed linen, a choice of pillows, pretty bathrobes. Proprietor in evidence greeting and conversing with guests. Well placed for the major sights of the Old City either by foot or a tram stop is close by. Only criticism is that rooms are a little small but I would rush back at any opportunity! Many thanks for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and friendly”
Reviews.Author: iggis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights mid September and could not fault the hotel or the staff. They made you feel very welcome and a bit special. We enjoyed a free meal in their fish restaurant, Sea Bass especially good (no frozen fish here). In the room were complimentary water, Turkish delight and wine. Never in the many hotels we have stayed have I experienced this level of detail and welcome. Afternoon tea was served on our arrival and lots of information was offered for the local area. Rooms were slightly small but this did not spoil our enjoyment. Bathroom was particularly good for this type of hotel. everything was spotlessly clean and eveything worked as it should. Gifts on departure was a nice touch. This hotel comes higlly recommended. Istanbul is a great place to visit, by the way.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel knows the meaning of service”
Reviews.Author: OccasionalCruiser
Reviews.Content: It's a delightful hotel, in close proximity to the Topkapi Palace and other important sites. They were a terrific help with any questions we had, whether about restaurants, sites, taxis, flights, etc. Don't judge from the outside, because it's on a strange little block with a mixture of auto supply stores and tourist junk shops, but it's lovely on the inside, and only a block from a main road. Most everything was included in the price of the room (taxes, breakfast, "tea"). Because we booked online and stayed longer than 3 nights, we got a free dinner and a free ride to the airport. We could hear street noise from our room during the day, but when we wanted to sleep, it became very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Service is the best”
Reviews.Author: jklaper
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to public transportation and right next to Topkapi and other attractions. But the service was over the top and is why we recommend this hotel. We got off our ship early, the small lobby was packed, people leaving and checking in. The gentleman on duty never lost his patience, smile and good humor. The guest services women attended to all of our needs and answered questions and greeted each arrival with maps and information. A free dinner with four nights, free taxi the airport, even tho our flight left at 5:55 a.m. The free internet/computer was easily available and useful, especially when trying to print our boarding passes. No surprise, we were not able to do so because US Air would not let us confirm a flight on their "partner" airline and, of course, their partner Lufthansa did not recognize us, since we had not booked thru them. The guests services agent to the rescue, almost 20 minutes on the phone, we all know how bad those airline wait times are, and got it resolved. And the rooms were well appointed and sparkling clean. Great place

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: tdlinkous
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent 4 wonderful nights at this delightful hotel in Istanbul and could not have been more pleased with the service,food and location(near most major tourist sights and very close to a tram station). Everyone "went out of their way" to make the stay perfect and we were especially impressed with Dilhan in guest relations. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “perfect introduction to istanbul”
Reviews.Author: UkMoonbeam
Reviews.Content: I'd recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Istanbul for the first time. They offer a (in our case) very smooth free transfer from Ataturk Airport, and take trouble to orient you by giving out maps and directions as soon as you arrive (unless you are feeling tired). The hotel is ideally located away from the main tourist area but close enough to walk to it, and a stone's throw from Topkapi (just over the wall) and the Galata Bridge. Seemingly nothing is too much trouble for the staff: they'll tell you the weather forecast, print out webpages about other areas, book taxis, and even lavish you with Turkish delight at the end. Free afternoon tea is a great institution, and on Sundays there's a stall with delicious pomegranate juice on the street corner. Breakfast was something to look forward to each day. We were offered a free dinner at the hotel's fish restaurant; though we chose to eat somewhere more authentic, we did enjoy two delicious and romantic meals on the rooftops of two associated restaurants, Pasazade and Imbat. Otherwise would recommend our lunches at Ciya Sofrasi in Kadikoy (a ferry ride away) and Gaziantep BurÃ§ Ocakbasi in the Grand Bazaar (specially good shepherd's salad with walnuts and pomegranate syrup). Our only regret was that we couldn't stay longer. Anyone who wants the most trouble-free start to the city should stay here. Our first room was clean and comfortable but on the last night we got a (free) upgrade to the most beautiful deluxe room with a balcony overlooking Gulhane Park -- definitely worth it if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Bronnyn
Reviews.Content: Well located for walking to major sites of interest and easy access to the tramline. Always felt safe when walking be it day or evening. Tram tokens available from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: chancher
Reviews.Content: We spent a total of 6 nights at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel, and loved it! Great location (walking distance to Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque), very comfortable and quiet rooms, excellent breakfasts (included), and superb service from everyone at the hotel. The staff made us feel completely at home. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Merritts4
Reviews.Content: Our family lives in the Middle East and we stayed at the hotel over the Eid break. Our 2 daughters-- age 9 and 11-- were warmly welcomed... and they catered to us throughout our stay. We especially liked the pool and Turkish Bath in the late afternoon after touring during the day. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “All That You Would Want in a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: magshapiro
Reviews.Content: At the Sirkeci Konac, â€œNo Problemâ€�-really means â€œNo Problemâ€�. If you stay 4 nights or more the hotel provides a free dinner from one of their wonderful restaurants. We knew that we were going to arrive late and we could not be partaking of the free dinner option that night. So, no problem, they gave us our complimentary meal from their fresh fish restaurant the next night. After an appetizer dish, we were served a perfectly cooked whole fish served with salad, potato and even desert. What a nice touch to provide a courtesy meal to their guests. Whatever you need or ask of the hotel staff is accomplished courteously and with a smile. The staff seems to be mostly younger individuals in their 20â€™s and 30â€™s who are energetic, very professional and reflect the proper â€�old schoolâ€� training provided to them. They even offer a 10% discount at their other hotel restaurants. We ate at both of our hotel restaurants and the meals professionally served and wonderfully prepared. The staff helped provide travel instructions, printed out boarding passes, set-up transportation to and from the airport (again included if your stay is four or more nights), and even gave us a very lovely good-bye gift. You could pay cash and get a 10% courtesy discount if you chose. Breakfast is tremendous-.great-cereals, olives, cheese, cold cuts, freshly baked muffins, spinach quiche, and cheese puff pastry. There are various breads, rolls, eggs-scrambled and hardboiled served with a variety of jams, yogurt and fruits-all served with freshly brewed coffee and tea. All included in the price of the room. Our friends can be somewhat critical and when asked what they felt needed improvement, they said â€œnothingâ€�! The room was clean, comfortable and moderate in size for European standards and the bathroom was super clean. Everything worked in the bath and the air conditioning was easy to use and it worked! The beds were very comfortable (and came with a selection of pillows). It was quiet all night-not even hallway noise was present.. The maids kept the room and the bath spotless. Whenever we came back to the room it was clean. Towels and sheets were changed daily. Two bottles of water were provided in the room daily and there was an electric hot pot if you wanted to make tea or instant coffee. The blackout shades really keep the light from the windows to a minimum. With quiet, darkened rooms you can enjoy sleeping soundly. In summary-one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had. I have traveled all over the United States and Western Europe and this was by far the friendliest and nicest hotel I have ever experienced. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've stayed in in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: PeterSurrey
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for tourism, very good service, very friendly and helpful staff. Only 54 bedrooms so genuine boutique hotel. All services were no. 1. Wiould definitely use again.

Reviews.Title: “A really good hotel. In the centre of Istanbul. Service couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: Moon83black
Reviews.Content: An oasis right in the tourist area of Istanbul. Its 50 yards from a tram stop (trams are surprisingly good) so everything is within reach. We were there in August so not walking very far was a 'must'. The hotel was super. They provided the best breakfast I have EVER had in a hotel. The service couldn't be better and we were asked at the end of our stay whether there was anything upon which they could improve....and they meant it. whne we said there wasn't anything, we were pressed ......'anything, however small???' The rooms are not enormous but more than adequate. We took over two rooms ( two doubles) and althigh a late booking, they managed to put us next door to each pther and we seemed to have a corridor to ourselves which was great as it seemed to be almost ensuite and private even though we left the doors to the rooms open to each other. We may have been lucky in that regard. The air conditioning was good and although it was busy outside, it wasn't noisy. The bathroom was nice - very clean which is my 'thing'. We We just had a shower, the other room had a bath and shower. If that bothers you, its worth asking. Dressing gowns and slippers are provided. Perhaps the only irritant is that the wardrobe area was short so didn't allow me to hang my dresses properly.....but if that's all I can complain about.....!!!!!!!!! The pool is a splash pool but very few hotels seem to have a pool anyway so it was a 'plus'. Nobody seemed to be using it apart form us. Again towels and service were good. I didn't use the fitness room but my son (who was training for something or other, so taking it seriously) said it was 'fine'. That's quite high praise. One of the really nice touches was the free afternoon tea at 4.30 (I'm not sure if this was just for the sumer season or not). They provided tea or juice and small cheese and tomato rolls. I don't know quite what they did with such simple ingredients but they were delicious. We quickly developed a routine of up and out quite early in the morning for hard sightseeing, back for afternoon tea, quick sleep and recharge batteries and then out for dinner. Bliss. The hotel had somone available at all times to help with tourist info eg what's open (not easy as things shut on random days), nearest bank, how you get there etc... Very helpful and always right. They own a number of restaurants including one on the roof of the hotel. We only tried that one. It wasn't the best meal we had in Istanbul but equally, there were no complaints and it was more than good enough. Although we went in August and the hotel was lovely and cool, I suspect it will appear very cosy in winter. Everybody was happy including my two son aged 21 and 17. To satisfy everyone is quite an achievment. I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for business or leisure trip to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: DavidT03
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well situated for all historic Istanbul sites. The staff go out of their way to make guests feel special. Small additional touches, such as Turkish delight in the room and a free tea in the late afternoon are delightful. I followed other Trip Advisor travellers recommendations on this hotel and the various restaurants in the group and was not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very guest friendly, always good to be back!”
Reviews.Author: DEWEHolland
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the second time in this hotel in which a warm welcome, fine food, perfect location make your stay in Istanbul one to remember. Staff is very friendly, and any request is followed up immediately. You truly feel like a guest!

Reviews.Title: “We trully enjoyed...!”
Reviews.Author: Milos72
Reviews.Content: Although we expected this hotel to be one of the best in Istanbul, we were surprised by the warm welcome we received from people from Sirekci Konak. Moreover, the hotel is very well located and all important sights are within walking distance. Rooms are very nice with nice views on the skyline of European part of the city. Breakfasts were excellent and tasty. All in all, we shall for sure come back....

Reviews.Title: “An incredible experience”
Reviews.Author: coqui74
Reviews.Content: We arrived at our hotel very late from the United States. Even at that wee hour we were treated with courtesy and excellent service. We ordered a bottle of wine from room service that came up quickly. The room itself was outstanding. The decor was simple but remarkably Turkish. The complimentary breakfast was nothing short of lavish. I wish we had stayed more than one night in this hotel because it was so impeccable and the service was so friendly and incredible. The next day when we departed they called us a taxi, waited with us at the curb and gave me a gift wrapped box of turkish delights! I cannot recommend this hotel enough. My husband and I are world travelers and this ranks amongst one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. Perhaps it is not cheap by Turkish standards but it is well worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Palmeat
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night ahead of a recent cruise. Having previously visited Istanbul we had a preference for the Sultanahmet district and were certainly influenced by Trip Advisor reviews in selecting this hotel. We were not disappointed. The reviews say it all - brilliant. Service on arrival was outstanding (and don't forget to pay Euro cash on check in to save a further 10%). We were upgraded to a Deluxe room with extensive balcony overlooking the Topkapi gardens. Ideally located for key attractions. Our dinner on the roof-top terrace was good - Turkish cuisine - and very reasonably priced. Excellent facilities and all in a very traditional setting. If you want American-style Four Seasons then look elsewhere - but if you're looking for something more authentic, then Sirkeci Konak is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “service and location was exceptional”
Reviews.Author: smiler25ecosse
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Sirkeci Konak because the staff looked after our every need, with a smile. The location was perfect to discover the city, and we would hope to stay there again. The afternoon tea was not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Ever”
Reviews.Author: TedMiltonKeynes
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the most welcoming friendly staff I have ever encountered. The hotel has great facilities at reasonable prices with a couple of excellent restaurants. The hotel is fairly small but the bedrooms and bathrooms are very well appointed. It is right at the centre of Old Istanbul, next to the palace garden walls close to the railway station and within easy walking distance of all the famous sights.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, excellent service and well situated for the main sights”
Reviews.Author: scunner'd
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice three night stay in September. The rooms are on the small side but very comfortable, housekeeping does a fantastic job and the room is always fresh and clean. The neighborhood is not especially scenic but the location is a short stroll from the main old city sights, so very efficient for a first visit to Istanbul and close to the tram line for getting further afield. The pickup at the airport was a little disappointing - a very grubby minibus with non-functioning seat-belts and a bit of hanging about while they tried to find other passengers. The welcome at the hotel was excellent with lots of help and guidance on plans for visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! Would stay again in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesCarol
Reviews.Content: We loved Istanbul and we loved the Sirkeci Konak. It certainly lives up to its reviews on Trip Advisor! What more can I say than what's been said. We met the owner and he was quite visible at the hotel, making sure that guests are happy. Upon arrival we recieved a welcoming letter from him with his cell phone number. The staff is warm and friendly. The hotel makes you feel very welcome. We were upgraded to a larger room than booked, which was a pleasant surprise. This stay was for two days prior to our cruise. My only complaint was that we didn't stay longer. We loved Istanbul and there is so much to see and do there. We had a very nice dinner at the roof top restaurant and the second night ate at the seafood restaurant next door that is also owned by the hotel. The location is perfect and all main sites are within walking distance of the hotel. When we checked out of the hotel we were given a box of Turkish Delight. They said it is a custom to give you something sweet so you will return. We will definitely be returning to Istanbul and will stay at Sirkeci Konak for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Value, Location”
Reviews.Author: SpecialTV
Reviews.Content: I was absolutely blown away with the service that we received at Sirkeci Konak, from the moment we checked in until we left. We were fortunate enough to be introduced to the lovely Dihlan (Guest Relations) who made us feel like VIPs for the duration of our stay. She spoke to us each morning informing us on what was open/closed and giving us ideas for the day's activities. Her service alone was 1 in a million. I honestly believe that this hotel has better service than many of the so called 'Top' 5 star hotels I have stayed at. The reception staff, porters and waiters were all nothing short of exceptional. The rooms were kept exceptionally clean (and the welcome Lokum just delicious). The included breakfast was diverse and tasty. The location is great and only a short walk to many of the tourist attractions. By far, this is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in and I have no hesitation in recommending it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charles_Orleans
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel with 50 or so rooms set in a quiet unprepossessing street next to Gulhane Park. This location puts all of Istanbul's major tourist sites within walking distance and the tram from the end of the street will quickly take you across the Golden Horn to Beyoglu and Taksim. As the hotel is made up of a number of traditional buidings that have been converted, do not expect a modern purpose built structure with a flashy lobby but rather a slightly quirky layout which is nevertheless a comfortable, homely environment. The decor is perhaps a bit kitsch at first for some tastes but after a few days one actually gets to quite like it. The room we had was of adequate size, very clean, well equipped and comfortable. From the floor plan shown on the back of the door some rooms appeared smaller, so perhaps worth checking when you book. Breakfast is more than adequate with a wide choice of fruit, Turkish meats and cheeses and excellent bread. The hotel has two restaurants, one fish restaurant and another which operates on the roof terrace weather permitting. The food is well prepared and offers good value when compared to local restaurants. What really sets the hotel apart is the level of service which is friendly and efficient and the thoughtful little extras like free afternoon tea in the lobby - ideal after a long day footslogging round the city. This is not a large, swish, corporate international hotel, it has a more personal character all of its own. It may not suit everyone but we liked it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: NJN00
Reviews.Content: The website made the rooms look so nice and large but when we arrived there the rooms were small and cramped. The location was not ideal but the terrace did provide a lovely view of the city. I was also dissapointed in the breakfast...not the best selection. I would not let the ranking fool you...look for another hotel. I think next time we will try Four Seasons Old City.

Reviews.Title: “Five-star service at three-star price.”
Reviews.Author: NancyBmillvalley_CA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I would like to add our voices to the crowd of satisfied guests at this charming small hotel near the Topkapi Palace. Walking distance to everything in the Old City, surrounded by good, moderately priced restaurants, immaculately clean, and only one block from a major tram line, this is a perfect base for touring Istanbul. And the service!!!! This is a hotel that cannot do enough for its guests. From the plate of Turkish Delight (which should be classified as an addictive substance) in every bedroom, to the ample breakfast and afternoon teas, to the hotel-arranged tours -- for a taste of what daily life in Istanbul is really like, take the one to the Wednesday street market led by the charming and able Dilhan Tatlisu -- the Sirkeci Konak offers a level of service seldom seen at hotels twice this price. Even the water pressure is excellent. Should you encounter a problem, rest assured the hotel will resolve it for you. It's that kind of place.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but top 3 material ?”
Reviews.Author: CERAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: We had a nice time at this hotel. The location is perfect for first timers: right at the touristic heart of Istanbul. The staff is extreemly friendly and the rooms are nice and clean. Although i understand the positive reviews (and share them) i was a bit disappointed.
