It might be the fact that they try so hard to be authentic, but the decorations are all too new, and the boss is hanging around all the time so the smiles turn from spontanious to ' oh no, gotta smile, cause the boss is watching me again'.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel experience in every way”
Reviews.Author: PHP59
Reviews.Content: My husband, his brother and wife, and I spent two perfectly wonderful nights at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel in Istanbul. The rooms were lovely, very well appointed (with excellent water pressure in the showers I might add), extremely comfortable, and inviting. On our first day at the hotel, a charming complimentary wine tasting was held for the guests. The hotel is perfectly situated for independent sight-seeing on foot, walking distance from Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, the Grand Bazaar, the underground cistern, the harbor, etc. etc. The staff was knowledgeable, gracious, and very helpful in arranging extras such as last minute tickets for a local whirling dervish show. We happened to be at the hotel over my birthday and, although we never mentioned it to anyone, they surprised me with a "party", complete with candles, cake, and a gift set of Gural Porselen cups and saucers. A genuine sense of concern for the well-being of the guests was conveyed at all times, from the owner himself, on down the line. There was never even a hint of "nickle and diming" for any hotel services or events; it was as though we were part of the hotel's extended family. All four of us simply adored this hotel and are in total agreement that on our next trip to Istanbul, we could never even think of staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “This is a 10 star hotel, Sirkeci Konak gets our vote!”
Reviews.Author: freedomnyc
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Istanbul from Paris not knowing what to expect. The city was enchanting and magical but one of the highlights was our hotel: The Sirkeci Konak. Well situated in the old city, conveniently located to all the grand sights, this hotel was truly a remarkable experience. The staff was suberb, the rooms were well equipped, the services such as a gym and hamam were extra treats and the service was impeccable. I would recommend this hotel to any and all travelling to this exotic city. Consider no other but: SIRKECI KONAK! Alexandra

Reviews.Title: “Turkish delight”
Reviews.Author: rcd1129
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, very friendly staff, very good breakfast and a few perks that make one's stay truly pleasurable (the complimentary transfer from the airport, the afternoon tea and sandwiches, the choice of pillows, the free dinner and the discount in the group's restaurants, the free internet). And they send you off with a box of Turkish delights, what else can you wish for?

Reviews.Title: “Terrific all-around”
Reviews.Author: stanvard
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves it's top rating on TripAdvisor. It is a phenomenal value. The staff is top-notch - friendly, helpful, and respectful. The room was lovely and the bed was so comfortable. Breakfast is included and is both plentiful and good. Also included is afternoon tea. The owner is refreshingly customer-focused and has included nice touches like a welcome pot of Turkish delight in the room, free bottled water, and a gift for guest on departure. The hotel on the roof is surprisingly good. And the location is phenomenal - directly across the street from Topkapi palace and within walking distance of all the major sights in Sultanahmet. And it is on a very quiet street. Hotel also has a mini-hammam, spa, and fitness center in the basement. These are definitely not luxury, but nice additions to a four-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Shaky start, but the hotel and staff pulled out all the stops to make me happy!”
Reviews.Author: JonathanKlein
Reviews.Content: My luggage had been lost by British Airways on the way to Istanbul (not the hotel's fault), but this didn't put me in the best frame of mind on arriving there. My room was initially a bit small, but they found me a new larger one within a couple of days (I stayed there a week). Breakfast and restaurants generally of high standard. Hotel is very clean. Roof top restaurant also very nice. Concierge sometimes not very knowledgeable, but this seems standard in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “a comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: david752000
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated in the old town in a great location. Maximum 15 minutes to all the touristic attractions. But also you can go to the modern part with public transportation very easily. Staff makes the difference and makes everything easier for you. Excellent breakfast. Exceptionally clean and tastefully decorated rooms. You should definately try hotel restaurant pnce. It was a very comfortable stay. Thank you Hotel Sirkeci Konak, Very Good Job David

Reviews.Title: “It was not good”
Reviews.Author: NewYork121
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very bad the staff was not clear on anything. The staff made me wait 3 hours until my room was ready. My bed was not put properly put together.

Reviews.Title: “I honestly didn't think this hotel lived...”
Reviews.Author: worldtour2000
Reviews.Content: I honestly didn't think this hotel lived up to the glowing reviews I read before booking my stay. The rooms were much smaller than expected, and I felt claustrophobic. The decor was just okay and even seemed a little weather-worn. The bed was comfortable, but the bedding was pretty lacking. There was no view whatsoever from my room, although, to be fair, they'd told me that would be the case. The staff WERE very friendly and helpful and I enjoyed my meal in the restaurant. The rooftop terrace was lovely as well, though, again, the view was unexceptional, though pleasant. Breakfast compared less favorably to other European hotels I've stayed in. And I took one look at the spa and Turkish baths and took a pass. I will say this: the location is very convenient for touring the Old City and the hotel scored major points for having free wifi and complimentary airport pickup. I wish I could say I was more comfortable there, but the truth is I couldn't wait for my stay to end.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in the heart of old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: janipots
Reviews.Content: Service was cheerful, friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. In fact on the day of our departure we were treated like departing family members. The rooms were comfortable,modern with a feel of Old Istanbul. All facilities including tea & coffee making facilities, airconditioning and free hi-fi. Extremely well located with the Grand Bazaar, Spice Markets, St Sophie all nearby. Only minutes to the tram, shops, rail and waterways. The hotel is equipped with a small gym, swimming pool, sauna and Turkish bath for those who like a bit of a workout. Also there are two restuarants with one at street level and a second one located on the rooftop to allow you to watch the sunset and see Istanbul by night. It also has reciprocal dining arrangements with other hotels in its chain. We had three wonderful weeks in Turkey and stayed at a number of hotels in Turkey including the Conrad and Hilton chains but not one of them was a patch on the Serceki for value, comfort or location. A five star gem !

Reviews.Title: “Warm reception”
Reviews.Author: rforni
Reviews.Content: Sirkeci Konak Hotel is near all attractions of Old Istanbul and is a charming hotel with a very considerate staff. We loved our stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good location!”
Reviews.Author: SRP1111
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights after we realised our previous hotel had booked us only for 2 nights instead of 4, so it was a real last-minute booking, after going through tripadvisor. The service at this hotel is fantastic! They are always smiling and so happy to help (well, most of them). Located very close to the sightseeing spots (Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia etc.) in the Sultan Ahmet area, and 2 mins. walk from the tram stop. The only negative was our ground floor room: it was too small, and facilities were not that great! One evening we got a fright seeing a man pop up outside our window from nowhere.. we later figured he was cleaning the outside open air atrium area, but prior intimation would've been nice. You probably won't spend too much time in the room anyways, so stay here for their fantastic service and good location!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: JackKEvanstonIL
Reviews.Content: Definitely on par with any "botique hotel' of any major city. Staff always friendly and helpful. Great buffet breakfast! Hotel is very well maintained and the room was spotlessly clean with great air conditioning! Close to all the major tourist attractions. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful in every way!!!”
Reviews.Author: winnieNY
Reviews.Content: This is a truly special hotel. No doubt the best service we've experienced in our 26 years of traveling together. The staff are extremely friendly, knowledgeable, and eager to help in any way to make your stay perfect. The rooms are beautifully appointed (ask for a room with a balcony view over the Gulhane park). The location in the old city is ideal...right near a tram stop but on a quiet street. Walking distance to all major sights...fabulous complementary breakfast...turkish tea and sandwiches in the afternoon...rooftop bar and seafood restaurant (get the grilled sea bass!)...turkish bath, pool, sauna, massages, and fitness room all on premises...absolutely wonderful in every way...really!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel, friendly and warm & helpful staff, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Vicki048
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem in a busy city. The staff are warm, friendly and helpful. Cannot ask for more. This was our first trip to Turkey and we felt the warm hospitality of the people everywhere. Our room was always clean, quiet and comfortable. The breakfast buffet is plentiful and you can get whatever you need. Tea time is a nice treat in the lobby. The help desk offers assistance without even being asked and we felt at home right away. What a wonderful reception since it made us comfortable right away. Love this place and recommend it to everyone visiting Istanbul. A big advantage is the free Internet. They can also arrange tours for you. Forget about the large 5 star hotels -this is better than any of them. Thanks Sirkeci Konak for everything!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gmarcus
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on the extraordinary reviews on tripadvisor.com, and we were hoping that it would meet our expectations. Happy to report that staying at this hotel enhanced our stay in Istanbul. We took full advantage of everything that the hotel had to offer. We did the cooking class, which was lots of fun, and we were served the dishes that we cooked in the hotel restaurant following the class. We went on the walking tour of the market and Greek neighbourhood, which was a 4 hour outing with transportation there, and a short ferry ride back. The wine tasting was set up beautifully in the hotel restaurant with platters of cheese to accompany the wine. It is important to sign up for these activities, most of which are complimentary. The afternoon tea and sandwiches were a nice touch, and the self-serve Turkish bath (hamman) was very relaxing after a day of touring. Complimentary dinner at the fish restaurant was excellent. We also enjoyed 3 of the Sirkeci group's roof top restaurants including Neyzade (in our hotel, which is located on the rooftop in the summer months), Imbat, and Pasazade. The view at each one is fabulous, and they are all very romantic settings, with excellent food. (10%off with your stay at the Sirkeci Konak) We had a standard room, which was a bit small, but very comfortable and well appointed. Hotel has a European feel. Location is ideal. Around the corner from the busier streets, and walking distance to all attractions. Staff including Dilhan, Ezgi, and Michael are the most friendly, helpful, and the most accomodating of any hotel personnel that we have ever encountered. Unless you are someone who generally prefers a more Western style, large, 5 star luxury hotel of a well known hotel company, (most of which seem to be located in the Taskim area, which I do not see as an advantage for touring in Istanbul), I would choose the Sirkeci Konak for my stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “You Feet at Home”
Reviews.Author: aduggar
Reviews.Content: "GUEST MEANS EVERYTHING" , I have been to many hotels across the world, and you can get be in spoilt luxury and charm but that is because you pay for the plastic smiles but the Sirkeci Konak is totally different. I have never found a hotel that is more friendly for its guests.I could rate it to No.1 ion the world for that My son had booked it for us being in the centre of the town and no wonder the location is great, you cannot be far from Hagia Sophia or Topkapi and anywhere of significance. The staff of this privately run hotel is the most admirable staff I have ever found. The check in was very soooth, the rooms were much smaller than we thought but my son called the manager to say that he was in an impression of what he had seen and that appeared to be a suite but the manager was so kind that he upgraded us to a very comfortable large room with all modern amenities maybe it was the suite that my son had seen, and the upgrade did not cost us anything ! I cannot forget the fact that receptionist walked with us a good 500 mtr. to bring us to the restaurant that we wanted to go only to make sure that we don't lose our way and that we don;t face a language problem. She offered us to call her back when we were done and she would come to pick us up ! I have never seen anyone do that The rooms are modern and nice but more than anything it is the culture of the staff that impresses one ! The breakfast was very nice and sumputous although other food we could not have tried it as we are strict veggies This place is located fantastic from all the historic sights, you are at any place if you can walk 5-10 minutes

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel: excellent valuu, location, food, and service”
Reviews.Author: NJUSA1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights at the beginning of August. The concierge was excellent in terms of directions, suggestions, and ideas. Dinner was well prepared and served on the rooftop restaurants of this hotel as well as the Orient Express Hotel, a nearby member hotel. The views were stunning. You can walk to all of the main attractions without any difficulty. The area is very safe especially at night. The tram stop is one hundred meters from the hotel. We also used the turkish baths and the pool. They were clean and well maintained. Note that the Konak does not have a kitchen on the top floor but rather sends the food up. The Orient Express does have a kitchen on the top floor. Each rooftop restaurant does require that you walk up one flight of stairs to reach the dining area. Pricing for dinner does reflect the coming Euro. Entrees are about $25. Overall, in fact, Turkey is expensive. The hotel also arranged for a car to take us to Ataturk Airport. The service was excellent. We would stay again, but do so during the fall or early spring. Summer is extremely humid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay.”
Reviews.Author: united90
Reviews.Content: Me and my huscand booked this hotel from Trip Advisor and had a very nice experience. It provided pick-up service at the airpot which is really important at a place where you dont understand a single word (!). The staff was very friendly and helpful. Bedrooms were clean, simple and neat. Its located in a quiet place (so we had good nights of sleep). Also the hotel is close to Topkapi Palace, Aya Sofia and many other historical sights. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgetable!”
Reviews.Author: JGTL
Reviews.Content: Our stay in this hotel was absolutely fantastic. From its perfect location to the staff's unique friendliness, this hotel really expresses what sustainable tourism is all about. I will defenitely return and recommend both couples and families to experience it.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: E-A10
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel at 0930 am and were offered breakfast whilst our bags were taken up to our room which was ready. The hotel is really well situated in the old part of town with all the sights well within walking distance. The room was clean and cool (air conditioned temp out side 39oC. The hotel has a pool and it own turkish bath both of which were fantastic. The roof top restaurant serves Turkish cuisine and with the evening breeze was a delight. The best meal was breakfast which had hot and cold selections to die for. If you like honey there was a full honeycomb for your pleasure. The staff could not do enough for us nothing was to much trouble. This hotel is an oasis of quiet and calm in the vibrant and hussel of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel in Istanbul. Clean, good...”
Reviews.Author: CJinPA
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel in Istanbul. Clean, good service, good breakfast. Large rooms. 5 mins from Topkapi Palace, 10 mins from hagia Sofia. 1 min from gelhanne train stop.

Reviews.Title: “You Can't Go Wrong”
Reviews.Author: ciscospudd
Reviews.Content: I will be succinct. Hotel Staff: Exceptional I had an issue with a local bank's ATM machine and Ezgi was on the J-O-B, assisting me to rectify this problem, daily for 3 days. Ezgi exceeded my expectations. Agah was top-notch as well. He always had a smile, was personable, professional and busy! Location: Second to None Dining: Excellent I ate dinner twice at the Sirkeci. Both times the food quality impressed me (it takes a lot to impress me). They were flexible as well, as I combined the menus from both restaurants at the hotel because I saw items from both menus that appealed to me. You cannot go wrong with a lovely dinner here. Cleanliness: Wow I am hard pressed to think of another hotel that I have stayed at where the housekeeping staff paid that much attention to detail. Rooftop Terrace: What a great place to have a cold beer in the afternoon after a long day of sightseeing! The view is superb. Secret Tidbit: The towels are sublime. I have sensitive skin and these towels had the right softness/firmness ratio in my opinion. I liked them so much, I called the front desk and purchased 4. I did have a hell of a time packing everything in my suitcase when it was time for me to depart! The Bottom Line: As an informed consumer you cannot go wrong with the Sirkeci Konak Hotel in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: pierre0562
Reviews.Content: We are just back from Istanbul after a 4 night stay at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel and I can confirm this is an excellent choice for a short term stay in Istanbul. This small hotel is conveniently located within walking distance from all the â€œmust seeâ€� and close to the tram station (the blue line), which can take you to the modern part of the city (we enjoyed the Museum of Modern Art which is an Oasis of calm away from the busy old town). The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Dilhan, from the guest relations team was always willing to direct us to places to visit and to new restaurants. We tried different restaurants owned by the same family; Anatolian, Turk and Mediterranean, the three of them on roof top, in the neighborhood of the hotel and enjoyed the combination of a nice view and a great food. The room for the children was a standard room on the 1st floor with a back / no view, rather small but nice and clean. My wife and I indulge a Deluxe room (1406) on the 4th (and last) floor, with a terrace overlooking the Gulhane Park (the park surrounding Topkaki). It is worth I and I strongly recommend it! I was also impressed by the Turkish bath inside the hotel. It is a large room with the walls and the floor entirely covered with white marble and decorated with some elegant tiles. Why pay to try it elsewhere? We had a great stay and unless you only feel good in a big chain hotel , I do recommend this hotel. Pierre, from Belgium

Reviews.Title: “The Sirkeci Konak is a gem!”
Reviews.Author: CA_Bird
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the SKH for about a week and throughly enjoyed our stay. True to its reputation, the staff was really great and always helpful. The two young women who were the Guest Relations Team (Dilhan and Ezgi) were exceptional. The location of the hotel near Gulhane Park was ideal, close enough to the sites to walk, but far enough to avoid the noise. There is a tram stop nearby. Some of the standard rooms on the lower floors are a bit narrow and long - the ones with only a small window can be dark. Like many hotels in Sultanahmet, this one is in an older building; I don't think any of the rooms are identical. The best rooms are on the top floor where you get almost a full view of the park. They were kind enough to upgrade us to one of these rooms after the weekend when space opened up. The hotel also has two restuarants and a great breakfast buffet (large selection of hot and cold foods). The seafood restaurant was excellent, as good a some of the pricier ones nearby - we ate there several times. We had dinner at the rooftop terrace on our last night in Istanbul - mostly for the view, but the Turkish fare was excellent as well. We highly recommend this hotel and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Facility, Great Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kentgs
Reviews.Content: Review: The Sirkeci Konak gets great reviews and does not disappoint. An excellent facility, location and an extraordinarily friendly and helpful staff made this the perfect stay for us in Istanbul. There were many special things about our stay there, including a surprise celebration of my birthday with the owner, staff and guests joining in with the presentation of a cake and gift! That may not be an everyday experience, but the comfortable rooms and attention to service are a foundation of a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem”
Reviews.Author: S0lan
Reviews.Content: Really good location close to all the major attractions and the rooms are nice. Has a small swimming pool, sauna, gym and the turkish hamman is the best! But the real stars of the hotel are the staff, they could not be more friendly or helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Truly wonderful”
Reviews.Author: nziain
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Right in the middle of all the attractions and with the most fantastic staff. They really do go the extra mile in making you feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WTrvel123
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is excellent; the service is the best i have ever had, the rooms are nice and clean, and the price is worth it. My only complaint would be the hotel restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic... Just book here"”
Reviews.Author: duchess39
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights in this fantastic hotel. Location, food, atmosphere were all superb. What blew me away the most was the fantastic staff. With a dedicated in-house guest relations person (Ezge) to give you personal advice, plus the fantastic front of house staff, not to mention the chef giving free cooking classes, and the reliable hotel driver to greet us at the airport... I don't think I have EVER had such an equally superb experience in other hotels. They truly are an impressive, professional, and genuinely caring team. Save your time, and just book here. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “A Real "Turkish" Delight !!!”
Reviews.Author: DebbieNH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sirkeci Konak for three nights prior to our cruise in May. All of the reviews that I read before booking this hotel were spot on. Everything worked out perfectly, we contacted the hotel prior to arrival and they arranged a taxi to pick us up which was a welcome sight after out long flight. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly and helpful and the welcome tea and map as well as suggestions about what to see in Istanbul was very helpful.when we arrived. The hotel was in a great location for our sightseeing trips around the old city. The hotel was just what we were looking for to have a real "Turkish" experience. We loved the breakfasts every day and also enjoyed the delicious food in the dining room at dinner. We really loved our time in Istanbul and would definately return to stay at the sirkect konak if we are lucky enough to stay in istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a gem!”
Reviews.Author: Mfoursdca
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at Sirkeci Konak it was late in the day and our luggage had all been lost. The staff greeted us warmly and made us feel very welcome and cared for. The ambience was lovely and the rooms very nice. The amenities are quite nice including a Turkish Bath and a cooking class which is free for hotel guests. The breakfast buffet was really good. All in all, a fantastic experience. Oh, the staff helped us in speaking with the airlines and after two days we did get our luggage back so it was even better after that.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, fine location”
Reviews.Author: AJTR
Reviews.Content: A very friendly hotel, in an excellent location, with good services. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to its excellent reviews”
Reviews.Author: Iqbml
Reviews.Content: We read Trip Adviser and chose this hotel for the family hoilday (two kids under 11, and two teenagers). We were not disappointed. The staff are genuinely friendly. We didnt have interconnecting rooms (teher are none), and the rooms (we had two triple rooms) were not large. However, the service more than makes up for it. 1. location- central and walking distance to the historic sites-dont catch a cab! the grand bazaar is a bit further, but is walkable. 2. food-all more expensive than I remember it from 10 years ago. the hotel has two restaurants-both excellent, for a family of 6- we paid TL140. It all adds up! You could just get street food- kebabs, but choose a busy place (TL 5 or less). The kids ate at Mcdonalds once- the lack of english from the staff caused confusion with the order however. The Mcdonalds is a short walk-going towards the Bosphorous. The Faros restaurant- 1 minute from the hotel does pizza and pasta (once your love of kebabs is satisified). There is a great baklava and tea shop on the corner of the main square towards the Bosphorous downhill from the hotel. Open seating upstairs to look out across the water. 3. Travel- we walked. A Cab gets you to the business area-near Taxim Square, and you find the equivalent of Oxford Street- and just as busy! We didnt try the trams. 4. Price- we paid in cash- they discount the price for this. Also, check the sterling price and euro price with them before you change currency in the UK. We found that their rate was better than we could get in the UK, so we fixed a price and paid in sterling. They also do transfers to and from the airport, thus making it easy with the family. Ask how much they will include and see what they say. You dont ask, you dont get. 5. sites-Most entries are 10-20TL. Kids under 12 are free- but at the topkapi palace they asked for ID to confirm. The rest were more sensible, and just looked at the Kids! 6. A Must- the hotel does a cooking session- Kids>12 can do it, but they allowed by 10 year old to do it. It is at 5pm twice a week- well worth it, and you get to eat the food after-so have an early lunch on that day! Do ask for the 4th or 5th floor if you want to see the park from your window. We loved it- and in July, 29-30 deg C was manageable.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the whole world!!!”
Reviews.Author: careen22
Reviews.Content: we went at the sirkeci for 3 nights but we wished we could stay more!! this hotel is very well located and the staff is soo friendly! our rooms were very comfortable and there were some delicate attention such as the loukoums in a nice bowl and a letter from the hotel's owner. it was a really great experience and I will surely come back to this hotel if go to istambul!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel, Great Location--Roaches in Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: ThommmFlorida
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent boutique hotel, and I would stay here again. I just wouldn't advise eating in the restaurant. They have a "seafood" restaurant on the first floor, with tables spilling onto the sidewalk. We had a complimentary dinner there the first night. When flying roaches grazed by our ears and landed in the shrubs on the sidewalk, we lost our appetite. The roaches were crawling out of the drainpipe near our table. The local cats knew they were there and came to play with them and eat them. When we called this to our waiter's attention, he shrugged and said he would have to let the janitor know. The next evening as we walked by on the sidewalk--same story--big winged roaches--no corrective action taken! The last night of our stay, we decided to eat at the Turkish restaurant on the roof. Actually, it's a collection of tables, but the food is prepared downstairs (in the domain of the roaches). The food was horrible. My partner sent back his raw meat twice, but it was still returned uncooked. Now, the breakfast is nice. Great bread, pastries, cheeses, eggs, meats. I couldn't help wonder how clean it was. The rooms are spotless, spacious, very nice. The staff are excellent. The tramway is one block away. Aya Sofia, Topkapi, and the Blue Mosque are two blocks away. There are loads of restaurants, sidewalk cafes within two or three blocks, and the Grand Bazaar is a short walk away. I would stay here again. I just wouldn't eat here.

Reviews.Title: “It is one of the best hotels I ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: salonica62
Reviews.Content: The Sikeci Konak is a rather small hotel in the heart of central Istanbul near all the important sights and museums. The staff is extremely helpful and patient and make you feel at home from the very first momment. The rooms are well equiped and clean. The hotel has also a swimming pool, turkish bath, sauna and massage facilities which help relax after a long day of sightseeing. There are also two good restaurants and access to more with a discount. They also offer a lesson of traditional cooking and on some days guided sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “...a haven in the heart of old Istanbul...”
Reviews.Author: BrelCanuck
Reviews.Content: Our family of four spent 4 nights in this perfect boutique hotel. In fact i'm writing this review as we are packing to leave. I want to come back to this wonderful city and one of the reasons is the Sirkeci Konak. Why? Quiet, comfortable and well-cooled rooms, hearty buffet breakfast, perfect location (it simply CANNOT be better located; read other reviews to understand why), and best of all, the staff. Friendly, helpful, proactive, all clearly living the hotel's customer-driven mission. Thanks to all of you! Hope we're back soon! Grateful Canadians...

Reviews.Title: “Location, elegance and service”
Reviews.Author: sparky006
Reviews.Content: This must be one of the best located hotels in all of Istanbul in a recently gentrified sections of the old city. A short walk from all of the major tourist locations and block from the tram which allows you to quickly and cheaply get around the City. From your deck you look into the park with heron and storks filling the trees. The staff is as good or better than any I have found around, helpful, inconspicious, professional and accomodating. They treated our 13 year daughter like a princess. Don't miss the Wednesday walking tour of the market and Greek section of the City

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was fantastic, the perfect starting point for visiting Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ExiledCanuck
Reviews.Content: The Sirkeci Konak Hotel is the perfect place to use as a base for visiting Istanbul. Although its location on a sidestreet might seem a bit daunting, it is actually a first rate hotel, with excellent service, and immensely helpful staff. Rooms are very clean, with modern interiors and lost of room. The breakfast was ample, with a mixture of Turkish and Western dishes to appease most appetites. In fact we hardly need to eat lunch (and we're not light eaters). The rooftop terrace is beautiful (although the one at the sister hotel Orient Express is even better, but pricier), and suited us perfectly for the first night. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful (based on our subsequent experiences in Turkey, this is very much the norm), and always willing to direct us to interesting places to visit or eat. Dilhan from customer service was especially helpful, as was Erhan. You need something, do not hesitate to ask! The location right next to Gulhane Park means you can easily walk to Topkapi Palace, the Haga Sofia, and the Blue Mosque. A short walk in the other direction takes you to the ferry terminal at Eminonu and the Spice Market. The Grand Bazaar is also well within walking distance, although navigating the labyrinth of streets to get there requires some skill, but is lots of fun. The Gulhane tram stop is 150 ft/50 m from the hotel, and provides quick and easy service across the Golden Horn, with connections up to Beyoglu and Taksim Sq. This hotel is a gem, and well worth staying at when in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: coyotetraveler
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel experience that my wife and I have had. We are veterans travelers with many European trips under our belt. The staff was helpful, warm, friendly, and genuine.Ezgi, the customer relations host, was incredible. She looked after our every need. She found out it was our anniversary and we were showered with gifts. I felt like I was staying with a loving family. She made a point of inviting us to a wonderful play, Troia, our second night in our stay. I asked her how much and she waived away any suggestion of money. We were treated to a night of world class dance and theater. She found out that we were headed to Izmir and that I had rented a car. She took it upon herself to call and check on my reservation to make sure everything was in order. In addition she took the initiative in reserving us a GPS unit. When I asked her how she knew that I would need it she replied, "Just in case. They only had one left. I could always call back and cancel it if you did not want it." It turned out to be a brilliant and ever so thoughtful move on her part. We also were treated to mezes and a wine tasting, sampling the best wines of Turkey that was complimentary. Ezgi arranged that also and made sure we attended. Upon leaving she gave us her cell phone and conveyed to us that in traveling throughout Turkey if we needed any assistance to please call. The most amazing thing about Ezgi and the entire staff at the hotel was I never felt they were obsequious. I was struck and touched by how genuine they all were. The more we talked with them it was clear how they regard their work and the hotel guest. My wife and I were sad to leave this hotel. They set a high standard for the rest of our trip. The location of the hotel is perfect. It's an easy walk to all the major sites. There is a beautiful park next door to walk, run, or simply to hang out in. The tram stop is a 100 meters away. The hotel is on a side street so it feels private and away from the bustle of the city. The restaurants at the hotel are excellent. I'll save that for my review under the restaurant section. The room was spotless, quiet, and had a nice view. Breakfast: We could not believe our eyes the first morning we went down for breakfast. We got up late and I thought we had stumbled into lunch or a special event. The spread was out of this world. There were cereals, fresh fruit, eggs, a variety of meats, yogurt, veggies, breads, croissants and the list goes on. The staff were super attentive. My coffee cup never reached empty. In summary, I highly recommend this hotel. This was our first trip to Turkey and we were a bit nervous. Staying at a hotel of this caliber quickly relaxed us and gave us a wonderful taste of Turkish hospitality. I think many people from the U.S. have a negative preconception of Turkey that despite the guide books is tough to get past until they actually visit. Having a warm, welcoming hotel that picks you up at the airport upon arrival quickly put us at ease as I am sure it would do for others. We look forward to returning to Istanbul and we would not even consider staying anywhere else. In closing, I have to say I would have enjoyed meeting the owner. It's clear to have a staff this brilliant, competent, and caring he must be a very special person. I know that leadership sets the tone for this kind of exemplarily service. I imagine that he is an exceptional employer who treats his staff with the highest regard. Thank you for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service delivered by a team of people who are obviously very happy in what they do.”
Reviews.Author: helen255093
Reviews.Content: I have just read the recent reviews and they are all very much on the mark. We all talk about the great service and I hadnt realised how much this can really make a stay memorable. Thanks to Ezgi who will help you find just the right restaurant you want. Thanks to Enver who will give you a free cooking class and you get to eat it afterwards.!!! I have been to 2 of the city hammams on recent trips and was disappointed but would recomment the hammam in the hotel itself. Oktay was very good and does not scrub you until you are raw!! The hotel is the top one of 3 in this new group built by a Turkish businessman whom the staff all appear to really like and I think this makes a difference to the whole atmosphere here. Topkapi is just next door and the bazaar and other highlights about 15 to 20 mins walk ..all good Thanks again everyone for a great stay Helen from Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Top service & excellent location”
Reviews.Author: EstelitaTheHague
Reviews.Content: We had a triple room which we enjoyed as comfortable and clean. A little minus was the lack of view we had from the first floor (at front of the hotel). A view over the park would have been nice. The staff was very friendly and hospitality-driven. They immediately came with an alternative, when I mentioned the view. We kept our room because the offer concerned a nice room on the 3rd floor with one small window with a view over the park. We preferred the room of the 1th floor because it had 2 bigger windows. Furthermore we liked the wooden floor in our room and the well equipped bathroom. Also the location of our hotel was excellent. We walked about everything and once we took a tram, a one minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Sirkeci Konak Hotel in Istanbul is the perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: jap86
Reviews.Content: What a gem of a hotel! The Sirkeci Konak's location is perfect for walking to almost all the major attractions in Istanbul. The service is amazing...customer service representatives are the best!! There's a wonderful breakfast buffet served for all guests with fresh juices, wonderful pastries, and a great assortment of breakfast foods; the restaurants are great. This was truly one of the best hotels we've ever stayed at. If we return to Istabul, I wouldn't even think of staying anyplace else.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel to explore all of the wonders of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: tkmanthor
Reviews.Content: First and foremost this hotel offers the highest level of service I have ever experienced. They go above and beyond each and every day to be polite and friendly offering smiles and "hello's" on a nearly continuous basis. The owner was onsite a couple times during my stay and you can see where the place gets it's charm and spirit. The location is nearly perfect with any major site within a 15 minute walk. The terrace is a wonderful place to enjoy a drink after work or a fine dinner exquisitely prepared. We held our meetings in their very nice room with a nice projector and screen. They also served lunch everyday which was nothing short of first class and delicious. Just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Best ever #1”
Reviews.Author: caro089
Reviews.Content: I have been in many hotels during my numerous travels and have stayed in Youth hostels and 5 star + hotels but my stay at this hotel is the best I have ever encountered because of the people who take care of you and all the other small attentions you get the minute they open the door for you. You are treated as a VIP but not in an impersonal way or because you are wealthy (which we were not) but because they consider you almost as family. and when you visit a country such as Turkey which might appear a little more exotic then the usual Paris Rome trips this becomes very special.I do not know another chairman of a hotel that leaves you a letter in your room with his personal cell phone number and e-mail to ask for you to contact him .This is not a bluff we were able to meet him personnally the second day of our stay and he was a superb host to us The breakfast and afternoon tea all included in price of room , the complimentary supper the first evening. the wonderful restaurant and food on the roof of the hotel , and all this at extremely resonnable prices for budget conscious travelers. Believe me this is #1 in Istanbul and in my book of all hotels I have visited.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, friendly, helpful and lots of little extras thrown in.”
Reviews.Author: MLF28
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable rooms with views over the palace gardens. Amazing breakfast! Each afternoon a complimentary cup of tea (we chose the delicious apple tea) while you chat with other guests or with hotel staff about sight-seeing. Our package included free airport transfer and a free first night meal so was excellent value. We were also given 10% discount on sister hotel restaurants which we thoroughly enjoyed and were great value and in walking distance. Staff very friendly and most helpful! Highly recommend this hotel as central and walking distance to all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “The staff at this hotelwere fantastic - provided us with the best experience of our trip”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsMature
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely, great location, brilliantly trained staff who really care about their clients. i had asked for s non smoking room, but we were mistakenly given a smoking room. No problem - the porter came up, packed the stuff we had already unpacked and moved us to the non smoking floor. We had a beautiful room, great view. Did a cooking class - great fun, then we ate the meal we had prepared. I cannot speak highly enough of the staff at the hotel, they were attentive, friendly and always there to help. Really lovely touch was the box of Turkish Delight I was given as we were leaving. If you want a memorable experience, stay at this hotel. Thank our for making our stay so special.

Reviews.Title: “lovely rooms, friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: lalady50
Reviews.Content: our room was lovely, I'm handicapped and they made it work. Ask for a deluxe room, others can be small. It's clean and well maintained. Breakfast is great, staff over the top, location is fabulous. Best decision I made on the trip was staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: dedenstein
Reviews.Content: After spending four nights in the Sirkeci Konak I couldn't fault this hotel in any way. Starting from the airport pick to drop off everything has been perfect. The service was truly exceptional and the restaurant one of the best I tried in Istanbul. The spa with the hamam was a finish to long days. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this to hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Brusselscharlie
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent for visiting the historic highlights of Istanbul. We stayed in a deluxe room with a beautiful view over GÃ¼lhane Park, but found the room just a bit expensive with respect to value. For example, there are clear warnings not to drink the tap water, but the hotel charges for the 2 small bottles of water in the room.The staff was friendly, but could have been more forthcoming with general or specific hotel information. This may be due to the fact that we arrived too early at the hotel after a cruise. We did not expect the room to be ready, just left our suitcases and went to visit Topkapi and the Archaeological Museum. On our return during the afternoon we were shown to our room, but we did not receive any special treatment like a welcoming drink or tourist information. On the other hand when leaving we were shown true Turkish hospitality and have received a box of lokum which is the best we have eaten sofar. Yes we were very pleased with the hotel, but are not raving about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality as an introduction to Turkey.”
Reviews.Author: DRPA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to Turkey from Australia in May 2010. This was our first visit. After researching hotels to stay in Istanbul, our first stop, I decided on Sirkeci Konak - and what a wonderful experience it was. Turkish hospitality at its best. Many extra's to enjoy from cooking lessons to a personal tour of a local area by Okay, our well- informed guide and an employee of the hotel. We were constantly delighted by the attention and friendliness we received from the staff; always ready to please. This we found an appealing characteristic of many places we visited throughout our 3 week holiday in Turkey. We highly recommend this hotel to visitors to Istanbul, and hope to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Hotel and Real Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: TravelguruDanville
Reviews.Content: Service, service, service! This small, beautifully appointed boutique hotel defines what a quality hotel should offer. Upon entering the hotel and check-in, you are immediately brought to the reception area for tea and snacks while they complete the check-in process. During this short process, you are provided an abundance of information regarding what to see, how to get there and information regarding the hotel services (such as the cooking school program, wine and cheese tasting class, pool and massage, complementary dinner, etc). Upon entering our spacious and exceptionally clean room, I found two wrapped presents for our anniversary and my birthday (how thoughtful)! A generous and delicious hot/cold full breakfast and afternoon tea and sandwiches is included as well as free transportation to the airport for visits over 3 nights. Two computers are available to guests and they offered us a free room netbook. Whatever the guest need was, they were there to provide excellent service with a smile. We couldn't have asked for a better hotel within walking distance to all of the major historical sites in Istanbul. We never needed a taxi which is a major consideration given the traffic! Our only recommendation would be that if you are taking a taxi to the hotel from the airport or a cruise ship, call the hotel to have them organize the transfer. We heard several stories of guests who had trouble getting a taxi to take them to the hotel. A wonderful hotel that brings service to a new level!

Reviews.Title: “Over expectation in everything”
Reviews.Author: Ali-Ahmed
Reviews.Content: Great location in old town Istanbul, very frindly employee, clean and nice rooms, great tourism infomation guide. This hotel is the best representative of historic city of Istanbul. Simply they were above my expectation in every thing.

Reviews.Title: “great location & staff couldn't have been friendlier”
Reviews.Author: EppingGirlie
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for my 40th birthday - we arrived back after a day out and were asked if we would like tea. We sat down in the lounge and suddenly the lights went out - power cut I thought - but no, then arrived the staff with a cake, candles and a present for me. I was just about to thank my husband for arranging such a nice surprise when he (very honestly) confessed that it wasn't his doing, it was the hotel staff - they had checked my passport when I arrived, seen it was my birthday and arranged the cake and present. Says it all really.........

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location to see the old town”
Reviews.Author: piuric
Reviews.Content: Very near the main attractions of the old town Istanbul. Friendly staff and nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in everyway, especially the staff”
Reviews.Author: ksmatthews0517
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a beautiful two tiered rooftop terrace and was perfectly willing to set up a cocktail party for us. We also brought our own wine and cheese on occassion. A real treat. It's any easy walk to almost everything of interest and very easy to use the tram for further destinations especially those uphill. It took us two days to finally give a try and it was so simple. The hotel has tokens for purchase which makes it even easier. Two of us gave the turkish baths a try and although certainly different than anything I've done before I enjoyed the experience. Try luxury for both massage , bath and oil massage at Cemberlitas Hamami, takes about and hour plus and cost $65.00..

Reviews.Title: “By far the best hotel I've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: Sumsums
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Sirkeci Konak was what made our trip to Istanbul so memorable! The location of the hotel is great for tourism, the breakfasts are lovely, there is free wireless internet, they provide extra activities such as cooking classes and wine tasting (we didn't get a chance to try them), and more. But, most importantly, the staff are outstanding!! They were extremely attentive to our needs. They recommended excellent restaurants for lunches and dinners and always arranged our restaurant bookings and transportation. This made our stay in a country in which we could not speak the language very comfortable and easy. We genuinely felt at home at Sirkeci Konak. My colleagues and I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: wenndan
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Istanbul and we were so glad we picked the Sirkeci Konak as we had a great stay. Although the hotel is situated on a side street, its location is ideal as it is within walking distance to all the major sites. We decided to walk instead of taking the tram and we ended up walking everywhere, even to Ishtikal Street in the Taksim area (we were on a cruise prior to this and wanted to walk off the pounds we gained). We had a deluxe room on the top floor and would definitely recommend this. The room was spotless and tastefully decorated with a balcony overlooking the Gulhane park. You can see people strolling in the park as well as birds nesting in trees while sitting out on the balcony. We were happy to find the room spacious and the bathroom had a fully enclosed shower on one side (not one of those half covered shower where water gets splattered all over the floor) and a bathtub on the other. Shower water pressure was great and temperature control in the room worked fine as we like to keep the room at a cool 21 celsius. Breakfasts (included) came with a wide variety of choice and included a spread of home made breads, fruit, meats, eggs, cheeses and cereals besides some local items. Since we stayed 3 nights, we had a free dinner at their restaurant as well and it was good. Although it was available every afternoon, we never made it back to the hotel in time to enjoy their free afternoon tea and simit sandwiches. We had dinner one night at Imbat, located on the rooftop of one of their sister hotels, and it had a gorgeous view of the city and the Bosphorous. Food was quite good as well and came with a 10% discount as the hotel was part of the Sirkeci group. Dinner on the third night was at Sofali G in the Taksim area. That area is just hopping and we had a fun time people watching. The best part of Sirkeci Konak is the staff. Ezgi, the guest relations member, is an absolute sweetheart. She is warm, friendly and very helpful. When we first arrived, she sat us down and provided us with refreshments and all the information we needed on the major sites to visit including a tourist map and tram line guide card. She made dinner reservations for us, arranged for a taxi to take us to the airport and made a point of chatting with us whenever we run into her. To sum it all it is the exceptional customer service that makes this hotel so special. Istanbul is a wonderful place to visit, its people are friendly and engaging and we hope to come back again soon. We will definitely stay at the Sirkeci Konak again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Suzzlili
Reviews.Content: The hospitality and welcome of the staff at the hotel was as friendly and welcoming as the magical city itself. They couldn't have done enough for us. Their tips on where to go and what to see, their recommendations for places to eat, their care and genuine welcome and their attention to detail was excellent. I will not hesitate to stay there again and have already recommended it to friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “If you are going to Istanbul you should stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AnneK16
Reviews.Content: All of the staff at the hotel were friendly and helpfully and they all went out of their way to make sure that we had the information we needed to ensure we made the most of our 3 days in Istanbul. We enjoyed the wonderful breakfasts and complimentary afternoon teas and we also enjoyed the complimenary afternoon activities (Turkish wine tasting paired with wonderful Turkish cheese and a cooking class with the chef). The concierge provided us with directions to all of the major sites (all within easy walking distance), made dinner reservations on a roof top terrace and gave us information on the best Bosphurous boat trip for the time we had available. Our room was on the 3rd floor overlooking the back of the hotel. It was very quiet and the beds were very comfortable. Overall the hotel was spotlessly clean and well maintained. If I go back to Istanbul I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: picky154944
Reviews.Content: This hotel far exceeded our expectations. The location in Sultanamed is ideal - walking distance to the rail line and the famous historical sites - yet just off the beaten track so that it is quiet. The hotel is well-maintained and exceptionally clean. Our room was small but well-appointed for our comfort. The staff was courteous and helpful. Excellent breakfasts are included as is afternoon tea. We are seasoned world travellers and have stayed at a wide spectum of hotels including 6*. This is a gem of a hotel and is amazing for the amount we paid. It would be our first choice if we travelled to Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: seniortraveller2
Reviews.Content: Great service, location and wonderful staff who couldn't do enough to help you. It's all been said in previous reviews but it is all true. They even provided the umbrella as it rained for the 4 days!

Reviews.Title: “The best stay ever”
Reviews.Author: OganPK
Reviews.Content: I have never bothered to write one of these because no hotel has ever wowed me. I have stayed at extravagant hotels all over the world and none of them have impressed me half as much as this hotel. The large point that makes this hotel excellent is the staff. I genuinely felt like the staff was happy to see me and truly enjoyed their job. When we got to the hotel we were met by one of the personal relations member who sat us down in a beautifully comfortable sitting area and provided us with refreshments and all the information we could ever use to explore the city. When we got to the room there was a letter addressed to us by hand and signed by the owner of the hotel who provided his cell phone and email for contact if we had any problems. I mean, who does that? Two days before my wifeâ€™s birthday I approached the personal relations representative to ask if they can put on a cake for my wife. I was told that it was already set up and all I need to do is give them a time for presentation. We had cake on her birthday and they presented with a high quality tea set and case. When we were leaving 4 members of the staff who we interacted with during the week came and stood outside in the rain to see us off. I felt like I was leaving my home. I would have to say their described location down plays its prime location. Itâ€™s about 3 minutes from the areas filled with nightlife and restaurants but far enough to keep the noise out. All major attractions are in a 5-15min leisure walk from the hotel. It is in an excellent location. Amazingly enough this hotel also had free wifi in the rooms. Can you remember the last time you remember the last time you stayed at a hotel in a tourist area that offered free wifi? I can go on and on about this hotel. You could fill a chapter in a travel guide about this hotel. Just go to their website and see all the things they offer.

Reviews.Title: “proffesional & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: justfletch
Reviews.Content: Although my check in was only for 2pm, my flight arrived in the early morning. The hotel arranged for my collection at the airport, and upon arrival they made sure my room was ready by 7.30am and offered me breakfast. They exchanged Euros into Lira at a reasonable rate, handed me a free map of the city and explained how to get around and where to go. Professional and friendly staff, clean rooms & comfortable bed. I wish I could have stayed longer

Reviews.Title: “If all hotels were like this wouldn't life be wonderful”
Reviews.Author: awizzbang
Reviews.Content: It has already been stated many times about the quality of the staff at this hotel, something I can totaly concur with. Our only problem was how could we say thank you to them all.The conventional way is to tip the really good staff, but since they were all so good it would have been too expensive. A suggestion that the hotel might like to consider is to have a "tip box" where you could put some reasonable amount into which can then be shared amongst all the staff. A couple of examples of the quality of service,there was a cheese and wine tasting evenig which I think they normaly charge for, we were invited to come to it and were told at the end it was complementary. Also while we were waiting for a lift back to the airport, with an external agency, the doorman noticed we had been waiting some time, asked us when we expecting to be picked up and immediately offered to phone the company up. Yes the rooms are slightly on the small side, but how much time do you spend in the rooms and everything else about them is fine. There has not been much mention of the leisure facilities but again we would rate them highly. The swimming pool isn't huge but on the four occasions we used it we were the only people in there and it was a wonderful way of relaxing at the end of a day's sight seeing Unfortunately the restaurant on the top floor terrace wasn't open but we were able to go and eat in the terrace restaurant at one of the partner hotels. Finally a big thank you to all the staff for the part they played in a memorable holiday

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: geogmaster
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in this hotel: the welcome was warm and friendly and the room delightful. We sampled two evening meals and both were delicious as were the breakfasts, where the service at all times was efficient yet personal. The glass of Turkish or Apple tea at the end of a dayâ€™s busy sightseeing was also a must! We tried the cookery lesson provided by the hotel which was great fun as well as giving us an insight into Turkish cuisine. \then we got to eat what we had cooked. All the staff were very helpful and a big thankyou to Ezgi who was particularly so. Also to Okay whose Market Tour was exceptional. He took four of us to areas that we would not otherwise have visited and delivered the information with knowledge, enthusiasm and humour. This is something that will stay with us for a long time. Finally, a big thank you to everyone for making our first stay in Istanbul so memorable: a remarkable city and a gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, superb staff.”
Reviews.Author: davegeeson
Reviews.Content: Faultless hotel. Excellent facilities. Incredibly helpful staff. Good location. Free activities provided by the hotel (cookery class, backgammon lessons, walking tour). Even the gift shop across the road is good - Ali is helpful and very fair - there is no pressure to buy and he can get most things for you.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel tucked away in the midst of old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: PierTom
Reviews.Content: This hotel would be easy to miss from the street. It's not on a major thoroughfare and it doesn't have a big sign out front. But please feel free to find it and enjoy a lovely hotel experience. First, I must point out the excellent staff. Everyone is unfailingly polite and helpful. The staff almost all speak English, and they are able to assist the traveler in all aspects of the visit to Istanbul. If you stay for four nights, there is a complimentary car service to or from the airport. In addition, we had a free dinner that was lovely and just the thing after a very long day of travel. The location is good: equidistant to the waterfront and the main attractions of the Sultanahmet area. The price of the rooms is fair. They are nicely furnished but not overly opulent. The bathrooms are very nice with great showers.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive Service in an Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: LoveTravelling49
Reviews.Content: I always read tripadvisor when choosing my hotels unfortunately I do not always write a review but with this hotel it would be wrong not to. We stayed for 6 nights. Our first room was by a lift and a bit small but we were told we would be moved the following day. Our 2nd room was very comfortable, spotlessly clean and had a small balcony. Unfortunately we had an incident on our first day in the Topkapi Palace when in an unguarded moment my bag was stolen. It was found, minus cash and credit card. We returned to the Sirkeci Konak and the reception staff were incredibly supportive. I felt anxious but they dealt with everything calmly and sympathetically. After my card was blocked so it could not be used, the hotel staff offered complimentary refreshments and I eventually felt composed enough to continue sightseeing. You do not receive this kind of personal attention in many hotels. I was very grateful to the reception staff. Theft happens anywhere and everywhere and I still think Turkish people are extremely good. The rest of our stay was wonderful. The position of the hotel in a quiet street was perfect. We were given a tourist map on arrival and realised all the major sites could be reached on foot and the tram stop was about 4 minutes walk from the hotel. With helpful advice from Guest Relations we were able to see all the other places we wished to visit. Breakfast offered a wide variety of choice and I sampled and enjoyed some different tastes. Late afternoon after a day of sightseeing we would enjoy a relaxing drink on the roof top terrace overlooking the park. We ate in a number of local restaurants but by far our favourite meal was in the Neyzade Restaurant in the hotel where once again the service was excellent without being obtrusive. I read other Istanbul hotel reviews but definitely made the right choice with the Sirkeci Konak.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome & Kindness”
Reviews.Author: LadyMT
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 night between the end of May and the beginning of June. My feedback is totally positive (I'm exigent and not always in compliance with tripadvisor review) and I'll recomand this hotel to everybody. More in detail: - staff: really kind and careful to every kind of demand- staff service is really superior to what is usually provided in 4 or 5 star hotel and make the difference; - location: perfect - it is a walking distance to the most visiting attraction; - breakfast: good quality - you can choose everything, fresh fruit too even if you are in Turkish (seems strange but I got some virus from food also in this country); - fish restaurant: this hotel has 4 restaurant, I only tried the fish one inside and the grilled fish was really excellent: I recommend it; - Spa& massage: I tryed a total massage (Bali) and it was really well done; only warning: be aware that the massage will be done by a man: he is really good buy could be embarrassing if you are a lady. - rooms: clean and really well finished - be aware that are small (but you are in the city centre) and there's a quilt instead of upper sheet even in this season so you can chose to sleep without any sheet or quilt or to set air conditioning to 18Â°C!!!!! What more? -There's a welcome individual session where a lady explain to you all main city attraction; - Twice a week there's a cooking class. Finally if I'll be back in Istanbul (I hope as it is a lovely city) I surely come back to this hotel and I strongly recomand it .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jebby
Reviews.Content: We completely agree with all the prior positive reviews of the hotel. The location is a 10 minute walk from all the main tourist sites and the galata bridge and boats. The tram stop is also very close. We stayed in a standard room with a view of the park; it, was spacious, the beds were great, the bathroom had all the amenities we wanted. Being on a side street, it was very quiet amid all the noise in the area. the hotel restaurant was excellent. The staff was pleasant and extremely helpful. Our only regret was that we could not stay their longer.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dina_AbuDhabi
Reviews.Content: All the reviews Iâ€™ve read about the staff are very true. They are incredibly friendly and you really feel that they love what they do. The hotel is in a perfect location because its off the main street so its quiet but its also a walking distance to topkapi, divan yolu, bazaar and galata bridge etc. The room's narrow, but comfortable and very clean. They have a kettle and satchets of coffee and tea in the room which I love to have. The bathroom is a bit on the small side but enough for one person. The food at the hotel is fantastic especially Sirkeci balik (fish restaurant). I particularly liked their afternoon tea where you can sip on apple tea and eat simit sandwiches. The staff are well informed and made great restaurant recommendations and reservations for me at both touristy places and where the locals would go. It was a truly great experience

Reviews.Title: “A top hotel in a great city.”
Reviews.Author: threeqs
Reviews.Content: No better feeling than to be in a special city and a great hotel. I just spent 8 days in Istanbul at the Sireck Konak Hotel. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful. The location is close to all the major sights and the shopping is fun. This hotel group has 4 restaurants and each one has a different specialty and each with great service and food.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, lovely restaurant,incredibly friendly staff and a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Bluejay61
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel in Old Town Istanbul. The entire staff was helpful and friendly, especially Sukru Araz who was always there for directions, help and advice! The location was great and within walking distance of the Blue Mosque, Haghi Sophia and Topkapi Palace. The Tram stop is close and we were able to go directly to the Dolmabahce Palace and other tourist attractions in the area. The breakfast buffet was delicious and tea was served in the afternoon. We had a superb dinner in the restaurant! All of this---and free internet!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, friendlier than any other”
Reviews.Author: KMaxwell
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 7 night stay at the Sirkeci Konak and thoroughly enjoyed it. The staff are really friendly and helpful, welcoming you when you arrive, making you feel as if nothing is too much trouble and generally being warm but professional. We had a deluxe room for some of our stay and would definitely recommend this. Sitting out on the balcony you can see herons, storks and parakeets nesting in Gulhane Park, which is just opposite. It is withing easy walking distance of the vast majority of places and we ended up walking everywhere. I have never been in a hotel where I felt so comfortable and welcome. The breakfast is great, a spread of home made breads, fruit, meats, cheeses and cereals.

Reviews.Title: “We think of it as our home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ParisandVenice
Reviews.Content: So much has already been written on this beautiful hotel that I will try to write something personal that has still not been said. From the very first minute we stepped into the hotel my husband and I felt we were greeted as members of the Sirkeci family and not as any kind of tourists. The hotel is very professionally run with the Front Office Attendant, Okay, and Guest Relations Team (a special mention to an adorable young lady called Ezgi) always at hand smiling and warm while not obtrusive at all: unlike other hotels they never try to sell you expensive trips, or send you to their friendsâ€™ shops; instead they organize free activities in and out of the hotel: they took us to the less well-known Fatih market and had us tour the Greek High School (not open to the public), all the while discussing Turkey with us and answering all our questions in the most clever way. We had a cooking lesson in the cookâ€™s immaculate kitchen one night and a wine- and cheese-tasting session on another night, all thiat free of charge. The location is absolutely perfect in a small non touristy quiet street, within walking distance of the big Istanbul sights of Haghia Sofia, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and the Grand Bazaar, and close to a tram line that can take you anywhere in town across the Bosphorus. The hotel sorted out taxis and airport shuttle for us (the driver will be holding your name as you walk out - the airport shuttle and the first three-course dinner in their restaurant were free of charge: the latter idea is excellent when you get there at night after a long trip). They booked all the restaurants we asked them, found out the location of the medical lab we needed during our stay, printed all the necessary maps for the taxi drivers to take us there, always explained them how to reach their destinations. The spotless, well-decorated room with the balcony overlooking Gulhane park will long be remembered as well-as the rooftop terrace with its elegant resin deckchairs. The breakfast buffet was excellent and plentiful. We had free tea & snack in the afternoon. We had dinner several times at the hotelâ€™s fish restaurant and enjoyed delicious grilled sea-bass (the fish restaurant is very well rated in town). What is more, the free wireless Internet connection allowed me to continue working mornings and nights and never lose touch with my kids back home. Both my husband and I enjoyed the Sultanâ€™s massage in the hammam of the hotel and my only suggestion would be to have a hairdresser at hand in the hotel or - why not - encourage the installation of a hairdresserâ€™s close by. Because the volcano ash had prevented us to go for a week over Easter the first time we were supposed to only spend 3 nights at the Sirkeci Konak and then relocate to a lesser quality hotel close-by: Okay, the Front Office attendant went out of his way to accommodate us a fourth night. When we did leave for the hotel next door and found out breakfasts (there and the rest) were terrible they allowed us to breakfast for free and use all the amenities of the hotel, including the extensive rooftop terrace overlooking Gulhaneâ€™s Park (the park around Topkapi), as if we had still been staying there. And finally, they offered us a box of Turkish delight for the road. Sirkeci Konak is really the place to be staying at when travelling to Istanbul and I myself have started recommending it on my blog !

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly, profeesionally run hotel in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: jimbo525
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Sirkeci Konak and were extremely impressed by the facilities and by the helpful staff. Their guest relations team helped us book the remainder of our trip in Turkey and were available to take calls and help us even after we left the hotel. The location next to the park made for perfect viewing from the rooftop and the proximity to the tram made it very easy to navigate around town. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Sirkeci to anyone traveling to Istanbul. Jim - Centennial, Colorado

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful spot in the midst of the old city”
Reviews.Author: writer26
Reviews.Content: We had only one day in Istanbul after a 12-day cruise, so Sirkeci Konak was a convenient location to easily access the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace and the Grand Bazaar. When we got back to the hotel from our full day of touring, the lounge and retaurant beckoned, and we truly enjoyed the selection of Turkish meze and good white wine. The rooms/beds were comfortable, the bathrooms well stocked and equiped. Wish we would have had time to enjoy the in-hotel haman. The hotel arranged for vans for our party of six to get the airport in plenty of time for two different flights. The staff was friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ValerieSF
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this hotel. Great location, down a quiet street within walking distance to all the tourist spots. Friendly, helpful staff. Nice breakfast buffet. Clean, modern room. Free tea & snack in the afternoon. Free wireless internet. We had dinner once at the hotel restaurant and once at the Terrace restaurant of their sister hotel. Both were excellent. And finally, they a box of Turkish delight for the road.

Reviews.Title: “Underrated--actually a 6 star!!!!”
Reviews.Author: WildCommonwealthBoy
Reviews.Content: Wow---What a visit.. KKinBmore summed it up perfectly. Beautiful people at the hotel who would do anything for you. Our highlights---My wife had a special birthday at Imbat arranged by Dilhan. Perfect.. Cake and presents.. Birol was amazing. I broke my sunglasses and he took me to the maintenance room where they filed down a screwdriver to fix them!!! I will not repeat comments on the other staff but they are abolutely 100% accurate and not exaggerated in the the slightest. These guys are number 1 on tripadvisor and very proud of it. The owner Faruk Boyaci, spends his money on his guests and training his staff to be number 1 . He has acoomplished this like no other place in the world that I have been. Mr Boyaci gives you his cell phone number at time of check in and tells you if you have problems call him!!!! Where have you ever encountered this? We will go back to Istanbul just to be around these fabulous people. Also, outside the front door to the left is Memo, a local merchant selling beer, wine ,spirits and snacks. Very nice man and honest. A liitle further at the fork in the road is Kenan, who has scarves,bowls,blankets,shirts and other collectables.He treated us very fair and his prices were better than the Grand Bazaar. All in all--Sirkeci Konak treats you like Misafir---which means more than a guest. Go and enjoy........

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: abf48
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the hotel was amazing. The location was great - within walking distance to all the major sights of Istanbul. Our accommodation was wonderful - the room was quiet, modern bathroom, comfortable bed. The staff could not have been more helpful or friendly - they made our stay in Istanbul unforgetable. I would strongly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond Expectations”
Reviews.Author: KKinBmore
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our 2 year old, travelled to Istanbul from the United States (east coast) for 10 nights (April 28-May 7, 2010). I spent weeks on tripadvisor and hotels.com reading almost every review on about half a dozen well ranked hotels in Sultanahmet. I chose Sirkeci Konak and got in touch with them. They were overall prompt in getting back via email, and answered my questions in detail. I was EXTREMELY happy with our choice. I will lay out the details here: 1) Located in a very nice, quiet location so we got excellent sleep 2) Very close to all major sites: 10 min walk to Topkapi, Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia, Grand Bazaar; less than 10 min walk to Galata Bridge, boat tours; walkable to just about anywhere....and we did! With a baby stroller nonetheless. 3) Tram is right around the corner. Although we walked just about everywhere from our hotel, this is a great choice if you don't have a baby stroller with you (it's very crowed inside tram) 4) Breakfast is to die for! Wonderful spread, and a hot breaktfast. Many hotels do not offer hot breakfast in the area. You don't need to eat anything until lunchtime if you do breakfast right. 5) Free 3 course dinner upon arrival 6) Free transport from airport (driver will be holding your name as you walk out) with a min 3 nite stay 7) Free cooking class with chef (a lot of fun) 8) 2 restaurants in hotel: both very tasty; highly recommended. 9) Staff is AMAZING. very, very warm and sweet and sincere. no fakeness. we were so happy with everything that we left a $100 tip for the staff at the end of our stay. from the guest relations team, Agah, Ezgi, Dilhan, as well as Biral and Sukru were wonderful and very helpful. food services staff and management consisted of Mohammed,Engin,Rukiye, Hakan, Zehra, as well as more individuals whose names I sadly forget. everyone always made time to talk and smile and even play with our son. we actually do miss them; they are good people with warm hearts. When needed, they would bring warm milk out for our son at night. our cleaning maid, Edibe, was very good...esp since we had toddler who would create mess in room; his cot sheets were changed just like ours. 10) I asked for discount b/c of our long stay: they gave 11% discount when we paid in cash, one night free, upgraded our room from standard to deluxe standard for free. This was very helpful if you have children and need a cot, and have a lot of luggage. make sure you know the size dimensions of your room; it is very helpful esp if you have much luggage or children. Some of the negative reviews posted on the website consist of saying that hotel is located near car auto parts. Not once did we hear any loud noises coming from that area. our room faced Gulhane Park. Helpful hint: when leaving hotel's main door, make a right turn and then you will get to busy foot traffic and tram, etc. If you make a left turn, then you will have to pass the auto shops, etc. you can easily walk around that by going right out of the hotel. it is NOT a major issue at all. Istanbul is beautiful. Have fun wherever you stay, but we would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Don't think about it...do it !”
Reviews.Author: alanandchristine
Reviews.Content: It's a new hotel built in the Ottoman style.
