It's close to everything...but quiet ,realatively small, excellent service(really !)and good restaurants if you are feeling like a relaxed evening. Istanbul has 20 million people.. Sirkeci Konak gives you a sense of comfort, friendliness and familiarity in an Asian/European context. Can't wait to go back !

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic.....a real gem in the old city!”
Reviews.Author: Marianne1960
Reviews.Content: This charming little hotel far and above exceeded our expectations. By booking online, we received complimentary transportation from the airport and a complimentary 3 course dinner upon arrival. Both were perks we were happy to have after our long transatlantic flight. After arriving, a wonderful woman from guest relations sat us in the beautiful lobby, brought us drinks and proceeded to go over maps, sightseeing options and amenities of the hotel. The hotel is the perfect location for those wanting to explore the historic sights of the Old CIty. We were within walking distance and the easily navigated tram system if we were tired. Delicious restaurants were right around the corner, although the ones within this restaurant group were fabulous. Dinner at a sister hotel was really good. A large hot and cold breakfast buffet each morning was included in the price and the Turkish dishes were an extra treat. The friendly and helpful team at the hotel was superb and any concerns or questions immediately addressed. A complimentary cooking class (held twice a week) was great fun and enjoyed by all who attended. The pool, fitness center, sauna and traditional turkish bath (hamam) were wonderful although the hamam was the self service style where you go in and relax on the heated marble slabs yourself. Istanbul far exceeded our expectations and we would highly recommend a trip there. The Sirkeci Konak was a real gem, fantastic value and incredibly friendly staff. This hotel had everything.....staff, location, food, amenities and charming but elegant rooms.

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place to Stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: C0nstantlyOnTheG0
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers without doubt the best service we have experienced anywhere in the world. Expect better and more personal service than what is offerred on the Club Floors of your 5 star hotels. The hotel organised airport transfers which were excellent. Our driver greeted the 3 of us at the arrivals hall and we were promptly transferred to a large modern van (which would comfortably seat 8 to 9 people) and taken direct to the hotel (approx 40 mins). Our return transfer to the airport was a similar experience. On arrival at the Sirkeci we felt we were greeted by a welcoming committee. Luggage was quickly handled by others as we were ushered to a seat at the check-in desk and offerred refreshments and keys. We were then whisked away to the lounge by the wonderful Ezgi at Guest Relations who gave us a quick brief on the hotel and supplied us with maps, tram routes and information on Istanbul. Afternoon tea was then offerred, which was another complimentary service of the hotel. We were then ushered to our triple room which was beautifully fitted out and included wall mounted plasma and a bowl of turkish delight on the bedside table. The verandah off the room gave us a lovely outlook onto the street and the beautiful flowering trees in the Park behind. We could also glimpse the Bosphorous if we looked down the street. The bathroom included bath, shower and toilet and was of a good size for European Hotels. It was not of the marble and granite variety, but completely acceptable and spotlessly clean. The room was very comfortable, compared to what is considered 5 star in European hotels. With the location, being off the main thoroughfare there is no noise to contend with at night. A pillow menu is offerred, and the beds were the best of 5 weeks of travel, better than the Atlantis in Dubai. Location was sensational. It was less than 20 metres walk to the street junction which appears to be the main thoroughfare for the tram routes, restaurants, shops etc. A further 5 minute walk to the Palace, Aya Sofia, Cistern, Blue Mosque etc. In the other direction were more shops, ATM's, restaurants etc. I was travelling with my two daughters aged 15 and 11 and the hotel location, surrounding streets etc. were perfectly safe to wander at anytime of the day or night. We never felt threatened and the kids would even wonder across the street to purchase snacks. During our first stay at the Sirkeci my youngest daughter was ill and the care and assistance we were given by the hotel was unbelievable. Luckily we were able to extend our stay and returned to the hotel after our tour, for another two nights. The staff were all equally wonderful. We never experienced Turkish hospitality on this scale anywhere else during our 16 days in Turkey, and the Conrad's and Hilton's failed miserably in comparison. On return to the Sirkeci, we partook in the Turkish Cooking class, complimentary for hotel guests. This was a real treat, and the bonus was you got to dine on what you cooked in the hotel restaurant. Breakfast was situated in the restaurant at street level and was excellent. We also ate from the bar menu, the seafood and lobby restaurants and all meals were excellent. Free Internet was also available to guests. The guest relations staff were wonderful with confirming flights and assisting stranded guests due to cancelled flights from the Icelandic volcano or the strikes in Greece. I have never stayed anywhere where I have been so impressed with the total team effort of staff. The management and staff should be totally congratulated on their hotel and they are fully deserving of their Trip Advisor Awards. We believe this hotel deserves its elevated status and give this hotel a 5 star recommendation to anybody choosing to stay in the Sultanhamet area of Istanbul. We will definitely stay here again and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “a cosy spot in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: meleone
Reviews.Content: I travelled with a girl friend, it was our first trip to Istanbul, we had a grand time thanks to last but not least the amazingly friendly and helpful staff. one can feel very comfortable there. I would stay there again any time.

Reviews.Title: “all was perfect !!”
Reviews.Author: bevimajuq
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days in Sirkeci with our three children. It was really nice. The staff is incredibly kind, smiling and attentive. The rooms were quiet and comfortable. The hotel is really well located.

Reviews.Title: “At Sirkeci Konak we felt at home and at the same time all our needs were tended to”
Reviews.Author: syyed33
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through phone and later it was confirmed by the email. On our arrival a gentleman was waiting for us at airport with a board displaying our name. The hotel staff received us and we felt that we were the most important people for them. The staff proved to be very friendly and kind towards all their customers. It was a unique experience living in this hotel because the atmosphere created was homely and comfortable. The hotel management service was rapid and up to the mark, it never failed to impress us. The staff adopted a manner whereby the customer was the only priority, they tried their level best to fulfill our demands. The hotel management was compromising and understanding about any personal problems the customers had. They welcomed us not only with a complimentary pickup but they also offered us a 3 course dinner which was scrumptious. The hotel rooms and location were a bright package which allowed us to absorb a luxurious stay and made us enjoy the surroundings. They completed our visit to Turkey and provided us with unforgettable generousity and services.

Reviews.Title: “A special atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: JerryVenice
Reviews.Content: Everything is special in this hotel, thanks to its staff. You aren't considered as a normal client, but as a guest to satisfy completely. An excellent Relation Manager takes care of all your needs and gives you extremely detailed information to make your holiday a success. The rooms are big and clean, with lots of complimentary stuff, the breakfast is very good and varied, the restaurant deserves a visit. I stayed there for 5 days with my family for holidays and we never found anything wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Old City Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: DougDoha
Reviews.Content: Just completed a two night stay at this Hotel during the month of April and really enjoyed our time there. The hotel is conveniently located to the key tourist sites, the quality of the hotel and room we stayed in was five stars, and the staff was excellent - always friendly and ready to help.

Reviews.Title: “Guest care at its best”
Reviews.Author: wok
Reviews.Content: Easy to repeat the many positives that this hotel clearly deserves. Consistency of warmth and helpfulness throughout our 3 night stay. Located in a side street, it may not have kerb appeal but that is forgotten once inside. Good Fish and Turkish restaurants (terrace would be an added attraction for drinks/dinner when warm. Staff speak excellent English and go out of their way to make helpful/knowledgeable suggestions. Take advantage of very good complimentary dinner and airport pick up (with 3 night minimum stay), daily afternoon tea and short guest programmes that include Turkish wine introduction and cookery class. Our standard room was perfectly adequately sized, well equipped, clean, quiet and comfortable. Some standard rooms may be smaller so it is worth checking when reserving. Location is ideal for most of the sites...easy walking and close to tram for longer trips.

Reviews.Title: “Will I return? Without a moment's hesitation!”
Reviews.Author: deborah1212
Reviews.Content: First impression: small hotel located in 'auto-alley'. Lasting impression: warm welcome, ever helpful staff. Location: I had no problem with the location of this hotel. Yes, it is situated on what could be described as Auto Alley (there were spare parts shops nearby) but this was a quiet street. The only noises came from the maintenance work being done on the wall around the Topkapi Park across the street. Views depended on which side of the hotel you were on. My room was bright and faced the park, nice views. Rooms on the other side maybe not so good and the importance of that depends on how long you want to spend in your room. Remember that if you feel a bit confined by your room size there are other escapes. The roof top terrace -a word of caution here â€˜the elevator doesnâ€™t go all the way to the topâ€™ is true in the literal sense as a flight of stairs stands between you and the great outdoors. For my last morning at the hotel- when I had it all to myself on a gloriously sunny day, there couldnâ€™t have been a more delightful place in the whole city. In the afternoon when you are tired from a day of sight-seeing, retreat to a very pleasant reception room in which apple tea and sandwiches are served. By evening you will want to try out the relaxing Hamam downstairs. Sitting in a nice warm room, whether or not you opt for a massage or scrub is always soothing. Sauna also available, and if you havenâ€™t walked off all that naughty Turkish delight provided in your room, a well equipped gym for you to use. There is a â€˜swimming poolâ€™, but that is more of a plunge pool to cool off in after your sauna. Sirkeci Konak is very close to many of the cultural attractions that you will want to see, my elderly mother and I walked to all of them. The terrain is not flat and cobbles are hard on the feet, so sensible shoes are a must. Transport: The tram is very quick walk away. The system is easy to work out, and the helpful hotel staff will explain all about this on your arrival. Size of room: This may be of concern depending on how much luggage you are travelling with. I am sure there are hotels will more spacious rooms in Istanbul, so if space concerns you, get an estimate of room size first. I have to agree with a previous posting that the room may be small, but in days gone by Iâ€™ve stayed in very expensive hotels in London that are even more cramped. Special touches: Look for a copy of the â€˜Sirkeci Daily Expressâ€™ on your breakfast table to let you know about happenings in the arts, nightlife, ideas for a day out, a couple of Turkish phrases or words, weather and also to check on which museums are closed that day. Great innovations: In your room-key folder you find a small piece of paper with Turkish Cultural Activities run by the hotel, usually at 5.30pm. I highly recommend the trip to the Wednesday 10.30am traditional market tour: this is where the locals shop for their necessities, not for souvenirs. And do learn how to play backgammon- its fun! Free wireless internet: in my room I was always connected to the web. Breakfast: traditional Turkish breakfast plus a host of cereals, bread, jams, fruit and juices. Cheese and sliced meats provide plenty of energy for the dayâ€™s activities ahead. The staff at Hotel Sirkeci Konak are extremely welcoming and helpful but also very professional. Will I return? Without a momentâ€™s hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “All was perfect”
Reviews.Author: triangle232
Reviews.Content: Two days in Istanbul AT The sirkeci konak. The breakfast wasn t unforgetable but The staff knows what guest means.... You can book it with closed eyes!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but I don't see what the euphoria is about”
Reviews.Author: dj_nr1
Reviews.Content: Currently, this is rated the nr 2 hotel in all of Istanbul, so my expectations were high. As most of the reviews are almost euphoric, I'll mention some of the lesser points : Due to the one way streets, none of the 5 taxis I had could either find it or get there (despite the map). The "on the park" location means it's next to the Topkapi park, which is surrounded by a 10 meter high wall, so park views are limited to high floors. The side street where the hotel is located is certainly not Istanbul's most beautiful. The room I had (2301) was tiny even for a single person (about 30 cm between bedside and wall). All in all, this is a good hotel, and you'll not be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute best!”
Reviews.Author: yotrustman
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here two separate weeks. We loved it so much we wanted to come back after renting an apartment. They are so friendly that upon our return it felt like coming home. The service was the best. Okay and Esgi took such good care of us. Esgi even went to the hospital with my wife when she was sick when we first arrived and stayed with her for 6hrs in Emergency. They were so kind to our kids and gave everyone presents when we left. The rooms were ample and clean. The beds were nice and they give you an option of pillows. The breakfast buffet was always fresh and the kids loved it. We also loved the little sandwiches put out at tea time. The location is perfectly set near a tram stop and walking distance to all the important sites. Getting around from this hotel was too easy and they were always eager to help with directions and advice. And don't forget about the Turkish baths downstairs. We traveled for 3 months around the world and the Sirkeci was the best hotel we stayed at--service, comfort and food. There is nothing second best about this hotel. I give it my highest recommendation and look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service defines this hotel - Top Notch!”
Reviews.Author: hillbillyexpat
Reviews.Content: This hotel could teach the art of customer service to other hotels. I just returned from staying four nights at the Sirkeci Konak in Istanbul with a group of four friends, and speaking only for myself, but the experience was definitely one to be treasured. From the moment the â€˜hotel-arranged-driver-and-vanâ€™ greeted us at the airport to when the driver dropped us off five days later back at the airport, the staff could not do enough to make me feel welcome and comfortable. They were always there with a smile and pleasant conversation. I had a superior single room which was spacious, very clean, and with a small balcony which overlooked the park across the street (part of the gardens of Topkapi Palace). The view to the right was of the minarets and domes of the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque, and to the left was the Bosphorous. The location of the hotel could not have been better. Fifteen to twenty minutes to the Grand Bazaar (yes, part of the walk is uphill, but itâ€™s not steep); 10-15 minutes to Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque; and 15 minutes in another direction to the water where you can hire a boat for a tour. The hotel is situated on a side street off the main tourist road coming down from Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace (less than a block). Breakfast was plentiful and tasty (and included in the price). Once out of the hotel, to the right half a block is a street full of fantastic restaurants and shops. Try the Faros Restaurant â€“ excellent food, and a â€˜little showâ€™ put on by the brothers who own/run the restaurant. Ask for Eddie as your waiter. Iâ€™m looking to return to Istanbul in July, then again in November; but only if the Sirkeci Konak is available.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: intrepidtraveler23
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were over the top in terms of doing anything they could to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. When we went by taxi anywhere, they even confirmed with the taxi driver exactly where we were going and the approximate cost (very helpful when you don't speak the language!). Our room was lovely, with a balcony overlooking a beautiful park and the water. The cooking lesson on Friday afternoon was great fun and we ate in the hotel one evening and the meal was excellent. Wonderful location for walking to many of the main attractions. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “great place. Very close to historical sites. Extremely friendly and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: borzoo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in an alley very close to the historical center of Istanbul. There a few hardware store in the alley which I donâ€™t find it an issue. The hotel interior is very authentic and nice and clean. Rooms are a little bit small but this is a historical area of town and everything thing is small. Staff and extremely friendly. I would definitely go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: peterNuernberg
Reviews.Content: Great location and very friendly staff! We definitly can recommend this hotel to all tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: v2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very well located, walking distance to all the sights in Sultanahmet and the tram, but tucked away in a side street, so the hotel was very quiet, away from all the hawkers and tourist traps. Felt very safe. The rooms and bathrooms were impeccably clean, and had all the amenities. What made the stay special was the staff. Everyone was very warm and welcoming, very helpful with directions, calling cabs, and even making reservations for us. Service was very personal. The afternoon teas were a welcome breather from frantic sightseeing, and energized us for further expeditions in the evening. The welcome dinner (while only so-so compared to other Turkish fare we tried) was very helpful for our arrival day, when we were still trying to get our bearings and did not want to go out searching for a restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great personalized service! I'll Go Back There Again!”
Reviews.Author: DiscoE
Reviews.Content: The first great impression I had on Sirkeci Konak was upon my arrival at the hotel and Dilhan, the manager, welcomed me warmly by name! Well, they obviously know who's arriving and when! I was very impressed by the personalized service the hotel gave me. My room was on the 2nd level overlooking the street. It was a little small, but as a solo traveller I was OK with it. Dilhan was kind enough, when I just checked in, to sit me comfortably down at the lounge and to tell me which are the places to go and what time are the best times to visit them. She even recommended me a few good restaurants to visit at night as well. All in all, not just her, but everyone from the chambermaids to the bellhop (who has a great sense of humour) and the restaurant staff, all made my 4-day stay there very memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff make this well...”
Reviews.Author: tardiswho
Reviews.Content: Fantastic staff make this well positioned, nicely furnished, clean, a must if you are going to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FritzL2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a two week visit to Turkey. We stayed four nights at the Sirkeci Konak. The other reviewers are spot on. The Hotel is great and the staff could not be nicer or more helpful. The rooms are nicely decorated and clean. They are not all the same size however. Our first room was on the small side, but adequate. The second room, room 2501, was larger and had a great view over the Gulhane Park and the City. The breakfasts are very good as well. I would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location,fabulous hotel and excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: sweepSouthYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Sirkeci Konak after being informed we had been upgraded from its sister hotel The Erboy a few couple of streets away.We were very pleased,especially after having our luggage missing our connecting flight from Paris and being told by the Air France staff that it could be up to 24 hrs before our luggage could be with us.On arriving at the Sirkeci we informed the guest relations staff Esgi about the luggage,who told us not to worry and that she would deal with any phone calls that would need to be made regarding the change of hotel and arrival of luggage.We were reunited with one piece of luggage at 10.30pm that evening and the other case at 1pm the following day.So after a bit of a wobbly start to the holiday the upgrade was a perfect antidote to the lost luggage. The hotel is the best we have ever stayed in.The room was lovely with a comfortable kingsize bed, free wifi, safe, tea and coffee facilities and a bowl of turkish delight. The luxurious bathroom with powerful shower had fresh white plush towels provided every day and even embroided flannels! Bath robes and slippers were provided also. The breakfast had a huge choice of cereals,fresh juices,yogurts,jams, fresh fruit,cold meats,cheeses,hot food such as veal, scrambled egg,boiled egg,pastries,bread with as much tea or coffee as you would like. We also had a couple of evening meals in the hotel ,again the food was delicious.The lamb dish was the best we had ever tasted,so tender. Finally I would like to mention the hotels staff,how kind and helpful they all were during our stay. A special mention goes to Ezgi Kepsutlu for being so helpful with the luggage problem and the advice she offered about where to go and how to get there nothing was too much trouble. We would most strongly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing ... the best ever!”
Reviews.Author: petethescouse
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a log weekend over Easter and have to say this was the best hotel experience ever. The staff were so helpful; nothing was too much. It really made a perfect holiday - wonderful. The rooms are small, but who wants to stay in the room! The Sauna and Turkish Bath were excellent, and the food fabulous. Location is perfect and everything is very very easy walking distance. On the last day all the staff turned out to wave us goodbye and the owner was on hand to check whether our stay had been good. What a perfect service. I cannot recommend this Hotel too much. It is OUTSTANDING and worthy of its reputation and awards. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with Outstanding Staff”
Reviews.Author: MDD3
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this wonderful hotel for 4 nights from 3rd to 7th April. All the good reviews on tripadvisor were true, the service really is outstanding. We were welcomed with a drink & lots of information on the city, after being met at the airport & transferred to the hotel. Our standard room was very good, very clean with good toiletries, bathrobes & slippers and tea & coffee facilities.The king size bed was one of the most comfortable I have slept on. We also had gifts of turkish delight, a bottle of wine & a lovely set of coffee cups in the room on arrival. The hotel is in a great location, we walked to all the major sights in the area, & took the tram to Taskim.The tram station is very close, & easy to use, 1.5 lira for any journey. We had a complimentary meal in the hotel restaurant on the first night which was excellent & also ate at Imbat, in the Orient Express hotel, & received a 10% discount, and the staff there presented us with a cake as it was our wedding anniversary. We used the sauna, pool & hammam which were very welcome after a hard days walking & sightseeing. All in all, an excellent few days. We saw all major sights, took the public ferry to the Asian side & also ate delicious fish sandwiches by the Galata Bridge. Have no hesitatation in recommending this hotel, please feel free to contact me if you have any questions about the hotel or the area, I will be happy to help. Also, contrary to some previous posts, we were never asked to post a review on tripadvosor.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ImranW
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Sirkeci Konak Hotel for four nights in late March, and we had an amazing time. From the moment we arrived at the hotel, we were treated like family. The staff were extremely genuine, and provided exceptional service. When we first arrived,one of the hotel's staff members gave us an overview of istanbul, and answered any questions we had. They provided us with a map, showed us where all the attractions were, and gave us useful information about each attraction (times of admission, best way to get there,etc.). The hotel room was very spacious, stylish, clean, and had free wifi. There was a letter from the hotel owner which provided us with his cell phone number, and advised us to call him if we had any problems or concerns. Sirkeci Konak provided a free complementary breakfast which was extensive, and had a large selections of breads, fruits, chesses, meats, and eggs. The hotel is located only 50 meters from the tram (Gulhane station), which is one stop away from Blue Mosque, Ayasofya, Hippodrome, and Yerebatan Cistern. Since we stayed for more than 3 nights, we were provided with a free 3 course meal at the Hotel's restaurant, Neyzade. The food was so delicious, that we decided to have dinner there on our last night in Istanbul. There was a fitness center, sauna, spa, and hamam on the bottom floor of the hotel. Upon leaving, my girlfriend stated that she loved the green tea. When the staff heard this, they gave my girlfriend a big box of green tea packets. This action summed up the exceptional service each member of the staff provided. We had such a great time at this hotel, and I will definitely say here next time I visit Istanbul. The service was top class, and I would highly recommend Sirkeci Konak to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “This Turkish Delight was the epitome of hospitality, warmth, service & great food!”
Reviews.Author: ZephyrFreeway
Reviews.Content: Our room overlooked the park and our view included a dozen storks swooping from the tree tops. The room was modern, clean, spacious and very attractive with a roomy bathroom & terrific shower. In our room was a letter from the owner of the hotel, inviting us to call his cell if we had any problems, impressive. We were less than 5 minutes from the tram for the Grand Bazaar/Spice Market, the ferry or Galata Tower. Access coins for the tram are available at the kiosk. Breakfast was open until 10 am for those who like to sleep-in but it was well worth rising early for the delicious spread. I wish they had this hotel in every major city.

Reviews.Title: “Location with a friendly smile!”
Reviews.Author: Rips
Reviews.Content: A perfect hotel! The location in the historical area is wonderful - we could see five of the major sights from our balcony. The deluxe rooms are great - a generous size, comfortable bed, super balcony and lots of little extras including complimentary wine and Internet and yummy Turkish Delight. The staff are out of this world! They are friendly and informative, nothing is too much for them, every time we returned to the hotel, we were greeted with smiles and a "how was your day?" They were able to recommend really good Turkish restaurants - all the food we had was delicious. The cooking lesson was fun - do it if you have time. If we return to Istanbul, this is where we would stay!

Reviews.Title: “Sirkeci Konak - Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LondonCath
Reviews.Content: Our long weekend spent in Istanbul recently was truly fantastic, thanks to Sirckeci Konak's hospitality. The welcome from all the staff, extremely comfortable room, wonderful assistance in booking day-tours and not forgetting the daily afternoon tea in the lounge area for all guests! We even received a lovely Easter Gift in our room! A great family-run-hotel. We wouldn't hesitate recommending it to couples, solo travellers and families.

Reviews.Title: “The personnel was superfriendly - you felt yourself "important"”
Reviews.Author: Onneli
Reviews.Content: No traffic noise Breakfast tasty and beautifully exposed Afternoon tea in the lobby together with the Guest Relations Attendants relaxing and useful (tips and good advice) - Congratulations with cake and gift on my birthday! Saunas and the swimming pool clean and nice - but we did not know what to do in the hamam (Turkish bath) - instructions on the wall outside the hamam had maybe helped? All the personnel was great!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Kenfaisey
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay at the Sirkeci Konak. Given the previous reviews we had very high expectations and the hotel still managed to exceed them in almost all respects. Rather than repeat the praises of the other reviewers I thought I would just describe the quality of the service we had from the hotel when we arrived in Istanbul at about 8.30 in the evening. As we were staying three nights we had the complimentary transfer from the airport. The representative was waiting for us on arrival and the car arrived a couple of minutes later to take us to the hotel. It was raining heavily that evening and we were not looking forward to going out into the city to find somewhere to eat. We needn't have worried. The front of house team sat us down, offered us a complimentary glass of wine and informed us that we also qualified for a complimentary meal in the restaurant. We were checked in, given maps of the area and the historical highspots and then shown to our room having been assured that the restaurant would still be open when we came down to eat. We arrived at the restaurant after 10 and were treated to a fantastic meal. Despite the fact that the meal went on to midnight and we had been the only guests there for the last hour we were allowed ample time enjoy the food. As a result of this brilliant reception we ended a long travelling day totally relaxed and both slept like logs in one of the most comfortable beds we had ever enjoyed. If you could package this level of service you would take it round the world with you. Well done to the fantastic staff and management of the hotel and thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best hotel ever.”
Reviews.Author: Roland49
Reviews.Content: Simply the best hotel ever. At 11:30 at night we arrived to a warm welcome from the night porter who offered us drinks and gave us a short introduction to the local area and street maps of Istanbul. Rooms were comfortable, clean and had everything you required. Wonderful buffet breakfast and the complimentary afternoon tea in the lounge became a ritual chatting with Faruk and his staff about our day and their recommendations for the next day. Meals in the restaurant were excellent and relaxed, we also ate at one of the hotels other restaurants, Pasazade and found the food and welcome just as good. All the staff were so friendly and helpful and wanted to make your stay special. Thanks once again to Faruk & all his staff. Bolton, England

Reviews.Title: “"Misafir" means more than guest, and that's how we felt at Sikeci Konak”
Reviews.Author: MadridMikelmadrid
Reviews.Content: Its very nice Ottoman style architecture, beatiful, warm and smart, combined with it's privileged and charming location in the Old City of Sultanahmet, inspired us in our visit to a magnificent and incomparable city. But this was nothing compared with the people working at Sirkeci Konak, they showed us that hospitality and kindness go far beyond what we knew, and made us feel "misafir". Back at home and after one week we still miss that people very much.

Reviews.Title: “Personal opinion about our staying”
Reviews.Author: Herbals
Reviews.Content: Excellent services, exceedingly friendly staff, nice memories taken home!

Reviews.Title: “This was my 12th time in Istanbul and the best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: alpaslan
Reviews.Content: Very warm welcoming hotel. My son and I stayed in the Sirkeci hotel for 6 nights in a big lovely and clean room , looking at the Gulhane park. This was my 12th time in Istanbul and have been in a lot of different hotels also in others areas of Istanbul , but here we feel directly at home. Very warm welcome, staff is amazing and are like close friends. EZGI and DILHAN,we love you. Also my turkish friends who came over for the weekend from the Karadeniz were cok cok mutlu The Neyzade restaurant and also Imbat form the Orient express hotel served interesting specialities from all the regions of Anatolia. Unfortunately I missed the cooking lessons. Every day the Sirkeci daily express with lots of tips. We loved the Picasso engravings at the Pera museum and also Istanbul modern museum. We will soon return !!!

Reviews.Title: “Everthing you read is true - Absolutely Excellent!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DBroon
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from an absolutely fabulous holiday in Istanbul. All the reviews about the Sirkeci Konak are true. The staff are warm, genuine and friendly. Nothing is too much trouble - they go out of their way to help in any way, no matter how small. From information on locations to visit, to places to eat, etc their valuable advice and help made our trip all the more enjoyable! The daily afternoon tea (simit) was a great opportunity as the staff encouraged us to talk about our day with them & the other guests. The rooms are a good size with a good sized bathroom, and we had no problems with the air con or outside noise. The cleanliness of our room was excellent and we were well taken care of. There were nesting herons outside our room which overlooked the Topkapi Palace gardens & we were not disturbed. The hotel location is outstanding within easy walking distance of all main attractions & a tram stop 2 minutes from the hotel. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone & will definitely use again when we return to Istanbul !!! Thank You to all the staff at Sirkeci Konak for a lovely holiday. Definitely memorable!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's all true, even a few of the critiques”
Reviews.Author: Tankster
Reviews.Content: I depend on Tripadvisor reviews when travelling to a new city, and when I read reviews, I read the gamut, from fabulous to terrible. And our TA friends are right again- indeed, this is one great hotel! The guest services are really extraordinary, and everyone on the staff seems personally interested in how the day went. Tea became a no-miss scene with my group- the perfect time to plan the next day as well as try to figure out where to eat. The staff is always available then, and the owner of the Sikecki group was very much in evidence during out stay- also asking how we were doing, helping with planning and offering very good travel tips. We thought the beds to be very comfortable, and the hotel and staff did an exemplary job at "predicting" what toursts need- lots of water, good maps and a substantial and fresh breakfast. They gave us good recommendations for food and shopping, as well as seeming to be quite pleased when we enjoyed something. All the staff had great pride in their city, and their country, and this was evident throughout our stay. It is true, these are not huge rooms. And you need to figure out how the ventilation system works.The street is quite quiet overall, but sometimes street noise can seep in. There are a good quantity of TV stations in English, but after all, this is Turkey. We loved our stay at the Sirkeci Konak, as did many of our TA friends. It offered the best of both worlds, the small, cozy and personal world of the B and B type place, with the amenties and options of a larger hotel (internet, pool, hamam and massage services etc). This is one of my favorite hotels in the world (okay, the Fazenda Barranco Alto in Brazil still has my heart, but different scenario...) and our whole group (husband and two friends) look forward to our return to Istanbul. Tankster

Reviews.Title: “Superb customer service & desire to please”
Reviews.Author: Allen-Chicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed with another couple for 1 week and were absolutely *wowed* by the service. The staff extend themselves in every way imaginable. The breakfasts are great. The location is very convenient. The owner introduced himself and made us feel very welcome. Free Wi-Fi in the lobby and rooms is really convenient. The restaurant provides a hospitable environment and great cuisine. The rooftop deck is wonderful, too. We recommend the hotel without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back - or as Arnold would say "I'll be back".”
Reviews.Author: carreradriver
Reviews.Content: A wonderful and charming hotel. You feel welcomed from the moment they greet you at the front door, and almost like a member of their family throughout your stay. Lots of smiles, very clean, a comfy bed, lots of hot water and a great shower - good location too, just a minute from a tram station and one stop away from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. (It's a very easy and enjoyable walk too.) A very nice Breakfast Buffet was included, and to my surprise, they even had Halva (or as I grew up with it, Halava - yummy). If you've never had Halva, you must try it - delicious. All in all, the bottom line is: Would I go back again? And the answer is an unqualified YES. It was a great trip and the Sirkeci Konak Hotel staff only made it better. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the hype!”
Reviews.Author: groovy_chicks_london
Reviews.Content: everything written about this hotel is true! From the housekeeping staff, through to the front office, nothing was too much trouble. Would return!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Excellent - warm welcome, great location”
Reviews.Author: loonytoons003
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay at if you are looking to visit all the attractions in the old town of Istanbul. You are just around the corner from the Topkapi palace, Hagia Sophia and the Sultanhamet mosque, as well as being a stones throw from the tram line that'll take you up to Galata and the shopping at Taksim beyond. This'll also take you to Eminounou where all the buses and ferries go from. The hotel itself is lovely, with helpful welcoming staff and an excellent 'wellness centre' where you can have a relaxing turkish bath, massage or a quick swim in the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel; really went to work for us during a crowded business trip.”
Reviews.Author: TR3
Reviews.Content: Wonderful boutique hotel with good food, spa, spacious room in a quiet neighborhood close to the Topkapi Palace, tramlines and ferry boat. Personal attention and service couldn't have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: GMarks
Reviews.Content: Travelled with some girlfriends for a birthday trip. The hotel although in a tiny side street was actually in a great location, within walking distance of some of the main attractions. The hotel staff were so helpful, they could not do enough for us, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, personable hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: LndyLAG
Reviews.Content: The location is in a side street, however, it is within 5-10 mins walking distance from the famous landmarks - Aya Sophya, the Blue Mosque and the Basilica Cisterns. The room is clean and well kept, has a safe for personal items. The beds are comfortable but there isn't a lot of storage spaces for clothes. Best features of this hotel: location - walkable to many different historical areas, very safe, and close to the tram stop - Gulhane. Clean rooms, good fitness amenities, good food. Meals: Free breakfast with lots of choices everyday - cooked breakfast as well as cereal, yogurt and typical Turkish breakfast food. Also has afternoon tea from 4-6pm. Served you great Turkish tea, with a small sandwich snack. They gave us a complimentary dinner at their Turkish restaurant - good food, reasonable prices. Unfortunately didn't get to try their fish restaurant, which is supposed to be even better! Personal touches: The best part is they have a Guest Advisor who comes around to introduce herself to all the guests and asks if they can help you plan or make reservations. Muge Osaky worked with us and she was GREAT! She gave us fantastic suggestions for restaurants and made reservations when needed and provide us with detailed maps to get us around. Amenities: The room has a great shower, shampoos, soaps, hairdryer - the usual. They have a fitness center downstairs that include a sauna, a small but decent swimming pool, and a steam room which is also served as an area you receive Turkish bath. We had Oktay as our masseuse - he was GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel--Personal Service”
Reviews.Author: Skrams2
Reviews.Content: Chose because of reviews on tripadvisor and glad we did. Great location and very friendly and personal service. Great buffet breakfast with many choices. The owner was at the property a great deal of the time and was very helpful in his advice. The front desk and other staff were always helpful and accommodating. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a briiliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: rdfTrip
Reviews.Content: Having done a miilion hotels around the world, the Sirkeci Konak stands out. Tucked away off the main road only minutes from the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque & Topkapi Palace, this medium sized hotel offers a wonderful welcome. We did a week there for business and pleasure and enjoyed every moment. Do the informal free afternoon tea and sandwiches with other guests and you'll get a great welcome & advice from Dilhan. All staff are very friendly & efficient. Both restaurants are excellent & good value. The rooms are fine and the pool/baths very good. Try cooking event in the kitchens. An excellent stay which couldn't be improved. We'd recommend to anyone on business or pleasure trips. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel In Every Way, A Wonderful Visit”
Reviews.Author: DukeWanderer
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the Sirkeci Konak hotel in every way. I had a 6 night stay that included free transport both to/from the airport (That was there waiting after a very long flight delay on arrival), welcome dinner on the first night. I was upgraded to a wonderful room on the 4th floor with a balcony, and Jacuzzi tub. I celebrated my birthday while there and the hotel gave me a cake and a small gift, along with a small going away gift when I left the hotel. To add a few comments that may not have been mentioned before, or where I differ. I think the hotel is in a great location, its less than 100meters to a tram stop and there is nothing wrong with this side street. The hotel is very small, the gentleman who helped me with my bags, served me dinner later in evening. The wifi worked great from the room and was able to use my Iphone/skype app combo seemlessly to make calls back to the US. Everyone was very helpful and would do anything they could to make the stay better. I liked that breakfast was served until 11:00am, Sometimes the 10:00 or earlier deadlines at hotels can be a little daunting if you really want to sleep in. I would strongly recommend this hotel as a great place to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: siobhanmuskett
Reviews.Content: This hotel met our expectations after reading reviews, yes you can believe the reviews. The staff, especially the guest relations and reception area people were extremely helpful and made us feel very welcome. The afternoon tea and what to do briefing were nice touches. The rooms are not generous(we had superior room which we recommend) but adequate and smart and everything you expect is there ie tea/coffee facilities, bath robes, pillow menu. Location is excellent for sightseeing, very close to main places of interest and Bosphorus ferries. The food in the hotel restaurant was good and better value than other places we tried(eg Amendros) and it was also good in the family restaurant. If you book through the hotel website, the discount for cash, discount for family restaurant, reduced transfer and dinner offer made it better value for money. We had a massage in the hotels spa area which was excellent and very relaxing. We took the Airport shuttle bus back to the airport for 10 Euros each(stall outside Haghia Sophia) which was excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: djakUK Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: very good service, good customer relations to offer an overview and directions. Great buffet breakfast, the best croissants outside France. Lovely comfortable bed, but very small bathroom. Good central location, easy to walk to main sights. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Sirkeci Konak is the perfect choice for Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: p0tter32
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the photographs as we wanted an upscale, boutique hotel with a turkish flair. We were not disappointed. This hotel compares to Prague's Golden Well. The room was beautifully decorated with a well appointed bath - the shower was to die for! Gorgeous common areas, a lovely view of the palace gardens, and exceptional hotel staff made for a perfect stay. Afternoon tea and visits with the hotel owner were a pleasant addition. Do not overlook the hotel restaurant for dinner! The Eggplant Pure Kebab, Baked Lamb Leg, and Keskhul were all excellent - our favorite meal in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Don't always believe the TripAdvisor Ratings”
Reviews.Author: Mangopops
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the TripAdvisor king! They really know how to get all the reviews in here. We LOVED the staff, this is by the far the best part of the hotel and if we could transport these people and their lovely service to another building it would be a PERFECT combination. I will rate this hotel based on "value for money". At 170 Euro per night, this hotel falls WAY below expectations. The rooms are TINY, with low ceilings and poor ventilation. There are limited amenities and hotel comes off with a "best western" type of feel. Does not feel like a luxury hotel at all. The bathrooms are nicely appointed but it does not offset the drab rooms. The location is good, in the heart of Sultanmet, but unless all you want to do is historical site seeing, you may be better off in a different area of istanbul. I would not visit this hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay - and a feeling of being genuinely welcome”
Reviews.Author: ArunHampshire
Reviews.Content: From the warm welcome at our arrival; to the helpful advice and booking of places to visit that would suit us best; to the thoughtfulness and friendliness of the staff, the Sirkeci Konak Hotel helped make our vist to Istanbul a straight 10 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Sirkeci Konak.”
Reviews.Author: Tati_G
Reviews.Content: In addition of being well located â€“ near the major historical sites, bazaars, and good restaurants; being clean; having an excellent breakfast buffet; having free tea and tea sandwiches for guests at tea time; and having a roof top terrace, the Sirkeci Konak Hotel has a superb staff who provide personalized attention to its guests. My husband appreciated having the comforts of home at the hotel: an orthopedic pillow, extra towels, and the â€œrightâ€� temperature in the room. The hotel staff provided every single thing my husband asked for promptly and with a smile. They even went as far as to let him come to breakfast 20 minutes early the day of our departure because he asked for it. We went away to Izmir and Ephesus for three days and when we returned to the Sirkeci Konak Hotel we received a warm welcome. We enjoyed the cooking class experience the hotel provided in its kitchen and the opportunity to interact with other hotel guests while we ate the food we had prepared. One couple told us that they came to Istanbul to celebrate their anniversary and the hotel staff surprised them with a cake to celebrate the occasion. We want to thank Mr. Faruk Boyaci, the hotel chairman, for talking to us at breakfast one morning and giving us the Turkish Table cooking book to take home with us after I expressed interest in cooking. Also, we want to thank the entire staff for being so competent, hospitable and professional. Finally, we want to thank the staff for very graciously saying good-by to us with a nicely gift-wrapped box of Turkish Delight. We were very pleased we stayed at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel; it made our vacation in Istanbul a real treat!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: Penguindad
Reviews.Content: We made reservations at the Erboy but moved to the Konak because of renovations. Location is wonderful, a few steps from the Gulhane tram (but no tram noise) and from most of the sights. The alley is a little seedy with store front auto supply shops and some street noise. Your choice of tourist restaurants and local eateries within steps. The staff was marvelous. Available but not pushy. The room was fine, but not exceptional. Breakfast was the best we had in 3 weeks of travelling. Afternoon tea was a delight.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL WITH FRIENDLY STAFF”
Reviews.Author: stevawin
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located near the Topkapi Palace. The rooms are clean, nicely decorated and the bed is excellent but the bathroom is rather small. Staff is very helpfull and very friendly Breakfast offers everything you could wish Wellness center is ok but swiming pool is very small.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, top end hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: TellSyd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sirkeci Konak for 4 nights in Feb 2010 and cannot praise it highly enough. As seasoned European city stay travellers, the hotel hit all the right notes: newly-refurbished; very good location (close enough to the Old City, but not right in it); excellent decor (modern with a hint of local); really good facilities for a city hotel (plunge pool, small gym, sauna). But the stand-out is definitely the customer service: the staff are so friendly and helpful. From the afternoon tea on arrival to dealing with each and every request quickly and efficiently. They even arranged flowers, a cake and gift for my wife, as we arrived on her birthday. Yes, the rooms are not huge, but it is a city centre hotel. Cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “a gem in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: madameswanLondon
Reviews.Content: good,honest service is how i would sum it up..fantastically clean bedroom with good quality sheets,pillows etc and bathroom well stocked good quality products and fluffy towels and bathrobes..extremely charming staff..the guest relations lady Dilhan was so so helpful with a genuine smile..she puts to shame a lot of those pompous concierge types you find in some 5 star hotels..book this hotel, i loved it all..there is just too much to say..the location is near all the touristy things. just go and stay here you will not be disappointed..very simple not at all grand but but 5 star service!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay, friendly and personal service but not intrusive”
Reviews.Author: Adventurer045
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights and really enjoyed every minute of it.The guest relations atttendants (Muge and Dilhan) made us feel very welcome.We were provided with maps and helpful hints for getting around the city.It was a great to get a complimentry meal on our first night there, which gave us time to get our bearings.In fact all the staff were always friendly and willing to help.The owner,Farouk Boyaci was always around to chat with guests.We mentioned in passing to him that it was our wedding anniversary and we were surprised with a cake and a gift later that day.Something we will never forget.The cookery classes were also fun..Don't miss out!! Great location, with easy access to all that you might want to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: archied
Reviews.Content: My first visit to this hotel, in spite of many trips to Istanbul. Expectations quite high given rave reviews on Trip Advisor, but the Sirkeci Konak absolutely justified the write-ups. Location very central. Benefit of being in a back alley surrounded by auto parts stores in that you're not pestered by carpet/jewellery hustlers on the way in. (Psst, you want fan belts? spark plugs??). Hotel itself is spotless, up to date and the staff are incredibly welcoming. The owner is frequently on hand and sets the tone that nothing is too much trouble. All very smiley and friendly in a nice way. Breakfast buffet as good/comprehensive as anything I've seen round the world. Free tea and snacks at 5pm ish very welcome after a hard days sightseeing. Dinner in the restaurant better than in many of the tourist traps that abound in Sultanahmet. Room good and well equipped including aircon. Small balcony with view over parkland and (just about) a glimpse of the Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelLondoner
Reviews.Content: I came for a short break to Istanbul and found the Sirkeci Konak a great base to explore from. A short walk to the Topkapi Palace and centre of town. Staff were impeccable, I arrived late at night but the reception staff were organised and efficient in making me feel comfortable and at home. I was treated to many delicious snacks as I made my way in and out of the main foyer and was always acknowledged leaving and returning in a polite way, staff only to happy to give advice or ask about plans etc. Breakfast was great, varied and I met several other solo travellers whilst eating so we could all meet up for dinner when it suited. Really pleasant stay here from start to finish. They have certainly got a good talent for making you feel at ease. Many thanks for making my stay so enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for the warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: DeluxSW
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my trip to Istanbul where I stayed for 3 nights at the Sirkeci Konak hotel. Initially I had made a reservation at the 3 star Erboy hotel of teh Sirkeci group, but as renovation was going on, we were transferred and upgraded to the 5 star Sirkeci Konak with no additionnal fees.Thank you very much! I congratulate the Sirkeci group for the excellent organisation of their hotels and their extremely friendly, helpful and professionnal STAFF. In particular, the two guest relation attendants are persons of special merit ! Many thanks to them. I only can recommend the Sirkeci Konak to everyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Delight!”
Reviews.Author: SampleTheCulture
Reviews.Content: Thereâ€™s a reason why the Sirkeci Konak is #1 on Trip Advisorâ€¦as soon as you enter the lobby, there is something crisp, special, and clean about the hotel - the fine lines of dÃ©cor, and friendly staff. We were welcomed to our spacious, bright â€œstandardâ€� room with a small tray of Turkish delight â€“ a nice detail. It was a large room in comparison to other Istanbul hotelsâ€™ standard rooms (we had also stayed at Zeynep Sultan and Pera Tulip, see reviews if you wish). Staff was gracious and eager to help. We received all the information we needed to find a Bosphorous boat tour with the concierge. The amenities and services provided with this hotel are spectacular. You are provided free transportation to/from airport, and if staying for longer than 3 nights, a welcome complimentary dinner is included! The food at the restaurant is superb. Afternoon tea time is the best; every day at around 5PM simit sandwiches (finger sandwiches made with a pretzel/bagel bread) and tea are offered complimentary for guests. Location is great, it has a pool / spa / sauna in the basement, it is clean, spacious and has a great staff. Overall, the best hotel we stayed at in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MrsOlive
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked into the hotel, we were made to feel special. Turkish people have a reputation as being very friendly and every member of staff in the Sirkeci proved this. Whilst checking in we were served the traditional afternoon tea (free of charge) and introduced to the area and activites by the lovely Dilhun who continued to advise us throughout our stay. Our room was fantastic, spotlessly clean with a big comfy bed and squashy pillows! with a view overlooking Gulhane Park. The hotel was perfectly located as many of the main tourist attractions, the tram and the ferries are all within walking distance. The hotel staff all made us very welcome and treated us like old friends rather than customers. This is a superb hotel in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Humanoid
Reviews.Content: Title sounds like advertisement, but it is true! We are giving every year weekend trip like birthday gift to each other, in the family. Usually in Europe - flighttime is shorter for weekend trip. Sometimes destination is completely surprize for birthday hero. This time we choosed trip together with husband for his birthday party. And we decided to travel to Istanbul for 4 days, along with 2 dauthers (21 & 11). We were searching many hours, reading lots of the Tripadvisor reviews. And wondering very high rating of the Sirkeci Konak hotel. Is it really true what people writing about this hotel? Anyway, they contacted very fast and confirmed the reservation by E-mail, we ordered then car to deliver us from airport to hotel. Our flight was late for one hour, but then everything went smoothly. Driver was waiting us with a sign and after 25 minutes we were in the hotel. Hotel staff was very cool, not as usually fake happiness faces. We had connected rooms with kids and very nice rooms, perfectly renovated, every millimeter was made with love and high skills, clean, fresh flowers in the both sides of the bed. Welcome note from the hotel owner with the direct phone number to his cellphone. Turkish sweets on the table...etc. So our stay in Istanbul started with pleasant stay in the hotel. Location is perfect, all the sights are on the walking distance away. We only used taxi once for driving to Taksim square and later back to hotel (10 euros one way). We used twice a hotel pool and sauna. There was also hammam - a turkish sauna. On the birthday evening we asked staff for some restorant with view to the city and sea, and they suggested for us nearby Sirkeci Group Hotel called Orient Express, and boy, it was really dining pleasure on the rooftop with the panoramic view of Istanbul, Bosphorus, Topkapi Palace and St. Sophia. Food was excellent and service superb. Such a good service is hard to find in the Europe and we have lot to learn from turkish hospitality. The best part was after dinner, when they suddenly turned off lights, and came to us singing "Happy birthday", with a cake and candles. We were very happy, everybody sang along and applaused. My husband was really surpirised and so was I, because I didn't wait that they'll come to the other restaurant to congradulate him. We were all very grateful for this kind of kindness. And when we went back to our hotel, a surprise was waiting in our room, more presents! We got turkish coffe-cups for 6 persons, and besides of that we felt that we are very appreciated and loved. Next morning, when the car brought us to the airport, there were three men from hotel personnel, waving us good-bye. :) That made us feel that we really want to go back. Amazing sincere friendlyness. We recommend Sirkeci Konak for everybody, and yes, all positive notes about it is true.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant City Break - doesn't get any better”
Reviews.Author: HowardoWestTotton
Reviews.Content: The hotel was first rate - the staff were excellent, particularly the lovely Dilhan Tatlisu the Guest Relation Attendant who was extremely helpful. There was none of the prententious nonsense you often get with 5 star hotels -indeed the whole experience was charming. The location is near perfect as it is within easy walking distance of all the major attractions. Although it is down a side street it is very safe & quiet - close by are an abundance of restaurants such as Home Made which we can thoroughly recommend. We stayed for 3 nights which was just long enough & flew with Easy Jet which was surprisingly good. Big tip - take the public transport ferry from Eminonu it is dirt cheap! For a 2 hour trip it cost approx Â£5 for both of us - take it after 10 30am when it is a slack time. What an amazing city - the sites are incredible!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Family Shared Holiday in Many Many Years!”
Reviews.Author: vintas
Reviews.Content: I shared a wonderful long weekend at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel with my three children. The point of our trip was to celebrate a 21st Birthday as well as visit the beatiful city of Istanbul. Each and every person at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel went beyond their call of duty to make our stay something to remember always. From the the Bell Boy to the staff at the Hamam one could not fault. We sampled everything the Sirkeci Konak had to offer during our stay and not once was something amiss. I found the Hotel after many days of serching on the internet and once found I handled everything online. Their staff are impeccable online as well as in person. Do not miss the little gem in Istanbul!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Charming”
Reviews.Author: momTraveller2010
Reviews.Content: I was about to book the Radisson Bosphorous when i came across the reviews about Sirkeci Konak on trip advisor and boy am I glad i did. The hotel was perfect. It is conveniently located within walking distance of many of istanbul's main attractions. The hotel is impicabilly clean (and i am quite a picky person). The staff was super friendly and accomodating. I travelled with my husband 2 1/2 year old daughter and when we arrived we were greeted by the guest relations who handed my daughter a kitten puppet and introduced us to the hotel and the surrounding area. The breakfast buffet (which came with the room) was excellent. The room was spacious and the amenities were top quality. The hotel had a number of offers including an 11% discount for paying in cash, a free airport transfer for 3 nights stay, and a free dinner on the first night for a 3 night stay. Even better all the rooms offer free Wifi. Istanbul is a beautiful city and the stay at this hotel was the cherry on top. It will definitely be my place of choice when i visit Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “unforgettable, Like a dream home”
Reviews.Author: amlsana
Reviews.Content: The Sirkeci Konak hotel was excellent, With kind, knowledgeable and helpful staff which had prepared a relaxing environment. I have stayed in many hotels in various countries around the world but haven't seen anyone like this. Congrats!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for a wonderful happy stay.”
Reviews.Author: jpossum
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my husband and 2 year old daughter at the hotel for three nights. They put us in a lovely big ( and quiet) room looking over the park next door. Dinner was on the house the first night which was just perfect with a young child in tow. My husband had a birthday the following day which the staff picked up from his passport. He recieved a lovely cake and a present and was very happy. Thanks for making us feel so welcome. Look forward to staying another time.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal staff, unbeatable location & extensive breakfast buffet.”
Reviews.Author: evansksa
Reviews.Content: Even after reading all the positive reviews of the Sirkeci Konak Hotel, it still managed to exceed our expectations. We felt like the hotel was big enough to include everything we could ever need, yet small enough to make one feel like a special guest. The location is within walking distance of all of the popular Sultanahmet sites. It is also conveniently located by a tram stop. Shopping, great food--everything--is right outside your doorstep. We stayed in a triple during our time in Istanbul. The room was mid-sized but very nice, with a balcony with an amazing view. The room (and bathroom!) was decorated beautifully, and all furniture was in excellent condition. The pool and sauna were a nice ending to a long day of sightseeing. They also have a gym and Turkish bath that looked topnotch, but we did not end up taking advantage of them during our stay. The welcome dinner we received free with our package offered many delicious options in one of their two lovely restaurants. We also truly enjoyed the extensive breakfast buffet, complete with actual honeycomb and Turkish delicacies. Above all, however, the staff is what makes the Sirkeci Konak such a phenomenal hotel. We were treated like friends as soon as we arrived--we were treated to tea and were given helpful information about the area. During our short stay of four nights, we began to feel personally attached to the staff. Everyone was so friendly and helpful, and each member of the staff seemed genuinely interested in our daily exploits. We would absolutely recommend this hotel and hope to return someday ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for a wonderful welcome”
Reviews.Author: jse993
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the most welcoming staff I have experienced for a long time - warm, friendly, good humoured and yet not intrusive. The rooms were comfortable and quiet and the food was very good. The pool, sauna and hammam were great. We were met by the hotel car at the airport. It was my wife's birthday whilst we were staying in the hotel, and I mentioned this in passing to Birol, one of the staff. On the big day, we were surprised and delighted by all the staff producing a birthday cake and a gift for her! Marvellous. Thanks to you all!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful!!”
Reviews.Author: nevermind2007
Reviews.Content: As a first time traveller to Istanbul, I had no idea what to expect at all - a true adventure! We were picked up by the hote's complimentary shuttle - a very comfortable van and made way to the hotel in sheets of rain but arrived safely and once we entered the doors of Sirkeci Konak, we instantly felt as if we were welcomed into a Turkish family's home. Immediately, we were asked to help ourselves to their breakfast buffet which was still on going. We hadn't even checked in yet. The buffet was a spred of fruit, yoghurts, nuts and dried frut, breads, meats, cheeses, and authentic hot cooked items. There is a never ending supply of Turkish tea (actually, its neverending throught the entire city!) Check-in was very personal and done around a table, with more tea as well as offers to make reservations anywhere throughout the city for anything that we wanted to do. The rooms were clean and decorated in traditional turkish colours and fabrics. Bathroom was updated and spotless - great shower and water pressure. Plush robes provided as well as TV, phone, and yes, more Tea. The beds were of decent caliber and comfortable. Our first night of the stay included a "welcome dinner" which we took advantage of. The food was decent and the service even better. The basement of the hotel has a pool as well as services for a traditional turkish bath "Hamam". We did not utilise this as the majority of our party decided to visit a Turkish bath house for the experience. I found the staff to beckon to our every need and do so with sincerity and a smile. This hotel was our first impression of Istanbul and was a definite positive one as well as a lasting one. Our departure was extremely early in the morning and knowing that we would miss the breakfast buffet, the staff had made sandwhiches for us to take on our journey to the airport. Sirkeci Konak paid attention to every detail and make my first visit one that I won't forget.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kroshka_enot
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our tour to Istanbul where we stayed 5 nights at Sirkeci Konak Hotel. (incl NY`` Eve). The location of the hotel is very central - all major touristic spots are in a walking distance, besides there are plenty of restaurants you may visit for a nice meal. Reception and guest relations staff were always helpful and answering all coming up questions. We enjoyed very much the 5 o` clock tea at the lobby area- apple tea, apples and bagels were always on time :) The breakfast offers a nice variety of fruits, cheese, ham, some hot dishes and pastry (was superb one )! Sauna, turkish bath facilities helped us being relaxed after whole day exploring Istanbul. free Wi-Fi in the rooms was operating very well. Besides we have visited free cooking lesson with the restaurant chef (held on mondays, fridays at 5 p.m.) and it was a nice experience of preparation traditional turkish dishes.. Our double room has been equipped with all necessary things (incl.mini bar, TV ), but it was pretty small one - there was not enough place in the wardrobe for 2 persons` clothes. The room temperature was to high, unfortunately aircondition was set to heat only, so we asked every night the reception to switch mode to cooling one (mode adjustmens are only allowed by staff ) or slept with open windows. Prayer at early morning didn`t bother us so much. to summarize all written - I don`t know if this hotel is really among the best ones in the Istanbul (as I has not been to others), but definitely its a nice hotel which I would recommend for accomodation there.

Reviews.Title: “great location withgreat welcome”
Reviews.Author: wilkeskeith
Reviews.Content: arrived on Dec 30th 09 late on for a 4 day stay in Istanbul for New Year. Staff were great, rooms were also great. Breakfast was particularly good. We went to meet other friends there who were also on holiday. These other 3 groups were staying in different hotels and it seemed that ours was the best of the bunch on discussion. partner was sick on the last day of our trip and the Hotel kindly let us check out at 6pm for no extra cost! Plus the staff were very helpful and took me to a nearby pharmacy by his own car so I could buy some medication for my sick girlfriend. Above and beyond the call of duty for a sunday and considering this guy was just about to knock off for the day. A great help. This topped off a great stay. The hotel definitely topped off the trip.

Reviews.Title: “A luxury home away from home”
Reviews.Author: RiyadhAzh
Reviews.Content: We went to Istanbul in July 2009 and chose the hotel through the trip advisor.We had no regrets about our choice. The hotel was located in a very good locality ,close to all the tourist spots.Rooms were clean and all the staff were very friendly and courteous. Breakfast was lavish consisting of different kinds of breads,cheese, fresh fruits and eggs. Not to forget the pure honey directly from the honeycomb and fresh juices. If we ever visit Istanbul again,Sirkeci Konak would be our choice again. We have brought back good memories not only of Istanbul but also of Sirkeci Konak and their friendly staff. We would definitely rate it 11/10!

Reviews.Title: “A better hotel will be hard to find”
Reviews.Author: buv1955
Reviews.Content: My wife and i have just returned from a 5 night visit to Istanbul and stayed at this wonderful hotel based on the reviews on Tripadvisor and we were not dissapointed. Arriving late at night and unsure of the public transport and location of the hotel in relation to the tram we pre-arranged for the hotel to pick us up from the airport at a cost of 25Euros (50 Turk Lira). When we returned to the airport for our journey home we took the tram at a cost of 6 turk lira for the two of us. The tram stop is 50 metres from the hotel. It was very simple and i can give directions if you care to email me. I was rather apprehensive when the driver seemed to be going down some seedy backstreets and i wondered what kind of choice i had made but all worries evaporated when we arrived at the hotel, the pictures of which are so adequatley shown on this site. The welcome was warm and friendly and so very informative. There was a customer relations hostess on hand to help us with vital tourist info and she and her colleague were invaluable to us during our stay. They were around all day and would help with any query we may have had. They booked restaurants for us, booked shows etc. Our room was roomy and very comfy. We were greeted with a bowl of fresh Turkish delight and a note from our chamber maid to the effect that we can choose different pillows if we weren't satisfied. The room had:- tea/coffeee making facilities flat screen tv, free wifi (this was superb) mini bar that didn't charge everytime you opened the fridge unlike some 4/5 star hotels. (We like to keep our chocolate, fruit etc in fridge). free bottled water, safe, sewing kits, shoe polish, shower cap etc etc . There was aircon but we didn't need it. The room we had had a little mini balcony which when we opened the double doors gave the room plenty of air and light. These windows are double glazed which is good as not all need the 5am call to prayer and this is well muted. The hotel breakfast was just the ticket (incl in price). Fruit, cheeses, yoghurts, breads, croissants cakes, cereals, hot food, eggs, jams etc etc. We ate in the restaurant at night and highly recommend it. I used the Turkish bath and Sauna downstairs which was great. There was a tiny swimming pool and fitness area which we didn't use. There was also a rooftop area which we didn't use. A nice touch was the free late afternoon reception the hotel laid on each day. It gave us a chance to unwind, meet the other guests and chat with the hotel about where to go next and share our experiences of the day. The hotel owner mingled with the guests and was a delight to meet. The hotels location is superb. Quiet as not to disturb but literally a 10 minute walk to the main sites such as Blue Mosque, Aya Sofa, Topkapi Palace. The tram stop as mentioned earlier will take you to Grand Bazaar or across Galat Bridge should you wish to venture up to Galat Tower and Taksim Square. All journeys are 1.50 turk lira (about 0.45p) In summary this is a great hotel and one of the most comfortable we have stayed in. I like staying in a hotel with a personal touch and this one certainly ticked all the boxes for us.

Reviews.Title: “nicest hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: BeckyJS
Reviews.Content: Charming, sincere, friendly and helpful staff; meticulously clean room; exceedingly central; delicious breakfast; lovely pool and hammam; free tea and sandwiches in the late afternoon; Turkish delight on your pillow... Just lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Well-located, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: LindaLL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for two nights, at the conclusion of a cruise. It was our second time in Istanbul, our first time at this hotel. We had a large upper-floor room with a balcony. The room was very spacious, clean and comfortable, and the bathroom was spacious with good water pressure and temperature. (I cannot comment on the size of the lower-priced rooms.) The location is within the old city, within walking distance to major tourist attractions. The tram is a very convenient and inexpensive way to get to other parts of the city, and the tram stop is less than a block from the hotel. One note about the location: some taxi drivers did not know the name of the hotel or the name of the street, and at least one was unable to find the entrance even when shown on a map, presumably because of one-way streets and traffic patterns in the area. The breakfast buffet was exceptional, with a large variety of both Turkish and "western" dishes. Other than breakfast, we did not eat in the restaurants. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful, and front desk staff are fluent in English. Having said this, you should not expect the elegant atmosphere of a Four Seasons or Ritz-Carlton with, for example, evening turn-down service. However, if you would like a very nice, friendly hotel near the tourist sites with a true local flavor, the Sirkeci Konak is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: aerosage
Reviews.Content: A cordial and personal welcome on arrival by the front staff, followed by a thorough, places to see, places to go and how to get there, guide-tour on several (pocket) maps of Istanbul's- they become yours afterwards. ( It is very likely that the level of attention you will receive throughout your stay at the Hotel will make you feel a special guest right from the start; I felt it, and judging from the reviews, I gather this is customary, yet, something that is seriously undermined both at check-in procedures and thereafter in the majority of chain hotels.) The hotel is exceptionally clean and the room we were given, which was facing the back, was indeed very quiet. Having been accommodated in a twin room, I found the room spacious enough for two people. (I agree that this description is relative.) The bed was comfortable, if you do not like the pillow provided you will have an option to choose a pillow (from a range of pillows) and request one with a call to the reception. (Example photos of a room you see on the web are what you will see when you arrive there.) Both the bathroom and the bath tub are indeed spacious enough to accommodate two people, but you should not expect to be able to perform wrestling- free style... for that you have to get a room with a jacuzzi. Some soaps in the bathroom were natural and made of olive oil. Flat screen TV on the wall- of course, in the living room. (You may say "this is standard"... Surely not... Many rooms at a 5-star hotel "Dan Panorama" in Haifa, in Jun/09 still had 90s box TVs, the same goes for Holiday Inn, Place Wilson in Toulouse, France. I was in both of them.) Breakfast was truly exceptional!... You can assuage your pangs of hunger with one (or more) from an en-suite variety of fresh cheeses (white/yellow), choices of salami, olives, fruits, sweets, yogurt, and cherry tomatoes. You will also find a selection of fried choices: sausages; scrambled eggs; boiled eggs. The number of bread types will please bread-lovers, together with croissant and mini simits - sesame seed sprinkled Turkish bagle.
