There was even a honey comb on a frame (as if taken straight from the hive). So, whether you aspire for a quick (cereal) breakfast, a slimfood one, or one that will keep you full till the afternoon tea there is an opportunity for all. In the afternoon, from 16-18.30, at the entrance lounge, you will find free refreshments comprised of tea, Turkish simit -bagel- and apples. The fish restaurant is worth trying and it is renowned. There is a PC-terminal with a colour printer, both of them worked (and I used them) and the latter always had paper in it- a point I cannot miss! There is a swimming pool, if you fancy a stroke or two, but I did not have a time for that. The hotel is situated within a minute from Gulhane tram stop, and within a walking distance from the main tourist attractions, starting from the Topkapi Palace, about some of which you will be debriefed upon your arrival. The neighbourhood is safe, crowded well after mid-night, with quite a number of souvenir, carpet and gourmet shops within 1-2 min walk. All in all, a boutique hotel, which will raise the bar of your positive experiences you have modelled from your stays at hotels or, it will set an unreachable bar for some time to come for the hotels you are yet to experience. If you can (afford) it I would definitely recommend it. All staff at the reception were professional, approachable and accommodating, but I would single out, Agah Alkan, for a special cordial thank you. One final point, which pleased me immensely and gave me a taste that I am coming home, though an expensive one ;), every time I entered the hotel. A point that I found quite unorthodox, when compared with 5-star-hotel tradition. Essentially, the door at the entrance is not an automatic door, but a manual one with a handle. It is a stylish door. So you enter the hotel like you enter your house. That was a surprise to me, but one I really liked. You are not anyone from the crowd of customers staying at the hotel, you are one that you will see they truly care about. This positive attitude is exhibited only when you deal with people who are passionate about their jobs, as well as professional. I hope your stay will be as memorably joyful as was mine.

Reviews.Title: “Best experience ever”
Reviews.Author: SinayLeicester
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly staff, comfortable rooms and delicious food. The hotel and the staff make you feel very welcome. It has been an amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, excellent service !”
Reviews.Author: Danny064
Reviews.Content: As it was my 50th birthday, I was upgraded to a room on the top floor. The room was excellent (huge, exceptionally comfortable bed) with great views of the gardens near the Topkapi Palace. The service at the hotel was excellent from the start with the chief receptionist Okay Alkan being as good as it gets! The breakfast was excellent and I would definitely recommend this hotel. My only negative comment is the view from the breakfast area which looked out at some untidy unoccupied shops.

Reviews.Title: “First class but friendly”
Reviews.Author: AlternaTrotter
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers fantastic service, but with a decidedly earth and human flavor often lacking in top-end luxury or business hotels. In particular, we recall one breakfast being somewhat disturbed by the howling of a stray cat outside the breakfast room door. Rather than running the cat off, one of the staff took out a few bits of food, quieting the cat and amusing the diners. The rooms are reasonable in size, although we found the bathroom to be very small. The tram line and one of the main streets is just a block or two away. Unfortunately, to get there it is necessary to pass a carpet shop with a persistent and aggressive salesman who is always out front, ensuring that any foray into the city begins with annoyance. On the positive side, when he hassles you on the way back, you'll forget about it soon enough after you've passed under the warm and welcoming sign at the hotel's front door. The breakfast buffet is excellent; the staff graciously invited us to partake even though we arrived four hours ahead of normal check-in time (they had a room ready for us as well). Our bags arrived a day before we did and the hotel kept them safely. We used the hotel's transfer service to two different airports and both drivers were professional and on time. We felt that the hotel had even more to offer than we had time to sample. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible reservation system that lost our reservation; rooms TINY!!!”
Reviews.Author: ChristyLund
Reviews.Content: Our initial reservation was made in March 2009 (based on such high Trip Advisor ratings) and, upon my confirmation in August 2009 of the reservation number they assigned to me, I learned that the hotel had changed computerized reservation systems and had "no record" of our initial reservation. So, I made another on-line reservation (per the sales rep, this was the only way I could reserve), and it, too, got messed up. So, when we arrived, there was no one at the airport as expected and we had no reservation!! They put us in a postage stamp-size room and then moved us the next day to a "sister" hotel of inferior quality. They were nice about it but our experience was HORRIBLE!!! The room at the "substitute" hotel was even smaller than the first room. Probably the worst and smallest room I have ever been in. And, to top it off, the busboys in the breakfast room at both hotels all had absolutely terrible BO, which was so bad, it ruined any change of a decent experience. I would never even consider staying at one of their hotels again. It ruined our entire impression of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Istanbul, especially with young children”
Reviews.Author: ladytraveler1973
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the hotel. The staff was unbelievably friendly and helpful. They were especially welcoming to our young children. The staff was very helpful in arranging tours and transportation - even negotiating a good rate for us when we wanted a guide! The kids had fun playing in the pool after a day of sightseeing but before dinner. The hotel is conveniently located to the major tourist sights and if your kids are too little to walk even the short distance, there is a tram stop about a half block away. The inclusive breakfasts were plentiful and wonderful too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Pcampana62
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Istanbul with my family and was surprised by the kindness of the staff and the conditions of the hotel: very new, clean, charming, not very big (I see it as an advantage, as you feel there as at home), very good located near the Hagia Sophia mosquee and the Gran Bazar, very well connected to other zone of the city (as Taksim) by tramway and public transport. The breakfast buffet is remarkable for its high quality. I will surely repeat this hotel in my next business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location near Tram Stop & all the Sites”
Reviews.Author: SteveG_9
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Attaturk Airport & we were met very efficiently, call on Intercom whilst we were queuing at Passport Control & immediately met after Customs with a Board indicating our Names/Hotel & a Handshake. Reception friendly, with the welcoming Chai/Apple Tea & Dilhan gave us all the maps/transportation guide. Room booked was the basic Double but we ended up in a 3 bedded twin on the 1st floor, probably this was better as we had more overall room. Bathroom Size fine & had everthing in it. There is no real view from lower floors, just the old ramparts into the Park, & other readers are correct, the immediate vicinity is not inspiring. Room also felt hot, AC controls complicated, so we preferred to open the Windows to cool down the room. Beds were comfortable. The Sirkeci is a small Hotel but benefits from this by a more improved direct personal service that this enables them to provide. Being small they seem interested in how our day went & this type of dialogue/banter is welcoming. We wanted to go to Prens Leather shop, when we arrived some national holiday meant the Grand Bazaar was shut, however the Receptionist called to establish when they would be open & pointed their location on our Map. On our last day the Receptionist told us how to use the Tram/Metro back to the Airport (only 3 TL per person!) & checked us in for our flight home & made sure that the Seats we had allocated to us on SWISS were what we wanted. He also recommended the real old Turkish Bath for us to use, Cemberlitas Hamami nr the Grand Bazaar, & gave us the pamphlet.. We both had a great time, you must really do this providing you aren't too bashful, it's the one open from 1584, so I suppose they must know what they are doing by now! Have the fresh Pomegramette Juice afterwards, it's really refreshing. I had left my razor at home, & whilst the Hotel would have supplied me with one, I preferred to go to the Barber Shop across the Street for a proper Wet Shave. Great experience that one chaps! Ended up having the "Full Service" & hey ho I really enjoyed it, went back another time for just the shave (was in IST 3 nights) & ended up chatting with the Barber about Turkish Football, our English Premiership & life in general. For you Footie fans he's Galatasaroy...... We had booked a 3 nite arrangement & took advantage of the AP pick up, the free dinner, & the 11% discount by paying Cash on arrival. You only get this by booking directly with them on their Web Site so it's probably worthwhile doing this if your arrangements are 3 nites or more. The Dinner at the Hotel was excellent & good quality presentation. We did venture out the other Nites, Orient Express, again excellent is around the corner, & terrace restauarant was nice although the view was spoilt. Emminou perhaps better for more local experience, we went to a Terrace restaurant to Kebab Restaurant again with just superb views all over the Goldern Horn. The spa area we used for 2 out of our 3 nites, nice Turkish Bath, fit for purpose to soothe tired legs after all the walking around all the Sites. Breakfast Buffet was excellent, lots of Hot & Cold Choice, but I'm not a Hot Buffet fan, I'm sure the Cook would fry you some eggs, perhaps the Hotel could have presented this as an available option. Us Brits don't always ask! The location is the selling point. You can easily walk to Sirkeci & Eminnou (Ferry Stop) or up a small incline to Sultanmhet where the Cistern, Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi & Grand Bazaar . Everything listed here European side is a 15 min walk, Tram rides are (1.5 TRY say Â£0.80) so public transport is Cheap. Go to Istanbul, I was celecrating my half Century & enjoy the Sirkeci, I'm sure you all work as hard as me for our Leisure Time!

Reviews.Title: “Guest house masquerading as a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler085
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms via the hotel website after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. We were very disappointed. The Sirkeci Konak is more like a bed and breakfast establishment than a hotel. We were given a free transfer from the airport on arrival as part of the package we booked on the internet. I was told that a hotel representative would be waiting, holding a placard with my name on it, as we exited someone called my name, I answered in the affirmative and the next thing I knew this person took my bags and started walking as fast as he could with my luggage without introducing himself, if it were not for the fact that I was travelling with my husband and son in law I would have been terrified, he took us to an unmarked vehicle and then proceed to drive like a maniac to the hotel without uttering one word and ignoring our questions. This was a very bad and scary introduction to the hotel. Can the hotel not afford to get their own vehicles? On arrival at the hotel we were greeted by Pellin and given delicious apple tea while check in was organised, I had specifically requested rooms on a high floor, but the rooms we were given were on the second floor, the room was really small, one of the smallest hotel rooms I have ever stayed in, the bathroom was even smaller, there was no way my husband and I could fit in the bathroom together, the walls were paper thin we could hear every time the people in the adjacent room used their bathroom or toilet and all the sounds that go with bodily functions. The room overlooked the street below and from 6.30 in the morning the noise started, shopkeepers opening their shutters, the hotel is located in a very non touristy part of the old city, surrounded by shops selling motor car parts. This certainly did not put us in a good mood, having our sleep disturbed by the street sounds. At night if a rowdy group of people walked on the road the noise would disturb us. The choice of TV channels was pathetic as they were mostly in Turkish. The thin walls meant that everytime guests in the other room used their TV the sound disturbed us. The location of the hotel is not the best, yes, it is walking distance to most tourist sites if you are very fit, the walk to the Grand Bazaar is mostly an uphill hike, would not recommend the hotel to older guests. On a positive note breakfast was very good with a good selection of hot and cold dishes, however on an extremely unpleasant note, Dilhan who I am assuming is the guest relations manager would come into breakfast every morning and greet the guests, on the four mornings we were there she made a point of greeting all the guests except my family, it was extremely embarrassing for us, on another occasion when we wanted some help with regards to the Bosphorous cruise she was extremely irritated by my request and assisted us in a very rude manner. Was this discrimination because we were non white? Pellin and Yogi were wonderful, however Dilhan's attitude left a very sour taste in our mouths, would I return to the Sirkeci Konak? An emphatic no! Would I recommend the hotel to my friends and family and other members of tripadvisor? Most definitely not!

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShellyR
Reviews.Content: Read other reviews and Paperboy from Australia pretty much sums it up so I'd recommend reading that review. This is a very good hotel but as Paperboy says, the rave reviews set up an expectation that is possibly very hard for them to live up to. Service was very good but the reviews do set the bar pretty high. Some staff definitely lived up to to the hype and some did not. The rooms and public areas are very nice but not perhaps the "WOW" factor we might've expected either - but that was more an artefact of high expectations I think. But very nice nevertheless. The location is near all the main tourist sites. However the area is really old Istanbul and at night not great. The street is populated mainly with shops for car parts if that helps. The streets aren't threatening in any way but a bit seedy and lots (and I mean lots) of touts that can get pretty pushy sometimes for restaurants etc. The Taksim area would be a more cosmopolitan area to stay perhaps if that's what you want and the public transport system very easy to use to come over to the tourist sites. The main restaurant at the hotel was pretty good but needed some more international dishes on the menu to keep it in line with a hotel of this standard. Overall, a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing has changed.”
Reviews.Author: Jaguar44
Reviews.Content: Our second visit to this Hotel. We found the same high standards and, most of all, the same level of hospitality from a team that do,really, care about their guests. There is nothing else to add other than we would not consider staying at any other Hotel in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “The customer service at the Sirkeci was the best that I have every experienced in my 65 years of travel.”
Reviews.Author: journey65traveler
Reviews.Content: After being on a plane for 13 hours and arriving at the Sirkeci at 6:30AM, check in was personal and efficient. The room was clean, average size , quiet and well appointed. The bed was comfortable and the pillows and linens were very nice. The breakfast buffet each morning was plentiful and delicious, but the milk for the coffee had a smell that indicated it may have been goats milk. The breakfast was a nice time to connect with other hotel guests/travelers. We ate in the hotel dining room 3 evenings and each meal was delicious with excellent wait staff. The 2 sitting areas in the lobby were comfortable and well appointed. We had a great time at the cooking class offered to hotel guests and the meal that we made and were served afterward in the hotel dining room was delicious turkish food. I can not say enough good things about the entire hotel staff. There were very attentive to every detail and need of ours during our stay. The most amazing occurrence was when a staff member offered to accompany us back to a money exchanger that had cheated us out of 15 euros. He talked with the man at the window and got us the money that we should have received in the first place. This service was a great surprise to us and very much appreciated. All the staff was knowledgeable about the area and readily took the time to give directions, answer questions and make suggestions about practical matters and sightseeing. The location of the hotel was within walking distance of most of the top sight seeing attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Best boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: FussyShopper
Reviews.Content: If you prefer a boutique hotel I highly recommend staying here. We are seasoned travelers and were so impressed with the service. When you walk through the door, a representative sits your down with a beverage of your choice and talks to you about the area (which is in the heart of the old city) and the hotel itself. Their restaurant and sightseeing recommendations were fantastic; and they arranged everything. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff. The buffet breakfast is good - very European. The rooms are clean and very nicely appointed. I can't say enough about our stay at this hotel. If we get back to Istanbul, we will stay at the Sirkeci.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant staff.”
Reviews.Author: jkhmross
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights in this charming hotel. The staff was outstanding providing excellant recommendations for dining and sight seeing. The hotel is conveniently located withing walking distance of most, if not all of some of the best sights in Istanbul and convenience to some great restaurants. Some rooms over look the palace park and have views of the Bosphorous. Its also right next to the local tram line. Highly recommend this hotel and hope to visit again soon.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect boutique hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AnonymousGuernsey
Reviews.Content: The staff are extremely friendly and polite. Nothing was to much trouble. We do not usually have dinner in the hotel we are staying in but here we dined in on two of our five nights as the food is excellent. They have two dedicated people responsible for Guest Relations. They are always there to help with site seeing, restaurant selection etc. Afternoon tea is Included in the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother looking elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Docs-DandG
Reviews.Content: My wife, son age 17 and I had a wonderful stay in this hotel. The staff is wonderful and made us feel very cared for. The welcome was the warmest we have experinced in many years of travel. Like many guests we felt part of a temporary family but not overwhelmed by the staff at any time. The owner, Faruk, gave our son an unexpected gift of a book once he discovered his interest in the classical world. This level of kindness and attention continued throughout our stay. The meal on the first night was free having booked on the internet and was some of the best we had. The room was very clean and the beds/pillows were very comfortable. The hotel is situated within a ten minute walk of all the main sites in the Sultanahmet area. All staff were very helpful with booking restaurants, making phone calls for us, and advising on travelling around the city. Great breakfasts. Pick up from airport all organised for us. Good turkish steam room too. We would have no hesitation in returning to this hotel. Our stay in this hotel helped make our stay in this city even better then we had expected.

Reviews.Title: “I figured out what makesthis hotel so great”
Reviews.Author: upgraded
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending 6 nights at Sirkeci Konak Hotel. I booked based upon the reviews in Trip Advisor. The rooms themselves are not very special.But its as if the hotel took a survey of tourists and asked them what they mosted wanted in a hotel and then did it. For example, they charge the same for an airport transfer as a cab cost, someone always available to answer your questions, free wi-fi that actually works, the free afternoon tea, great breakfast included, 11% discount for paying cash, free airport transfer and dinner if you book for 3 nights or more. super clean, and wonderful beds. I had requested a deluxe room at booking but one was not available. Upon our arrival we were told that one had become available. I was shown both the deluxe and the regular room. The deluxe would be about $1000 more so I stuck with the regular one figuring that we wouldn't be spending too much time in the room. We stayed in room 1206 which was very nice except that the street below was very noisey. I would without a doubt stay there again. It made us feel like we had family in Istanbul that was watching out for us and who really cared how our vacation was going. We thought that the neighborhood was very safe.

Reviews.Title: “THANKS TO THE STAFF”
Reviews.Author: basilsboss
Reviews.Content: A great hotel, well located with excellent staff. Treated my husband to Fizz, cake and a gift for his birthday. Thanks for making our weekend extra special. Would recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hidden jewel”
Reviews.Author: Beachb214
Reviews.Content: Taking the recommendations from Trip Advisor, we booked 3 nights at the Sirkeci Konak and we could not have been more pleased. This boutique hotel is actually larger than it seems at first but is still quite intimate and homey. The staff tries hard to please you. The standard double room was quite comfortable with a great bed - my wife is not easy to please when it comes to hotel beds but she slept like a baby. The European breakfast was excellent and I soon became addicted to the fresh yogurt with honey from the standing honeycomb! We ate at both restaurants and found them both excellent. In fact the fish we had at the hotel restaurant was every bit as good as that at the specialty seafood restaurant. The extra amenities added excellent value to a reasonable hotel, including free wi-fi, turkish bath, pool & sauna, tea time, complimentary cooking lessons followed by a light meal, complimentary dinner and airport transfer. And the 11% cash discount saved us $100! And with the location, you really can walk all over the old town, with Tapkapi, the Blue Mosque, and Ayia Sofia right up the street. We hit Istanbul at the end of a two week itinerary-jammed cruise and it was a welcome respite. An example of the staff going above and beyond came when, after two days of rain, my jeans had become water-logged and muddy. The laundry bag states very clearly that there is no service on Sundays but we were leaving on Monday so I inquired about a laundromat in the neighborhood. The manager told me not to worry and to bring him the jeans. Literally two hours later my jeans were delivered back to my room washed and pressed. The only down side to the location is the appearance of the street which seems a bit sketchy but it actually quite safe at any hour. If we find ourselves back in Istanbul, we will definitely be staying at Sirkeci Konak.

Reviews.Title: “Without Question, The Best in Old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: jpsNewYork
Reviews.Content: As you can see from all of us reviewers, this hotel is something special, from room comfort to food to location within walking distance of a number of Istanbul attractions. But the most noted quality is the friendliness of the staff. Whenever you enter the lobby they are there to assist. I remember particularly Palen, the young lady, and her newly appointed cohort who had just transferred from the restaurant area. Both of these ladies were helpful at all times. I keep kicking myself for not taking a picture as we departed: They were all lined up at the door, even the hotel owner, to see us off in a cab to the airport. This is Turkish hospitality at its most memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves is top billing. Excellent in all respects.”
Reviews.Author: kissthesunsetpig
Reviews.Content: Smashing little boutique hotel, that stands out because of its wonderful staff. Location is great, if a little difficult to find at first as Sirkeci is something of a maze. No more than a few minutes walk from most of the sites, and easy access to the Galat bridge. I wasnt in the hotel long enough to put it to the test, but every contact i had with the staff was excellent. I can well believe the many glowing reviews elsewhere on this site. A special word for the breakfast though- wonderful buffet with even a whole fresh honeycomb!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ele17
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been a fantastic surprise: a boutique accommodation in the hearth of the old Istanbul, just in front of the Topkapi entrance. Fantastic breakfast, excellent service: at your arrival an hostess greats you and is available for any possible question you may have. Definitely reccomendable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service from a team that really cares!”
Reviews.Author: citybreaksarefun
Reviews.Content: Superb staff greeted us as we arrived and detailed what to do and where to go in the city, including which sites were open/closed on certain days - all this whilst being served an excellent complimentary tea. Our room, a deluxe double was very spacious, very clean, and well furnished, with complimentary fresh fruit, water and turkish delight as a bonus. The hotel is extremely well-situated, next to the archeological museum, Topkapi palace and very close to a tram station for easy access to other sites of interest. The staff always greeted us with a welcoming smile and made us feel special. There is a swimming pool and fitness centre too, which is well equipped. We highly recommend this gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “an absolute gem”
Reviews.Author: calico09
Reviews.Content: after happy days of sightseeing, we so enjoyed returning to this delightful oasis in the fascinating, bustling, beautiful, historic city that is Istanbul we chose this boutique hotel after searching online Travel suggestions & being very impressed with Tripadvisors rating & the excellent reviews. we were NOT disappointed.. The hotel was superbly located with extremely helpful & friendly staff & our lovely room overlooking the Topkapi Gardens was truly special. we left the city with wonderful memories & a warm affection for the Sirkeci Konak Hotel - certainly hoping to return.

Reviews.Title: “Sirkeci Konak is Very Good.... but not Amazing”
Reviews.Author: thepaperboy
Reviews.Content: Had a very enjoyable 5 nights at Sirkeci Konak. It's hard to fault - good location, clean attractive rooms & helpful staff - but I guess after reading a string of glowing reviews, I was perhaps hoping for a little more of a "wow factor". It met my basic expectations in terms of a well run 3-4 star city hotel. Room (a standard) at the rear of the hotel was quiet and clean, but reasonably small with no view to speak of. Good water pressure. Wi-fi was free and reliable. Public spaces are nice, but reasonably generic. The rooftop terrace would be very pleasant in warmer weather. Breakfast buffet was decent without being fantastic. The restaurant entrance also doubles as the servery area, making it quite congested at times. Had one dinner (complimentary) at the restauarant, which again, was good without being memorable. Took advantage of the offers promoted when booking direct through the hotel web site - 11% cash discount; free dinner; free transfer (when staying 3 nights or more) which helped improve the value. Staff were really nice and always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The friendliest Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BobB53
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights in October. The location is fantastic being right next to the walls of the Topkapi Palace, right in the middle of all the historic attractions and only 50 metres from a tram stop. The staff were as friendly as you could ever hope to meet. The rooms were good and breakfast was good. There is also a small pool and spa in the basement. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute delight”
Reviews.Author: Londontraveller01
Reviews.Content: Everything you will read on this site is true. A truly delightful hotel, and some of the best service and most helpful staff we have encountered anywhere. Superb location and extremely comfortable rooms. A real treasure.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable clean and relaxed atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: LondonSjm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my Mum after train travel across Europe and booked on Trip Advisor recommendations. Little bit pricey but you definitely get what you pay for. Small but clean and comfortable rooms with great service from the staff. Basement pool is small but the turkish baths surprisingly spacious. Breakfasts were lovely with a wide selection catering to all tastes. Great location for all the sights in the old quarter and easy access to Sirkeci Station and the ferries to the Golden Horn and Bosphorous. Good mix of nationalities and ages - although no children when we were there. We were given a complimentary evening meal in the hotel restaurant and can definitely recommend eating there. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Friendly - Close to Attractions”
Reviews.Author: Brockles
Reviews.Content: The hotel had arranged the transfer from Ataturk Airport, which took about 40 minutes and was comfortable and effortless. On arrival, we were greeted by friendly and helpful staff, provided a complimentary drink, free maps and offers of help during our three night stay. Try to get a room on the 5th (top) floor. These have terraces and views of the Bosphorus as well as the gardens. Rule of thumb guide - the lower the floor, the lesser the view. Dinner in the hotel, provided free on the first night, was really excellent, with no restrictions on what we could select from the menu. Turkish wine is quite expensive (high taxes), but we found the Egea Cabernet & Merlot to be of high quality. The room and (smallish) bathroom were both clean and very comfortable, with a choice of pillow types. There was free Wi-Fi - ask reception for the Code. The breakfast buffet was plentiful with a good selection on offer. Most of the attractions are within a 5 - 15 minute walk. We found the Topkapi Palace was the most interesting place to visit (but avoid changing currency at the entrance), followed by the Bazaars. Not much hassling either, but beware the usual 'Carpet traps'! If Marakesh scores 8/10 for hassling, then I would mark Istanbul at 2/10. The people are genuinely friendly for a city with a population of 17 million, and seem to want to practice their English, chatting to you in the street without any ulterior motive other than to be helpful. We found this a pleasant surprise, and one we did not expect. If you complete the sights with time to spare, ask reception to arrange a half day boat trip, which was well worth doing, providing a whole new dimension of interest. If you can arrange to pay your bill in cash, you can get a considerable discount. Our bill was shaved by 11%, which would be worth making a few trips to the plentiful ATMs. This was a highly enjoyable - even relaxing - stay at the Sirkeci Konak. Thank you TripAdvisor for the No. 1 ranking, which made our choice so simple, and was confirmed by our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: provatejet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sirkeci Konak for four nights in October and really enjoyed it. It is a lovely hotel, very clean and well kept; the staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. Breakfast is excellent with a large choice of food; in the afternoon between 16:30 and 18:30 tea and simit (lovely bread sandwich) is provided in the lobby and is complimentary. There are two restaurants - one dedicated to fish and the other multi choice. The food is very, very good and the service is excellent. The Turkish wines are excellent too. We would recomment this hotel to anybody and would like to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Sirkeci Konak Hotel lived up to my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: bobbi-bbc
Reviews.Content: My traveling companion and I stayed here in May 2009 for 4 nights. We had a room with twin beds and windows overlooking the street. I liked the decor of the hotel and the spacious lounge area on the ground floor, as well as the ground floor dining area and the rooftop terrace. Beautiful tile work and furniture adorn their public spaces. Since we stayed more than 3 nights, we were able to take advantage of a complimentary ride from the airport to the hotel. Our plane was late in arriving, but our ride was there waiting for us. We also received a complimentary meal in the main dining room. There was just a short wait to check in, so we relaxed with cold waters that were offered to us, checked in, which went very smoothly, then taken to our room. Our room was very clean and comfortable- good beds and pillows, roomy enough. I would have liked the bathroom to have been a little bigger; it felt cramped and there was very little shelf space. The shower had good water pressure and the water was hot so that made up for shortcomings of the bathroom. The breakfast buffet was fully stocked with hot and cold choices of food items and it all tasted very good. I loved the rooftop terrace, not only for the views, but also for the dining experience it offered. They serve drinks on the terrace also. We had a seafood meal one evening which was very good. There was one computer on the ground level for people to use, but I never had a problem with other people using the computer when I wanted to use it. I liked the location of the hotel because it was near all the major sites and within walking distance. This hotel was a little bit of a splurge for us, but it was worth it to me. It's the little things that made it so- the staff offering shawls on a chilly night while enjoying the rooftop terrace- being so prompt in bringing us ice for our drinks- and not just a few cubes, the friendliness of the staff. They allowed us to leave our Istanbul purchases with them while we traveled around Turkey and we collected our things when we returned 10 days later. I liked the size of the hotel. It was a small, intimate place to stay in a quiet location, so it didn't have that typical hotel feel about it. I loved it here and would definitely go back for the comfort, great location, friendly and helpful staff, rooftop views and great dining. If I'd had more time, I would have taken advantage of their spa offerings- next time.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: PolarBeech
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough to praise the Hotel Sirkeci Konak. My wife and I arrived in Istanbul after a one week Windstar cruise from Athens - it was our first time in Turkey. From the moment we walked into this hotel, we felt like we were at home with family. Not only was it a lovely place, with very nice rooms and public areas, but it was in a fantastic location for seeing the sites of old Istanbul by foot. What really made this hotel stand out, however, was the service. Every evening we chatted for fifteen to twenty minutes with one of the two guest services women, mostly a woman named Palin. Palin took a genuine interest in how we had enjoyed our day, and gave us enthusiastic advice about what to see and where to eat. She obviously enjoyed her job, and it was a pleasure to chat with her; her advice was excellent to boot. Twice a week, they provide a Turkish cooking class, gratis, to hotel guests. It was a great experience, and we actually were involved in the preparation of the food. We came away with some great memories, and a couple of delicious recipes. The entire staff were wonderful to us, and we felt like we were leaving our friends when we finally had to go. I cannot imagine a nicer way to experience this fantastic city that a stay at the Sirkeci Konak. BRAVO!

Reviews.Title: “Sirkeci Konak made our trip in istanbul extra special”
Reviews.Author: elkl
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 3 nights recently. this is truly a maginal boutique hotel as reviewed by others. it is situated in a central location off a quiet street. we arrived late about 8pm after a tiring day, were immediately greeted by friendly staffs. Nothing was too much trouble. we had to wait for 10 mins before the room is ready and were brought to a longue (very noce ottoman decor) and drinks offered. we were then brought to our room, found a welcome surprise of Turkish delight on the bed. The room is warm , cosy and spotlessly clean. Free wifi service is available. Oh, and there's georgeous selctions of breakfast. you have to try the veal bacon when it's available. we moved on to different hotel(pre-booked) to get a different taste of Istanbul for another 2 nights, and only wish we have stayed on in Sirkeci Konak. Everything is top class and it'll be our choice when we return to Istanbul! Special thanks to each of the staffs there!

Reviews.Title: “HONEYMOON HEAVEN”
Reviews.Author: james09173
Reviews.Content: Of all the hotels I've stayed in, the Sirkeci Konak is by far the best. My wife and I spent 4 nights here during our honeymoon and it was worth every penny! On arriving at the Ataturk Airport, a driver sent from the hotel was already waiting for us. Upon arrival at the hotel, we were sat down at reception and given the usual information and a handful of really good maps and brochures. Afterwards we were shown to our room, a deluxe room with a balcony (Room 1407). The room was absolutely immaculate. I felt like I was a Turkish movie star with a lavish apartment in the center of the city. We arrived late into Istanbul that night, but we still decided to redeem our free dinner coupon at the in-hotel restaurant. However, we didn't eat from all the courses as we weren't too hungry after all our travleing around. It was a wonderfully kind gesture that the people at the restaurant there allowed us to redeem the coupon at a later date when we would have more of an appetite. A few other pluses: --Breakfast was included with our room and has a very great variety, not just in foods, but in hours of service, as well. You could wake up at 1030am and still make it in time for breakfast. --Wireless internet was complimentary, the way it should be at a nice hotel. --Turkish delight, a fruit plate and bottles of water in the room, free of charge. --Free use of sauna, turkish bath, swimming pool and weight room. The staff--to include the housemaids--are extremely helpful and very humble, not looking down their noses at you like in some other European hotels I've been to. The location is second to none, within short walking distance of Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, Haghia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. A good travel tip: If you follow the metro lines you won't get lost as easily. It's once you start wandering into alleys and side streets that you get disorientated. Finally, today we experienced the fastest, most efficient hotel check-out ever. Within 5 minutes of calling reception and informing them that we would be checking out, we were already in the taxi and on our way to the airport! Oh yes, we will definitely be staying at this hotel again whenever we're in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “# 1 hotel ranking in Istanbul by fellow travelers is true”
Reviews.Author: dividendo
Reviews.Content: Awesome location just minutes away walking from all the attractions in the old city. Delicious breakfast included. Super nice staff. Very good dining recomendations. Plush rooms and bathrooms. Hats off!! Keep it up!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for few days in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: DerbyshireTwoBobs
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Istanbul, so I thought I'd go with the top choice of TripAdvisor reviewers and I wasn't disappointed! Superb location close to the "must do" sights of Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace (hire your own guide here - much more illuminating) etc, plus the unusual but highly recommended Basilica Cistern. The hotel staff are amazing - so helpful with suggestions for visits and restaurant bookings, I've never met more pleasant and courteous people. The breakfast is a gargantuan and infinitely varied feast - if you take an hour over it you'll be fine until evening dinner! Any down sides? Only one - we'd set aside a couple of hours for the grand bazaar but hated it after a few minutes because of constant badgering by shopkeepers. The streets between the bazaar and the spice market are much more interesting and a lot less hassle. If you're pushed for time as we were, I'd also recommend the hour and a half TurYol trips up the Bosphorous - you still get a taste of it all but don't need to take the whole day as you do with the longer cruises. Once again, the Sikeci Konak is a wonderful base from which to explore this fascinating city - I can't praise it too much!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel near Sophia and Blue Mosque”
Reviews.Author: Armchairtraveler
Reviews.Content: The Sirkeci Konak lives up to its top rating in Istanbul. We spent four days touring the city from the hotel, which is located on a quiet narrow street just minutes away by foot from Santa Sophia and the Blue Mosque. From the time we were greeted by Guest Relations Manager Pelin Nasoz and her stall unhtil we left, we felt we were welcome guests. Not only is the hotel located near the heart of Old Istanbul, but it is just a few hundred feet from a streetcar stop, located quietly around a corner.

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: julirk
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel from the moment we stepped in the lobby. After being welcomed by Pelin with maps, cay and simits, we went to our room. We loved the traditional ottoman decor. Our room had a large balcony that overlooked Gulhane park and the Bosphorous. All the staff was warm and friendly, helping us with anything we needed. From helping us bubble-wrap ceramics to send home, to directions around the city, they were great. The breakfast buffet was fabulous and very turkish and a great start to each morning. My only regret is we didn't spend enough time there! We will definitely be back to this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jgm9549
Reviews.Content: Best location, great service, lovely rooms, awesome breakfast, would recommend to everyone traveling to this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Best honeymoon in Turkey!”
Reviews.Author: FernandaMaria
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Sirkeci Konak for four nights in our honeymoon and recommend it! The hotel is brand new and very charming, with Ottoman decor. Our room was spotless, had wi-fi, flat-screen tv and a thub (not all standards have one, so ask in advance). Service was incredible: great staff, complimentary pick-up at the airport and three-course dinner (don't forget to order the "meze plate" to begin your Turkish gastronomic experience). Breakfast was also excellent, with all sorts of bread, cheese and fresh honey. Location is great for sightseeing, most major attractions are within walking distance. If you take a taxi to go out at night, ask the reception to call it: the drivers from most taxis we took at the streets tried to cheat on us by charging ridiculous prices. Apart from that, our stay in Istanbul was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience!”
Reviews.Author: Sbarleva
Reviews.Content: After being picked up by the hotel from the airport, upon arrival, my boyfriend and I were treated to delicious apple tea and little sandwiches while the concierge sat down with us and explained everything about the city and answered all of our questions! We were then taken to our room which was clean, spacious, quiet and gorgeous and had a little plate of fresh Turkish delight :) one word- AMAZING!!! Everything that our heart desired was brought to us and I can saftely say that the staff went above and beyond any other hotel (not even the Ritz!) and with a most pleasant and helpful demeanor! The breakfast buffet was wonderful and scrumptious, the Turkish bath was super relaxing and I strongly recommend the peeling- I felt truely clean like having a new skin! There is no doubt that we will be staying at Sirkeci Konak again and they deserve 7 stars if it was possible! Everything was perfect- EVERYTHING!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in the perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: TandMA
Reviews.Content: We were impressed by this hotel from the moment the taxi door opened. We were warmly welcomed by everyone from the door to our room to the restaurant. Nothing was lacking in their approach to impeccable service.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: sabbin
Reviews.Content: Make sure you visit the Taksim area at night. It is like no other area I have been to.

Reviews.Title: “excellent, deserves its high rating”
Reviews.Author: DocRB
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent choice. The management is among the best that I have ever seen, super friendly, super helpful. It's an old hotel but well maintained. The location can't be beat. (From Tram stop, less than a minute walk. Walk along the stone wall in direction of Golden Horn and don't turn with the tram tracks, keep right at the Y). Breakfast excellent. Nice choice of foods unless you are a meat eater. Free wireless. I would rate it 5 star if a bit more plush.

Reviews.Title: “A very welcoming chic hotel in an excellent central location”
Reviews.Author: GKinghorn
Reviews.Content: The Sirkeci Konak Hotel is a gem. What makes it exceptional is the friendliness, helpfulness and professionalism of the staff, particularly Pelin, the Customer Relations Manager. Pelin responded quickly and effectively to emails sent in advance of our stay. Nothing was too much trouble for her, from locating a shop to booking three restaurants for dinner for us. When we met Pelin, she lived up to our expectations. The hotel provides excellent value for money in a very central location which is ideal for both sightseeing and public transport. We did so much sightseeing that we did not have time to use all the facilities like the hammam and swimming pool. But we did avail ourselves of the free cookery lesson which was great fun - donning the 'whites' and eating our efforts in the dining room. The owner of the hotel company came and joined us afterwards and was very friendly and informative, telling us about his future ventures - another hotel due to open May 2010 which sounds just as good as the Sirkeci Konak. Another very nice feature is the complimentary apple tea and tasty items to eat every afternoon in the lounge lobby. We would certainly return and stay in this delightful boutique style hotel because it is so intimate and friendly and such good value. When we return we would probably upgrade bedrooms to get a larger bathroom. (Bedrooms and bathrooms are well equipped and provide everything you need when on a busy sightseeing holiday in such an interesting capital). Well done to all the staff at the Sirkeci Konak - a great team effort..

Reviews.Title: “A delicious taste of the real Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: IslandHopper041
Reviews.Content: This was the first time that my wife and I picked a hotel purely from Trip Advisor recommendations and we certainly weren't disappointed. We arrived mid afternoon and were greeted by the Desk Manager a charming guy called Okay and were offered welcome drinks and simit if we wanted. My wife happened to remember a few lines of a Turkish song and sang a few bars and He was absolutely delighted and they wound up singing this song together in the middle of the lounge - made for a lovely warm start to the holiday. Our room was furnished in a traditional Ottoman style, comfortable bed, strong hot shower and a balcony view over the Topkapi gardens. We ate in the hotel restaurant on the roof terrace that night, incredibly atmospheric with commanding views over the city, the food was interesting though not memorable in my opinion, service was plenty good though. Breakfast was varied and plentiful and in the afternoons the staff assemble in the lounge with the guests and everbody has tea and simit and talk about the events of the day, good idea, got everybody mingling nicely. The hotel has a little pool, sauna and Hammam in the basement which appeared mostly deserted, I used the pool and the hammam a few times and found it very relaxing , my wife had a massage and said it was pretty good. Summing up : I dropped points for the location as it was next to a late night cafe that could get a little raucous when the footie was on but for a hotel in the middle of Sultanhamet you shouldn't expect tranquility. There weren't robes in the rooms on arrival, but they arrived sharpish after we rang down. The staff are all under 30 I reckon and they're like a little family and couldn't be more helpful particularly Okay (the manager) who upon hearing that we had to meet someone in the business district later on offered to drive us there after he went off shift, lovely bloke. Obviously if you want opulence (and to drop 450 euros a night) there's the Four Seasons but when we popped in for a look it just looked like any other Four Seasons - OK if you like that sort of thing but completely insulated from the rest of Istanbul We much preferred the Ottoman styling and intimacy of the Sirkeci Konak. All in all it's high rating on TA is I think more than deserved.

Reviews.Title: “An Exceptional Charmin Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sirine62
Reviews.Content: Dear Ladies and Gentlemen, I use to travel several times per year in different countries, among others Turkey. We like so much the turkish culture and its exceptional hospitality. We usually stay in charming hotels and we just staid in Istanbul in SIRECI KONAK hotel, located close to the historical area of Istanbul and not far (within half an hour) from the modern area Taksim thanks to the tram. This hotel (about 35 rooms) is far and away the most comfortable and the most friendly I have till yet visited. All was perfect : cleanliness, food (2 restaurants), breakfast, room, frontdesk, service and warmest wellcome. The extras and meals prices are very moderate regarding to the quality. I can recommend it without any hesitancy and I am waiting for a next stay in it as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are correct, we want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Heraldman
Reviews.Content: Personal service from the the moment you arrive outside the hotel. Every single member of staff smiled and their attention to detail meant nothing was too much trouble. Excellent location, great food, lovely room and the bonus of a turkish bath downstairs. Afternoon tea provided free of charge, ideal after a day in the bustle of Istanbul. We'd go back!

Reviews.Title: “A superb small hotel,ideally situated”
Reviews.Author: gordonlondon
Reviews.Content: I was well pleased with this charming small hotel and its delightfully helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Value in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyExplorer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel in Sept. following a trip to Athens and a cruise through the Greek Islands. While this is not what I would call a luxury hotel, the service and amenities provided were right up there with the best of hotels we have stayed in. Our room was spacious and comfortable (ask for a second blanket because the air conditioning does not operate at a 'steady' temperature) and most of all, we found the staff outstanding. We enjoyed free internet access; a generous breakfast; good advice; a fun cooking class; and an ideal location in the old city. We would definiely return.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely the hotel you want to stay at when in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ValeryTokyo
Reviews.Content: As newly wed, we went to Istanbul to catch the Orient Express. We had planned to spend three nights at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel before embarking on the train. Yet our honey moon trip was delayed as a typhoon forced us to postpone our flight out of Japan for one day. The young and friendly personnel at the Sirkeci Konak made us quickly forget our unwanted shorter stay in Istanbul by upgrading our room to a Deluxe Room with view on the garden by the Sultan Topkapi Palace at no extra charge. The hotel is ideally located in the old city (within walking distance of the main sightseeing points in Sultanahmet and close to the train station) and offers many amenities (try the Turkish baths...). The quality of service and food was impeccable. We had a romantic dinner at the restaurant on the roof terrace, somewhere between the glowing Bosphorus straight and the lit towers of the Blue Mosque, under the first full moon of September... A memory I will treasure...

Reviews.Title: “Great Service With A Smile!”
Reviews.Author: KGMUSIC1
Reviews.Content: Great service, great location, great food, and great staff. One really nice touch is when you check in. You are greeted by the Guest Relations Attendant, in my case a lovely woman by the name of Dilhan, who sits down with you to explain all of the hotels amenities, where and how to get to all the nearby tourist attractions, and answers any questions you may have. I've been to a number of nice hotels, this was a first! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Sirkeci Konak provides a warm welcome for a solo female traveler.”
Reviews.Author: FFAH
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned about being a lone female tourist in Istanbul, but the staff was welcoming, helpful, and charming. The concierge--a lovely young woman--greeted me with sandwiches and hot apple tea. (It turns out that this is a daily event and great for socializing.) She spent about 20 minutes with me, explaning how I could best see her city during my 3 day stay. They also post a helpful itinerary on their website. I suggest squeezing in the complementary cooking class that is held on Friday afternoon. It's a hands on experience involving fresh vegetables,filet mignon, and seasoned travelers. You needn't have any kitchen experience to make this a fun and filling event. I did not take advantage of the swimming pool and Turkish bath or the upstairs restaurant. I understand that I really missed an opportunity with the restaurant. I will definitely try it on my next trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL IVE VISITED”
Reviews.Author: texastrojan
Reviews.Content: First, we received a free upgrade here from Erboy Hotel which is there sister hotel. Service, cleanliness, and location are unbeatable--a 10 minute walk to Ayasofia, Blue Mosque, and Hippodrome, and a 20 minute walk to the Grand Bazaar. Located right in the old city, lots of shops and mediocre restaurants in the area. All the staff were extremely helpful and polite, and even helped make sure the cab driver didnt rip us off for the trip back :) And btw, they have a "pillow menu" which allows you to choose whatever specific type you desire. Great hotel!! Cant say enough good things...cant go wrong here folks.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel for a romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: neekgee
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Sirkeci Konak in late August 2009. We were travelling through Turkey and finished in Istanbul for my wife's 50th birthday. The staff was very professionnal, making us feel at home as soon as we arrived, the hotel is very beautiful, nicely decorated and the rooms are very comfortable. The breakfast buffet is outstanding ! Finally, the location is ideal, only a few minutes away on foot to the main sites of the old city and 100 m away from the tram station to cross the Golden Horn.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Weekend”
Reviews.Author: DaveScot
Reviews.Content: been to istanbul many times never to konak sirkeci. superb best central location, great, interesting restaurants and all the sites nearby. good facilities in hotel and incredibly friendly and professional staff. only problem: rooms a little small and dark, and the outside area can be slightly noisey. If you want central location and to avoid the large impersonal international hotels this is the answr.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: nicho22
Reviews.Content: Sirkeci Konak was a fabulous place to stay, great staff and very friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean the meals were delicious and the setting on the roof top was terrific for a restaurant with a fab view. We purchased a carpet in a shop close by, "Capadocia", the guy,Ali, was very helpful and knew all about carpets, we would certainly deal with him again If we should ever return to Istanbul we would certainly stay at the Sirkeci Konak

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: engreja
Reviews.Content: When they say it is the best location.... They sure mean it... I stayed with my family (Wife and 4 young kids)... The location is perfect... Old istanbul right in the middle of everything... Yet not near the noisy streets... The terrace overlooking TopKapi Palace was just amazing... The staff is Extra Nice... Helping us with almost anything... I even lost my ATM Card in the airport. And they found it for me... Definitly the best hotel in area... They even came outside almost all of them to say goodbye at the time of Check out... Management is procustomer %100.... Lovely time in istanbul... First time but definitly not last time... AlSaeed Family from Kuwait...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful introduction to the most splendid of cities”
Reviews.Author: kelting
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sirkeci Konak for 2 nights in August prior to joining a cruise of the Black Sea. I had originally thought to stay at the Four Seasons, but the rates there seemed steep, and my husband wanted to stay in a more traditional Turkish hotel. I'm glad he did, because the Sirkeci Konak proved to be a delight. (And they have testimonials from Trip Advisor posted prominently in the lobby, so we're obviously not the only people to think so). The room was air-conditioned, spacious, clean, and comfortable, decorated in a not-over-the-top Turkish theme, and looked out into the gardens of Topkapi Palace. The bathroom was modern and pristine. And the location is great; walking distance to all the "usual suspects" - Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, etc. But most of all, I would recommend the hotel for the warmth and helpfulness of the staff; the manager and the concierge were not only professional but friendly, and we truly felt like guests rather than customers. Other pluses: the hotel will arrange a pickup at the airport, for about 20 euros. For a stay of 3 nights or more, it's complimentary. Also, in the summer months, the hotel has a rooftop dining room specializing in local seafood; sitting up there, listening as the muezzins all across the city called out at sunset (it was Ramadan), watching the sun slide behind minarets...astonishing! And the food and service were wonderful. One more, unrelated Istanbul tip: we hired a private guide for a full-day walking tour of the city, to see some of the places we wouldn't be seeing with our cruise group. Her name is Arzu Tutuk, and she is wonderful! She speaks perfect English, and will customize a tour to fit your needs. Her contact email is [--]. Kudos to all the Trip Advisor travelers who ranked this place so high; we owe you a debt fo gratitude!

Reviews.Title: “Yes, it is excellent”
Reviews.Author: alfieParis
Reviews.Content: Even if the room was not too large, everything is there to make you a very pleasant stay. The afternoon tea is a must. Kind service, good fish restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: dofter
Reviews.Content: First time in Istanbul. Hotel is perfectly located for the Blue Mosque, Sofia Mosque and Topkapi Palace. Gulhane tram stop is mere feet away but hotel is still off the main street enough to be quiet. Staff are excellent. Our room on the 1st floor was clean and comfortable. Mattress was very good (an issue for me at most places). Staff were very friendly and spoke good English. Breakfast was also surprisingly vast and the afternoon tea snack was a tasty bonus. Do not understand other comments that Sirkeci is not clean or that staff are not helpful. The area does have alot of car part shops but it also has many good restaurants. It is a bit expensive, but I've stayed in many hotels around the world and I felt this place was worth the extra cash.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed by Sirkeci Konak and impressed by Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: arblancw
Reviews.Content: We decided to travel to Istanbul just the day before we got there and our experience far exceeded our expectations in great part thanks to the staff of the Sirkeci Konak. Since we only had less than a day to get ready for the trip we were not well prepared and had done virtually no reading or research about the city. The hotel sent us a driver to pick us up from the airport and when we arrived at the hotel we were warmly greeted and offered Turkish sandwiches tea and juice and the manager gave us a map of the city and answered all our questions, she also gave us free of charge a good guide book of the city. We loved the buffet breakfast, I particularly liked the many varieties of cheese they offered. Since we spend four nights, we were also offered a free dinner which was excellent. Istanbul is a great city and I will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel near the centre of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Insightful
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely stay in this hotel. My room (overlooking a grocery store in the street) was nothing remarkable, but the service in the hotel was of a high calibre. All of the staff work consistently together to ensure that your stay in the Konak Hotel is a highly enjoyable one. The morning breakfast is offered buffet style and it boasts a rich range of delicious foodstuffs including different fruit juices, fresh and dried fruits, cheeses, hams, salamis, mueslis and yoghurts. They also serve really good coffee in the morning. Breakfast runs until 11 a.m. and I was really glad to avail of the opportunity to have a late breakfast the morning after my midnight arrival in Istanbul. As other posters have pointed out, the hotel is quite close to some of the most imposing places in Istanbul including the Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque and the incredible Hagia Sophia. Together with six others, I paid Euro 60 a for one day walking tour of these places. Our guide was from the University of Istanbul and he gave us some wonderful insights into historical Byzantium/Constantinople/Istanbul (as well as the benefits of his hilarious sense of humour). We also had lunch with him and a lengthy afternoon cafe break at Topkapi Palace (to allow us to take in a wonderful view of the Sea of Marmara). All in all, I was impressed with my stay in Sirkeci Konak. Great people running a comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We will return”
Reviews.Author: vivaSydney
Reviews.Content: The staff were overwhelmingly helpful, yet unobtrusive. Istanbul is a huge and fabulous city; to have such a great base is essential. Everything from restaurant recommendations, restaurant bookings and transfers arranged without fuss sounds trite but was so important in this city. Rooms are very clean and comfortable, hamam on site and essential to remove travel weariness and dirt. Easy walk to old city sights and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “The ideal hotel in Istanbul for service, character and convenience”
Reviews.Author: Sampsonite
Reviews.Content: I visited Istanbul this time with my partner and extended family. The hotel made our stay. Having been to Istabul before, I wanted a hotel that was closer to the sights - to avoid traffic delays and the problematic taxis. Sirkeci Konak is not large and has a clean, comfortable and relaxed feeling. It is in easy walking distance of the Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, the Grand and Spice Bazaars, the main ferry terminals and lots of good restaurants. It is not pretentious and has lots of local character. It has an excellent Hammam which is modern, clean and well run. We all had massages and would strongly recommend the 30 minutes session. All the staff can communicate in English and some speak it very well. They were all very friendly and helpful. The guest relations manager was particularly helpful and her advice contributed greatly to our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RGFAN
Reviews.Content: Lovely family-run hotel. Personal service and attention to make each guest feel special. Be sure to ask the very helpful concierge about hotel's cooking classes, recommended restaurants, etc. Lots of guide books available. Computer with printer available for free usage. Nice breakfast buffet and afternoon tea included. Well-located for walking to all major sites, but get a map showing precise location and phone number of hotel if planning to take a taxi to hotel. The two late-night taxi drivers we encountered were incapable of finding the hotel, so we got out and walked. If you travelled overland to India in the 70's, be sure to stop by the Pudding Shop. Sadly, place has completely changed but nostalgic to read letters, news postings, etc on walls. If you're moving on to Greece, consider early morning flight to Izmir to see Ephesus (fabulous ruins), then late afternoon ferry Kusadasi to Samos.

Reviews.Title: “Permanent high quality”
Reviews.Author: segr
Reviews.Content: When travelling it is important to know those places where quality is not under question. This knowlege makes life easy. During my last travels around Turkey (2007/2008) I relied on Sikeci Konak in Istanbul and both times with success. I am travelling a lot and cannot say that the building or rooms of the hotel are smth extraordinary. Actually standard rooms are not very large (though it is common feature of Istanbul downtown ). Then, what makes my happy? It is combination of location, cleanliness, exellent breakfast, and very frendly service. I never experienced answer 'no' for my (normal) requests. Managers on reception are always professinal and ready to help. Resume - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Turkey”
Reviews.Author: Keke1974
Reviews.Content: We got married the day before arrival, and arrived very tired to the hotel. Check in was fast and easy and friendly, you could not ask for more. A week in Turkey was beyond anything we have experienced earlier. Hotel location is just prefect, close to all the main sights. Service was excellent, very polite but still not too formal. Rooms are tidy and stylish, as well the entire anterior. You really feel your self welcome there. Restaurants both down and upstairs where amazing. These people can really make your vacation so much enjoyable. Thank you Pelin, Birol, Okay, Arcon, Muhammed ! We will remember you always! Hope to meet with you when we come back. Reg. Kimmo & Eglis

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful stay in an adventurous city”
Reviews.Author: topino21
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed every aspect of the hotel from the reception, breakfast, solarium, wellness center and gym. The location is perfect - within walking distance of all the more famous attractions and the tram stop is right outside of the hotel. The upstairs outdoor solarium overlooks a surrounding park and the river. It is a beautiful oasis of peace and quiet. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: RickSFlorida
Reviews.Content: Extremely nice and friendly Hotel. Started with Pelin offering us Apple Tea and explaining the hotel and services and any suggestions we had about our visit. Very clean and modern accomodations. Hotel offers lovely dining on rooftop with view of Istanbul. Indoor (small) pool as well as gym and Turkish Hamam (bath). Location is excellent. Very short walk to Topkapi Palace. Also walking distance to Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, Spice and Grand Bazzar or two stops on tram, right out the door. Not the cheapest but well worth it if you want a reliable, convenient and very pleasent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wow wow wow wow. perfectooooooo”
Reviews.Author: Mario_Mireille
Reviews.Content: Absolutely perfect, and i really mean perfect stay....... friendly staff that go beyond the usual and explain to you everything u need to know about the hotel, a breakfast that has varieties more than i have eaten everywhere else in Turkey, very clean rooms, lien that smells wonderful.... I highly recommend to stay in this hotel, absolutely perfect..... (PS upon my arrival, the recepionist asked me how do i wanna pay at the end, i told him i can pay cash or by credit card, well paying cash made me save 110 euros, where in the world can u find people who make u pay less then what u reserved)... keep on the good work...absolutely perfect

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like Treasured Guests. Perfect Istanbul Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Spideog50
Reviews.Content: We felt more like visiting family than customers. Staff is wonderful! The owner drops by to chat regularly and make sure everything is functioning efficiently. There's a free afternoon tea with simet sandwiches. The breakfast is the best anywhere - 8 kinds of cheese, about 30 different rolls and breads, two kinds of egg, halvah, olives, make your cereals, yoghurt, two or three types of sausage, fruit salds, on and on. A Turkish bath downstairs. Lovely, clean rooms and you have choice of four different kinds of pillow. The internet connection for my laptop was free and excellent. Staff helps with the first connection if needed. As well, there's a computer available to guests. Each room has a private safe. Great location - you truly can walk to all major sights or catch the tram 1 minute away which takes you to everything else. Five to 10 minutes walk to Topkapi, Gulhane Park, the Archaeological Museum, Hagia Sophia, the Ferry Port, the Spice Market, Galata Bridge and about a thousand restaurants and kebab places. And yet, it's quiet at night! It's not just a modern box but a historic building that's won a prize for refurbishment. So no, every room is not the same size, but they are quite comfortable and spacious enough. Fine air conditioning. Two lovely young ladies whose job is just to circulate among guests at breakfast and tea or in the lounge to help make connections, order taxis, explain tram protocols or simply answer questions about life in Turkey. They speak English, Turkish, Spanish, Arabic and I don't know how many other languages. All the staff speak English. If you want a special place to stay in Istanbul, you'd be hard put to find anyplace better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Has a lot to live up to- did not disappoint.”
Reviews.Author: teafree
Reviews.Content: Looking at the reviews on trip advisor this place has a great rating... Think about booking on their web site we would have saved the transfer charge from the airport if we had. We really enjoyed it. Its location is great, if you ned a break it is right there. The restaurants are very good. They couldn't have been more helpful in giving us directions, making reservations and even packing a breakfast/ dinner for our very interesting overnight train ride to Bucharest (not for the faint hearted, an adventure) They also have a beautiful Hamam, but the attendant could use a little help. They must have an agreement with the local mosque, even though we heard calls to prayer they never woke us up like Morocco. It is not cheap, it was the most expensive hotel we stayed in in our two+ week trip through Eastern Europe and Vienna.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Hilary55
Reviews.Content: Great location, lovely rooms, friendly helpful staff without being intrusive. Worth every penny /euro/ lira. I have stayed in numerous hotels around the world and highly recommend this one for either business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “What a great choice!”
Reviews.Author: we3liketotravel
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at Sirceki Konak end of July. Wonderful. We chose this hotel after reading reviews on Tripadvisor, and are glad we did. We had a beautiful triple room with hard wood floors, two comfortable beds and the place was spotless. Bathroom/shower is excellent, room was quiet and we had a great night sleep. Location perfect for tourists, 10 minute walk to most sites in Sultanahmet and 1 minute walk to Tramvay for going to other parts of city. No concerns walking back to hotel late at night. Breakfast had interesting selections and was quite good. Most importantly was hospitality of owner and all employees which really made us feel at home. We were given wonderful tips for restaurants not necessarily found in the tourist guides and these really capped off our evenings. NOTHING bad to say about this hotel, would definately stay there again if returning to Istambul.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: ottercastle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel for 2 nights and loved every minute of our stay. Everyone in the hotel is very helpful and went out of their way to make sure that our every desire was satisfied. We stayed in a deluxe room that was large, spotless, very quiet, and most important of all in July, it was nice and cool. The staff helped with recommendations on a self-tour of the old and new cities. Any questions were quickly & completely answered. The hotel has two great restaurants with several local dishes. One of the restaurants is located on the roof of the hotel. It specializes in fish dinners. Our dinner on the roof-top cafe was the most romantic, enjoyable dinner we had in many months. The hotel has a great mini-bus that picked us up at the airport and at the end, delivered us to the ship for our cruise. There is a very reasonable charge for the bus and it is spot-less and has a great cooling system. I can understand why this small gem of a hotel located in the heart of the old city is the number one pick in Istanbul. Great Job !!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: CanarioViajero
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel!! All of us were amazed by how friendly and helpful the staff was with us from the very beginning of our stay. In fact, the service is just the very best we have had at a hotel (and we stay at hotels every single weekend!). We had some minor problems with the pick up service from the airport and that had to take us to the hotel, and once we arrived at the Sirkeci Konak they did anything they could in order to help us and make our stay enjoyable. Although the start of the trip was not the best, the staff of the hotel was so incredible that they made up for the minor inconveniences we had with the shuttle service. The hotel itself is in a great location, close to all the tourist areas (Santa SofÃ­a and the Blue Mosque are just a 5 min walk away, Topkapi Palace is right in front of the hotel...so better is impossible!). The rooms are quite large (taking into account that the hotel is in the old part of the city), and have anything you would expect. The roof terrace is also quite nice (with cool views of the city) and in the basement there is a small pool (to refresh yourself after a whole day walking around the city). Breakfast is also good, with fruits, cereals, some Turkish delicacies, cheese...and served in a nice room with big glass doors on to the street. Another good thing is that there are two computers with free internet access...this is greatly welcome to surf around and take information of the city or to print out your boarding cards. Finally, the recomendations for going out for dinner were great. One of this recommendations was the Mikla restaurant, which has the best views of the city. If you go to Istanbul, don't miss the chance to go out to this place! Once again, thank you to the staff at the reception of the hotel, which couldn't be better!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really lovely, different hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Mirabelle046
Reviews.Content: We had just one night here at the end of a trip and would have loved to stay longer. The welcome was wonderful and staff could not have been more helpful in giving guidance in order to maximise our short stay in Istanbul. Our rooms (3 in total) were all lovely and very clean. The location is great, very close to many of the main sights. The pool area, while small is nice and relaxing and the Turkish Bath was an entertainment in itself! Breakfast was an excellent buffet with plenty of variety. I am recommending it highly to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, hotel, and service”
Reviews.Author: s_wilde
Reviews.Content: My husband chose this hotel directly from the reviews on TA, it was a surprise for my birthday, and i wasn't disappointed. The hotel itself is very clean, the rooms are not overly large, but they are very well equipped and comfortable and at the end of the day its just a bedroom, that hopefully you will not see too much of as you will be out sightseeing! The beds are comfortable and they have a pillow menu so you can have exactly what you want. On arrival we were offered drinks, we were given a map and shown exactly where all the sights, restaurants, boat trips etc were. The staff were very knowledgeable and pointed us in the right direction for everything that we asked about. We ate in the roof top restaurant on the first night which was really good, and set the standard for all the following nights food. It wasn't the most expensive restaurant we ate in, the 360O restaurant was, which was recommended by the hotel and was very good for a different flavour of Istanbul, very modern, quite hard to find, get a taxi there! We also went on a boat trip, we opted for the private boat trips which meant we could stop anywhere and they would wait for you, this again was advised by the hotel, we stopped at Ortakoy and had probably our best lunch in a restaurant called Poussin it has a roof top terrace which is just lovely looking over the harbour, highly recommended. The hotel has a gym, and a small spa which has a pool, turkish bath and sauna, we used these facilities and found it relaxing at the end of a hard days sight seeing. Another review points out that the hotel isn't in a pretty street, but we found the hotel to be in a great location, we didn't feel threatened in any way, and its just a short walk up the hill to all the main restaurants, bars and shops etc. , its just in a back street, it has a lovely Turkish delight shop opposite and a cafe, that sells the usual tea and coffee to the locals, who yes, sell car parts, but hey they live here! There was friendly banter by all the locals as you walk up the road, but nothing a smile couldn't sort out, and anyway what do you expect in Istanbul!! There is a tram stop just up the road from the hotel, and its a great way of getting around, and very cheap, they are also airconditioned.
