The grand bazaar is an experience!! the spice market is interesting, and the mosques amazing, overall we had a brilliant experience in Istanbul, and I believe it was due to the hotels location and the staff who were exceptionally knowledgeable and saved us a lot of time and effort in their recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not first choice”
Reviews.Author: ffd-travel
Reviews.Content: I must say that I do not understand the rocket ratings that this hotel received here. So here is my "minority opinion"! Rooms: nice furniture but incomplete (had only one bedstand and bedstand lamp - so if only one side of the bed can stay up and read without disturbing the other). Loud and unpredictable air condition. Couldn't open our window at night because of the noise of the central air condition system next to our room. Staff: mostly friendly but untrained. Facilities: nice wellness section, free internet. Breakfast is good. Location: very near to the main sights such as Topkapi palace and Hagia Sophia so very convenient for a day trip. But the street is not really nice (filled with providers of car components). The surrounding area is strictly touristic (men luring around to aggressively drag you to their restaurant) and has little atmosphere. I'd recommend to choose a hotel in the Beyoglu area for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: FCB-7
Reviews.Content: This is one hotel I would not hesitate to recommend to friends. The owner, who has other hotels and restaurants, is hands on and understands customer service. The rooms are superior as is the roof top restaurant. Breakfast is abundant and there is plenty of food. The staff attends to every need and makes sure they seek you out to see if they can be helpful. One feels as if they are staying with friends. The location is just below Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and with in walking distance of the Grand Bazaar. One does not have to take the local transportation to see the major sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location, can't ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: lajollacalifornia
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Istanbul but we are well traveled and critical of hotels. This place was great. Clean, nice room, great view, great location, wonderful breakfast and staff could not have been more helpful and friendly. Bihar was especially helpful! Also great restaurant up the street, HAN near the TOPKAPI Palace. And though we did not have a chance to go, the rooftop restaurant is supposed to be good.

Reviews.Title: “An unique hotel for an unique city”
Reviews.Author: mfjr
Reviews.Content: Service is very professional, but not cold or too formal. The reception desk, the restaurant, the customer welcome and the public relation team are efficient and sympathetic. Our room was very clean, organized and confortable. Turkish delights were left to welcome us. Once it was my birthday celebration, we had a sparkling wine bottle on our arrival day. Cake, gift and "happy birthday to you" song on my birthday date ! The hotel is very well located, close to most of points of interests. Topkapi, Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque can be reached by a short walking. And they can recommend you very good restaurants close to the hotel, but have dinner at the hotel restaurant at least once. The breakfast is turkish-typical, with delicious cherry tomatoes and many types of turkish cheeses and delights. Turkish tea is a must. Besides the breakfast they offer a 5 o'clock tea, with typical turkish bread and teas. My wife and I liked best the....whole hotel complex and service....and least was...the leaving time !

Reviews.Title: “A short break in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: wendybridle
Reviews.Content: The hotel offered friendly service, good restaurant especially rooftop fish restaurant, rooms well firnished, cleaned spotlessly everyday with excellent facilities. Guests offered complimentary tea everyday which was refreshing and plentiful. At any time the staff were concerned for the comfort of the guests. Didn't use pool and other extras but they were on offer as part of accomodation fee.Thoroughly enjoyed our stay, would recommend the hotel and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “At Sirkeci Konak hotel you feel you are hearty welcome”
Reviews.Author: Goldenhair_9
Reviews.Content: A quiet place in the big city of Istanbul, very close to the Bosphorus, the Mosques, with a beautiful vieuw from the roofterrace. Very kind and helpful personnel. I would come back to this place, and will recommend it to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Take your earplugs and duster”
Reviews.Author: einstein_1964
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me say that this hotel is perfectly located if you want to be within walking distance of The Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar etc. You'll find it down an unprepossessing side street and to be honest it doesn't look too promising. However once you get inside, the property opens up and you might be lucky enough to be greeted by one of the friendlier receptionists there. I can't remember his name but he had floppy dark hair and always seemed to be smiling. The rooms were fine for the three nights we were there, however my daughter had the misfortune to be next to the cleaner's cupboard. Now, I would hazard a guess that hotel cleaners ought to start work no earlier than 9am. I think that's a reasonable time, but not at this hotel. Daughter was woken two mornings by the cleaners banging around in their cupboard at 7am, which is taking enthusiasm for their to the extreme at the cost of guests' sleep. It's a shame that this enthusiasm didn't extend to their cleaning abilities; they did the absolute minimum, for example, we were given a glass of water when we arrived. We took the half empty glasses to our room and there they stayed for the rest of our time at the hotel - not touched or moved. It seemed to us that they just did the absolute basic and if they could start as early as possible, all the better. I know that one might expect to hear the odd bit of plumbing during a stay, but the sound of the room above us flushing their loo or having a shower did take us by surprise on the first night - it was so loud that we thought something had gone terribly wrong in our bathroom. The manageress greeted us on our arrival, then forgot us the next day and re-introduced her self. She asked if we had had a good day in the city but as we were literally mid-sentence she stopped us to greet new guests, fair enough but her manner was very rude and off hand. All that said, the food served was top-notch and the presentation was great, no complaints at all. A nice touch was a daily newsletter on your breakfast table with little announcements and facts. To sum up, if you want a great location and fab food but can put up with noisy waterworks, staff that are slightly remote and cleaners that have no concept of time, then get booking! As an aside, we loved all the sights Istanbul had to offer (who wouldn't?), but be warned, the Topkapi Palace is a bit pricey with an extra entrance fee for the Harem. A one and a half hour trip up the Bospherous was a great cheap way to cool down.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure”
Reviews.Author: El_Marques
Reviews.Content: The personnel is very skilled and really nice. The rooms and the hotel are decorated with good taste, while keeping the essence of the otoman decoration, they avoid any kind of overelaboration resulting in an ellegant and charm hotel. The rooms (the basic ones) are not very big but they are confortable and elegant The location is excellent, some meters away from the walls of Topkapi Palace and 5 minutes walking to the Galata Bridge. I recommend dinning fish in the terrace (nice views of Agia SofÃ­a and the city lights) and going to the Hamman (turkish bath) of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, well located hotel. Great option for mid-price option!”
Reviews.Author: briwood4
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent first recommended an expensive 5 star hotel (the Conrad) which I'm sure would have been beautiful, but we asked for a more price conscious option and she came up with the Sirkeci Konak. It fit the bill perfectly! Totally acceptable; clean, fresh rooms with nice bathrooms; pleasant staff and good service. We were so tired from the travel day that we decided to eat at the hotel's restaurant rather than venture out and it was very good. The location was a five minute walk to the main sites (Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, Topkapi Palace, etc), so that was perfect. Only stayed one evening as we caught a cruise ship the following evening, so it was perfect for us. Don't miss out on the nice rooftop lounge! Nice view of city and tops of minarets!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful get away”
Reviews.Author: MarieAmman
Reviews.Content: Sirkeci Konak is a hidden gem. From the moment you walked into the hotel, you are greeted by warm staff members. They are welcoming and open to answering all of your questions. After checking in, you are given maps and the staff explains where the various sites are located. The cooking classes that they offer on Monday and Fridays should not be missed. It was fun to get hands on experience, learn about Turkish cuisine, meet some new people and share a meal at the end of the class. In addition to having a wonderful location, this hotel offers warm friendly service, comfortable rooms (the Turkish Delight on the bed is a nice touch) and their afternoon tea is great. Next time I am in Istanbul, I will definately go back to the Sirkeci Konak.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: terroir
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights. Can't say enough. Excellent from initial contact through departure. Breakfast fantastic and included, ate on roof restaurant first night and was blown away. Chef came out with samples of his fish, all fresh, and recommends cooking method for each. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great place... the other reviewers are quite correct.”
Reviews.Author: StarAllianceGold
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my girlfriend for a three-night city break to explore Istanbul. Excellent location easily reached by a taxi ride along the coast road (25 mins with light traffic). We took public transport (metro and tram), and the hotel is 50 yards away from the SirkeÃ§i tram-stop. We were greeted by the Pelen, who checked us in over some glasses of hot, sweet apple tea. She provided us with maps, asked about our schedule and then explained what we should see and how to get there. The hotel is an easy walk to the main sights of Haghia Sophia, Sultan Ahmet Camii (The Blue Mosque), to the restaurants and hamams (baths) along Divan Yolu, and close to the river and ferry terminals. We walked everywhere, and made it back to the hotel for the 'happy hour' between 4pm and 6pm, where a modest complimentary selection of fruit and sandwiches were available (no booze). The breakfast selection is broad and good quality. The rooms are comfortable and a good standard of furniture and fittings, and a pot of delicious Turkish Delights were set on the bed for our arrival. Light-sleepers beware: the walls are a little thin, so bring your ear plugs if you're easily woken. The swimming pool in the basement is a compact one, but great for a cooling paddle. Staying at this hotel and interacting with the staff was an absolute pleasure, from start to finish.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in a great city to visit.”
Reviews.Author: leila9
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in Istanbul to celebrate our 42 nd anniversary. Everything we had read about this place turned out to be true. It was a wonderful stay. Everyone on the staff worked hard to make our stay an enjoyable one. It's location is very convenient to the major attractions to see. The service was excellent as was the food and ambience. The room was very clean and the guest relations manager was very helpful. We look forward to returning there on our next trip to Istanbul. From Mclean, Virginia.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Broomy57
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a little more upscale than we usually choose, but we stayed only one night so decided to go for comfort. We chose this hotel based on this sites reviews. It's close to all the sites, and barely 100 yards to the tram station, which you can take to the airport for about $2, the best deal of the entire 3 week trip. The breakfast buffet, which is included in the price, is a delight, with lots of types of food you don't get at home. The staff was friendly and efficient. The Turkish bath on site looked like it got little use. I can't comment on whether it was a good value because I don't know what other places charge. I know they get a lot of 5 ratings, and I don't mean for my 4 to be a slight. It's a very nice hotel. I'm just stingy with my ratings

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price. Perfect and More. Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Typam
Reviews.Content: Booked directly after reading the reviews and Number 1 rating in Trip Advisor and after bad experiences elsewhere.I usually find something to complain about but not this time. Yes, this Ottoman style Turkish Boutique Hotel is expensive (150 Euros for 2 per night) but there are plenty of extras included in the price which other Istanbul hotels charge for. Our no hassle experience was worth every penny. We paid cash and received a discount on the room rate (150 Euros instead of 165 Euros). I have paid more elsewhere for much less! The staff is so polite, helpful and AVAILABLE. Room size average but spotlessly clean, quiet, modern bathroon with bathrobes and the twin beds were perfect. You even have a choice of pillows. The sheets and towels were changed daily. Many hotels don't change the sheets each day. The airconditioning worked perfectly. Our room was 1309 (3rd floor ) with a view of the gardens of Topkapi but other rooms were larger with a small balcony on the 3rd floor. They give out maps, directions and answer every stupid tourist question with a smile. The location is fantastic only 100 meters from the local tram stop which takes you past all of the major sites. And a 6 minute uphill walk to ther Topkapi entrance. Of course you can also walk easily to St. Sophia, the Blue Mosque and the Underground Cistern or take the tram for 1 stop.They reserve tables for you or make local phone calls for you at no charge. There are complimentary sandwiches and tea at 5 PM to hold you over until the evening. A very nice lounge/bar area. 2 computers in the lobby for hotel guests and no charge for use of internet + printer, free airport pick up in a spotless minivan, a very tasty complimentary gastronomical dinner (drinks extra of course),.. one of the best we had in Istanbul, 24/24 hours reception and currency exchange desk. The safe in the room works well and there is a free safe at the desk you can use the day of check out, when you check your bagage in their cloak room. They have a very inexpensive rate for return to airport in a private car (35 TL). The hotels nearby charge 80 TL each way. Free use of the Turkish bath, sauna, swimming pool (extra for massage) downstairs. Fantastic buffet breakfast. This is the first time I have left a hotel and the staff waved goodbye to me at the door. Our 4 nights were great. I have no complaints whatsoever. The number 1 rating is well deserved and I can't wait to return. The only negative side is the disappointing view from the fish restaurant on the roof (4th floor... not high enough) and the main restaurant is in the lobby. But we ate at the rooftop restaurants at Seven Hills Hotel (across from 4 Seasons), Nearby there are The Olive restaurant on top of Romance Hotel and The Orient Express Hotel Rooftop restaurant which were all OK. The best view was Seven Hills. So the view is not necessary since this hotel has everything else.

Reviews.Title: “It is Everything the Reviews Say”
Reviews.Author: SBCATraveler
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was # 1 on Trip Advisor. We stayed three nights which included a pickup from the airport and a dinner. We arrived at 11:00pm, so it was great to have a driver waiting for us at the airport. We had a double room with a queen bed. There were two windows that open up overlooking the street and park. The room was modern and comfortable. The breakfast each morning was delicious and kept us going throughout the day. Every afternoon the hotel served tea and sandwiches which was served in their sitting room. We enjoyed our dinner at the hotel where we dined on some local fish. The location made it easy to walk to all the sites. There is a park across the way of the hotel, which was nice to walk through every day. The best thing about the hotel is the staff. They are extremely helpful and friendly. It is a very cozy and comfortable hotel that will make your stay in Istanbul even more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Janakii
Reviews.Content: Welcoming, courteous, friendly and professional staff- especially GÃ¶rkem SÃ¼zgÃ¼n at the front desk, whose helpfulness and knowledge is a credit to the hotel. Used Skype to request airport transfer and on arrival we were shown to our gorgeous room with balcony overlooking Gulhane Park and an oblique view of the Bosphorus. There were welcome Turkish delight sweets, plus complimentary bottled water and hot drinks and kettle, fresh flowers, and on our return from an afternoon of touristing, a basket of fresh fruit. Oh and TimeOut Istanbul, LCD TV with cable, Air Con . Bathroom was rather nice too- it even had a jacuzzi! Complimentary tea (apple or black) and sandwiches served every afternoon in the lounge, great beakfast buffet and a little newsletter every morning detailing which attractions were open/closed that day etc- it's with these extra little touches that Sirkeci Konak receives its well deserved reputation. Two restaurants- one rooftop, one ground floor- we tried the traditional Turkish fayre of the latter which was fine. Free Internet access- there are two machines for guest use plus i believe there's wireless access too. The basement housed the pool, gym and hammam which we didn't have time to use. Great location too- 10-15 mins walk to the main tourist spots. Nice Turkish delight shop opposite- and two beautiful kittens in the carpet shop directly opposite. Would definitely return to this hotel and Istanbul for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place to stay”
Reviews.Author: travelfan94611
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sirkeci Konak for a total of five nights (four at the beginning of our trip and one more at the end)...it was a great experience. We had two spacious triple rooms overlooking Gulhane Park (1406 and 2502)...they were perfectly clean, quiet and comfortable in every way. By far the best part of the hotel is the terrific staff. Pelin, Biro and Okey were delightful. They helped us with sightseeing, concert tickets, taxis and reservations. They even stepped in to resolve a problem we had with a rental car company. We enjoyed our stay very much and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels that we have ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: Clive8
Reviews.Content: A truly memorable stay at a very comfortable hotel, situated in position 'A' regarding access to the main tourist sites. The hospitality was possibly the best we have experienced at any city hotel and the breakfast was first class with some interesting Turkish dishes. We stayed in a 'standard room' which was comfortable but small. Would definately go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay---could be better though”
Reviews.Author: zwgc2
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at the hotel, having spent a considerable amount of time reading the reviews on tripadvisor, and this hotel is certainly not a bad choice. Located in Sultanahmet, only a mere 5-10 minute walk to Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque, so excellent location. The roof top seafood restaurant serves top quality seafood with impeccable service--should definitely try. Room is clean and it has got all that you need--a decent (perhaps slightly small) LCD tv, with limited english speaking channels, free wifi, bathroom with jacuzzi, pretty good for a boutique hotel. The included hamam is okay if you don't want to try those in the city centre The were several (minor) disappointments though-- 1. The hotel somehow lost my arrival details, hence didn't sent a cab to pick me up. I arrived near midnight and paid a big premium for a local cab to take me to the hotel. 2. The hotel gave my friend and I a triple room instead of a superior room. I guess there isn't much difference between the two so a fortunate mistake. 3. Not all the staff are friendly--we have met one or two staff at the concierge who were pretty "slack" or unhelpful. All in all a good hotel, but if you have the money to spend I think you would have a vastly better experience at Four Seasons Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid”
Reviews.Author: doctimothy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a belated honeymoon to Europe. Before leaving, she emailed the hotels where we would be staying in Italy, Greece, and Turkey to ask a few questions. In the correspondence with the Orient Express Hotel in Istanbul (a sister hotel to the Sirkeci Konak), she mentioned that we were honeymooning. Upon our arrival, the front desk at the Orient Express told us they had upgraded us to the hotel around the corner. For the record, we were impressed by the Orient Express based upon its lobby, so I am sure it was also a nice hotel for a more budget conscious traveler. And, yet, I recommend considering the expense of the Sirkeci Konak. And you can walk to everything you really wish to see while in Istanbul, while taking a tour for a few other locations if you are interested (consider doing the Bosphorus dinner cruise; I was not as high on the Princess Island tour as I thought I might be, so I would not really recommend it). Many people recommend Taksim square (Istinkal street) for shopping and nightlife - if you wish to go there, you will need to take a tram from the hotel, but I was unimpressed by this area. Everything we liked about Istanbul was in walking distance of our hotel: beautiful and clean, with some good local shops with which you can seek to strike some deals. Go see Hagia Sophia, Topkipa Palace, Blue Mosque (free on Sunday to enter), and the Underground Cisterns (my favorite). [While I gave the value 5 stars, I really do not know how much a room per night is at the Sirkecki Konak as I had originally booked with Orient Express].

Reviews.Title: “Deserves to be No. 1”
Reviews.Author: Velour99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel following our cruise and couldn't have been happier with the place. The staff was very friendly, the rooms comfortable and spotless. The pool was a nice extra and the location was perfect. The hotel is behind the walls of the Topkapi Palace and about a 15 min walk to all the major sights. The attached restaurant serves an ample breakfast in the morning, and also serves dinner. We ate at the hotel one night and to our delight, had an excellent meal.

Reviews.Title: “The closest thing to home a hotel could be”
Reviews.Author: HPL69
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at the Sirkeci Konak at the beginning of June, and it absolutely made our trip to Istanbul unforgettable. The staff is unbelieveably friendly and attentive, and returning to the hotel roof top terrace after a day of sightseeing literally felt like coming home, something I have never before experienced in my many stays in hotels. The hotelrooms are a fair size and spotless with very good beds and - something I love -the shower at full blast almost blows you away with its power. The restaurants are very enjoyable, and a lot of the main attractions of Istanbul are within a 5 min walk from the hotel, with the Gulhane tram stop only 50 meters away. The hotel also offers an indoor swimming pool with Turkish bath and several Spa services, but as we so enjoyed spending our evenings at the roof top terrace we never actually got around to enjoying them. Other touches that make the SK special are the free welcome dinner if you book over 3 nights and a free transfer to or from the airport, free tea in the afternoons in the lobby area, and the Guest Relations manager Pelin. All in all, the SK may not be the poshest or grandest hotel I have ever stayed at, but if I could have my ideal hotel anywhere around the world, it would be a copy of the Sirkeci Konak. I speak for all our party (my partner, parents and mother in law) when I say that what makes the Sirkeci Konak hotel truly stand out is its staff and the fantastic atmosphere they have managed to create. We would recommend it to anyone without a moments hesitation, you will definitely not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Go yourself, and see why we all love Sirkeci Konak”
Reviews.Author: ccmanly
Reviews.Content: This hotel really is special, and as so many reviews have noted, it is the people - there is a sincerity and generosity of spirit that makes guests feel very welcome. We stayed 10 nights and loved every minute. The rooftop terrace at sunset, overlooking the Bosphorus on one side and gardens on the other was bliss - so was the pool for a late afternoon swim after shopping and sightseeing. The welcome dinner and breakfasts in the restaurant were delicious - and all of it came with smiles and friendly service. Location is perfect - five minutes up the hill to Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar and other sights - five minutes down the hill to the Spice Market and the waterfront. Jump a tram and go to the end of the line in either direction for a fun sightsee - or go to the waterfront for the Turyol ferry trip on the Bosphorus, a bargain at 9 turkish lira for 2 hours trip. Coming back to the hotel each afternoon was like coming home. And if we are able to return to Istanbul there is no question about where we will stay - Sirkeci Konak. Thank you .to all the staff and management for such a gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Numero uno”
Reviews.Author: shufflesLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sirkeci Konak with my mum for 4 days at the end of May. It was such a nice experience, I have to write about it! The hotel itself is in the old town conveniently located next to a tram stop and walking distance to pretty much most of the attractions. I'd say its a reasonable size for the hotels in the area and is very clean, simple and traditionally decorated. We had a twin room which didn't have the best view but, had all the mod cons and the beds were sooo comfortable, I slept soundly on all 4 nights. We dined in the restaurant and had room service a few times. I thought the food was really nice, I definitely recommend the sea bass. Turker was a great host at dinner on our first night and also at teatime in the lobby where you could have snacks and tea and chat to the other guests and staff. I loved the Apple tea and Sedat was kind enough to give me my own pack! It doesn't taste the same when I make it though! Breakfast was also a nice affair, there was such a large selection of goodies and Mohammed and the girls were always on hand when you needed more tea. My only dissappointment was I was expecting to have breakfast on the roof terrace. The basement contains the fitness centre, sauna, pool and hammam and it was lovely to be able to go for a swim at the end of a hard day of sightseeing. It was very clean and well maintained. All the guys at reception, Okay, Gorkem and Serker were on hand to help with any queries and bookings for excursions and were just generally pleasant as were Birol and Engin and the other guys who's names I cant remember. This was one of the best things at the hotel, the staff are approachable and are really attentive without being overbearing. The jewel in the crown though, is Pellin. She is a real asset to the hotel and was so helpful. She made us feel really welcome and practically sorted our itinerary for us whilst we were there. Every hotel should have a Pellin! So, to conclude, If you look at the hotel in terms of walls and a place to sleep, its probably not very different to the other hotels out there. What makes this hotel is the staff, from reception to housekeeping, everyone did their best to make you feel comfortable and at home. If the staff are reading this, thank you guys, you deserve to be numero uno.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service from a first rate Hotel, but warning about taxis.”
Reviews.Author: Frances-Jane
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days in the Sirkeci Konack. Room was beautiful with views over gardens. Nice touches in the room, basket of fruit, turkish delight, toiletries etc., The breakfast was wonderful with such a fabulous spread of food to choose from. Free tea and afternoon sandwiches were a pleasant surprise. Lovely roof terrace for drinks and relaxing. The sauna and swimming pool where well apppointed and well staff. All Hotel Staff were very friendly and most helpful. Would highly recommend this Hotel we could find no fault with it. We also had a meal at their sister Hotel the Orient Express which we can highly recommend. This is a warning about Istanbul. When we left the Hotel they called us a taxi. After reaching the Airport we gave the driver a 50 Lira note. After a few seconds he showed us a 5 lira not and insisted that we gave it to him. In the confusion we agreed and then gave him another 50 lira note. (the fare was 15 lira). It was not until we got into the Airport we realised that we had been conned because we had not had a 5 lira note, we had used our small change for tips at the Hotel. Please, if you get a taxi, and give a large note to the driver, hold onto it until he produces the change.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: javlietto
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay in this hotel.Extremely friendly and smiley staff. Excellent location

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in great location but not cheap”
Reviews.Author: lifeisbeaut
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location in the old part of town and is right next to the tram station so handy to all transport. The staff were friendly and helpful and the number one thing is that the rooms were spotlessly clean - one could not find any way to fault them. We had a nice view over the park from the room. Everything was great. It was around $400 AUD or more per night without breakfast which is more than we usually pay and I am not sure that it is better than somewhere that may be a little less per night. However, as it was for business the price did not matter and therefore the hotel was great and a perfect place to stay and location wise it is perfect. The only thing I wouldn't recommend is taking up their free meal offer - the meal was not great - better off eating elsewhere as there are plenty of other options.

Reviews.Title: “Sparkling clean, great location, but the people make the place”
Reviews.Author: KathleenCK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made our first trip to Turkey in May. We stayed 10 days, seven of them in Istanbul at this hotel. We picked it because of the reviews on this website. Every positive word is true. The hotel is at the edge of the district with the major sites. Despite being in an ancient area, the hotel is only two years old. The bathrooms are particularly lovely. The spa in the lower level was an unexpectedly nice treat. Breakfast and daily tea are included. For this long a stay, the room could have used a little more space, but that was the only--and small--downside. The staff was universally wonderful. The cooking lesson was great fun. The guest relations manager, Palen, helped me with a three day trip to Ephesus that went marvelously well. She was also on hand to help plan our daily activities in Istanbul. We are food people and seldom eat in the hotel where we stay. However, for this trip, the hotel dining room was really great and we ate in oftern. When we went out, we visited other Sirkici group properties in the area. A major guide book said they had raised the standard of dining in the area and it iscorrect. With limited (really no) Turkish language ability, the transfers from the airport were essential. I was expecting some bus arrangement, but each time it was a private car and driver. I really cannot say enough good things about this hotel. We had a wonderful trip.

Reviews.Title: “Sirkeci Konak best hotel experience in Turkey”
Reviews.Author: Jerendine
Reviews.Content: Sirkeci Konak was a wonderful stay during our nearly 3 weeks in Turkey. We spent 3 nights here in early May, 2009, at the end of our travels in the country. We really enjoyed the friendliness and helpfulness of the Turkish people generally throughout the country, and the staff at Sirkeci Konak certainly continued that experience. Our taxi driver from the airport managed to offload us about 500 metres from the hotel and so we had to trundle our suitcases through the Sultanamet district, a little disgruntled. But on arrival, the reception staff did their all to welcome us, even though our room was not quite ready - welcome drink in the lobby lounge, helpful advice about what to see and where to go in Istanbul. Our room was very nice, even though it was the standard double - a big king bed, view over Topkapi Gardens, plenty of space and a really good bathroom. Breakfast was substantial with plenty of cereals, fruits, yogurts, hot foods and cheeses, the best we had in Turkey. Free internet access was a nice touch as was complimentary high tea in the late afternoon - sandwiches and Turkish tea. Location is really good, too, down a quiet side street near Topkapi Palace, but just a couple of minutes walk to the light rail, and easy to get by foot to all Sultanamet sights. Late checkout was no problems, our transfer to the airport was arranged and on departure we were asked whether we enjoyed our stay and whether the hotel could improve in any area. Now that is a rarity. Well done, Sirkeci Konak.

Reviews.Title: “Easy breezy time at Sirkeci Konak”
Reviews.Author: Ataner76
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sirkeci Konak for 3 nights during my honeymoon trip through Turkey and Greece. Made the choice based on TripAdvisor reviews and did not regret it. Overall, our stay at the hotel was very pleasant and the hotel is very nice. The hotel is in a great location. It is very close to Ayasofya and the Topkapi Palace. We could also walk to the Blue Mosque and to the ferries to go over to the Asian side of Istanbul. If you are someone who is traveling by yourself or gets nervous when traveling abroad, please note that the hotel is about 60 meters down a smaller alley-like street. The street is well-lit and I never felt unsafe but wanted to point that out. The rooms are a nice size for a city hotel (not overly big but not super cramped either). Bathroom is nice - small but modern. The staff at the hotel were extremely helpful and very friendly. Though we didn't use it, there was a Turkish bath on property. Definitely no complaints about Sirkeci Konak.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate!”
Reviews.Author: DrBeach77
Reviews.Content: A gem in Sultanahmet...well done Sirkeci Group! My wife and I truly enjoyed this charming character boutique hotel. The hotel staff were excellent! The hotel provides a free airport pick up and 1st night dinner to its guest..a welcoming touch. Great idea! The location could not be more perfect! The hotel is centrally located and 50 meters from the Gulhane tram stop...it overlooks Gulhane Park and the old wall. We have travelled the world for 30 years, from our experiece the Istanbul taxi drivers are the worst we ever encountered and after some nasty experieces we made a decision to take the tram everywhere. We were very impressed with how clean everything was at the hotel. The hotel has a rooftop sun deck...this was a huge bonus for us! A great place for downtime after a hectic day of sightseeing. We will definately be recommending this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT, highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: toridon
Reviews.Content: The SK far exceeded our expectations. As previously arranged, they had a man at the airport awaiting our arrival, We were promptly transferred to the Hotel Ilkay where we were booked. Upon arrival, we were told we were being upgraded to the nearby SK hotel. We were skeptical at first but pleasantly surprised when we entered the SK. It is nicley decorated, immaculate, the entire staff is extremely helpful, especially Pelin. Our room was spacious, light and airy, decorated in the ottoman style with a modern bathroom. The mattress was firm and the room totally comfortable. The location is perfect for all the sights. The breakfast buffet was the best we had in all of Turkey. We had booked through the hotel web site and were able to saved 7% by paying cash upon checkout. . They offer free airport pick up when booking for 3 nights. i would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service & great location in a fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: vandy1999
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sirkeci Konak hotel in Istanbul with several friends for a quick 4 night holiday. We had 3 rooms all on the second floor (each with 2 persons) that varied in size. Room 1208 was the largest and quite spacious with a view toward the palace gardens. The service at the hotel is exceptional and every request is quickly filled. We made (and changed) numerous dinner reservations through the hotel and the restaurant selections were excellent. We enjoyed drinks and food on the hotel's roof deck at night as well. The hotel offers a discount to those paying in cash, and the multiple airport pick-ups and drop-offs that our party required were handled seamlessly. The hotel's location is perfect for walking to see the main sights of Sultanahmet though the street it is on is not the most scenic. There is a nice family owned Turkish delight store across from the hotel, and the hotel is very close to a tram stop (though we walked to all the sights and took taxis at night). The hotel is out of the heart of the "main" tourist drag, but I preferred that and the quite streets to the hustle and bustle of the busy tourist streets.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: oasa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had decided to spend a few days in Istanbul and originally planned to use a tour company. However, having read TripAdvisor reviews of the hotel which would be used, we decided to make our own arrangements. Based on the Tripadvisor reports, we selected the Sirkeci Konac. Our experience was totally positive. We were transported from the airport and provided with a free dinner. ( We were so impressed with the meal that we ate at the hotel for the rest of our stay. ) The staff could not have been more helpful; everything was impeccably clean; free internet access was provided; guidance for visiting the sights of the city was clearly given. Finally, the hotel arranged a taxi to take us to the airport at a fixed fee which was very reasonable and saved any argument with taxi drivers. From our original contact to make a reservation until our farewell on leaving to return home, the hotel staff went out of their way to ensure we had a most pleasant experience. I would recommend this hotel to anyone ( and I have done to my friends since we returned to Ireland. )

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alcama
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a last minute trip to Istanbul for 4 nights. Sirkeci Konak came highly recommended by a family member. For a three-day or longer stay (with breakfast included) booked on the official website, the hotel offered a free airport transfer and a welcome dinner. Our plane arrived earlier than scheduled, but the driver was already waiting for us. The service at the front desk and restaurant was amazing from the beginning to end, without any exception. The staff was very courteous, accomodating and often engaged guests into casual conversation. They were willing to provide assistance and always delivered results. The breakfast buffet was very good, with a lot of variation, offering both Western European and local dishes. The welcome dinner was delicious. The hotel itself is perfectly located in the old part of Istanbul. During our time there we walked to all the places we wanted to visit. However, if needed, public transportation is available 150m from Sirkeci Konak. The street is very quiet, the hotel clean, comfortable, and with a great ambiance. The room was very nice and spacious, with a beautiful balcony that had a view of the water, the Gulhane Park and the Blue Mosque minarets. We hope we will go back soon!

Reviews.Title: “But for the pampering,felt like home.”
Reviews.Author: ccltoronto
Reviews.Content: This small boutique hotel in the old section of Istanbul is both hospitable and comfortable.The staff are wonderful and make a stay here a pleasure. The rooms are small but very clean and functional.The Turkish bath is a hidden gem,well worth the descent to the second basement level. Both restaurants are first rate,with kudos going to the fish restaurant where we returned twice for as good a meal as we had anywhere in Turkey. So if you are looking for great location,helpful and caring staff and a hotel with personality,this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “A superb find....”
Reviews.Author: RichWandsworth
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at the Sirkeci Konak and have to say I wish it was 3 weeks. Firstly, Istanbul is amazing and if you want to be near the centre of all the major attractions Sirkeci Konak is superbly located. I would recommend a room on at least the third floor at the front, with a balcony giving views across into the park, lower rooms you mat not get such a good view. The next thing and I would say the most important thing to mention is the staff, from all reviews below the staff are mentioned and this is for good reason. They honestly make you feel like you are the only guest - they were amazing and made the stay. You felt like they were really interested in you, rather than having succesfully completed a corporate training course on customer service that you get in the bigger hotels. One night we were late to see the Whirling Dervishes, rather than explain the difficult location in the backstreets one of the team actually walked us to the venue - just brilliant. Rooms were great, extremely clean, bath with jacuzzi jets was also nice to have. Breakfast was also great. Nice touches like printed daily news sheet giving info about Istanbul and various events taking place around Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “FRIENDLY, COMFORTABLE, CONVENIENT”
Reviews.Author: dan773
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed here for 3 nights in May 09. We chose it as it is ranked #1 on this website. It is I think a bit dearer than some, but if you can afford it do it. Its great. I would definately stay again. Visit its website. its good and has handy links The hotel was yards from a tram stop and signposted when you get off the tram. This makes it dead easy to find. We got the train and then the tram to the hotel from the airport. Dont be put off, about an hours trip and cost about Â£1.40 each person each way. Dead Cheap, clean and easy to use. dont waste money on a cab We have stayed at many hotels, whilst this is not the poshest it was by far the most welcoming and freindly Despite it not being the poshest, this is not to infer it is not a lovely hotel, it is. They serve afternoon tea between where you can have tea and filled rolls, handy if you have missed lunch. Breakfast was Okay, a buffet type, hot and cold. Not excellent but far from poor. Standard I would say The big plus for this hotel are A) the location. very handy for all the major tourist attractions. B) the staff and help the hotel can provide. TRY IT. I doubt you will be disappointed, we weren't.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel.....amazing city!”
Reviews.Author: joedoe1
Reviews.Content: I told my friends in the United States about how exciting was the experience of visiting Istanbul and meeting friendly people like Pelin NasÃ³z, GÃ³rkem Suzguh, Emre Hersad and Dilhan Tatlisu at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel. Emre was always with a smile on his face and willing to help us anytime with the luggage . Pelin is an excellent Guest Relations Manager. Dilhan demonstrated a lot of dedication at the restaurant. Mr. GÃ³rkem Suzguh , thank to his help I have the most beautiful pictures of Ortakoyâ€¦he showed me how to experience (like a local) the tramway (close to hotel), funicular (at Karakoy and Taksim) and bus (to Ortakoy). While I was looking at the pictures, I realized how many places I visited during my one week stay. I arrived the last day of the Tulip Festival (April 13th) and the beginning of the Tourism week. The city looks amazing; a lot of color and music. I spent a week visiting the following places: Hagia Sophia, Cisterns, Bosphorus ferry, Blue Mosque (a unique experience), Topkapi Palace (you need a least half day and have luch at the restaurant with the most spectacular view of the Bosphorus), Spice Bazaar (very crowded watch your bags and money), Grand Bazaar (always ask for a low price, try to buy as much as you can from one store to get a good deal), Taksim Square & Istiklal (the new Istanbul), Ortakoy (have lunch or dinner at the restaurants close to the mosque), Whirling Dervishes at a Monastery (the real oneâ€¦not the tourist trap), and a lot of shopping. My only adviseâ€¦be careful at night (like any big city in the world) and avoid using the taxi service. There is a lot of Taxi scamâ€¦if you decide to use a taxi, never show your wallet to the driver and bring a lot of change in small currency. Before you hand out the money, look at the face of the taxi driver and ask him to tell you how much you are giving them before putting the money in their hands. In that way you avoid them switching a high bill into a small one and start a discussion/fight. If you ever experience a problem with a taxi driverâ€¦just pay again and let God take care of them. I am sure it willâ€¦trust meâ€¦the Coran is very clear about robbery! Donâ€™t let this to ruin your vacations! Also, take the service provided by the hote (you have to pay) to the airport. The hotel is super clean, great food at the restaurant and service was impeccable. Bon Voyage, Buen Viaje, Have a safe trip!

Reviews.Title: “A HIGHLY PLEASURABLE EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: RICHARDLONDON41
Reviews.Content: This wasour first trip to Istanbul and we chose the hotel on the strength of the very favourable reviews and its central position. We were not disappointed.From start to finish we were made to feel like the most honoured guests the hotel had ever had. The staff were unfailingly charming and courteous and nothing was ever too much trouble. The concept of having a Guest Relations Manager is one that other hotels could well follow and nobody could have been better than Pelin, who was genuinely interested in everything we did during our 4 night stay. The hotel is attractively decorated and retains an auhentic Turkish feel, including a very pleasant Turkish breakfast and a very welcoming afternoon tea. Included in our rate was dinner on the first night which was also excellent. The staff make the art of the hotelier look easy, which it certainly is not, without fail thay produced a master class iun customer service. I can't remember going to a first class hotel where the managers wave goodbye to you. One minor comment, the bedroom got very hot at night but was too cold when the air conditioining was on. Apart from that absolutely faultless and we will no hesitation in recommending the hotel to anyone and we look forward to returning

Reviews.Title: “Tripadvisor reviews are real!”
Reviews.Author: coug
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at this lovely hotel. Room was on the 3rd floor on the street side. We found it to be a very restful and quiet hotel. The air conditioning system worked perfectly for adjusting our comfort at will. Breakfast was included with our stay, as well as airport pickup. The indoor pool is nice and clean, the sauna and hamman are also very nice and clean. The hotel will provide you with a pestale, a wrap to cover your modest areas to wear while in the sauna or hamman. The location is very convenient to walk to the historic sights, Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Cistern, etc. It also has a tram stop just a block away. Pelin was quite helpful and has a very warm personality. We were very pleased to find the reviews to be accurate. The Bosphorus boat trip is a must do. There are lots of good restaurants convenient to the hotel. Prices at the Grand Bazaar are high and the hawking of vendors and guides through out Istanbul is a pain, how many times in a day can you tolerate saying "no". The staff is helpful in every way, this includes the desk, bell, restaurant and housekeeping personnel. The hamman is a great jewel to find in this type of boutique hotel. The sauna and hamman are co-ed.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: BigAnthony
Reviews.Content: Yes the rooms are small, yes the bed is very small but this is one of the best hotels I have stayed in. My room was nicely decorated very cozy and very clean The staff is AMAZING and VERY helpful they will do their best to make your stay unforgettable The breakfast is nice and the fish restaurant of the hotel is very good. The internet if for free and fast The location is excellent for tourists because the old city is only 2 minutes away the tram line is 50 meters away and less than ten minutes walk to the golden horn and the Bosporus ferries stop but the location is not excellent for business travelers

Reviews.Title: “The Sirkeci Konak encompassed all you need for a comfortable and enjoyable break in this intriguing city.”
Reviews.Author: Cheltenhamlady59
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived the staff were warm and friendly, efficient and most helpful on every aspect of our stay. The accommodation was comfortable, clean, everything worked well and any requests promptly dealt with. The restaurants were excellent - I had some of the best lamb I have ever tasted and offered varied menus. Breakfasts were well stocked(although I would have liked the option of a variety of cooked eggs) and kept us going until coming back for the complimentary afternoon tea, which was a welcome and refreshing touch before going out for the evening. Very conveniently located, made it very easy getting around but it was still peaceful and relaxing place to return to. Being able to have our Turkish Bath in the hotel before we came home was so relaxing and great fun, setting us up for our return.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: bbar01
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable time. The staff were very welcoming and went out of their way to meet our every need. The rooms were very clean and comfortable with a choice of pillows to ensure a good night's sleep. It is very central and within walking distance of all the main sites in the old city. It is close to the tram line and railway station. Taxis had difficulty finding it owing to one way systems and roads blocked off without any warning. We enjoyed the Turkish bath after a long day sight seeing and the cooking demonstration given by the chefs one evening in his immaculate kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sweetytours
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in April, all the staff were fantastic -everyone made an effort to make our stay more enjoyable - with lots of help & advice. The hotel is in a side street away from all the hustle,but 5 mins walk away from all the major sights,our room overlooked the park with its wonderful flower display. The hotel's complimentary afternoon Tea was very welcome after a day sightseeing,we ate 1 night in the hotels restaurant (traditional Turkish food),the lamb was delicious. Breakfast was buffet style with lots of variety and choices - very good Our only dissapointment was the swimming pool - its in the 'dark' basement and small The hotel room was small but comfortable with a small 'Juliet' balcony,the roof terrace had great views. There are lots of restaurants/cafes nearby ... some are very much looking for tourist's rather than locals! Also if you do want to buy a rug.... there are plenty of people who will help !!!!

Reviews.Title: “what a gem in istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: docsla
Reviews.Content: When we booked this hotel it was fairly new and had a few reviews but the forum did not know at that time if the hotel was really as nice as the reviews posted. We had problems with our computer accessing the reservations email, but an employee of the hotel followed thru with comfirming our reservation for four nights on her own email acct. We had been on a ship for 6 weeks from So America and was looking forward to the sights of Istanbul for the grand finale, so we wanted a large room with a view but easy to walk around in the old city, unkown to us, it was week of formula one racing so we had problem with first choice only two days available in the jail hotel. Lucky for us, we got a balcony room here that gave us view of the Bosphourus, balcony overlooks the Palace park gardens, and the room was huge- yes very big!!!! After ship we were really happy to have all the space. Breakfast was wonderful every morning and had some lunch meals that were good also, but the best part of this beautiful hotel was the staff. They made every effort to direct us to what we were looking for and helped in every need that we had, my husband uses a wchair so we sometimes need a little extra help. We will always remember the kindness of the people we encountered in Turkey, starting with the staff of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Munstermike
Reviews.Content: Stayed here based solely on trip advisor advice . It was a very good stay allround . Staff were excellent . Food good . Wifi in lobby - didnt get to check out the leisure facilities but certainly reccommend - no room service on one of the nights the only dissapointments but rest more than made up for it - good reccommendation and excellent location

Reviews.Title: “They let me check in at 9 am”
Reviews.Author: JE_Nayland
Reviews.Content: I arrived off the overnight train at 9 am and they not only let me check in, but gave me breakfast at well without charge. If you are arriving by train, then this is the place to stay. The room had no view, but was spotless, scented and cool. The breakfast was fantastic, loads of fresh ingredients, even down to a large honeycomb. One caution, I nearly booked with another place, based on a large number of wholly positive reviews, but something just didn't seem right. Then I noticed that none of the many reviewers had reviewed any other hotels. Very sus...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Enhanced_Blond
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a weekend break in Istanbul and stayed at this hotel on the strength of the reviews on Trip Advisor. The hotel is not in the prettiest of locations but once you step through the front door any doubts disappear. The staff are polite attentive and very informative, nothing is too much trouble. The complimentary teas and sandwiches are very welcome after a hard day sight seeing. This hotel is in a perfect location as you are within walking distance of all the main tourist sights as well as restaurants/bars etc. If like us you have been walking around for most of the day trying to see as much of this facinating city as possible, you don't fancy putting your walking shoes on again to go out to find dinner, try the hotel restaurant. We found the food and service to be of an excellent standard and reasonably priced. If I had any negative comments at all, it would have ben on the size of our room it was very small with limited storage, having said that though it was spotlessly clean and for the amount of time we were actually in our room on reflection it didn't matter. I would recommend this lovely little hotel 100%

Reviews.Title: “Sirkeci Hotel First Class”
Reviews.Author: Berko19
Reviews.Content: One of the things that attracted me to Sirkeci Konak Hotel in Istanbul, Turkey is the name and the history around it. The hotel is a very modern one, and according to the concierge personnel the owners wanted to give the establishment a touch of old world charm to keep in line with its namesake. We really liked the fact that this Istanbul hotel was in an area that wasnâ€™t chock full of tourists and heavily laden attractions. All of the attractions are within walking distance and our Istanbul hotel has a nice rooftop restaurant with some good food and a pub restaurant as well. The swimming pool is an indoor one with its own changing rooms, handy since I really hate walking through a nice hotel sopping wet. There is also a doctor on staff at the hotel and from what I could tell, the medical services were pretty quick to respond to a call as one of the guests twisted their ankle and needed it seen to. We booked our rooms online at www.istanbulbooker.com, and our flights at www.thy.com We enjoyed the Old City and the attractions there and we even ventured as far as the Galata Tower. Some of the museums are totally unique to this part of the world and no visit to Istanbul is complete until you visit the Grand Bazaar. We found some great souvenirs to bring home, including little replicas of the Orient Express. We completely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a place a little off the beaten track. ~ Berk Berkan, Cyprus

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul's own piece of "Turkish Delight"”
Reviews.Author: Deans58
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at this charming hotel for a few days last week after reading all the excellent reviews and we were not disappointed. As we stayed for 4 nights we qualified for a free one-way transfer from the airport and a free welcome dinner in the hotel's Neyzade restaurant. Also, as we chose to pay for our accommodation in cash we received a discount of 11%. Upon arrival at the hotel, we were warmly welcomed by the reception staff and offered afternoon tea whilst we checked in. We found all the members of staff to be friendly and helpful at all times. The location of the hotel-in a quiet but unattractive street-is ideal for visiting all the major historic sights such as, the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and Topkapi Palace, and for catching ferries/boats on the Bosphorus. The hotel is clean, tastefully decorated and the nice touches such as, the Turkish Delight left in the room on arrival and the daily complimentary afternoon tea were thoughtful. Above all, it is the staff who make this hotel so special with their outstanding hospitality and kindness. Upon our departure, all the staff who were on duty, led by the Guest Relations Manager, Pelin Nasoz, stood outside to bid us farewell-we were quite moved. Our visit to Istanbul was made even more memorable because we saw Barack Obama whilst we were there!

Reviews.Title: “A Superior and Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ClarkeWestSussex
Reviews.Content: We went last week to celebrate my daughter's 21st birthday. When we arrived Mr Farouk the Owner, Mr Okay Reception Manager and Ms Pelin Nasoz Public Relations Manager were at reception to welcome us. While registering they organised a cake, candles and sang Happy birthday to my daughter (at no charge to us) . My daughter's room had 21 balloons (again at no charge). This attention to details started our holiday on a superb footing. The staff were very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful at all times - the rooms were spotless (we were upgraded the next day and I think the only reason was because I said that it would have been lovely if we could see the Bosphorus). So again they made sure that our rooms had a view , although limited, was greatly appreciated. We had a four course meal at the Fish Restaurent in the hotel which was very enjoyable. We travel several times a year but this is a truly memorable hotel and one of the best we have ever come across. Thank you to the Owner and staff for making our stay very enjoyable. We will back again soon. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Jaisaach
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading all the positive reviews posted on this site.So we knew what to expect. Cosy clean rooms,good breakfast, great location, etc. But what really took us by surprise was the efficiency and helpfulness of the staff.Its the staff that makes this hotel special!Pelin,Okay and all the wonderful people working at this hotel thanks a million for making our stay so memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rfmcgrath
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights on a layover from business trip. Nice rooms....ask for a deluxe room...they have a balcony with a great view. Nice spa downstairs, small but well done.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with wonderful , friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: goodputt
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay for four nights to celebrate our wedding anniversary & a birthday.The hotel is very clean ,comfortable & in an excellent location to walk to the sights.All the staff were very friendly & helpful & arranged a number of visits for us.We would mention particularly Pelin & Okay.We enjoyed very much the afternoon teas & the presents & celebrations for the anniversary & birthday.We travelled from the airport by metro to Zeytinburnu then changed to a tram to Gulhane.It only took an hour & cost just YTL 2.80!! We would definitely return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Warm people with a personal approach”
Reviews.Author: beaenpaulinsibculo
Reviews.Content: During our private to Istanbul this hotel has been the starting place of many beautiful trips to the cultural hart of Istanbul. Situated on a short walking distance from most of Istanbul's top tourist sites this hotel is ideal. The hotel staff has been very friendly and helpfull without being unnatural. Next to that the hotel's tea break with typical Turkish sandwiches and tasteful apple tea was a nice touch. Also, the restaurant, based on the Turkish kitchen is certainly worth to be visited. The staff has many ideas how to spend your days and are a good source of information for Istanbu;'s high lights. We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, friendly staff and nice touches”
Reviews.Author: jobean
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the rave reviews and we weren't disappointed. The location is excellent, near all the main sights and also very close to a tram stop. Hotel itself is very nice and also has a Turkish bath, sauna, gym and small (very small!) swimming pool which we used most days. Looks like they are also building a jacuzzi. You can get a massage/scrub but we chose to go to one of the very old baths in the City (Cemberllitas) to get more of the 'real' experience - although it was clearly geared to tourists and quite pricey. Hotel breakfast very good - a vast array of sweet and savoury things - our favourite being the walnut-stuffed figs. Our room was nice, overlooking the park, although a little on the small side (and the bathroom especially so) given the relatively high price of staying there. Nevertheless it was very comfortable and had nice touches like a box of Turkish Delight on arrival, bath robes, slippers and complimentary water every day. In addition, the hotel puts on afternoon tea every day with little typical Turkish sandwiches which was most welcome after a hard day's sightseeing. Above all, the staff at this hotel could not have been more friendly and helpful and did their utmost to make our stay pleasurable, with a dedicated Guest Relations Manager a very good idea.

Reviews.Title: “If you're going to Istanbul - stay here!”
Reviews.Author: AndrewCBirminghamUK
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel - staff can't do enough for you - take advantage of Pelin's advice for dinner - do the cookery course with the Executive Chef. Just a few minutes' walk from major sites and harbour for brilliant ferries all over Bosphorous.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: TinyAbuDhabi
Reviews.Content: Based on the TripAdvisor database, I expected more, especially for the price. Biggest problem was with the room ... many things didn't work.

Reviews.Title: “Sets a standard other hotels should aspire to”
Reviews.Author: Honest-Jim
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simply excellent, fully deserving its Tripadvisor Award for 2009. We were impressed as soon as we walked through the door. Our host, Pelin Nasoz (the Customer Relations Manager) welcomed us immediately and showed us to the lounge area where she sat us down and ordered tea and sandwiches for us while she took us through the checking in process, and then went on to provide a map of Istanbul, describing what we might like to do and where it all was. In the meantime, our cases were taken up to our room. Great start! The room was compact, although the bed was large. It was spotlessly clean and very comfortable, with everything you could possibly want including the usual complimentary tray, mini bar, dressing gowns and slippers (useful for the leisure suite). The bathroom was great too with underfloor heating, but beware that the showers are so powerful, it could almost blast you out of the bath! The location of this hotel was superb. The street it was in was fairly quiet â€“ particularly at night as it is located more in a commercial area with a number of car spares shops around. The view out therefore was uninspiring, but we donâ€™t go on holidays to sit around looking out of the window! The hotel is also located a two minute walk from a tram stop, and 5 minutes from the railway station. Most of the main attractions eg Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar are easily accessible by foot. We enjoyed using the very clean leisure facility, comprising a fitness suite, swimming pool, sauna and Turkish bath. The meals were excellent. Plenty of choice for all tastes for breakfast, and the evening meals too were very enjoyable. There is a good selection of restaurants in the vicinity, including this hotelâ€™s sister (three minutes walk) which has a top floor restaurant where the views are quite good over the Bosphorous. Tip: The hotel offers an airport transfer service for 24 Euros one way. We were warned that some taxi drivers have an elastic interpretation of the appropriate fare; they should cost about 35TL â€“ so the hotel rate is very fair. To sum up â€“ I could find no fault with this hotel whatsoever; highly recommended. I would not hesitate to stay here again . A final nice touch - Pelin was there to shake hands and bid us farewell on our departure. I think many other hotels could learn a thing or two from this place, especially in the customer service department. It set a standard others should aspire to.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Silym
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from four nights in Istanbul, I feel moved to compliment this hotel for its outstanding hospitality and kindness. The hotel is charming, not large, well positioned and tastefully decorated with everything you need. However what really stood out was the high standard of hospitality from the very helpful staff. From the turkish delight on the bed to a surprise birthday cake and present (picked up from my passport) to the complimentary turkish cookery lessons, everything possible was done to make our visit an enjoyable one. Having travelled all around the world staying in masses of hotels, this one really stands out and it is the first time I have felt moved to write a review.

Reviews.Title: “Like coming to a family”
Reviews.Author: DEWEHolland
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with very nice and helpful employees. You feel like coming home instead of going to a hotel. Clean, nice breakfast, good tips for Istanbul and walking distance from cultural events. Definitely a recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - full of character, friendly but professional staff and so clean!”
Reviews.Author: JudeC1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and loved it. I would call the rooms cosy rather than small, they had everything you needed and were beautifully decorated, full of Turkish character. We have stayed in many hotels and this is probably the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in, even the plugholes were scrubbed! All the staff were very friendly and helpful, from the receptionist, to waiting staff to the cleaners. I am vegetarian and had plenty of choice at breakfast. We ate in the restaurant twice and had very good food, service and Turkish wine. We also ate at the Orient Express Hotel which was just around the corner and had wonderful food with fantastic views over the Bospherous! The Turkish Bath was wonderful. I thought the temperature was just right. I visited the Cemberlitas Public Turkish Bath (which was a wonderful experience) and that was a similar temperature. It's not like a steam room, you have to lie on the hot marble slab (hotter around the sides of the room) and pour hot water over you periodically in order to perspire and it is very relaxing. The pool was small but we used it a couple of times for a quick swim and found the temperature fine! The hotel is perfectly situated, within a ten minute walk of the Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sofia and Blue Mosque. Sitting between the Hagia Sofia and Blue Mosque listening to the call to prayer is a mesmerising experience (apart from the interruptions from shoe shiners)! We loved Istanbul and will definitely visit again and stay at the Sirkeci Konak!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to fall in love with Turkey...”
Reviews.Author: RoxxyGirl
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 7 night stay at this hotel and I absolutely loved it. Everything positive written about this hotel is true so I will try not to be redundant. Rooms: We got a very good rate on this hotel through booking.com. We stayed for 3 nights in a regular room and then were upgraded to the superior room simply because we asked. The superior room is on the top (5th) floor and it clears the bldgâ€™s in front. We had park views and a glimmer of the water. The room also has a king sized bed and large balcony. If you have a choice between the two- I would def pay more for the larger room. The standard rooms are fairly small albeit very comfortable. We were on the 4th floor in the standard room with a small balcony. It was an ok view but I would NOT have liked to be any lower than that. The shower pressure was great and the rooms were warm. I note that because it was freezing outside. I traveled through Europe in December and a lot of the hotel rooms did not provide adequate heat. Rest assured, you will be toasty! Location: Walk to all the historic sites, grand bazaar etc. The street the hotel is on is not pretty. Itâ€™s located across the street from Kamalâ€™s car shop. You will get over this though. One thing you should note before you go is that the hotel is hard to find. Every cab driver we had could NOT find the hotel- especially at night. After the second day or so when you have an idea of the area, you will be able to guide the cab drivers like we did. Itâ€™s actually not hard to find but it seemed to confuse the drivers. Service: I need to comment on the service of this hotel because truly, in all my travels, I have never had such a warm and helpful staff. They were on a first name basis with us on day 2. Pelin is magnificent. If I owned a hotel I would want someone like her working for me. Food: Breakfast was amazing and we loved the afternoon tea time. Overall, I would advise to leave the Sultanahmet area at night (it was dead) and venture to other more lively neighborhoods for dinner. We had our best two meals at 360 restaurant and at Mikla (located in the Marmara Pera hotel). Both are chic restaurants that boast a stylish crowd. Amazingly enough, both actually serve fine food as well. I only say that because we were given restaurant recommendations that were not very good. Both 360 and Mikla give you the ambiance and the food. Also check out the Bebek neighborhood as it also has a nice scene at night. We had cocktails at trendy Lucca and dinner at Lulu. Ask the locals about Pelit. Its THE BEST chocolate place I have ever encountered. Better chocolate than Demel in Vienna. I only knew about it because my boyfriend is from Istanbul and his family requested him to bring chocolate back from there. The one we went to is in Yesikloy (near the airport) but there are others in Istanbul. I am pretty sure there is one in Bebek and also Levent. The chocolate covered Turkish delights are one of their specialties. What not to do: Donâ€™t go to the malls. It was pouring rain one day and I wanted to be indoors so I went to both Kanyon Mall and Cevahir Mall. There is nothing there that you canâ€™t get in the US for cheaper. It was a waste of time! Safety: I was alone during the day while my bf worked. I walked to all the sites and yes, men did bother me but it was more annoying than anything else. I just ignored them. Always count your change. I gave 20 Lira to get into one of the sites and the cashier didnâ€™t want to give me the 5 lira back until I asked him to. Also many of the cab drivers donâ€™t give you enough change back- they did this to us three times- until my bf asked for the change. Overall a fabulous hotel in an amazing country- I would HIGHLY recommend a stay here. Please email me if you need more information. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic customer service,wonderful location,however!”
Reviews.Author: Dave098
Reviews.Content: I think that this hotel is over rated. Before all other posters shoot me down in flames let me explain. If your priority is fantastic customer service and a wonderful location then this is the hotel for you. I will not further commend the excellent customer relations service from the collection at the airport to the meet and greet and the first class service of Pelin and her colleagues. They are great. However, I like to consider everything. Unless you are on the top floor of the hotel you do not have a view of Gulhane Park. The hotel overlooks several 'motor factor' distributors. At night they are all shuttered with blank facades. So unless you are on the top floor this is your outlook. As previous correspondents have commented the rooms are on the small side again the more exclusive rooms are bigger. The swimming pool is cold and unless a cold dip is required after a sauna it was not for me. I did not see anyone using it. I have used several Hammam's before but this one did not seem to get to the required operating temperature. The slabs were warm but the overall temperature did not reach the required levels. Would I stay here again? Probably not. From 12rth March a basic double room costs 184 euros which I think is expensive for bed and breakfast. I just think that overall for those type of prices every catergory needs to be 100% and in my opinion it is not.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: sweetecb2000
Reviews.Content: A great stay. The staff is very helpful and friendly. Very close to many popular tourist destinations. The best part was the restaurant. We found it hard to leave and venture out to other food destinations because the food here is outstanding. Come here!

Reviews.Title: “Seriously good hotel”
Reviews.Author: RamblingRambler
Reviews.Content: Really an excellent hotel. Very friendly, helpful staff, good value for money, nice central location, good rooms and with super comfortable beds. Perhaps the best thing about the hotel was that the food was AMAZING. Could barely tear ourselves away to eat anywhere else. Also lots of nice little pluses: free sandwiches and afternoon tea between 4.30-6.30, 24 hour room service (I personally love being able to order something at 4 in the morning...) My minor complaints are that the elevator is a little cramped and our room was slightly on the small side (though still perfectly fine - and we had just a standard double room). Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: marc_vleuten_NL
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel on Tripadvisor so we were full of expectations. This was no disappointment! The hotel is great and the staff is very helpful. We enjoyed all of our stay in the hotel and the diversity of Istanbul. Beds are big and nice. Everything is nicely decorated and cozy. At 16.00h it is tea time in the lobby with apple tea and local pastries on the house. In the basement is a great sauna with swimming pool and Hamam. The breakfast is very nice. For dining the young enthusiastic female manager gave us a good recommendation. The Zinham Kebab house at the bridge next to the bus station. We enjoyed it so much we went twice! Fantastic views and GREAT food. The bread is made fresh in their oven and the meat is grilled on charcoal. Not too fancy but authentic Turkish food. Not that inferior altered touristic food you can find easily everywhere. The Konak Hotel certainly contributed to a fantastic city trip! The Turks are very nice and warm people. We will certainly go back to Istanbul and it will stay at the Konak or the new hotel which the owner plans to build next. If you go. Enjoy. Marc Notenboom

Reviews.Title: “Superlative!”
Reviews.Author: pcsqueen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sirkeci Konak for five nights at the beginning of February 2009. I won't re-write all of the glowing compliments given to the hotel, its location, its rooms, its cleanliness, etc. They are all quite true, and I agree with all of them. My focus, like other recent reviewers, will be on the absolutely phenomenal hospitality we were shown by everyone (repeat: everyone) on the hotel staff. From the time we entered and were offered drinks and food (the famous afternoon tea), to the time we left with our hosts waving to us from the front door, we felt like true guests, instead of like paying inhabitants that most hotels make one feel. While Pelin has, and very accurately, been singled out for compliments by other reviewers, she is only one component of a team that works hard, but seemingly effortlessly, to ensure that all guests not only enjoy their stay at the hotel, but also appreciate the majesty and history that is Istanbul. And the downright fun that is Istanbul, too. How many other hotel staff invite a guest and his wife to accompany them to an important football match (soccer game)? They not only did, but also gave them a lift in their personal vehicle and provided the appropriate club (team) tee shirts! My husband and I have traveled fairly extensively, both on business and for enjoyment. I cannot think of another hotel in which our stay was so absolutely pleasant. Personally, I think that, instead of the Sirkeci Konak's staff doing internships at huge hotel chains like Hilton and Ritz-Carlton, the latter should send its folks to the Sirkeci Konak to learn a thing or two.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsGBerkshire
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed on arrival and were greeted with traditional apple tea. We were asked whether we were on business or vacation and when I said it was our wedding anniversary a bottle of wine was sent to our room. The hotel is beautifully presented, very clean and the staff are all exceptionally friendly and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble. Tea and sandwiches are provided each day at 5pm and the Guest Relations Manager would come over for a chat to ask how our day went. She (Pelin) would also arrange any excursions for you and advise you of the easiest way to get somewhere.
