The hotel is very well located for the bazaars, mosques and palace and has a tram stop just a hundred yards or so away on the main road. We mainly ate at the restaurants near the Blue Mosque, where you can get a snack from 2 TL up to a three course meal for over 100. We were genuinely sorry to leave. The hotel Chairman was on his way home when we were leaving and gave us a lift to the airport. This hotel is probably the best we have stayed in for customer service and satisfaction and we would recommend it to anyone. Oh and if you're a cat lover, look out for Olivia, the cat who has the luxurious lifestyle of sleeping on the rugs in the carpet shop on the corner! All in all a great holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, I would recommend...”
Reviews.Author: tracyosullivan
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the hotel from the 30th December to 6th January 2009 and we all really enjoyed our stay. The location was fantastic, very central to everything of historical nature. The staff were very friendly and on the first day we arrived we were offered a complementary dinner at the hotel restaurant which was of a very good standard. I would recommend trying the restaurant. The twin room was a little small but the deluxe double was a good size, albeit low ceiling height. The deluxe rooms overlooked the gardens of the palace and had there own balconys, shame the weather was so cold we could not use them! Whilst the hotel offer a pick up service from the airport it would be good if they offered a return service to make it easier for their clients.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, hospitable family”
Reviews.Author: HenenGem
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay in Serkeci Konak. Staff is always ready to help, open and friendly. Interior is fresh, good mix of traditional en modern, nice room en very good bed. Location is perfect, next to Topkapi en Aya Sofya, trams at 50 mtrs.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic friendly staff wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: ajt78
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fantastic holiday in instanbul. I booked it as a surprise for my husband's birthday. We stayed at the Sirkeci Konak as we wanted a hotel with traditional Turkish decor and atmosphere. The staff were amazing - there was not enough that they could do for us. On our arrival the owner of the hotel introduced himself and we had tea with him and on my husband's birthday they made him a cake and gave him a lovely present. One of the best things about the hotel was the Turkish bath/massage. You could use the all the gym/spa/pool facilities for free but we opted to pay a bit extra and have a foam/peel massage - it was fabulous and well worth the money!! Also they provide free internet/printing and have a dedicated person to help plan events/outings. With all of these services plus it location only 5mins walk from all the major attractions in the old town I would definitly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Helpful staff, superb location for tourists; Quaint, better than 5*”
Reviews.Author: rostomic
Reviews.Content: With 7 full days of full program of visiting all the places of interest, the hotelâ€™s welcome at the end of an exhausting day never failed, the genuine interest of the staff in the success of ones day, the apple tea and a cheese bago .. without the haggle of additional cost, ever so refreshing in todayâ€™s bottom line oriented hotel business. Just like being in a superb Bed and Breakfast place! Mr Okâ€¦ you and your group of folks there is more than ok â€¦ we thank you for all your assistance and we will be back. Thomas

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ge90
Reviews.Content: There were many positives: friendly helpful staff, breakfast was good, airport transfer was appreciated (Istanbul taxi drivers are hopeless!), free internet in the lobby, afternoon teas in the lounge, central location (although the street itself is rather drab, surrounded by carparts outlets), pleasant decor and room fitout. Bed was superb. Restaurant was excellent. Negatives were : room too small and with quite a lot of luggage we were cramped. We paid a higher tariff for a superior room purely for the extra space but it turned out to be the same 25m2 size as an ordinary room so we paid a lot for things we didn't want such as a jet-bath and a larger TV screen. Suggest be aware when booking of exact square metres of room. Noise from the street was constant through the night so sleeping was not good. When in the bathroom we could hear every detail of the sounds of the person in the neighbouring bathroom- bizarre! I think it came through ducting. And, like many hotels in the winter, the aircon was either stifling heat or nothing. You cannot keep a confortable temperature. Gymn had only limited equipment.

Reviews.Title: “lovely place”
Reviews.Author: travellerxyz123
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel, great service from the guest manager, good value for money, convenient area

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: markandpat
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this wonderful boutique hotel for 4 nights in December. We selected it based on reviews like this one and couldn't have been more pleased. We had planned to do most of our sightseeing in the old city. The location of the hotel was perfect, only a 10-15 minute walk from all the sights. When we wanted to go further afield, the excellent staff helped us find our way with ease. Speaking of the staff, they couldn't have been more helpful. We were greeted by the Guest Services Manager when we checked in. She helped orient us to the hotel and the city and seemed to almost always be there whenever we needed advice, whether for directions to some sight or with recommendations for dinner. And when she was not there, the other staff worked hard to be equally helpful. The hotel itself was beautiful. The lobby area, where complimentary tea and sandwiches are served every afternoon was lovely. Our room was clean and well furnished, although a bit small. There was great variety in the breakfast which came with our room, and the restaurant where it was served was excellent, as was the service. There was also free internet service, something we did not find in other hotels on our trip. We were very pleased with our choice and would not only recommend it to anyone, but would certainly stay here again if we return to this fascinating city.

Reviews.Title: “good restaurant”
Reviews.Author: vvvlas
Reviews.Content: Really it is just note that when food is mostly mediocre or worse in istanbul, in this hotel food in restaurant as well as service and cost is very good

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely stay!”
Reviews.Author: johaha
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Sirkeci Konak was ineed very nice. The room and bathroom were perfect, spotless clean, and what we appreciated most was the professional, helpful, kind and attentive staff. As my birthday was within our stay they even realised that had a nice surprise. We would defenitely stay there again and recommend the place to friends. Christine

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Nice789
Reviews.Content: The hotel experience was the best i ever had, and we travel a lot. The hotel itself is not very big, but very charming and had lots of character. They have very nice facilites to use( pool, turkish bath...) after a long day of touring the city. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. I was most impressed by the staff who went above and beyond each time we had a question about anything. Everybody in the hotel new us personally and always gave insight on best places to see and things to do in istanbul. The owner of the hotel even hosts a "tea time" everyday and sits down with each family to chat about the day or things to do. I would definately stay at this hotel again and recommend anybody going to Istanbul. I can truely say i have never experienced such fantastic hotel service. The staff was the amazing. Everything was perfect...from complimentary breakfast ,to the rooms,to all the offerings of the hotel. Also, it was in a great location. Walking distance to everything, but still tucked away on a relatively quite street. My rec: Stay here without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Warm and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: suzannaknot
Reviews.Content: This charming little hotel exceeded all of our expectations. It was so charming and in a fantastic location. The rooms were warm and welcoming and the decor was superb. The hotel's Restaurant is just great (we couldnt stop eating). But what sets this hotel apart from any that we have ever stayed at is the attention from the staff! We had amazing service and attention from the minute we arrived,welcoming, helpful, with great suggestions on restaurants, sites to visit.. We felt as if we were house guests of true friends.My husband and I are trying to work out when we can go back to Istanbul just so that we can stay at the Sirkeci Konak .

Reviews.Title: “I have never been so sad to leave a hotel”
Reviews.Author: HPL93
Reviews.Content: If you are thinking of visiting Istanbul, do it! And when you're there stay at this hotel. It's wonderful. Everything about it is fabulous; the staff are friendly and do their best to make you feel welcome, even to the extent of inviting you for apple tea and a snack at tea-time. They collected us from the airport, gave us a meal on our first night and produced a daily leaflet of attractions and closures. The hamman is great and there is a well fitted gym, sauna and small pool in which one can relax. Breakfast was excellent with a good choice of foods - we rarely needed any refreshments during the day. We ate in the hotel restaurant a couple of times and were pleased with the quality. We also participated in the cookery class which was good fun and allowed us to see the pristine conditions of the kitchen. Best of all were the staff who were attentive, courteous, helpful and happy. The ambience of the hotel is friendly and the staff clearly enjoy working there. A brilliant time and I cannot recommend them highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “The most friendly hotel we have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: awaydays29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for four nights to celebrate my wife's 50th birthday with our two daughters. The management were excellent in helping me to make all of the arrangements including surprise birthday cake and bubbly on arrival! The complimentary pick up from the airport and meal on arrival were added bonuses. The rooms were exceptionally clean and very spacious with great facilities and views over the adjacent park. We used the hotel restaurant several times and we found the food to be really good value and quality with a good choice of dishes. The complimentary afternoon apple tea went down very well considering the temperature outside! The hotel arranged a guide for one of the days to give us an insight into the main tourist attractions. Her knowledge and English were excellent and we were able to jump the ticket queues! We also took part in the hotel's cookery lesson, creating our own main course which was then served to us in the restaurant. The hotel's kitchens are immaculate. The management and staff all speak really good english and just could not help us enough. This is without doubt the most friendly hotel we have ever stayed in. I have never put a comments on websites, but I felt compelled to add to the list of recommendations for the Sirkeci Konak Hotel. If you are going to Isanbul then stay here, don't bother browsing anywhere else, it is about 35 minutes from the airport , ideally situated for the main points of interest, and they really do make you feel like a valued customer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pallavi98
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay. Staff was friendly and made us feel very comfortable. Room was above expectation in terms of amenities and cleanliness. Good spread of breakfast buffet. Hotel is very close to most of the attractions. Overall a very good value for money. I will recommend this hotel to everyone. Jay and Pallavi UK

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, a little charmless”
Reviews.Author: Katiet14
Reviews.Content: Sirkeci Konak Hotel is in a great location in Sultanahmet. It has been recently decorated in a traditional style so is a touch lacking in charm, but everything is exceptionally clean and they have thought of everything you might need. The staff are very welcoming and helpful. We had a park facing room which was a good size, had a balcony, amazing shower and a brilliant bed. Breakfast is great and afternoon tea is a lovely extra. The pool is bijou but the hammam is a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful In Everyway”
Reviews.Author: joshpayton
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I stayed at the Sirkeci Konak for four night this past weekend. We chose the hotel based on the spectacular reviews here on TripAdvisor and our experience was EVEN better than the already high expectations we had. This is my first review on TripAdvisor but we had such a great time I felt the need to pass along the story of this amazing little hotel. The rooms were clean and well stocked. Everyday there was complimentary breakfast and afternoon tea. And the staff at the hotel was the friendliest and most helpful I've encountered. While the staff at a Four Seasons or Ritz-Carlton may come across more polished, the staff at the Sirkeci is so warm and inviting that each day our return home and walk through the lobby was a treat. The location of the hotel is perfect for anyone who wants to walk around old town Istanbul. A five minute walk to the major attractions (Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, etc) and a wonderful ten minute walk to the Grand Bazaar and Spice Market. A couple of special notes - if you book through the hotel's website (like we did), they will 1) arrange for a complimentary car to pick you up in the airport and transfer you to the hotel (a huge plus when we arrived late at night with a very tired baby) and 2) a free dinner at the restaurant located in the lobby of the hotel, which was surprisingly good. Also - if you pay your bill at checkout in cash (as opposed to by credit card), you get an additional 11% discount. A nice little treat to end our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: H_C_Lederer
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights in a double deluxe room and the celebrations package plus Hamam and cooking course. It was a wonderful experience. The service was really perfect and all was done to make you feel comfortable. The location is absolutely marvelous - you just stroll to all major attractions in the old parts of Istanbul. Im Gold Member of Starwood, GOLD VIP of Hilton Honors - but this Hotel topped them all in terms of customer service - i can fully recommend the Hotel. You will fell like the Sultan himself.

Reviews.Title: “Not disappointed”
Reviews.Author: quinnkk
Reviews.Content: We had read so much about this hotel on TripAdvisor and after listening to my wife's brother raving about Istanbul we just had to go. We spent 5 nights at the Sirkeci Konak in late October with our 11 and 13 year old children and we had two interconnecting rooms on the top floor. The rooms were fine - comfortable beds and decent bathrooms. The hotel was quiet with the exception of the early morning call to prayer from a nearby minaret, which was very atmospheric. We enjoyed breakfast where there was plenty of choice and after a busy day we dined in the hotel's Turkish restaurant each night. The menu has plenty of choice (we even had the chance to sample the fish from the hotel's other restaurant a couple of times). The food is great and all of us took to Turkish cuisine with relish. Service was very good and the staff were so friendly and helpful. On our second day the heavens opened and it rained and rained. Because of the rain the restaurants handled over 100 diners as everyone nearby seemed to want to eat here and whilst we waited a little longer than usual the staff battled through with good grace. We all enjoyed the swimming pool which was a nice way to relax after sightseeing and also loved the tea and sandwich snacks each afternoon. All the staff were really great and helped make our stay so special. The Guest Relations Manager, Pelin, helped us with our daily itinery and saved us a lot of money with advice on a boat trip along the Bosphorous. Pelin also sent us some Turkish menus for our daughter's cookery class - a really nice touch. We were a little worried about how the children would react to Istanbul - so different to the other 20 countries they have visited but they loved everything - the mosques, Hagia Sophia, Grand Bazaar and Spice Market, Topkapi Palace, Galata Tower, several boat trips including a short excursion to Asia side (cost of Â£5.60!!) and especially the Basilica Cistern. The sights and sounds on each street were amazing and we walked miles round the city taking it all in. We went to Istanbul with high expectations of the Sirkeci Konak and it did not disappoint!

Reviews.Title: “A+ In Every Category”
Reviews.Author: GM-Travelers
Reviews.Content: The Sirkeci Konak Hotel is an excellent place to stay in Istanbul. It is very comfortable, clean and relaxing. Our room like many had a small balcony and the space inside was enough for just two people. During warmer weather the roof terrace would be a great retreat. Included in the price is a very nice breakfast with enough selections to get you started for the day. My wife and I visited during the off season and were able to include complimentary shuttle service from the airport plus dinner the first night (which was awesome). The hotel itself is strategically located off a quiet corner in an ideal spot -- you can walk to the Topkapi Palace in 8 minutes, the Haghia Sophia and Blue Mosque in 10 minutes, and in the other direction you can be at the Spice Market in 15 minutes or the Grand Bazaar in 20 minutes. Istanbul is very much a walking city and renting/driving a car is not recommended. Free internet is also available in case you wanted to search on local events-- but there was very little need, since the Sirkeci Konak Hotel staff was extremely knowledgeable and helpful, they really made us feel at home -- of course our favorite was the complimentary tea time every evening. If you ever have an opportunity to visit Istanbul we would highly recommend staying at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel. Greg & Miriam

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, close to sights”
Reviews.Author: pengysan
Reviews.Content: Sirkeci is in great location, within walking distance to all of the sights in historic, old Istanbul. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff was always friendly and helpful. We stayed there for 6 nights and were always comfortable during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it!”
Reviews.Author: Travellingmum39
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a very short, but needed, girls weekend to Istanbul. We stayed at this hotel based on reviews we read on tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. Pelin is a great asset to this hotel. She made us welcome as soon as we arrived - slightly frazzled from immigration. We had missed the cookery course which we had been keen to do but she rearranged it for the next day. Nothing is too much trouble for her. The hotel was clean, tidy and comfortable. The food was great, including the breakfast buffet. Taxis were summoned, baggage stowed, restaurant bookings made, all with a smile. I would definately recommend this hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Instanbul Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leahy55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sikeci Konak Hotel during the first week of November and would highly recommend it to others. The hotel was located close to points of interest in Istanbul and had a wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff ever, Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: light11
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews unless I've had an absolutely fantastic or completely terrible stay. I'm glad to say that my stay at Sirkeci Konak was wonderful. I am quite picky about hotels and the room they first gave me looked out onto some ventilation fans and hence was a bit noisy ( I am very fussy about noise, but I doubt anyone else would have noticed the fans). So I asked for a room change and the staff obliged immediately and transfered my luggage for me too. The staff are the epitome of Turkish friendliness and hospitality, they found out it was my birthday while we were staying there are they brought me a cake with candles and even a present! To top it all off, they took some photos and sent someone running to get them developed to be able to give it to me when we checked out (half an hour later). Location wise, it's very convenient and central. The rooms are beautiful and my friend raved on about the bathrooms for several days after! The breakfast buffet is good, the creamiest and best yoghurt I've ever tasted and the great thing is that there are many turkish specialities on offer too. The only minor downside is that unlike some hotels in Istanbul they don't have a terrace with a view to the blue mosque but they have a roof terrace which overlooks the palace gardens and will lend you binoculars to look over the golden horn. Furthermore for the standard of accommodation and service you get, I'm more than willing to have a drink somewhere else to enjoy the view of the blue mosque. I recommend the hotel to all my friends and am looking forward to going back to Istanbul and staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: skychaserCalgary
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our four night stay here at the Sirkeci Konak. Our balcony of our room 1405 overlooked the gardens of the Topkapi Palace and if you leaned over far enough you could see some of the minarets of the Blue Mosque. It was very well located in every way. For instance, it was one block to the Gulhane tram stop (the tram system is fast and runs very often and goes everywhere) or a ten minute walk to the Blue Mosque and Haiga Sofia and all the sights in between. A full breakfast buffet was included and offered a variety of European and Turkish foods - the honeycomb was to die for. The hotel has two restaurants and we had dinner in each of them - one offered fish and seafood - very good and the other featured Turkish cuisine, again very good. The hotel features a traditional Turkish hamman which was fantastic; everyone should experience a full Turkish bath at least once! There is also an exercise room and a swimming pool and sauna. The staff was fantastic in every way and very helpful in confirming flights, obtaining information, suggesting itineraries, etc. They couldn't do enough for you to ensure that your stay with them was worry free and seamless in every way. We can't say enough about this hotel - it's the Best!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly with good food”
Reviews.Author: SLIEMESA
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend beginning on 6 November at the Sirkeci Konak and were very comfortable. The staff were efficient and friendly, nothing was too much trouble. The room we had (admittedly their best one) had a good view over the park, was spacious, had a very comfortable bed and a good bathroom. Breakfast was excellent and dinner was very good and not expensive. The Wellness centre was well run and i enjoyed a Turkish hammam there. The location couldn't have been better from a sightseeing point of view - the Blue Mosque, Topkapi, Archaeological Museum were within very easy walking distance and so were the souks.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: 3sons
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in October '08 after a post-cruise tour of Cappadocia. I cannot stress enough the convenience of the location! To reach Hagia Sophia, The Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and the Underground Cisterns, "just follow the tram rail up the hill". We had booked on a website which only offered a standard room, so when we checked in we asked for an upgrade, which they offered us with no extra charge. There are groups sometimes, so that's not always an option we were told. Our room was very long and narrow, with no view, but it was beautifully decorated, there was a small fridge and coffeemaker, the king bed was awesome, and the bath was big with great amenities. Breakfast is large and good, and there is a small complimentary tea served in the afternoon. The service is friendly and extremely personal at check in. When we left, the front desk actually called our cab driver to tell me I'd left our airline printout at the hotel and asked if he should tell the driver to return. We also stayed at the Ritz on the Asian side for one night, but would return to the SK because of the excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: GenevaCH
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel at the end of October 2008. The hotel is very well located, very clean, the staff is extremely helpful and friendly. The room was just, just slightly noisy (from the next door lift). We stayed for three nights, so we benefited of their offer (free meal - rather good, free transfer, 7% discount if you pay in cash) - the price was reasonable - to sum up, a pretty good solution in Istanbul. I gave four stars - five stars is for something exceptional - this was good, very good, but not exceptional (although I'd love to stay only in hotels of this standard,)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! It lives up to its reputation”
Reviews.Author: CardinalMazarin
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel based on all the glowing reviews listed. Stayed for 4 nights at the beginning of November and couldn't find fault with any aspect of our stay at this hotel - it was just amazing. It was a great location - all the major sites were only a short walk away. If you didn't fancy walking the tram stop was close by. All of the staff were so courteous, friendly & helpful. The facilities were superb - the turkish bath is a must! The room was excellent, very comfortable and spotlessly clean. Booked direct with the hotel and they were very quick to respond to any queries before we arrived especially as our Swiss Air flight out got cancelled on the morning we were flying out and the airport transfer they supplied was there on time for our new arrival time.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay at the Sirkeci Konak”
Reviews.Author: MikeLisaAnna
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend the Sirkeci Konak. We stayed there for a week in August and were treated very well by the very friendly staff. The Sirkeci Konak is more expensive than many of its Sultanahmet competitors, but we believed that we got our money's worth. The hotel's location is excellent. It is 50 meters from the Gulhane tram stop (on the main tram line), a 10 minute walk from Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, and the Archaeological Museum in one direction, and the Golata Bridge and Eminonu boat docks in the other direction. It is located on a quiet street (filled for the most part with auto part stores, which never seemed to be very busy) along the walls of Gulhane Park (the park that surrounds Topkapi Palace. You get a nice view of the park from the hotel's upper floors and rooftop restaurant. The hotel's rooms were not huge, but large enough and clean, with modern bathrooms, wood floors, cable TV, and Wifi internet access. The hotel has a very attractive lobby area, with comfortable seating and a small bar, where they serve tea and snacks every afternoon. In the basement, there is a small swimming pool, as well as a sauna, exercise room, and hammam (Turkish bath). Our daughter loved the swimming pool, which was very clean and heated. One of the hotel's most underrated features are its excellent restaurants, which we dined in multiple times. One restaurant specializes and seafood and is located on the rooftop in the summer, while the other restaurant serves a wider variety of Turkish dishes and is located off the lobby. Of the two, the seafood restaurant is more expensive. We actually preferred the food in the non-seafood restaurant. For breakfast, the hotel has a decent buffet every morning, which is included in the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Location, staff, service”
Reviews.Author: julamal
Reviews.Content: Extremely helpful staff! Great location near Blue Mosque, etc.. Nice rooms and bathrooms. Good value for the price. Staff noticed from my passport that it was my birthday. They not only brought a candle-lit cake into the dining room for all to share but also brought a small gift to my room. I can't imagine how the staff could have been nicer or more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice family atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: MarcoF.
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in October 2008. I chose it because it had really good reviews on this site. As is usually the case, I found that the reviews gave an accurate picture of the hotel. The location is very good, within walkinfg distance to all the sites, even if the small road on which the hotel is located is quite drab (but you only have to walk two minutes on it). What I liked most about this hotel is the staff. They are all -without exception - extremely friendly and nice. They really give you personal attention and are very willing to help. I would rate the hotel facilities 4 stars. The common areas, while not being luxurious, are nice. I particularly enjoyed the wellness area, which has a beautiful, large Turkish bath all in marble, a nice swimming pool, and a fitness area that is definitely above average (very many four and even five stars hotels are deficient in terms of the fitaness room; not Sirkeci Konak). In October the rooftop terrasse was closed, so I tried only the ground floor restaurant. I ate there several times, it was good, and again, the staff are so nice that it's impossible not to like them! I had a standard room. It was tastefully decorated and the furniture was new. The bathroom was very nice. My only critique was that the wardrobe is a bit small, if you're travelling as a couple and have a lot of clothes, it might be a bit cramped. But these are small details. Breakfast is buffet, good quality. If I were to complain about something, it would be that during my stay, no fried eggs or scrambled eggs were served. However, I have not enquired, perhaps it might have been possible to order them. The breakfats included, among many other things, home-made tomato jam. Try it, it's really good. Another thing I would really recommend is trying the traditional Turkish massage, which involves an exfoliating scrub. Several people besides tried it and all enjoyed it very much and it's not expensive. You can ask the very pleasant and friendly young man working in the wellness center, he's easy to recognise because he's blond and looks Dutch or German (but isn't, he's Turkish). While staying there, the hotel arranged me a full day private tour with a guide (150 euro, very good quality) and booked a show (Dervish dance show - personally, I found it disappointing). The hotel kept their promise to have someone pick me up at the airport - no problem at all. Overall a very nice stay. I would certainly recommend this hotel to a friend and would certainly return to it.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Delight”
Reviews.Author: TravelManGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Great reception staff, friendly, attentive guest relations lady, lovely room, excellent restaurant with good breakfasts and first class dinners - and a great location to boot. What more could you want? Well a Turkish bath perhaps? No problem. This hotel has that too! Really, I guess this hotel doesn't need my recommendation because it's a top Trip Advisor hotel. We could see why, it really was great and the Turkish bath is a must-do if you haven't had a Hammam experience. It was so relaxing. We arrived in Istanbul by train and if you're able, it's pretty easy to walk to the hotel from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Sirkeci Konak”
Reviews.Author: frankandethel
Reviews.Content: From the initial booking through to our final check out, the experience of dealing with this hotel was top notch. The rooms are charming,impeccably clean, quiet, great bathroom (especially the water), very good bed, wireless internet, air conditioning, and good tv if you need it. The breakfasts were a treat (provided).The restaurant is excellent and is unusually good. I may have had the best lamb dish I have ever eaten! The real strengths of this place though are the little amenities (tea in the afternoon) and the people who work there, such as Pelin (guest relations) who will help you plan your days and evenings. Everyone there is very approachable and goes out of their way to make your visit to the hotel and the city memorable. Good command of English by most of the staff. Another big plus is that it is very well located...easily a 10-15 minute walk to all the sites and a 1/ 2 block away from the train/tram stop. My wife and I would recommend the Sirkeci Konak to anyone looking for a boutique hotel experience. A couple from Vancouver, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DMilo46
Reviews.Content: Ten friends and I stayed at the Sirkece Konak a few weeks ago and were delighted with everything about the hotel, from the furniture, to location and the incredibly polite and helpful staff. It's very rare in my experience for a hotel to be as good as its notices, but this hotel was if anything better. It's a wonderful place to experience Istanbul and we'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: jgmArlingtonVA
Reviews.Content: This is another great review for Sirkeci Konak. Pelin is the most helpful of hospitality managers and her enthusiasm generates to all the great staff. And don't sell their restaurant short. Very good food in a quiet refined setting.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Cinti attorney
Reviews.Content: This hotel definitely lives up to the high expectations instilled in Istanbul travelers by all the wonderful reviews. From the apple tea at check-in while comfortably seated and acquainted with both the hotel and Istanbul by the excellent front desk staff to the three employees coming outside to wave good-bye to us upon our departure, this hotel epitomizes hospitality. Excellent location, about 50 yards from the Gulhane tram stop, yet on a very quiet street so light sleepers like me have no issues. Every request I made in my emails beforehand was fulfilled, including the most lovely Turkish bath and aroma massage, a park view from our window, etc. The common areas are lovely, including a comfortable lounge where tea, lemonade and sandwiches are served gratis every afternoon. The breakfast buffet is enormous, and includes several hot dishes daily, as well as honeycomb honey for my fresh yogurt and granola. (Not to mention the variety of fresh fruit and jams and the chocolate muffins!) Dinner the first night after our overseas odyssey was excellent and well-served, and I did not fall asleep at the table! The beds are comfortable, the bathroom is modern, the room decor is attractive, and the pillow choice is a fun extra. But it is the staff that makes this hotel stand out from the pack. Hats off to Guest Relations Manager Pelin Nasoz, who graciously and patiently sought to, and succeeded in, making our stay so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Much deserved rating”
Reviews.Author: rosiegk
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because of its Trip Advisor rating and we certainly weren't disappointed. It's a small boutique hotel that prides itself on service and we found everyone from the managers to the service staff to be extremely warm and friendly. We stayed 3 nights and we just couldn't fault them on how keen they were to please. The chef even made up fresh baby food feach day for my one year old nephew. The day we left, we had a send-off party of about six staff waving goodbye and I don't think it was because they were glad to get rid of us! We ate at both the restaurants at the hotel, one serving modern Turkish food and the other seafood and both were extremely good. Overall, the rooms are stylish and clean; the food is delicious; the location is extremely convenient and the staff are absolutely outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Just great”
Reviews.Author: Mister-B1
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights in Sept 08 - would heartily recommend this hotel. Great location. Very friendly staff. Nice room, and a decent size (not huge, but had feared much worse after reading other Istanbul hotel reviews). Lovely bathroom. Good AC, flat screen TV, minibar, even a pillow menu! Buffet breakfast was fine - same every day but plenty of choice. Small pool & spa area but all spotlessly clean. It was the little things that really made the experience. For example: - free transfer from airport - staff always helpful & full of humour - free afternoon tea & sandwiches every day in lobby - free drinking water every day - free internet access via PC in lobby - daily "what's on" guide with breakfast - free evening meal on day of arrival (not sure if this was a seasonal deal) Couple of small downsides: Main restaurant is expensive, and so not many people ate there. In the evenings it tended to be quiet or deserted. View from rooftop restaurant is not as good as from the "Orient Express" hotel; but that's just round the corner anyway. The worst part of the experience: booking the hotel was difficult. I tried to use a booking agent but in 48 hours they hadn't heard back. The hotel's own internet booking process asked me to give my credit card details BEFORE telling me whether there was availability. I thought that was a bit cheeky ... P.S. Ask about a discount for paying in cash!

Reviews.Title: “no complaints about this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MaxKent_England
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six nights at this hotel and cannot find fault. It is a great location for walking everywhere but also very quiet. The breakfast is amazing and the afternoon tea a very nice touch. As it was a special birthday I was surprised by the staff with a lovely brthday cake complete with candles and singing! The staff are very helpful and friendly. We would recommend the cooking activity whch was great fun. We would definately stay here again when we return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: intrepidvoyager1
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. The staff were incredibly helpful - in terms of making arrangements and looking after us at the hotel. We had a triple room - which worked well - with a nice view over the ancient walls into a park. Breakfast was great and the roof deck has a lovely view. Its a short walk to all the sites and there is a small gym and pool in the basement along with a steam room and good massages. I would happily visit again. Even my partner who wanted to stay at a (far more expensive) five star chain further out of town agreed this was a great hotel and he would choose to stay here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Value, Staff & Location”
Reviews.Author: PHX
Reviews.Content: There were no deluxe rooms available, but I've been offered a standard room. During my 6 nights stay, I could confirm that this little hotel means good value in every sense. Very well placed, at walking distance from Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sofia, Sultanahmet Camii (Blue Mosque), the Grand Bazaar, Spicy Bazaar, the Underground Cistern, etc. And if you want to go further, there's a tram stop (GÃ¼lhane) right at the corner. I couln't figure out a better location, with the only exception of the uphill Sultanahmet Four Seasons. But then we'll be talking about a much more expensive hotel. Back to the Sirkeci Konak, the staff is extraordinarily attentive, competent and friendly (special thanks to Mr. Okay at the Concierge). High speed free internet access, two excelent on site restaurants, complimentary tea-time snacks, clean rooms: all one would expect (but not always get) from a luxury hotel, for a very affordable rate. Till next time!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Matthijs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and we had a very enjoyable stay. The room was nice, not extremely large but very clean and the bed was comfortable. For the money paid we had expected something slightly larger though, however Istanbul in general is not cheap. Right in the old city, so walking distance to all tourist attractions. As menioned here before by others the breakfast is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mpaPoland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sirkeci Konak for 3 nights as part of our honeymoon. We liked everything about the hotel and it surely deserves highest rating. The wellness is very nice, especially the Turkish bath The staff is very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Beancounter35
Reviews.Content: Serkeci Konak really exceeded our expections. The room, food and location were all excellent. Very near a tram stop and all the major historical sites. What really sets them apart is the level service you receive from everyone on the staff. We really appreciated Okay Alkan and all of the help he provided to us during our three day stay. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Istanbul. It is certainly a very interesting city to visit. Wayne Golden, Colorado

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel with awesome hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Tuntax
Reviews.Content: Apart from this Boutique Hotel being central to places of interest... Staff: Amazingly friendly and always willing to make you feel at home and extremely hospitable. They will go out of their way to assist you with any information required on Istanbul. Hotel: The breakfats buffet is sumptious and the spread is good and has a good mix of continental and turkish breakfast. Rooms are very comfortable and very cosy TV channels are limited. The complimentary soap is quite appaling so carry your own soap Request for the rooms to be vaccuumed every day If you pay cash on arrival you will be entitled to a 7% discount and makes a difference on your budget Safe Deposit available after you checkout and helps if you have extra time to wait for your flight Tips The Tramstop and the station is known as 'Gulhane' and it usually cost about 1.4TYL to go to any location. You can go to the last stop Kabatas and then take a bus and venture around. The people are extremely helpful if you are a tourist. To go to the airport..some take the Metro to the airport and if you take a taxi then it will come to around 35 to 38TYL. The hotel will organise it for you Beer (efes) usually cost around 2.5TYL and in Hotels/Restaurants costs about 5 to 7 TYL.The beer at the Hotel is reasonable The Spice Bazaar is great on pricing and if you are a cooking enthusiast then try kirkik ( red chilly) For turkish sweets there is one sweet shop opposite Park Hotel and its called Haci Bekir and they are supposed to be the best for Turkish sweets. A bit on the expensive side and try the double pistasio...ymmmm! By the way tasting is free. Try Kumpir their potato delight and is supposed to be best at a place called Ortakoy and nice place to walk around. In the afternoon there are cruises at Ortakoy ( behind the Mosque in the afternoon) and is only 7TYL per person for an hour and is worth it and then come back and try the Gozleme being baked by ladies. to go to Ortakoy..take the tram towards Kabatas, then from Kabatas catch the bus 22E or 25 to Ortakoy 61. The Bus driver will help you out. Coming back the same route.. Istanbul is great place and the hotel adds to the ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like friends at Sirkeci Konak”
Reviews.Author: rhinopias
Reviews.Content: We have spent 5 nights (12.-17-Sept. 2008) at this wonderful Hotel and it was in every respect a memorable stay. The location is in a quite and little bit hidden street with the major attractions and a tram stop in easy walking distance. As soon as we arrived we were greeted with traditional tea and from the first minute we were treated like friends in a small family by every member of the extremely friendly and attentive staff. Our room was nice, spacious and very clean. The breakfast is good with also some oriental influences. The turkish bath at the wellness center and a traditional turkish massage is a have to. It was of course not really a surprise that my wifes birthday was noticed and a nice cake and a present were presented to her by Guest Relation Manageress Pelin NasÃ¶z and her colleagues. Mrs. NasÃ¶z is the person who is around to answer all the questions of guests and she did it in a remarkable way. No doubt that we will stay at Sirkeci Konak again. Manfred & Gerrit Fraatz GÃ¶ttingen, Germany

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel”
Reviews.Author: burgundywine
Reviews.Content: I echo the other reviewers - this is an excellent hotel especially for the price. Context: I am 40, live in London, work in consulting, and a frequent traveller in 5* hotels, and this is my first Tripadvisor review. We travelled to Istanbul for a wedding. Great points: service at Four Seasons levels, great welcome, check-in sitting down, free cooking lesson with hotel chef, good room, free pickup from airport (when you book directly with hotel), 7% discount for cash, free wifi internet (though sometimes not working). Location: Hotel is located in Sultanahmet which is near great museums and palaces, but far from the more modern part of the city where all the great restaurants and nightclubs are situated. Due to very bad traffic, taxi journeys to that area take 45mins. Hotel is located on a rather run down street next to shops selling car parts. Hotel is good at marketing itself on Tripadvisor - hotel sends you an email after your stay to remind you to log on to site to vote. Well, it worked! Would definitely stay again. If staying in Istanbul for an extended period though, would split journey with a hotel further north due to traffic issue.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: nagabi
Reviews.Content: Perfect!!! The hotel is a great hotel, but the best thing is the staff!!!! Meneske and Palin are respnasble for the relations with the guest, so they are greats!!! The rooms, not very special, but are nice. I suggest you to book your room by the internet site of the hotel, so you can take some advantage like a discount or the free-transport from airport. Special

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: CBGL2008
Reviews.Content: We visited Istanbul for 3 nights at the beginning of September and really enjoyed our stay at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel. Everyone, from the moment we were met at Ataturk Airport until our departure went out of their way to help us enjoy the hotel, the surrounding area and Turkish hospitality. The hotel is superbly located for the tourist sights such as the Blue Mosque, the Cistern, Grand Bazaar and for cruising the Bosphorous river. The food is pretty good, the rooms were very clean and room size about right for the price paid, we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: jacksgrandma
Reviews.Content: This is a totally frank review of our four-night stay at the Sirkeci Konak. We returned on 18 September. First, location. The hotel is very close to the main sights (overlooks the gardens of Topkapi Palace) and you really couldn't be better placed for a sightseeing tour of Istanbul. It is only a matter of minutes to walk to the main sights, to the station (we arrived by rail), to the ferry terminal, to Sultanhamet square, etc., etc. The hotel itself is situated in a quiet side street, which is a bit scruffy looking, but no problem. The hotel itself is a haven of cool and tranquillity. Second, rooms. Do not book the Sirkeci if you want a huge room or are looking for the standard chain-type luxury hotel. This is very much a boutique hotel and the rooms differ in shape and size. Our two (we were two couples), were fine and overlooked Topkapi palace. We saw some at the back which did not have quite such a nice view. The rooms were spotless, and the bathrooms etc lovely. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff. They even have a pillow menu for you to choose your own feather/down/foam pillow or whatever! The beds were very comfortable and the air-conditioning quiet and efficient. Third, food. We ate at the roof-top restaurant, which specialises in fish and which was lovely. We also ate at the restaurant downstairs on our last night and found the food there quite delicious, beautifully presented and was very Turkish rather than bland international cuisine. Breakfast was also good, lots of fresh fruit and cereals. Again, there was a real Turkish feel to the food, for example, fresh Turkish honeycomb, spinach tart. Fourth, customer service and general ambience. This is where the hotel is, in our experience, in a different league from other hotels we have stayed in around the world. The staff are all absolutely committed to ensuring you enjoy your stay in Istanbul. We arrived very tired from a two day rail trip overnight from Budapest. We were welcomed, offered breakfast (which we really needed!), then instead of checking in at reception, we were taken to the lounge where Pelin Nasoz, the delightful Guest Relations Manager, explained everything about the hotel. The staff went out of their way to get our rooms ready early (we checked in at 11.00 am, an hour earlier than we expected). Every afternoon tea, cold drinks and snacks are served to guests and Pelin asks about your day, and if there is anything she can help with. The staff are very knowledgeable and can help with all sorts of queries and book up trips, meals etc etc. It all felt very different from the usual, bland and rather faceless experience of major city hotels. To sum up, we would absolutely recommend this hotel, which thoroughly deserves it top position on Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: silversurfer65
Reviews.Content: Really lovely friendly hotel, great staff who were very welcoming and helpful in advising where to go what to see and how to get there. Within walking distance of most of the important things to see. Nice comfortable, quiet rooms (important in a very busy city). We had a delicious dinner on our first night, which was included in the price of a 3 night stay. We also enjoyed the complimentary tea in the afternoons in the lounge on our return from sightseeing. Guests could sit comfortably whilst enjoying home made lemonade and rolls while discussing their day's activities. Altogether a very good experience, I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of visiting the wonderful city Istanbul, we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely going back!!!”
Reviews.Author: JoleneBathUK
Reviews.Content: Six of us have just returned from Istanbul, one of whom booked this hotel after reading the TripAdvisor reviews. He was a bit concerned as to whether the reviews were too good to be true. No problem there - this hotel is fabulous. The staff were welcoming, friendly and very informative. They were happy to suggest places to see, give you directions, call you a cab, book a restaurant... nothing was too much trouble. We had standard rooms which were more than adequate. The beds were large and comfortable and the rooms had all the usual things you would expect in a 4* hotel. One couple in our group did ask to change rooms as they were on the 2nd floor with not much of a view. They were moved to a higher floor the very next day as soon as a room became available, all done with a smile and no fuss. The food was lovely, a varied selection for breakfast ranging from toast and boiled egg, fruit, yogurt, sausage & scrambled egg, olives tomatoes, cucumber, cheese and fresh honeycomb. On our first evening we were entitled to free evening meal, which was great. I am a vegetarian (no meat or fish) and there was plenty for me to eat. The hotel provide tea in the afternoon when you are able to have lemonade and tiny sandwiches with either tomato and cucumber or soft cheese. Drinks were more expensive than in local bars, but that is true over here as well. The hotel is right in Istanbul Village with Topkapi, the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia just minutes walk away. 5-7 minutes walk in the other direction, past various bars and restaurants and you are at the sea front where you can catch a boat trip on the Bosphorus or just sit in a waterfront cafe and watch the world go by! We took advantage of the 7% cash discount for paying on arrival. Yes it is a genuine deal. Whilst looking back on our trip on the flight home we all agreed a fantastic time was had by all and we will definitely be returning to Istanbul and staying at the Sirkeci Konak!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely choice in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Mindwanderer
Reviews.Content: As usual, Tripadvisor guided us correctly to a lovely hotel in a great location. Service was very good, although there were a couple small glitches, but they were dealth with pleasantly and quickly. The rooms are decorated to a high standard and if you book the deluxe type you will have a great balcony with a view of Gulhane Park and the Bosphorus/Golden horn in the distance. I recommend this hotel heartily to anyone wanting to visit old Istanbul and see the major sights of Sultanahmet. The restaurant food was also quite good - we booked for three nights and had dinner complementary on our first night. Breakfast each morning was a treat with lots of options, both hot and cold. The hotel is very good - but didn't make me feel like I would only stay there if I returned to Istanbul. I would be quite happy to, but also might enjoy trying another experience next time. While there we booked a private tour. I looked at many options online but chose a small husband-wife team based on reviews from cruise ship travellers. We were toured by the wife, Lale Kosagan (pronounced Lolly) - and she is excellent. Check out www.tourguidesinturkey.com if you are looking for a private guide. We did two days just on foot or in taxi of old town and Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “A best bet”
Reviews.Author: SJayinCT
Reviews.Content: The Sirkeci Konak Hotel has been rated #1 in Istanbul by Trip Advisor contributors and, after staying at this superb hotel for four days, it is easy to see why it so well rated. The hotel itself is a very well kept, modern facility with clean, comfortable, well furnished rooms and very pleasant common areas. The breakfast buffet is excellent and should last most guests until dinner. The location is perfect. Istanbul is a city where one wants to stay within walking distance of the main sights as the traffic can be very congested with virtual grid lock during busy periods of the day. Staying at the Sirkeci Konak puts one within very easy walking distance of the Blue Mosque, the Topkapi Palce and Haigia Sophia. The Grand Bazaar, the Spice Market and the Bosphorus ferries, while a bit farther, can be reached by foot in about 15 minutes. The nearest tram stop is only a five minute walk and we found that the easiest way to get to the somewhat more distant locations was to take a tram out of the congested areas and then get a taxi. As a bonus tea sandwiches were available gratis every afternoon to allow tired tourists to refuel prior to dinner. The staff at the Sirkeci Konak was very friendly and helpful well above the call of duty. When we arrived our room was ready at 9:30 AM and the guest hostess, Menekse Goker, greeted us and helped us plan our trip highlights. We had a personal destination in the city which we could not locate and Meneske and the hotel manager spent at least twenty minutes on the internet to get us the required information. This is truly an exceptional hotel in a world class city. We recommend it wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Your charming hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: xaroulaMadrid
Reviews.Content: We are an spanish family of 7 people and we were at Sirkeci Konak hotel for 5 days. The hotel was fantastic, and the staff is so kind and helpful. They help you in all your doubts about museums, restaurants, trips and everything in Istanbul. The hotel is situated in the very historical center of IStanbul. Just 3 minutes walking from Topkapi Palace and 7 minutes walking to Sultanhamed (Agia Sofia and Blue Mosque). Moreover you have the tram stop just beside the hotel. Sirkeci Konak is a hotel in a very turkish style and with a lot of charming details like a free afternoon tea at the reception of the hotel everyday. No doubts, This is your hotel in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel; Fantastic City!”
Reviews.Author: Fractalactic
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel!! We just loved our stay here, they really took care of us from our transfer from Ataturk Airport to our return. A most pleasant surprise was the delicious "welcome" dinner that we had on our first evening. Do try the Turkish ravioli, it is delicious! We had also pre-booked a massage in their wellness centre on our first evening which was a wonderful way to start our short break. The Sirkeci is a short walk away from all the best sights - the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sofia, Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar....... The breakfasts are a feast and I defy anyone to say that they couldn't find something that pleased them - from muesli to yoghurt to honeycombe and halva; eggs to toast' olives and fresh fruit. you name it! Oh, a fantastic local restaurant for lunch is Doy Doy which is a short walk from the Blue Mosque and if you want delicious seafood in a beautiful rooftop setting (with the Blue Mosque on one side and the Hagia Sofia on the other) try Seven Hills restaurant at the seven Hills Hotel (just across the road from the Four Seasons in the old city). Another fantastic restaurant with a great view is the Hamdi Restaurant which is right next to the Spice Bazaar. What a lovely place to spend a few days! Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Chanster1
Reviews.Content: My friend and i stayed at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel for 5 nights in August, and we had a wonderful time. The service was first class, as was the food in the restaurant. The rooms are clean, quiet and spacious, and there's even free use of the facilities (internet, sauna, etc). The hotel is also situated very centrally, within walking distance of all the major sights as well as public transport. A definite highlight of a trip and i couldn't recommend the hotel highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “Can't imagine staying anywhere else in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: torontome
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sirkeci Konak for a four days in July and it helped to make our Istanbul experience the highlight of a two month trip. From the welcome apple tea to the pillow menu to the cooking class in the hotels kitchen everything at this hotel was perfection. The breakfast was fabulous and the hotel even puts on a complementary tea in the afternoon which was very appreciated after a day of walking around. The hotel is very centrally located and we could walk to most of the sights we were interested in. When we wanted to go further the tram is located about 100m from the hotel's door. Menekse, the guest relations manager helped us with maps and advice on what to do during our time in Istanbul. We couldn't recommend this hotel more highly.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful stay”
Reviews.Author: JT6th
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sirkeci Konak August 13-20, 2008. The stay was splendid in every way. The hotel has about 40 rooms which are comfortable and pleasantly decorated. The hotel had a freshness about it, having been open about a year and a half. it also has a local falvor due to its smallness. The beds are quite comfortable and there is not much noise. The staff are most cordial and go out of their way to advise you. Their English was fine, which was very helpful since we knew no Turkish. The staff took a personal interest in our stay but were not instrusive. They knew the many attractions in Istanbul and can give insights about what to visit and when, and when it is necessary to take a cab rather than the tram, which is only a block away. THe location made it easy to get about the city using a variety fo public transportation means. The complimentary breakfast is a splendid meal in the continental style-- fruit, cereals, pastries, olives, meats, quiche, sausage, scrambled eggs Turkish style, juices. The inhouse restaurant is also a pleasnt place for dinner. A nice touch is a 8 1/2 by 11 daily paper that gives facts about the city, the weather, and other tidbits of information. We did not use the turkish bath, sauna, or fitness equipment. Returning to Istanbul is not on the immediate horizon, but were we to go, this is the place that we would stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Lever212
Reviews.Content: The other favorable reviews on TripAdvisor got this one right -- it's a real find. This hotel is ideally situated between the old city (Sultanahmet) and the modern city across the Golden Horn. The rooftop restaurant (good food) overlooks Gulhane Park and the walls of Topkapi Palace. The rooftop is a great place for a sundowner or alfresco meal. The complementary breakfast buffet offers plenty of variety, including Turkish specialties plus the familiar Euro-American standbys. On previous visits to Istanbul, we've stayed in pricier hotels, both Luxury category and "Special" category, but none offered better value than Sirkeci Konak. The rooms here are relatively small, but there is a significant difference between various rooms on each floor - when you reserve, ask for one of the larger-sized rooms. Bathrooms are modern, clean, and well-equipped. The hotel does not have an outdoor swimming pool, but there is a small indoor pool, a hamam (steam bath), and a massage studio (open by appointment only), so there are multiple options for relaxing and de-stressing in a clean, uncrowded facility. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and friendly (a characteristic of Turkey in general). We requested airport transportation with our reservation, and when we failed to find the expected driver at the airport (a traveling companion inadvertently "stole" our transport), a phone call to the hotel produced a fast solution: we took a commercial taxi to the hotel, and the hotel paid our cab fare on the spot, no charge to us. The hotel is on a little-known backstreet that cab drivers don't always know about; it's a good idea to carry a couple of the hotel-provided cards listing the address and phone on the front, and on the back a neighborhood map showing its exact location. On the plus side, neighborhood traffic is relatively light, especially after dark, so it's quiet and peaceful, by Istanbul standards, anyway. Even so, it's less than 100 paces from the hotel's front door to a major thoroughfare with shops, restaurants, ATM machines, foreign exchange bureaux, and even (if you insist) -- McDonald's and Burger King. Best of all, right on the corner is a tram stop that can take you (cheaply!) to the Grand Bazaar, Taksim, and many other attractions, in air-conditioned comfort.. Learn to use Istanbul's public transit -- It's a great way to avoid traffic jams. The hotel staff is happy to advise you on using transit, or they will call you a taxi or arrange a private car if you prefer. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay for our honeymoon !”
Reviews.Author: MichaelFrance
Reviews.Content: We stay at Sirkeci Konak for our honeymoon trip in Istanbul... The city is really magic... as well as this hotel that was a real oasis of calm and confort after long days of walks and visits. Its central situation in the old city and the proximity of the tramway were real advantages. The staff was moreover one of the most kind and helpful we had the occasion to meet in our trips worldwide. It was hard to leave such a beautiful city... and such a beautiful hotel. Many thanks again to all staff, particularly to the reception people. It will be a pleasure to stay again at Sirkeci Konak. MichaÃ«l & Marie

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: S_Akhter
Reviews.Content: Absolutely superb! The Sirkeci Konak truly merits its rating on Tripadvisor. Every single member of staff was very friendly, professional, and whenever help was required they went out of their way to assist. The accomodation and service was excellent, as were both of the restaurants. If I return to Istanbul, this is where I will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Totally deserves the #1 rating”
Reviews.Author: kess
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisor reviewers were right! This is a gem of a hotel! EVERYTHING, from the breakfast, roof deck, on site Turkish bath and pool, free (!) cooking classes, afternoon snacks, friendly and helpful staff, proximity to a tram stop, walking distance to the major sites, to the well appointed and spotless rooms made our stay a memorable one. A real find!

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel Which Meets All Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Voyager1Enfield
Reviews.Content: Based on the excellent reviews on TripAdvisor, my wife and I booked into the Sirkeci Konak for 4 nights in August. Our only regret was not being able to stay longer in both the fascinating city of Istanbul and in this excellent hotel, which met or exceeded all expectations. The hotel is well situated being in easy walking distance of the main tourist sites of Sultanhamet, including the Topkapi Palace, Aya Sofaya, The Blue Mosque and the Basilica Cistern. It is also easily walkable to Grand Bazaar and the ferry terminals for crossing or cruising down, the Bosphorus. Although situated in a road where the Hotel seems at odds with what mainly seem to be car spare shops, this is not a distraction given the excellent position. The road is safe, clean (as was most of what we saw of Istanbul) and quiet. The Hotel itself is tastefully decorated, clean and with excellent facilities, including a terrace bar which was a haven both before venturing onto the streets in the morning and for a nightcap prior to retiring (look out for the herons in the park opposite). The (small but adequate) swimming pool was also great for a late afternoon dip to refresh after getting hot and tired from sightseeing. Breakfast offered a superb range of choice and for lunchtime or evening, the hotel's own restaurant offered better quality and value than many of the guide book recommended restaurants that we tried. Our standard room did not have a great view, but that was academic given that it was just for sleeping in. The room itself was spacious, clean and had all that was required. The bed was very comfortable and a choice of soft or hard pillow was available according to preference. All of the above notwithstanding, the Hotel's biggest asset is its staff. From arrival to departure you are treated like an individual and made to feel very welcome. Nothing is too much trouble and without exception, the staff are helpful, friendly, sociable and always smiling. I can best describe this as a "happy" hotel, which excels in customer satisfaction. We have stayed in many hotels in the course of our travels and in all honesty I can say that the Sirkeci Konak is up there with the best of them. The praise on TripAdvisor is well justified and I have no hestitation in endorsing the recommendations and looking forward to a return visit. Our only caveat , and this is not a reflection on the Hotel itself, is that when we last went to Turkey about 15 years ago, the cost of living was very cheap and you could eat and dine out for next to nothing. Times have changed and with the effects of inflation you can now expect to pay London prices during a stay in Turkey. However, this is not a reason to put off visiting this amazing city which has so much to offer with its history, culture and vitality.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Excellent Hosts”
Reviews.Author: adribaer
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time at the Sirkeci Konak and recommend it to anyone traveling to Istanbul. The staff is wonderful and their suggestions for places to visit and things to do were spot on. The hamam was wonderful and clean as was the sauna and pool. A gym is available and all are open until 10pm. The beautiful roof terrace is a great place to have a drink while looking at the view across the river and of the Topkapi Palace park. The dinner at the restaurant was the best meal we had in Istanbul - try the grilled fish! Breakfast is enormous and open until 11 which makes a leisurely morning part of the relaxing calm in the storm of the city. The breakfast includes delicious breads, yogurt, cheeses, fruits, eggs, etc. etc.. Simit in the afternoon is worth a trip back in the afternoon for the bread and Turkish teas. As single women, we felt comfortable, well taken care of, and felt that it was a great place for singles, couples, and families. The beds and amenities in the room are comfortable and well decorated. We loved everything about our stay there and really recommend it to all!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luluwanders
Reviews.Content: I had fabulous time at the Sirkeci Konak from the moment I walked through the door. The staff was incredibly gracious and helpful, the facilities are excellent and the restaurant was absolutely delicious. Our room was spacious, clean and we were thrilled to fÄ±nd a plate of Turkish delight waiting for us there upon our arrival. We took advantage of the wonderful wellness center which includes a beautiful swimming pool, sauna and hamam. The Turkish style massage there was unbelievably relaxing. Overall, I would reccommend this hotel to anyone looking for a quintessential Istanbul experience in a location central to everything a visitor would want to see. Be sure to take the suggestions of the staff as far as what to do and see during your stay. We did and were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul Visit”
Reviews.Author: WSaltineW
Reviews.Content: Being our first stay in Istanbul we were not quite sure what to expect. However, we quickly found our visit to be quite enjoyable as we spent several days taking in the sights from the Spice Market to the Blue Mosque to the Whirling dervishes to the Museum of antiquity. Our week was in part enjoyable due to the assistance of our Guest Relations Manager Menekse Goker who graciously assisted us almost every day were were in the Sirkeci Konak Hotel. Her helpfulness and friendly advice included working with the Chef in preparing a meal in a cooking class.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrancoisLondon
Reviews.Content: The Sirkeci Konak Hotel thoroughtly deserves being rated as the number one hotel in Istanbul on TripAdvisor. We spent five nights there. The staff were exceptionally friendly, the hotel (including the kitchen where we took part in a cookery class) was spotlessly clean and the rooms spacious. The position is fantastic, our room overlooked the gardens of Topkapi Palace. I spend most of my life living in hotels and this one stands out, it felt like being at home, only better. My only criticism, which is a minor one, is avoid having a massage. Mine only lasted half the advertised time and wasn't very good. Apart from this, you're guaranteed a wonderful stay in a fascinating city. We loved the hotel and Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Grace040
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel, Istanbul, earlier this month. All the staff there were very friendly and helpful but Menekse, the Guest Relations Manager, in particular was extra helpful in that she pointed us in the right direction to all the sights we should see in the short time we were there. She was always very bright, cheerful and friendly and it is easy to see why she holds the position of Guest Relations Manager. We were given a free welcome dinner on our first night at the hotel and every afternoon at about 4.30 p.m. the chef produced some wonderfully refreshing home made lemonade. Delicious The hotel itself is tucked just in a side street but within easy walking distance of all the major sights in the Sultanhamet area of Istanbul. There is a tram which runs across the end of the road if you do not feel like walking. It is also easy to walk to the ferry terminals that will take you on a Bosphorus cruise or on the Golden Horn.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Åštay”
Reviews.Author: gmcleod
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights in the Sirkeci Konak thanks to a friend of mine who advised it. The perfect location makes it easy to walk to Istanbul's main tourist attractions and shopping areas. The hotel's staff are always willing to help and really impressed me during my stay. The room was clean and very luxurious. The terrace on the 4th floor has an amazing view, making it a great place to enjoy a drink..or just take a few photos. It's equipped with many tempting facilities like sauna, pool, hamam and internet access is available. Highlight for me was the breakfast buffet..outstanding. If you find yourself looking for a place in Istanbul's centre - check out the Sirkeci Konak!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: pembrokegail
Reviews.Content: FABULOUS!!!!!!!!!!!!!! that is the only word to describe this hotel. From the moment you walk in to the moment you check -out--you are treated like royalty. The rooms are spacious, clean and decorated in such good taste. The welcoming apple tea is a treat---to the special tray of Turkish delights left on your bed as a extra treat were so appreciated. The location in the Old City could not be better. The staff can not do enough for you--anything you ask for or need help with is taken care of immediately. Their breakfast buffet was outrageous!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I have stayed in some of the best hotels ie: Ritz Carlton, Four Seasons ect.--but they do not come close to the service and attention that Menekse and her staff provide. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning a visit to Turkey

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lcosette
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in July, and thought it to be a wonderful start to our stay in Turkey. The hotel is located a few minutes away from all of the major tourist attractions, although the street it's located on doesn't have much on it. You would never guess that such a nice hotel was located on the street. The interior of the hotel is very nicely decorated. I was actually surprised by how spacious the double room we booked was (although we were on the 2nd floor with not much of a view). It was clean, and the bed was very comfortable. We used to hotel pool once during our stay, and, although it was small, it was the perfect temperature and was nicely done. If you use it during the day you will most likely be the only ones down there which is another plus. We didn't get a chance to try the hammam but looked at the facilities and they were spotless and looked just like they do on the website. You can also use the sauna, fitness room, and get a massage. The breakfasts were also very good - a wide selection of breads, cheese, olives, meats, fruit, etc. But truly one of the best things about the hotel is the service. The people who run the hotel and are employed by it work very hard to make sure that your needs are met. This is what pushes the hotel into the 4-5 star range.

Reviews.Title: “18”
Reviews.Author: laverdaMilan
Reviews.Content: Considering space limits for urban reasons, this 'micro' 5-stars hotel manages to give all comfort, specially thanks to ability and disposition of personel. Comfort and services apart, worth signaling its native-oriented character, with modern spirit and without falsness and superfluous kitch, that keeps the place quite different and true respect to many other soul-less and lavish-full hotels of the same category.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - but is it really No. 1?”
Reviews.Author: Sue&Baz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in April and yes it was very nice - clean, good service, good restaurant and good location - but I'm not sure it rates the effusive comments of some of the reviewers. Don't get me wrong - I have no complaints at all about the hotel and I would recommend it to anybody - but I don't think it was a place to go overboard about.

Reviews.Title: “Don't not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Flowzat
Reviews.Content: I am not the "reviewing" type but I cannot resist gushing about the terrific five day stay I enjoyed here with my wife and two young children. This hotel, has without a doubt, the BEST combination of value and service I have ever experienced. While not dirt cheap, there are absolutely no hidden charges and all the freebies: the breakfast, the internet connection, airport pickup, hamam (turkish bath), tea, etc are first rate. The service is friendly, personal, unpretentious and most important extremely useful. For example, they booked our tickets and transportation to Izmir and Ephesus promptly, economically despite a couple of last minute changes on our side. The kept our some of our luggage for 5 days for free while we traveled to another part of Turkey even though we weren't going to be staying with them any more. They sent up an electrician to take a look at a problem in one of our rooms (we had two with a connecting door) within 5 mins and he actually fixed the problem in another 5 mins. The location is perfect if you want to explore the old city or take the tram. So what's the downside? Everything is on the smaller side: the building, the rooms, the pool, the lobby etc. It does not have a view of the Bosphorus. But I'm betting that if you decide to stay here, you are going to be very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: janineor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sirkeci Konak for 5 days and had a wonderful time. I stayed in 7 hotels ranging from 3*-5* during my time in Turkey and this was the best. Our experience started with the pick-up from the Airport which went perfectly which is not easy when travelling with a huge box of Model Aeroplanes (for World Champs in Turkey). As the hotel was full we were not able to check-in when we arrived (9am) but were pleased when offered breakfast and then storage of all our luggage while we went for a walk. The hotel is in a great location within walking distance of the major sights and very near a tram stop for those not wanting to walk. It is also near lots of eating places. When we were able to check-in we were given a fabulous room on the 4th floor with a lovely balcony looking over the park and a spa bath in the bathroom as well as a separate shower. As the hotel is on a lane with shops selling car parts and looking over a park, it is very quiet at night (which hotels near the Blue Mosque aren't) We found all the staff to be extremely helpful and and made great recommendations and bookings. We really enjoyed our cooking class (free for guests) with the Executive Chef and the experience of eating our cooking in the Restaurant as well as using the indoor pool, fitness centre and the Turkish Bath. Breakfasts were great and such a variety that we were able to try different things each day. We also ate in the hotel restaurant and found the food great and good value. I would recommend this hotel to anyone as it was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Sirkeci Konak Hotel was the best!”
Reviews.Author: Carrvale
Reviews.Content: Like so many of the previous writers, I would like express our thanks to Trip Advisor for alerting us to the Sirkeci Konak Hotel. We recently stayed there for four days before departing on a 15 day tour of Turkey.
