From the moment of the very welcome sign of the Car driver at the Istanbul Airport (after the long haul from Australia), to the refreshing cup of Apple Tea whilst waiting to be checked in, we knew we had made the right choice. All of the staff were courteous and went out of their way to make us feel at home and special mention must be made of Mr A. Okay Alkan at the front office for his efficiency and general disposition. After checking in we met the guest relations manager Ms Menekse Goker, who gave us the names of several good eating places and was more than willing to give us advice on any of our questions including the best way to see the Sultanahmet area including the remarkably cheap and efficient tramway system, just up the road from the Hotel. The variety of dishes at breakfast each day was great, the rooftop bar area with views over the city and the Tokapi Palace Grounds was a great place to finish off the day and also to meet people, along with the recent addition of the seafood restaurant just added to the overall satisfaction of the Hotel Also a mention should be made of the staff at the Hammam Baths and massage area, (along with the swimming pool), located on the lower floors of the Hotel. What a marvellous facility! Just a short elevator trip from your room to the best body scrub (for me) and relaxing massages for my wife that we have had for a long time. A special thanks to â€œOctavo?â€� for his professionalism in the remedial massages for my wife. After 4 days we were truly sorry to leave and move across to the newer part of Istanbul and the 5 star hotel to meet up with the tour group. These Hotels could learn a lot from all of the staff at Sirkeci Konak as to making one feel at home at their properties. Where else would the staff come out onto the pavement to say goodbye to you as you left their property! The Sirkeci Konak Hotel was the best!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: stockholmguy
Reviews.Content: I went with my family to this hotel earlier this year and I really really can give it my best recommendations. Pick up service from and to the airport included in price - extremly helpful staff, bookings of resturants that really were full was no problem for them etc etc. Very good rooms - we were lucky enough to be upgraded and I really recommend to book their best rooms on the top floor - HUGE - well equipped with an nice terrace overlooking the park. Breakfast was also good - overall - we had an excellent stay and I will certainly come back. If you are coming to Istanbu for partying the location is perhaps not the best - I would stay on the otherside in that case.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Istanbul Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deb869
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, and our two teenage daughters, just returned from a two and a half week vacation traveling around Turkey. We started the trip with four nights in Istanbul at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel and it is clear to us why this hotel is number one on Trip Advisor in Istanbul. First we were met at the airport by an employee of the hotel who drove us back to the hotel in a car which had plenty of room for the four of us and all of our luggage. I had told my husband that the hotel was located on a small street with numerous shops selling auto parts, so we were prepared for the unusual setting of this otherwise elegant hotel. Like previous guests have mentioned, we were offered apple tea when we arrived and we checked in sitting on a couch. Pelin, the guest services employee, gave us a map of Istanbul and told us what attractions would be closed on which days. We then had a complimentary dinner in the downstairs restaurant with traditional Turkish food (there is also an excellent fish restaurant on the roof). The bedrooms and bathrooms were immaculate. The rooms have an Ottoman design, which reminds you that you are in Istanbul, not in some generic hotel room. The bathrooms were marble and were large enough to be comfortable. Complimentary tea is served every day at 5:00, if you are at the hotel at this time. There is an exercise room, small pool and steam room, as well as a Turkish bath and other types of massages offered on the premises. The Turkish Bath is an experience you must try, and it was very convenient to do it at the hotel, so we could stumble upstairs - all of our muscles relaxed - when we were done. The staff is extremely helpful, from giving directions, ordering a taxi, making dinner reservations, checking times of Bosphorus cruises, etc., etc. They also speak very good English, which is not always easy to find in Turkey. Pelin would check on us from time to time to see if we needed anything. The breakfast buffet is excellent, although it is of course Turkish food, not eggs, bacon and French toast. Of all the hotels we visited in Turkey, it had by far the best breakfast buffet. The fish restaurant on the roof - only open in summer - is really top notch. Not only is the food delicious but you also have great views of the Gold Horn. It is not inexpensive by Turkish standards, but we also ate more expensive meals in other parts of Turkey, which were not nearly as good. By U.S. standards, the prices were reasonable. There is also a comfortable lounge area on the first floor of the hotel, where you can take your tea or have something stronger. We spent an enjoyable evening in the lounge watching the Euro 2008 soccer finale with other guests from all over Europe. The only negative point (a very minor one) which is not the fault of the hotel nor within its control, is that our rooms faced a somewhat unattractive lot behind the hotel. You might request an upper level room facing the park. Finally, as previous guests have said, this hotel is very well-located. You can walk to most of the major sites very easily and the tram, which is very user friendly especially if you don't take it at rush hour, is a short block from the hotel. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sirkeci Konak -- a beautiful gem in a beautiful city!”
Reviews.Author: BKT48
Reviews.Content: We had a weeklong stay at the Sirkeci Konak--a bit of a splurge for us, but I am so glad we did it. It was extremely comfortable, with wonderful food, and every member of the staff was unfailingly helpful and friendly. The lovely Peylin, who was in charge of food & beverage guest relations, even helped arrange a breakfast box for us on one day when we had an unusually early start. The rooftop bar/restaurant is well worth a visit on a clear summer night!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: anakuma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sirkeci Konak 3night. this hotel has nice breakfast ,clean room and good location. there is Trum(train) station near the hotel. Hotel staff are all friendly and helpuful. We had no view from our room at first. We could only see the wall and water pipe of another building. We were so disappointed with this and asked the stuff to change our room.(some romms have nice veiw and some rooms have no veiw. ) Next day hotel manager was glad to change our room . Room changed to upper floor and view was getting better. he was so helpful and nice! We enjoyed our rest of staying in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: LondonMissSunshine
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 days and I had a very positive experience Everything was suberb. Room was exactly as I expected Staff;unparalleled. From the moment I arrived at the hotel, our excellent concierge MenekÅŸe (who was extremely friendly, helpful, polished, her smile really puts you at ease as one of the review mentioned about it ) addressed me by name. The Turks are generally a very friendly and happy nation and the staff in Sirkeci Konak are not any different, I received probably the most friendly and professional service I have ever received. Somehow everyone here seems to be genuinely happy to be here and to be of any assistance to you! They make you feel as if they are your family.. I booked two restaurants through Menekse and both turned out to be superb choices. Agah also gave me good directions to a few shops I needed to check out as well as handled a few itiniary changes again with professionalism and efficiency. All in all, I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough! It is an absolutely priviledge being able to spend just a day so in conclusion, do stay here at least once in your life!

Reviews.Title: “An Outsatnding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Prufreck
Reviews.Content: This is an outstanding hotel. As a frequent traveler and tour operator over the last 25 years I have stayed in dozens of hotels all over the world. I rate the Sirkeci Konak in my top five, alongside the Four Seasons in Cairo, Oberoi Udaivilas in Udaipur and the Umaid Bhavan in Jodhpur. I have been to Istanbul a number of times and have stayed at Empress Zoe and other boutique hotels in the Sultanahmet area. I chose the Sirkeci Konak this time because of its rating on Trip Advisor. After nine days in Istanbul it is very hard to find fault with this property. The room was comfortable, the breakfast extensive and the rooftop restaurant excellent (though a little pricey). And itâ€™s one of the few small hotels with a pool, which is useful when it is 30 degrees outside and when you have kids with you. But above all, the reception staff were incredibly helpful and friendly and their service outstanding. They could certainly teach Sydney hoteliers a thing or twoâ€¦ Location is critical in Istanbul and this hotel really is perfectly situated. Importantly, it is in a quiet lane, with double-glazed windows so the traffic noise is negligible. And we slept through the pre-dawn call to prayer on all eight nights, which is something of an achievement in the old city. Itâ€™s a ten-minute walk down to Galata Bridge, a ten-minute walk up the hill to Topkapi Palace and the Haghia Sofia â€“ and if you donâ€™t want to walk the tram stop is one minute away at the top of the laneway. There are dozens of restaurants nearby â€“ and the staff will happily recommend one if you are unsure where to eat. All their recommendations are excellent. On arrival, a man wandered up to us as we waited to check in. He introduced himself as the Chairman of the hotel group (which includes the Orient Express hotel just around the corner). He asked where we were from and wished us a pleasant stay. This set the tone for what has been a truly outstanding experience. Sirkeci Konak well deserves its position at the top of the league and I hope it stays there.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: isla-soleada
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on TripAdvisor's rating of excellence and were not disappointed at all!! The hotel sent a van to pick us up at the aiport (we were in a group of 13 family members). The Guest Relations Manager was wonderfully helpful in our check-in process as well as giving us suggestions for our days in Istanbul. The restaurant staff was excellent, the rooms were very clean and comfortable. It was a total five star stay. Would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “birthday treat”
Reviews.Author: APYE
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful position, we had a large quiet room in this friendly comfortable hotel. We could walk everywhere or take a tram saving on expensive taxi rides. The hotel was perfect in every way unless you want trendy bars and restaurants. I can't fault the excellent breakfast, the cleanliness and the staff and the owner for their helpful, but non-pushy, advice on trips and restaurants. Every afternoon there are free refreshments and you are able to meet and talk with staff and other guests. Most of all they realised it was my birthday and surprised me with a lovely cake and a present, I was so touched by their good wishes and later finally waving us goodbye felt sad to leave. I have never received such genuine kindness before from hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: DAISYSydney_Nsw
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Sirkeci Konak and it certainly lived up to our expectations, after reading other reviewer's comments. On arrival we were greeted by the guest relations manager Menekse Goker, who was so welcoming and after offering a lovely afternoon tea while we checked in, showed us to a great room overlooking the gardens behind the Topkaki Palace. The room was spacious and very well appointed. Could not fault our stay for two nights and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful property and staff”
Reviews.Author: MikeSteven
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the aiport in Istanbul and found that we had made a mistake in booking our 6 nights at this hotel. We had our actual check-out date as our check-in date (my mistake). I called the hotel from the airport in a panic and explained my situation to them. They handled my problem in an absolute perfect manner. They spent a lot of time trying to accomodate us and somehow they miraculously made arrangements to give us a room even though it was my mistake. I compliment the wonderful staff (guest relations employee Pelin deserves special mention for her excellent skills with assisting us on planning our touring while in Instanbul). The rooms were immaculate and clean. The breakfast was absolutely wonderful with a great variety of foods to satisfy any type of appetite. I was extremely delighted with the accomodations and would definitely return. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, a beaut of a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: mdot1
Reviews.Content: Excellent. The street immediately outside may be shabby, but the location is great both for the Sultanhamet /archaeology museum and the tram to other parts of the city. Staff, especially the front desk, extremely helpful and personable - we felt we had a real relationship with the hotel. Breakfasts just great. Ranks with my best hotel experiences, which for sake of comparison include the Wedgewood in Vancouver, the Four Seasons at Marunouchi in Tokyo, and the Ritz Carlton in Osaka. We stayed there for 7 days (with a break half way through to visit Cappadocia).

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Edinburghtraveller
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay- rooms were clean and comfortable. The breakfast buffet was extensive and very enjoyable, with plenty of Turkish items. If you want the standard full English or American breakfast this is not the place for you. As others have mentioned the guest relations people were always around with helpful advice when we retured from our day's sightseeing. Agree with the poster who thought that some of the staff were green. The coffee servers at breakfast were a bit slow but maybe i'm just a caffeine addict and should be discouraged. It was great to return to the small swimming pool and Turkish bath after walking all day. I really felt I was staying in Istanbul at this hotel. Big international hotels could be anywhere. Most of the sights were within easy walking distance. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TwinTourists
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a wonderful experience in Istanbul, then the Sirkeci Konak Hotel is just the place for you. We, who travel the world, found the Sirkeci Konak to be one of the nicest hotels weâ€™ve stayed in. You do not have to stay in a big, expensive 5 star hotel to be pampered and doted upon. The service is just as, if not more, important than the size of the room or elevator. The people on Trip Advisor who wrote negative reviews are either very fussy and hard to please or not world travelers. You have to remember, this is not America or the UK. From the minute we walked into this charming boutique hotel, we knew it would be great. By the time we checked in, the Guest Relations Managers , Ms. Menekse Goker and Ms. Pellin Nasoz came up and greeted us, gave us their business cards and told us if thereâ€™s anything we need to just let them know. Our private tour guide met us at the hotel and he told us heâ€™s never seen anything like it before. He thought it was impressive. Before we finished checking in, we each received a glass of apple tea â€“ which was delicious. Menekse noticed how much we raved about the unusual apple tea that, before I knew what was happening, she presented me with a packet of the tea to take home. The location is perfect â€“ nice and quiet. As we had a private tour guide, we didnâ€™t have to worry about how to get around, but the hotel is near all the major sites that you can even walk to. Our room was just like the pictures weâ€™ve seen. Decorated lovely and with a welcome dish of Turkish Delight waiting on the bed for us. There was a little card on the night stand with a selection of about six or seven different pillow types to choose from, if we didnâ€™t like what was on the bed (it was a good firm pillow). The bathroom was very clean. You have to watch out, though, because when you step out of the bathtub, itâ€™s a high step, so you have to hold on. But we found that most European hotels have bathtubs like that. There were also nice amenities in the bathroom. If you stay in the hotel for more than three nights, you receive a complimentary dinner. Well, we did, and it was just delicious. We had the typical Turkish meal â€“ mezeh (appetizers), main course of lamb, which was soft as butter, and then a delicious dessert. Menekse and Pellin and even the owner of the hotel, Mr. Faruk Boyaci, came over and joined us for dinner. It was quite a treat! They were all so warm and welcoming. There was a huge buffet breakfast, consisting of a dozen types of bread or rolls, fresh and dried fruit, fruit juices (including cherry juice), a big bowl of Turkish Delight and Halvah, a selection of cold cuts, cheeses, fresh vegetables, a selection of olives, yogurts, jams, and the hot selections of either scrambled or hard boiled eggs, a vegetable quiche and eggs with vegetables, sausage and bacon, plus coffee and the famous Turkish apple tea. There is a little reception in the afternoon, but we were out touring and did not participate. The breakfast is served in the main restaurant, but there is a second fish restaurant, where you can pick your own fresh fish. It looked good, but we didnâ€™t have time to eat there. Even though we did not utilize it, there is a Turkish Hamam downstairs with a sauna, pool and fitness center. It looked very inviting, but there wasnâ€™t time. They even have complimentary internet service. When the weather permits, you can dine on the rooftop patio, which is charming. The staff was very nice and helpful â€“ from the bellhops to the waiters. Everyone was so warm and welcoming they made you feel like family. We feel that we have made new friends in Turkey. If we ever have the privilege of visiting Istanbul again, you can be sure that we will stay at the Sirkeci Konak.

Reviews.Title: “Truly wondeful!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa-who-travels
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is lovely! ,and as soon as you walk through the door you get a great welcome. The check in was very informative,and was accompanied by apple tea..a very nice touch. The room are very sweet and well equipped and nicely done..and have robes and slippers,tea and coffee making facilities too,also bottles of water free of charge.They leave turkish delight on the bed which is also a nice welcoming touch too. The spa is great and is just what you need after a long day site seeing!We used the pool every day and the sauna. The great thing about this hotel is it is very near all the sites and over looks a lovely park..if you get a room with that view!!we over looked the roofs behind but it didn't matter. The hotel also does a news letter which is on the tables at breakfast..have a look because it suggests lots of great things going on in Istanbul. This is a lovely hotel! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay with 1st class customer service”
Reviews.Author: Alister454
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Sirkeci Hotel with my father for 4 nights in June. The hotel is in a great location â€“ under 5 minute walk from The Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque â€“ offering excellent rooms with high quality amenities. In addition to a hassle free airport transfer, we were offered a complementary dinner on arrival in the hotelâ€™s restaurant which was of a high quality. The daily breakfast provided was also extensive, fresh and balanced between local offerings and more familiar options. Members of the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful throughout our stay; the hotels client relationship manager, Menekse, kindly provided sight opening hours and ferry timings, as well as making reservations for us at some of the cityâ€™s leading restaurants. After enquiring about a local Turkish bar in which to watch Turkey in Euro 2008, we were kindly invited by the hotel staff to join them at their local 'haunt' - which was a very enjoyable evening, especially given the fantastic result! If you are looking to avoid spending your life savings on one of the many luxury international hotel chains in Istanbul then the Sirkeci Konak hotel is perfect for you, it combines a great location, excellent rooms and amenities with unbeatable customer service offered at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best little hotels in Europe”
Reviews.Author: marinhorserider
Reviews.Content: Like many others, despite buying all the usual guide books, I booked this hotel because of its Trip Advisor rating. As a single woman traveler I am careful where I stay and can assure any reader that this is a lovely hotel. The street is a bit shabby, but the hotel service and the rooms are excellent. Good: shower water pressure, comfortable beds, good breakast, fabuous location if you like to walk. OK: THe Haman, I went to one in Goreme (Cappadokia) too, and it was much better. The rooftop, not much of a view and no service whenever I went up there. Pelin, in guest services is a great asset too. Oh yes, if you use the internet (free) remember it's a Turkish keyboard - the i is in a different place! I also stayed at the Hilton 8 days later, the Sirkeci is MUCH better. I did walk the city for hours and can say that if you want to be closer to the Mosque on a pretty street consider the Yesel Evi (sp?) Other recommendations: Take a cooking class from Cooking Alaturka, it's a great experience, Eveline the owner is really interesting and the food you cook (and eat) is fabulous. If someone recommends Sarnic Restaurant, skip it - pretty building but mediocre food. Istanbul is a safe, clean city. The only negatives I can share are the dreadful traffic (have the hotel send a car) and the constant cigarette smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel but staff were green.”
Reviews.Author: PhillyCanuck
Reviews.Content: We booked after reading the glowing reviews from others. We will say that this is an excellent property, top-notch. The flip-side is that the staff were very young and quite "green". We felt they could have done better in several areas. For example, we dined at the hotel restaurant and waited 30 mins only to find out that the initial order and wine selection could not be completed (normally, you tell diners in advance if you are out of an item on the menu). When it came time to pay for the check there wasn't anyone around at all. After 15 minutes, we actually, had to go to the front desk to tell them we wanted to leave. Sadly, they didn't get a tip that night at all. The room was excellent and everything was clean, modern and beautiful. The spa facilities and services are truly awesome! We'd stay in this property again, but think managers should remember that it is the staff that makes the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Great position, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: LondonJulian
Reviews.Content: Like most city hotels in Istanbul, the Sirkeci Konak Hotel is situated in a back street with little to offer in the way of outlook. The difference is that as soon as you step inside the door you are welcomed by the warmest people you could hope to meet. The accommodation is a very high standard with rooms adequately sized and very well presented. The public areas are comfortable and there is a lovely spa in the basement with a tiny pool, sauna and gym. The greatest feature of the hotel, however, is its position - within very easy walking distance from all of Istanbul's major tourist attractions. We enjoyed a lovely four days at the hotel, celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary with friends who had the same celebration. The staff at the hotel made it a time to remember.

Reviews.Title: “The Splendid Sirkeci Konak”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustNewcastle_
Reviews.Content: Just back home from a 5 night stay at the Sirkeci Konak. Without a doubt the most impressive feature of this Hotel is the warmth and professionalism of the staff. A special mention is needed for Manekse and Pellin, both delightful young girls who are a great asset to the hotel, always available to offer help and advice or simply a chat at tea time. Overall the standard of the hotel is high and the location is ideal for access to most of the major sights.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem!”
Reviews.Author: rmazer
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at this property in April for 2 nights prior to going on a cruise. We were traveling with another couple and we both had deluxe rooms. They were spacious with balconies and a view of the park. We enjoyed dinner at the property our first night and the authentic Turkish cuisine was delicious and the service was great. The buffet breakfast included in our room rate was extensive and also delicious. The staff is amazing and location perfect in the Old section of Istanbul near all the major attractions. It is on a side street and not on the main drag which made you feel like you were part of the neighborhood. In a large city it is nice to have the intimacy of a smaller hotel as well. The staff was always on hand to help with any questions we had. We enjoyed our conversations with Menekse (the Guest Relations Manager), she made us feel like part of the Sirkeci Konak family! I would recommend this property to anyone who seeks superior accomodations with an authentic Turkish flavor in a location convenient to all of the not-to-miss sites. The personal service here is exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “An enchanting hotel”
Reviews.Author: wistyone
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this delightful boutique hotel for a week in May. We had a large, beautiful, spotless room with a private terrace overlooking Topkapi Gardens. The hotel is located on a small, unprepossessing side street, so walking through the hotel door is a complete surprise. It is within walking distance to all the important cultural and historic sites. As other reviewers have noted, the hotel has special amenities, including two charming restaurants and a hamam. But what makes the Sirkeci a standout, is the unsurpassed genuine warmth and service of its youthful staff ,and the sensitive attention to the needs of guests by the hotel owner, Faruk Boyaci. If you stay here, you will forever understand the meaning of "Turkish Hospitality". The Guest Relations Manager, Menekse Goker, is a young, higly informed powerhouse who follows up on every request and usually stays well beyond her designated work hours to insure that all guest requests have been honored. The hotel has a wide appeal; while we were guests, we noted solo business people, couples,small groups and families. My husband and I are world travelers. The Sirkeci Konak is high on our list of truly memorable hotels. And a great bargain, as well!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionall friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: paul3804
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel located near the best attractions in Istanbul. In all respects this hotel exceeded our expectations. From the minute we arrived the staff made us feel welcome. The public rooms were well appointed and had a welcoming feeling. Our room was well appointed with a very comfortable bed. We even found adequate electrical outlets which are often missing in European hotels. The included breakfast was generous and of high quality. The hotel offers several additional features such as afternoon tea, a cooking class, and free internet access. I consider this hotel a great value for a top notch property.

Reviews.Title: “Sirkeci Konak Is Just Marvelous”
Reviews.Author: KarinMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We can't speak highly enough of the Sirkeci Konak. We stayed at this delightful hotel for 7 nights this May and we didn't have a single complaint. The room (deluxe with balcony overlooking the Topkapi Palace gardens) had everything you could want - the bed was comfortable and well appointed as was the bathroom. The Turkish Bath and Spa facilities were excellent and the restaurants were above average. But without a doubt the best thing about this hotel are the staff - every one of them without exception are dedicated to excellent service, friendly, outgoing, interesting and thoroughly delightful people. Of special mention should be the two Guest Relations Managers - Ms Menekse Goker and Ms Pelin Nasoz - helpful, efficient and friendly. We would definitely stay at this hotel again if in Istanbul and are happy to recommend it to other travellers. Karin Diamond & Alan Palmer - Melbourne Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: gfranz
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Sirkeci Konak. The staff and deluxe room exceeded our expectations. One aspect that disappointed us was the lack of an evening turn down and towel service. I'm sure if we requested towels they would have supplied them. Also, the phone in our room could not receive calls and was not fixed. If you go to this hotel, bring your own wash cloths as they do not have any,

Reviews.Title: “Return to Sirkeci Konak”
Reviews.Author: AMGAthens_Greece
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveller I spend a lot of time in hotels and have learnt there are many components involved in making a guest wish to return. And the Sirkeci Konak succeeds in doing just that! I first stayed at the Sirkeci Konak in October 2007 when I found the high standard of the facilities and comfort of the accommodation was matched with details and thoughtful touches that made it a very special place - the tea served on arrival while check in formalities where completed; the afternoon tea served free of charge every day so refreshing after a long day out; the flowers and Turkish Delight left in the rooms along with complimentary water and tea/coffee making facilities; the excellent food and service in the restaurant; the daily Hotel newsletter with wonderful snippets of news and tips about the city; the warmth and hospitality shown by the staff and overseeing it all the wonderful management team always available and willing to help and advise. No wonder I couldn't wait to go back! My return visit was in May. Arriving was like going home to old friends and my return visit was even better than the first. This time they knew me, remembered me and warmly welcomed me back. The roof terrace was glorious at night in the balmy summer air and the new fish restaurant a great addition to the range of delicious food served. This hotel is tops in my view and I look forward to visit number 3. Special thanks and congratulations go to Mr Faruk and Menekse the Guest Relations Manager for their constant care and attention to detail ensuring that this guest will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: AviationFrankfurt
Reviews.Content: Sirkeci Konak Hotel, Istanbul Stay: 7 - 11 April 2008 We decided that we'd prefer to stay in the older part of Istabul and be within walking distance of the main sites. Our choice of the Sirkeci Konak Hotel proved to be 100% in all aspects. Starting with the timely pickup at the airport. Although situated in a "very interesting" street of shops selling car spare parts, the Sirkeci Konak stands out like a jewel one would see at the Topkapi Palace. The entrance and reception are very tastefully laid out, the reception by the management made one feel as part of the family from the first minute. We booked a room on the 5th floor, a bit more expensive, but certainly worth the price due to the superb layout of the room, bathroom and amenities as well as the wonderful view from our balcony over Istanbul, the Bosphorous and the Topkapi and Blue Mosque. We were more than pleasantly surprised on the first evening as we'd decided to eat at the hotel restaurant. wonderful food, tastefully prepared and served along with a "happy" and helpful waiter. Regretfully, my wife came down with some food poisoning (not from the hotel). However the staff went very much out of their way to help her get better and arrange proper medication and so on. Wonderful people. We always saw all of the Sirkeci staff with smiling faces, always a pleasant greeting and really eager to help in any way possible, even with the smallest of requests. Facit: It's where we'll always stay when back in Istanbul and you'll certainly miss something if you don't go there.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cholmley
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this wonderful hotel for three nights with my daughter and husband. The location is excellent if you want to be in the Sultanamet, and if you are first time visitors to Istanbul, it's the most convenient neighborhood. Our room was clean, bright and, for a triple, roomy and very comfortable. After staying recently in four hotels in Italy, I was impressed with the bed here. I slept very well. We loved the hotel's hamman and we also participated in a delightful hands-on cooking class on a Friday afternoon. But the best aspect of this excellent place is the staff. I've never come across a nicer, more personable and consistently helpful group in any hotel in the states or in Europe. I don't know who is training these people, but they are to be commended. It would be even better if more hotels would copy the ethos of the Sirkeci Konak.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: sgolden600
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the hotel for 9 nights and we thoroughly enjoyed it. The staff was excellent. They were all extremely helpful and accomodating and went beyond the norm. In fact, I had my birthday while in Istanbul, and they surprised me with a cake and a nice gift. The hotel location is perfect. It's in the Old City and is a brief walk to all of the major sites (Topkapi, Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque and Grand Bazaar) as well close to the waterfront where the ferries are. The rooms are nicely appointed and the beds are very comfortable. (I slept incredibly well). The bathrooms are also nice as is the hotel's hamman, sauna and pool. Special thanks to Pelin Nasoz who had great recommendations for places to eat and things to see. Also, thanks to the chef for the great cooking class!

Reviews.Title: “It lived up to its top billing”
Reviews.Author: CarlaBrighton
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of its outstanding reviews and ratings on Tripadvisor. It certainly met those expectations. Perfect location within easy walking distance of all the Sultanahmet attractions, lovely quiet street and views from the roof terrace of the Bosphorous, Beyaglu and the Gulhane park and gardens. It was magical having a drink at sunset on the roof, watching the nesting storks and parrakeets and the distant boats. The staff were friendly and very helpful and the room was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: LionNeil
Reviews.Content: While on a Mediterranean Cruise in May, my husband was injured and had to be hospitalized in Istanbul. We had reservations at the Sirkeci Konah Hotel as we had planned to stay in Istanbul a few days after the cruise. While my husband was in the hospital, the entire staff of the Hotel went WAY out of their way to help and support me. They got me a charger for my cell phone, walked me to a local store and ATM, sent emails and faxes for me, and even volunterred to go to the hospital with me. This small hotel was an oasis of friendliness and graciousness. They extended similar services to my husband once he left the hospital and joined me at the Hotel. He was equally impressed. When we left the Hotel, the staff on duty all appeared to say good-by and come again. Although our stay in Istanbul started off poorly, we were heartened by the wonderful service given by your Hotel and highly recommend it to travelers looking for a small, personal hotel. Sincerely yours, Mr. and Mrs. C. J. Desmond Concord, CA 94521 USA

Reviews.Title: “Not a one off...”
Reviews.Author: ArtemisTT
Reviews.Content: Judging from other reviews, the excellent standards we enjoyed during our visit to the Sirkeci Konak from 6-10 May are consistent. Yes, the staff were all genuinely friendly and helpful - the duty manager even allowed us to use his office computer when our attempts to send an email from the hotel computer failed. (With his help we discovered we were inputting an English 'i' instead of a Turkish one!) The location means all the main tourist attractions - the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, St Sophia, the Galata Bridge and Tower, the museums etc - are within walking distance. The hotel itself is clean and comfortable with an excellent buffet breakfast offering everything from fresh fruits & cereals to cooked dishes. We were very grateful to Menekse for her advice - particularly restaurants to try in the evenings. The only negative is the cost - with the Turkish Lira hardening against Sterling, holidaying in Turkey is no longer a cheap option (but that's hardly the Sirkeci Konak's fault). Go for it! [--]

Reviews.Title: “priceworthy hotel”
Reviews.Author: baghdadcafe
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel last week for two nights, when I was on the way back to my home in Wien after my three month duty in a hardship country. Therefore, the NO. 1 criterion for my selection of the hotel in Istanbul was of course it should provide me with an immense rest which I think I deserve for my hard work. I can say that this hotel fully satisfied my criteria. The hotel was smaller than I expected. But it was cosy and of course comfortable. The bed and bed cover were of high quality, all clean and made up tidy. I was able to feel the interior of the hotel room and corridors showed the beauty of traditional turkish culture and arts. The sauna and massage facility inside the hotel were not that big as shown in the photos but quite clean. The service was also quite professional and helpful for my recovery from my hard work. Although I was not able to use wireless internet service through my laptop inside my room, but at the hotel lounge I could use the wireless internet service without any registration or PIN. The speed was quite fast. I was also able to use the internet facility which was conviniently located in front of the elevator, for free. Last but not the least, all of the hotel staff I met were kind and always tried to be attentive and responded positively to many of my lengthy requests and inquries.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: superdeb77
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the excellent reviews on TripAdvisor but were a little disappointed. The hotel was slightly chaotic and it was quite noisy. The zoo in the park opposite is being dismantled and there are building works from midnight until 6.00 a.m. Rooms 2501 and 2502 have bad sound-proofing. The guests in the next room had a habit of falling asleep with the TV volume on high and when I went down about 1.00 a.m. to ask the desk clerk to ring them and ask them to turn it down, he did - but then rang us to say he had done so, just after we had finally fallen aseep. The guest services advisor is excellent but the front desk staff are not so good. They got some bookings for restaurants and treatments wrong and one night sent us in the taxi to the wrong restaurant. Having said all that, perhaps our expectations were too high.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing But The Best”
Reviews.Author: cinciti7
Reviews.Content: We arrived a day late due to missing connection in London. Our bags were not put on the flight the next day with us. We arrived at the hotel and the staff is just absolutely wonderful. Every one of them. They called every day about our bags and we finally received them on the 3rd day. The beds were wonderful. The room looked exactly like it did in the picture and was just as comforable. My Sister & I had hired a drivng tour guide and then we returned to the hotel the night before we left to come home. It just happened to be my birthday and they brought me a cake and sang to me and then one of the girls brought me a little gift. We can't say enough about the hotel. We will be returning to Turkey as our time was short and there are many more things we want to see and will definitely stay with them again. 5 Star as far as we can see. Wonderful breakfast included also.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Fortysomething7
Reviews.Content: Putting aside some of the quirks and frustrations of Istanbul, there is no doubt that The Sirkeci Konak is a good choice, particularly if you are there sightseeing, as all the major attractions are within easy walking distance. What particularly marks out this hotel though is the customer service, and what appears to be a genuine desire to want to assist all its clientele. In addition, many of the staff speak very good english, which is invaluable when the turkish language will appear almost unfathomable to the average brit. We stayed over the Turkish GP weekend, and their ability to organise transport for us and other guests to get to the circuit, was a godsend, although tolerating the journey back in a minibus for 2 hours through some of the densest and most chaotic traffic I have ever seen was not an experience I would necessarily choose. However, that is simply the way that it is in Istanbul... As for the hotel itself, aside from the staff and welcome, the room was adequate and clean, if hardly capacious. Breakfast was good, even if some of the dishes might seem a tad unusual to the more westernised palate, and the facilities (which include a small pool and gym) were fine. You will not get unadulterated luxury here, but you will get a comfortable and welcoming place to stay, at a reasonabel rate, and right in the heart of the old part of the city. How you then conduct yourself and where you go in Istanbul is up to you, but be prepared to be amazed (at the sights and sounds), appalled (at the crass westernisation of some aspects, particularly those with a tourist bent), mildly intimdated (hard-selling shop-owners and con-artist beggars), astonished (the traffic and the way it behaves is unlike anything I have ever witnessed) saddened (the breathtaking ignorance and arrogance of so many tourists who seem to have not an ounce of sensitivity and respect in their bodies) and curiously and fascinatingly intrigued by a people and a culture that has a wealth of history and prowess, but which remains in a struggle between the new and the old.

Reviews.Title: “Charming with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TomScaletta
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. It met all my expectations and the location was ideal for walking about. The best part was the personalized attention we received from Menekse. The restaurant was also exceptional!

Reviews.Title: “Very fussy traveller”
Reviews.Author: fussytraveller_8
Reviews.Content: We turned up in Istanbul at the hotel that we had originally booked and were told our booking was changed to the Sirkeci Konak - another hotel in "the"group". Very nervous as to what we were going to be staying in, however, this hotel turned out to be fantastic. Nice staff, great rooms & food. Only negative (very minor) was the local carpet shop - just up the road - obviously has some deal with the staff at the hotel so when you walked out of the hotel the carpet sellers knew where you were from & started the hard sell ! Minor negative point though - eveything else was great - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Your Place Number 1 in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Hentschke
Reviews.Content: I have been extremely busy over the past months, therefore this review comes with a delay. However, I would not want to miss recommending this hotel to other potential guests. I myself have benefited so much from user reviews. I booked on the hotel's webpage and received a prompt reply in a most welcoming tone. I knew immediately that I had chosen a very friendly place. Ms Petek Goker, Guest Relations Manager, went out of her way to help me finding the best connection from Istanbul to Bergama. We entered into a longer correspondence, and when I arrived I was welcomed with tea and like an old friend. The hotel is in a prime location, ca. 15-20 minutes walking from both the railway station and Topkapi Palace/Hagia Sophia. If you prefer taking the tram, the stop is 2 minutes from the hotel, and the tram will also take you directly to Dolmabaci Palace (30 min). Hotel rooms are super-clean and tastefully furnished though they could be better isolated. Try to get a room away from the cleaners' broom board, cleaning starts after 8. The hotel also has a very small swimming pool, sauna, and fitness room, all very clean. Breakfast is fantastic even though it does not change much. As long as you do not spend weeks in the hotel, you will enjoy. The main asset of the Sirkeci Konak is its staff, virtually everybody is most polite and friendly. The guest ifeels like a king, and this has become rare nowadays. Thanks to all staff. Advice: even Ms Petek could not find all the Bergama connections. I managed in the end, and you might find the following to be helpful. Do not pay a lot of money to take a flight to Izmir and a bus from there to Bergama. Avoid the sticky night buses that need hours and hours to just go around the Marmora Sea. Go to the Instanbul Gar (railway station) and ask at the counter (not the rather unfriendly tourist office) for a combined ferry-train ticket to Bergama. It is very cheap, but booking in advance may be useful. On the day of departure take a taxi from the hotel to the ferry port, cross the Marmora Sea with the early-morning speed boat (ca. 7 am). When you arrive in Bandirma, at the other side of the Marmora Sea, the train is waiting for you, 5 minutes from the ferry port. This train goes from Bandirma to Basmane (Izmir) at 9.45. However, you leave in Soma where it arrives at 12.45 (all times September 2007). The train will only stop for 2 minutes, so make sure you do not fall asleep. There are taxis and the cheap minibuses from Soma Gar (outside the small town) to Soma Otogar (bus terminal in the centre). From there you can take several buses to Bergama. You arrive after 3 and will have sufficient time to take a motorcycle or taxi ride to the top of the Bergama hill and visit the excavations. On the way back, take the footpath behind the Zeus temple and walk down through the ruins of the old city. Look for cheap accomodation in Bergama? Try the Athena Guesthouse. There are no proper hotels in Bergama. If this is what you want, then indeed fly to Izmir and take a day trip by bus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: DrSD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel from April 26-May 1. The experience was excellent. Tea was offered on arrival, as well as a map of the city and a pamphlet describing when sites were open or closed. Also, we were introduced to Ms. Pelin who was available at what seemed like all hours to offer advice, make recommendations and reservations. The rooms were spotless the beds had clean white duvet covers. Breakfast was good and free snacks and tea were offered in the evening. Complimentary bottles of water were left in the room each day. My husband and I ate at the hotel restaurant twice and the main courses were excellent. Pelin was also around to ask each and everyone how their day was, which was very, very nice. The hotel even offered a free cooking class in Turkish cuisine. Also, the hotel is very conveniently located. It is next to the tram that runs through the city with the tram stop being only a minute away. Nevertheless, my husband and I were able to walk everywhere: Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, Bosphorus, Galata Tower, Takism business area and even the Dolmabahce Palace. My husband and I would not stay at any other hotel in Istanbul. (Thank you Pelin!) Drs. Dhaliwal & Bhandhal, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Really Good Hotel - Fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: HareHiller
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is not particularly prepossesing from the outside the warmth of our reception lifted it to a new class. We loved the apple tea whilst checking in. The room was airy and well equipped, if a bit small. The bed was large and comfortable. Fresh milk was delivered within minutes of asking with no suggestion of a charge. The roof top terrace was lovely for a lunchtime or pre-dinner drink. A small and very warm pool in the basement was perfect for soaking away the aches of heavy sightseeing. Many of the main sites of interest were within easy walking distance and for those farther afield there was a very close tram stop plus very economical taxis. Above all the staff were just so good. We felt welcomed every time we walked into the reception. In particular Menekse was delightful and a fantastic asset to the hotel. We will definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “warm welcome at the sirkeci konak”
Reviews.Author: Arienne
Reviews.Content: We, four ladyfriends, had a wonderfull stay at the Sirkeci Konak. We liked our rooms with the spotlessly clean bathrooms with extra bathrobes and slippers. The breakfastbuffet was etraordinary, so much variety and it all tasted delicious! The Hammam was really nice with a very good massage. We had dinner at the hotels restaurant twice , and we were pleasently suprised by the good quality of the food as well as the modest prices in the restaurant. A highlight was our cookinglesson on friday with the restaurants Chef. We had so much fun and got a very nice meal out of it. But the most positive thing about the Sirkeci Konak is the friendlyness of the staff. One of a kind! The guest relation management go out of their way to make you happy. This is not a cheap hotel but it gives you something money can't allways buy; a very warm welcome, and a longing to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Felipe S
Reviews.Content: We were impressed from the begining. A great reception, with Turkish Tea and lost of information of the area. The staff in the hotel is extremely nice and always prompt to help. I strognly recommend the Turkish baths and dinning in. The hotel is in walking distance of the main attractions of the area and also to the harbour. I coldn't imagine a better place to stay in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Naomi51
Reviews.Content: We chose the Sirkeci Konak for my husband's 50th birthday (the date of which, coincidentally, is my birthday as well) after seeing reviews on Tripadvisor and were not disappointed. We were warmly greeted on our arrival with apple tea (very traditional for Turkey, not sure why one reviewer was so dismissive of this). Although we knew from the earlier reviews that one person had a birthday celebrated we weren't sure whether that had been a 'one-off' so were delighted when a cake and candles were brought out at the 5pm tea slot on the appropriate day, swiftly followed by a present each. A 50th birthday was also being celebrated by a newly arrived family so a second cake was presented! I was offered a dairy-free alternative to the cake when I mentioned my inability to tolerate milk: a delicious apricot and almond dessert. Breakfasts were excellent: I am often very restricted with what I can have, but with both fresh and stewed fruit and a range of hot dishes I was given plenty of choice (the waiters were very knowledgeable about the ingredients of dishes). We had one evening meal at the restaurant which was delicious. The bar area lacks the atmosphere of some of the sister hotels in the chain which we visited, but the floor area is quite small so it is hard to see what else could be done. The beds are quite hard (so often the case - we now carry a single bed foam topper which we spread across the middle of the bed). The only other thing I would have found difficult if on my own was the towels were placed on a very high rack above the bath, and you need to practically get in to the the bath to turn the bath taps on (yes, Polyarny, some of us do still like a bath: and my king size bed at home is twins pushed together). A couple of small oddities, my husband's swimming shorts went missing from our room, and one one occasion the room tray was not replenished with tea bags. We were very grateful to Menekse for her advice, and she was only too happy to book us in to the restaurant we had chosen. We would heartily recommend this hotel for a great stay: central, quiet and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel, great staff, expensive”
Reviews.Author: Wudja
Reviews.Content: The location is terrific in the Old City. Walk to all the sights and convenient for the tram to the New City. Rooms are nice with a year-old 'very fake' attempt at pseudo-Ottoman decor. Bathroom was VERY dark. Gave up trying the shave after day two. I know no one goes on holiday to watch television but the channel selection in English was limited to EuroNews (more stories about female power lifters and cycling) and the Hallmark Channel's ongoing "Terminal Illness Week." Buffet breakfast was fine, if a bit repetitive. The staff are lovely and go out of there way to make your stay easy. Given the recent rise in the Euro this is NOT an inexpensive proposition. If you go, go for three nights. We went for five and that's way too long to spend in Istanbul. Paul London

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shropshirelad2
Reviews.Content: Comfortable Hotel in Great Location for the main sites of Istanbul. The main plus though are the staff who can not help enough. A great experience that l would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Spring in Sirkeci Konak”
Reviews.Author: reiziger78
Reviews.Content: The very friendly staff give us a very warm welcome with apple-tea and simits. They were always very kind and willing to help us.The location is perfect, all the important tourist-attractions are on walking distance. Very comfortable beds. Nice, coffee, tea, water and Turkish delight in your room. Next time in Istanbul: Sirkeci Konak!

Reviews.Title: “An Istanbul highlight”
Reviews.Author: PW24
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, we were made to feel at home. Friendly, helpful staff, who knew their job, their city and how to look after their guests. Clean, tidy, well equipped rooms and non-smoking too. Great breakfast, handy bar and in-house restaurant. Gym, etc loked good too. Well placed for all sights, railway station, ferry terminals and public transport. Good car service to & from airports. We'd be happy to go back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Carlos4578
Reviews.Content: We chose Sirkeci Konak for a 4 night stay in Istambul, after reading other TA menbers reviews, and our experience has been even better than expected. The hotel itself is cosy and very well located, just few steps to Topkapi Palace, Sta. Sofia and Blue Mosque, and has excellent installations such as a little SPA with hamman, sauna, massage room and gym. All very private, clean and luxury finished. The rooms (Sup. Room) are exactly as they appear in their website, with jacuzzi, luxury bed linen, towels and ammenities and a little terrace with beautiful views (the hotel has one upstairs for breakfast or drinks). The room service is silent and effective and breakfast buffet is fantastic, with many sweet and salted options and their "newspapper" Sirkeci Daily Express giving you advice of interesting things to see in Istambul. Anyway, what makes this hotel so special is the service attitude and care of the whole staff, specially their 2 Guest Relations Managers, Pelin and Meneckse, who are always keen to help you in everything you may need, like bookings, advices, queries... or simply getting feedback about every aspect of the hotel. From our arrival (we arrived at midnight, with a 6 hours delay, but there was our welcome tea while check in and rose petals in bed&jacuzzi for our anniversary) to the departure (with all the staff saying us goodbye outside the hotel), everything has been memorable for us. I am used to travel a lot for business and I know many excelent 4* and 5* hotels across Europe: No-one has the combination of simpathy and professionalism we have found in Sirkeci staff.

Reviews.Title: “" Sirkeci Konak Keeps It's Eastern Promise! "”
Reviews.Author: paz786
Reviews.Content: Hello All..here's my story.. My sister and I had been planning a trip to Istanbul and were overwhelmed by all the hotel choices on offer online until I stumbled upon the Hotel Sirkeci Konak's website as if by Divine Providence! I immediately warmed to the description of the hotel, it's location and overall intimate ambience. We were certainly not disappointed in the least when we arrived at the hotel in the Old City district of Istanbul. The driver who came to collect us from the airport was a kind and friendly young man, immediately putting us both at ease on the journey to the hotel. On arrival, we were served delicious Turkish Apple Tea by the reception Manager who then briefed us on our stay at the hotel; we were made to feel instantly welcome. It is important to feel safe when you are staying in a hotel and we felt we were well cared for by all the staff and that they made every effort to ensure we were catered for. Turkish Breakfast was delicious..if like ourselves you enjoy hearty breakfasts as opposed to a light snack ! The room we were given was quiet, as we had requested, clean and room service was prompt as well as friendly. Lovely. All throughout our stay the lovely Customer Relations Manager, Menekse helped us out with suggestions for places to visit and even joined us for some congenial chat over breakfast- we felt very welcomed and certainly the Sirkeci is an ideal location from which we could travel to all the important Tourist sites. We also enjoyed chatting to all the staff after a day out , sometimes recanting the adventures we had had in the city, with them. I personally, being a languages enthusiast, took every opportunity to practice a few lines of Turkish that I had learned much to the amusement and pleasure of all the staff. :-) We would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to ALL types of travellers, especially if you wish to sample a taste of REAL Turkish hospitality as opposed to Western-orientated 'tourist' hotels where you have all the mod-cons without the heart and soul! Also, if you appreciate Oriental Art you will not be disappointed with this beautiful, compact Ottoman designed hotel; the hotel lounge is a lovely place to sit back and chat with your fellow-travellers whilst sipping some relaxing Turkish Tea after a day sight-seeing as we both did; and finally: if you desire a peaceful and quiet atmosphere to retreat to after a long day shopping and sight-seeing.. then the Sirkeci will not disappoint. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Sirkeci Konak and I am already planning my next long weekend back there soon..Very soon! See you there or as they say in Turkish: "Gorusuruz insallah! "

Reviews.Title: “Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: MIC_8
Reviews.Content: very nice ottoman style hotel in the centre, beautiful room with view on the park, high standard service, nice & very helpful staff (who managed a surprise birthday cake for my partner and reserved a couple of wonderful restaurants!). Recommended for all Italians!!

Reviews.Title: “Not disappointed at all with this choice”
Reviews.Author: andreaonmon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. We stayed from March 21 â€“ 24 and booked our room directly with the hotel for 150 EUR/night for a double room. This includes a transfer from the airport upon arrival, daily breakfast, daily afternoon tea, and a welcome dinner in the hotel restaurant. You also have usage of the spa facilities: pool, sauna, and traditional Turkish steam room. At this price, I feel that the hotel was great value for what it offered. There were also some nice extra touches that we really appreciated. Since you cannot drink water from the taps, the hotel provides some complimentary bottles of water for your use with the kettle provided in your room. They left some traditional candy, Turkish delight, in the room and had little vases of fresh flowers. The staff at the hotel was all very helpful and eager to help. I had a few queries about things to do in Istanbul and emailed them before I arrived to which I received speedy responses. Upon arrival, they greet you with apple tea and provide an orientation of the city. They ask you right away if you need help booking any activities or restaurants. I think it is great that you are so proactive in helping their guests rather than waiting for you to come to them with your needs. You were always greeted with a smile from everyone who worked there. The location of the hotel is also very good. All the sights of the old town are within walking distance. The tram station is also right outside the hotel so you can catch that if you do not wish to walk somewhere. There are many places to eat right around the corner and also a grocery store nearby if you want to self cater. The daily breakfast is not exceptional but was adequate for us as our first fuel of the day. In contrast, the free welcome dinner in the hotel restaurant was truly excellent and not that far off in quality from the meal we had at Tugra, which is one of Istanbulâ€™s most expensive restaurants. We really enjoyed the dinner and were pleasantly surprised by its quality. Our only complaint is that it was difficult to book appointments with the spa upon arrival. I would suggest that you book your treatments ahead of time to avoid disappointment. I tried a few times during my stay to book a massage but was never able to secure an appointment. I have no reservations in recommending this hotel to anyone who is visiting Istanbul. We were very comfortable here and liked the small, homey feel of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sirkeci Amazing Despite 2 feet of snow!”
Reviews.Author: Baglady_NJ
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Turkey for six nights at the Sireki Konak ,as snow began to fall. The staff gave us the warm welcome, for which they are famous, complete with the famous apple tea. The hotel is lovely, clean and new (approx. 1 year). It has a small indoor pool, a turkish bath, The rooms are comfortable, and well appointed. The next morning we got up and looked outside and it was still snowing , over a foot and we were thinking what will we do stuck in a hotel in Istanbul. Well, here is where location really counts. The hotel is located on the tram line that connects the city and all the historic sites and best of all the Grand Bazaar, which is covered. Perfect for a day filled with snow. When we got back, we took a cooking lesson with the chef and made our own dinner. Since the chef speaks no english we had a wonderful translator named Engin who is the restaurant manger. He was so nice. We invited him to join us for dinner and afterwards he taught us how to play backgammon. So much fun! I must mention the food which was wonderful. The breakfast included local foods such as honey (on a real comb), olives, figs as well as standard breakfast fare. The egg dishes were particularily good. Out of six nights, we chose to eat at the hotel not only because of the cold and snow but mainly due to the delicoius food and wounderful staff. They are opening a fish resturant soon that will share the hotels kichen so I anticipate it will be wonderful. There is also an outdoor area that looks lovely in the pictures. We were so sad to leave when our time was up. We loved Istanbul, the people, food. sites which were all enhanced by our wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay, would go back any time!”
Reviews.Author: summerlovebaby
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sirkeci Konak for 5 days with our 15 month old daughter and it was one of the best experiences we have ever had. The hotel staff are warm, friendly, welcoming and approachable. Upon arrival the guest managers sit down with you, explaining everything and spending the time to answer any questions you may have. Admittedly the rooms are a bit small but the excellent hospitality of this hotel more than makes up for that. The Turkish baths and Sauna are excellent, the food is reasonable and one of the best meals we had in Istanbul was at this hotel. The staff are extremely child friendly and on many occasions they entertained our daughter while we ate or had tea. Every afternoon they serve tea and snacks in the lobby which is a great opportunity to relax as well as interact with other guests. The guest relations managers were very helpful, Menekse is a delight to interact with, warm, cheerful and always forthcoming in her suggestions about what to do and where to go. This was really useful, especially since all places are not suitable to take a baby. We had a truly amazing time in Istanbul and a lot of it was due to Sirkeci Konak.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT, Great Staff, Great Location and overall amazing value!”
Reviews.Author: BellinaRaffy
Reviews.Content: LOVED ISTANBUL! I just got back last night from Istanbul where myself and my friends - total 6pp/3 rooms all stayed at this hotel and we were thrilled with the hotel- We could not have been happier! First off this hotel is not trying to be a Ritz Carlton or a Four Seasons as some past reviewers tried to compare it to so I will not be comparing it to any other hotel. PRE ARRIVAL: A few weeks prior to our arrival I received kind emails from the hotel offering any pre-assistance in advance for any reservations, restaurants, tours etc. I enjoyed this and it made me even more excited for the trip! It was as though these emails were a countdown to my trip! Thanks! LOCATION: The hotel is in the Sultamet area which was perfect for our needs. We were within walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Grand Bazaar, Spice Market, Ferry Boats, the Camerberlitas Hamam which is the Turkish bath we wanted to try, Toppikai Palace and many restauanats, stores etc. In front of the hotel there is a small store that sells sodas, water etc It is true that some of the stores in front of the hotel are rather odd like a filter store, metal scrap part store but who cares! Our entrance was charming! HOTEL OVERVIEW: First off- let me say that I booked our rooms direct with the hotel and I personally feel we got a great deal! 170 Euro per room per night included: Breakfast each day which was more than fine.. they had breads, eggs, dips, cheeses and all the traditional Turkish things. Welcome dinner per room (appetizer, main and dessert or main menu) Free airport transfers RT Cooking Lesson- We were all offered a free cooking class with the chef which was great fun and we learned a traditional recipe, not to mention that it actually became our dinner- so really we got two free dinners! CASH PAYMENT offered us a 7% Discount We were in Room 2204 and we had a cute balcony, CLEAN room, with mini bar and safe, air climate control system- which allowed me to make the room super chilly at night just the way I like, bathrobes, slippers, blow dryer, close up mirror, and desk. The bed was a queen size bed- which was yes made up of two beds pushed together but we barely felt the crack and it was fine. The sheets and towels in the room have a wonderful smell which I think is the OLIVE OIL SOAP that is sold all over the city... very fresh! The room had beautiful hard wood floors and a traditional Turkish decor. The bathroom was a beauitful tiled bathroom with a large sink and yes, with a tub and the typical European 1/2 panel glass. The previous reviewer commented on this and while I admit I am not a fan of these either- they are all OVER EUROPE, Paris, London, Berlin, Vienna so.... I think you just gotta get used to it. Ohh... the water pressure was amazing! The lobby isin't huge but is nicely decorated and offered just what we needed. We loved sitting in the lounge part after a long day on the town and having a traditional apple tea (Complimentary) The fitness Center, Pool and hamam and sauna down below are all great- we loved the pool and hamam. COOKING CLASS AT HOTEL: Included in our room rate was a cooking class with the chef. Don't miss it ! We got to dress up as Chefs, hats and glovers and away we went! Just another treat from the hotel. STAFF: As many have commented before- the hotel staff at at this hotel is wonderful. They truly go out of their way to assist with anything they can and make it a point to make you feel at home. The nice part of staying at a hotel this size is that you see the same hotel staff each day vs. different. ISTANBUL IN GENERAL: I loved this city quite a bit and having seen many places in the world this was my 1st. Muslim city and I was fascinated by all. I think it''s fair to say that the city is HUGE and there is a lot to see! We covered all the main sites and really enjoyed the charm, yet also the reality of the city and some of the impoverished parts. In terms of dining on two of our nights we went to two amazing places of which this first one is in my top 10 EVER Dining Experiences: 1. AL JAMAL- This is a swanky, trendy place that serves an all you can eat Turkish dinner with wine & beer included and a wonderful belly dancing show for a set price! We were only able to get reservations via a Turkish friend of mine since when each time I called they were sold out. In fact the place was sold out and the people there were primarily wealthly beautiful Turkish people. The cool part is that since they only have one seating we actually met some of the people close to our table. The atmoshere was graet, the food was amazing, the service was perfect and very attentive and yes- the belly dancers were HOT! Our reservation was at 8:30pm and we left the place at 2am! Everyone was dancing, and having a blast and our wine/beer glasses were still always being filled. The cost was $150USD per person- which for 5.5 hours of great food, wine, service, belly dancers and dancing with amazing DJ music- I think it was well worth it! 2. The 2nd. place we went to was the famous RAINA. This too is a hot trendy , swanky place with more Continental Food. The menu was wonderful, the food was great, the views were amazing and the decor was ultra sexy, red and just HOT. Yet the service was a tad so so. This place became an exclusive club after dinner and here too- the place filled with wealthy Turkish crowds all looking to dance the night away! I hope this helped you a little and if you have any questions let me know! RST

Reviews.Title: “look no farther”
Reviews.Author: ZAHA
Reviews.Content: This charming boutique hotel is just the right place to stay if you are looking for a home away from home. There is an Ottoman design to it. The staff here is very helpful and polite. Always with a smile and they make you feel that you are a relative visiting from aboard. There is a family atmosphere in this hotel. The location is just perfect. You are steps away from Ag. Sofia and most of the rooms overlook the park where Palace Topkapi is located. The tram station is a two minute walk which leads you to the rest of the European side of Istanbul. The rooms are comfortable, CLEAN and they provide you with CLEAN TOWELS each day. They serve tea and light snacks at 5 pm in their sitting area FREE. Here you can wind down from a full day of sightseeing or a pick me up before seeing the night side of Istanbul. Do ask for Ms. Menekse Goker the Guest Relations Manger and Mr. Okay Alkan at the Front Office. Good Luck with planning your trip and remember you need at least 4 full days to see Istanbul. Zaharoula Athens, Greece

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Istanbul Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jplusj
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in early March '08. Cannot speak highly enough of the staff, room, food and service. Our spacious and comfortable top floor room came with a view of the Topkapi Palace grounds and minimal street noise. The hotel's location is perfect for exploring the city. Not only is it walking distance to the major sights, ferries and European side train station, but it is only 50 yards from the tram which is a very efficient way of getting around town. Breakfast was excellent; great quality and variety. The decor was well thought out; elegant and tasteful Ottoman style. But best of all were the staff. They were all smiling, friendly, intelligent and helpful. They clearly want each guest to enjoy their stay. If you need any help at all figuring out what you want to see or where you want to go, just talk to Menekse - she knows everything. If it's your birthday during your stay, you may even get a surprise cake and present! We hope to be lucky enough to visit Istanbul again and if we are we'll definitely stay at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The friendliest hotel”
Reviews.Author: Seasonedraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend after being recommended by a previous visitor. The welcome was first class with tea appearing in the bar while we were given advice on the sights, opening times, restaurant recommendations etc. Our room was spacious and well furnished (4th floor -best rooms) and the small spa with pool, hammam, gym, sauna etc was good for a small hotel. It is also very well situated for Topkapi, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazzar etc all in easy walking distance This is the only hotel where I have been waved off at the door by all the lobby staff as we headed back to the airport. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “The most wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: africajourneyman
Reviews.Content: Serkeci Konak is one of the most wonderful places I have stayed. In a fabulous city, the hotel is in a superb location - 5 or 10 minutes from two of the main sights Hagia Sophia and Blue Bosque, and from the bustle and excitement of the Bosphorus and the Galata Bridge. The hotel is wonderful. The rooms are beautiful. The restaurant is excellent and good value. The Turkish bath, pool, suana and gym is a real treat. But what stands out at this hotel is the staff. They are absolutely fantastic and make the service at this hotel more than 5 star. Right from the moment we booked I felt cared for by the staff personally. I brought my girlfriend to Istanbul for a special occasion and the lengths the staff went to to help was astonishing. They responded to my many requests promptly and made me feel welcome before we even arrived. Once in Istanbul I felt that every member of staff was personally looking out for us and focused entirely on making the stay one of our best ever trips and they succeeded and beyond. The staff arranged for us to upgrade for the final evening to a wonderful deluxe room. More than that, they arranged for flowers, rose petals, a CD player and more for the room, and managed to help me keep it all a secret so it would be a surprise for my girlfriend. They recommended a restaurant that had the most specatacular views over Istanbul and the food was superb. I really am struggling to find any more superlatives to describe the staff and the experience at Serkeci Konak. Everything in the reviews is true and more. I can honestly say that having travelled to many cities in different ccontinents I have never had an experience like this one. Thank you so much for making a special occasion an utterly memorable one. We left feeling like we had been looked after my friends. If you are hestitating book to stay at Serkeci Konak now!

Reviews.Title: “the perfect place for real travellers”
Reviews.Author: horravel
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival to Sirkeci Konak, we immediately fell at home. Hotel staff was over 5 stars.There is nothing negative to say about this hotel. It truly feels as if one is staying in a friend's home. The staff is exceptionally helpful, gracious, and knowledgableThere is nothing negative to say about this hotel. It truly feels as if one is staying in a friend's home. The staff is exceptionally helpful, gracious, and knowledgable Especially MenekÅŸe, Cihan,Sukru, Pelin. Everybody is helpful In fact, they made us feel as if they knew us from a long time. If I could describe the feeling upon entering this hotel is that of happiness and well being, as soon as you enter the doorway. As others have stated, the location couldnâ€™t be better, but that applies for tourists only. Hagia Sophia, Grand Bazaar, Spice Market are 10 minutes to 15 minutes by walk.I must say:Everything that everybody writes..It's TRUE!!! All in all It is an absolutely priviledge being able to spend just a day at this Sirkeci Konak Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Five days away”
Reviews.Author: Robbie08
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Istanbul was a great success, largely due to the help given to us by the friendly management and staff of the Sirkeci Konak hotel. There is an excellent breakfast which runs from 7.30am until 11am. which will suit those who like a lie in of a morning, a same day laundry service, and a complimentary dinner on your first night if you stay for five days or more.The hotel is well placed near the Topkapi museum, the Blue mosque, Aya Sophia, and the Museum of Archeology. There are also many good restaurants and cafes within walking distance of the hotel, and the management of the hotel can advise you on your choice if need be. Galata bridge and the Egyptian Bazaar are close by too, and we found that this hotel was one of the best places to stay in great comfort, right in the city centre. An absolute must for the visitor, is an evening performance by the Mevlevi Dervish group. You are asked not to use flash photography during the performance as it upsets the performers. If you rate your digital shots at 3200 ASA there is no need for a flash and the results are much better anyway.

Reviews.Title: “great combination: excellent service and good location.”
Reviews.Author: salitre71
Reviews.Content: The Sirkeci Konak Hotel is a very nice small boutique hotel in Istambul. The service is excellent, the food delicious, very nice rooms (specially the ones with a view to the gardens of the Topkapi Palace), superb location (within walking distance of Santa Sofia, the Blue Mosque, the Grand Bazaar, the Spice Bazaar and the port where you take the boats for the excursions on the Bosphorus). On top of all this, it has a small indoor swimming pool, a sauna, a gym and a super turkish bath. We tried the "real thing" at the Cimbelitas Hamman, and the one at the hotel was better (lacking the local atmosphere... but the actual massage and bath where better at the hotel). All in all, just great.

Reviews.Title: “Def the best hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Midgiepug
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 ngts after spending 3 days in 2 different hotels in Istanbul and this one is by far the best in Istanbul. It is great value for money as you would be hard pressed to find a 5 star serviced hotel in other cities in Europe for around Â£100 - Â£120 a night. The interiors of the hotel are lush and the facilities are wonderful. Lovely decent bedroom with lovely, clean facilities.
