Step out of your hotel to the beaten side street in which the Serkeci sits and know that you have found a gem amongst the rocks. Its a great feeling. Also, please do try the retsaurant while your there. You will be surpised at the quality. The food is fantastic and is soo cheap if you compare the quality of the food to what other tourist restaurants charge. The best hotel in istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “I want to live at the Sirkeci Konak!”
Reviews.Author: dayatthebeach2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 days. We never wanted to leave! The staff is so warm and helpful. They will personalize your stay and take such good care of you. The hotel itself is gorgeous - like a jewelbox. We were a group of 6, including two teenagers - and the teenagers even experienced some Istanbul nightlife with members of the staff. They knew all our names, kept track of our individual needs, and made our stay very special. We have many wonderful memories, especially of the superb food in the hotel restaurant. This restuarant offers dishes from every region in the country. Try every dish on the menu! You can even cook with the chef one or two nights a week, and make your own dinner. We woud like to give special thanks to Menekse and Pelin, the two young women who help you find your way around Istanbul, and Engin Goban, the chief of the kitchen, for his delicious food and his charming atmosphere in the restaurant. This little hotel is so special you will not want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Best staff of any hotel we have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: travel_mojo
Reviews.Content: We are an Australian couple in our 30's have been travelling around the world for 9 months and have stayed at every imaginable kind of hotel from 2* to luxury 5* and this hotel was the friendliest and best value for money that we have ever stayed at. We were made to feel entirely welcome from the moment we stepped in the door and the rooms and beds were lovingly decorated in a very modern ottoman style. Very comfy /luxurious beds and linen and the 'turkish baths' downstairs were beautiful as well as a novel addition to the hotel. There were even complemantary turrkish delight sweets in the room for us. We can't recommend this hotel strongly enough - another tip - their in hotel restaurant had among the best meals that we tasted whilst in Istanbul. We know that most people try to leave the hotel for dinner every night but - leave one night free to try their menu, it is excellent and very good value for money. Quite cheap actually for such a touristy part of town. Every member of staff was EXTREMELY friendly without being intrusive at all and they all spoke excellent english. The staff are very proud of their #1 Trip Advisor status and work extremely hard at making your experience the best it can be!! Fantastic, we will definetly return.

Reviews.Title: “Mad to stay anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: mimmiLondon
Reviews.Content: I expected a great stay after all the reviews I had read, but actually even the reviews don't do enough justice to this hotel. Yes, location is great for the old city, and yes the rooms and facilities are fantastic, yes the restaurant and breakfast is wonderful.....but it is the people that have made this the most memorable stay in a hotel we have ever had! ( and we have had a lot of stays in hotels too!) If you want attention to detail, the most wonderfuland charming staff, and the feeling that you are incredibly welcome, then this is the hotel for you. We celebrated my sons 2nd birthday whilst there, and were delighted with a very yummy cake, candles and a rousing rendition of Happy Birthday. He also received a lovely gift. We also had the fright of having to rush my son to hospital with a severe allergic reaction ( not their fault of course!) and were helped every step of the way, right down to translating medicine instructions. The staff are kind, caring, professional, and nothing is too much trouble. This beats ALL 5 star hotels I have stayed in, and service is really important when travelling with a toddler, and a fussy mummy! Saying goodbye was like saying goodbye to friends, (they all came to kiss my son goodbye, present him with another special gift, and waved us off into a taxi), and even though we liked Istanbul very much, we will be returning as much to see more of the city, as to stay at this fantastic hotel again. Pelin, Meneske and Sukara and their whole team made our 5 days unforgettable- Thank you so much everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at a bargain price”
Reviews.Author: travelingdoctorMGB
Reviews.Content: The Sirkeci Konak Hotel was delightful in every regard. After check-in, we were greeted by the lovely and fragrant Pelin, Director of Guest Services, who gave us a quick and comprehensive summary of recommended sites, closing days and times, directions, etc. The lobby is beautifully decorated with dark wood paneling and traditional Turkish ceramics and is a very inviting place to sit and enjoy the complimentary afternoon tea. Our room was large (by European standards) and quite attractive with comfortable high quality beds and pillows. Although the hotel is on a slightly shabby side street occupied by auto parts stores, the overall location is great! 500 feet to the tram station, 5 minutes to the Haggia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi, etc. The complimentary buffet breakfast offers a selection large and varied enough that you wonâ€™t get tired of it even on a longer stay. But the most exceptional aspect of our stay was the warmth and gracious hospitality of every employee we came into contact with. We received Ritz-Carlton service at a Novotel price. In summary, for this experienced traveler, the Sirkeci Konak was the best value in lodging I have ever enjoyed. I recommend it enthusiastically and unreservedly.

Reviews.Title: “Recommendation”
Reviews.Author: YungHonolulu
Reviews.Content: I want to strongly recdommendate this hotel to all friends of mine because I have been treated as one of their family members when I stay in the hotel during last Oct. the buidlding was designed so European style, the room was so clean,the ammentis are so nice and morden. the brekfast was so rich, lots of fruits, varity breads and many Turkey delights. of course, the staffs' warming services make you like belong to their family. especially, the manager Menekse, she was so patient to explain to me about the attraction area around Istanbul. I would like to recommend to all friends who want to visit Istanbul, Turkey, this hotel was a wonderful, perfect choice. becuase their staffs excellent services. I will definately go back again to visit Istanbul and stay this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What A Gem!”
Reviews.Author: cress1234
Reviews.Content: What a Gem! This was a cosy, nicely appointed hotel without the lofty Four Season prices. The rooms were cute and decorated well with good, clean bath facilities. The pool and gym were nice for a small hotel. The turkish bath was sleek and really added a nice extra demension to the whole experience. Notably, the head of guest relations, Menekse Goker, was one of the best concierges that I have ever encounted world wide. She consistently went above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable. Mapping out agendas, fufilling request and escorting my family to unknown territories. The locaton of the hotel is also great as you are situated right near the major sites and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Made Overnight a Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Jerusalembarbara
Reviews.Content: A friend and I had a single night in Istanbul on the way to Casablanca but we managed to squeeze in a lot because of the hotel location, the airport pick-up service and the help we received. The rooms are spotless and pretty with luxurious bathrooms. While we were checking in, hot apple tea was served. A staff member ran after us with a hotel umbrella when we saw we were umbrella-less. . This is a boutique hotel at very reasonable price, and gave us a good feeling about the city.

Reviews.Title: “Sirkeci Konak Hotel The Best!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: VanDerSteen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel by our travel agency. We went to Istanbul for 6 days from monday till saturday. We arrived with a taxi, it was a little bit difficult to find it, but when we are in the hotel we have had a great welcome. Everybody was very friendly and they offered us directly tea with sandwiches. The lobby and the restaurant are beuatiful and the rooms are very clean and great. When we arrived the hotel people are very helpfull. The first day when we arrived my husband had an accident. He was fallen from the stairs and he had to go to the hospital for an operation. All the time there was someone with me in the hospital from the hotel and that was MENEKSE GÃ–KER, it was good for me that she was with me. She has done very much for us these days, but also the people in the hotel were very worried and friendly. My husband and I want to tell about the kindness and help that the hotel offered us in this special situation. We also like to thank you for that. In situations like this it is good to have friendly people around you for support and advice. We thank you very much for everything that you have done for us. Be sure how much we apprecaite your service. Specialy lotts off love to MENEKÅžE GÃ–KER, I dont know what I would do without her. She is such a lovely girl. Thank you all very much indeed thank you MenekÅŸe, we would definitely return to this hotel( when my husband is in good health). THIS HOTEL IS certainly NUMBER ONE FOR US!!!!!!!!!!! With kindly regards from, Huib and Thea Van Der Steen.

Reviews.Title: “Worth its position at no.1!”
Reviews.Author: Blackeyemike
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and first class customer service! I proposed to my girlfriend while we were in Istanbul, and the guys in the hotel were brilliant. They'd booked a fantastic restaurant (Mikla) and when we got back to the room they'd put rose petals all through the room and champagne on ice. Special thanks must go to Menekse and Pelin who couldn't do enough to help - thanks guys! Facilities in the hotel are ace, rooms are spacious, turkish bath and sauna was great, and you're within walking distance of all the main attractions. Plus you get afternoon tea - with that amazing apple tea and cakes!! All in all we had a wonderful time, and i would definitely recommend the hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hospitality at Sirkeci”
Reviews.Author: Bear08London
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel based on the reviews on Tripadvisor, and we were not disappointed. The staff at this hotel go over and above the call of duty to make your stay in Istanbul memorable. In fact, the service at this hotel began before we had even arrived. I e-mailed Menekse, the guest Relations Manager before I arrived, and she went on to provide me information about the city and to suggest various tours and shows. When we arrived, we were really made to feel at home by the staff, who were always helpful and friendly. Nothing was ever too much trouble for them. The hotel is also in a very convenient location to explore the city. Great value for money - a really, really great find!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value - first class hotel”
Reviews.Author: shapma4
Reviews.Content: Had a great time in Istanbul and greatly enjoyed staying off peak n the well located Sirkeci Konak Hotel. We enjoyed a room upgrade and had a complimentary meal on our first night which was excellent. the hotel is new and clean, the staff charming. Breakfasts superb and the restaurant authentic. The Concierge staff, MENEKÅžE GÃ–KER and the lovely Pelin Nasoz couldn't have been more helpful, which we arranged a guide for day 1 (Kagan Kosagan, who can googled). The current "offers" of a 7 per cent discount for paying in cash and a free transfer from the airport were pleasing. Book direct via the website and don't be scared of turkey or the hotel - we had a number of email exchanges prior to arrival and so we felt like we almost knew Pelin before we met her. Would love to go back. Pamela & Marcus S

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, wish we could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: whethergirl
Reviews.Content: We had one night in Istanbul after returning from the Mediterranean coast, and we chose to stay at the Sirkeci Konak - I only wish we could have stayed longer! The hotel is a little difficult to find - our taxi driver went around in circles a few times - but once you find it, you won't be disappointed. The lobby and restaurant are beautiful, and the service is excellent - we were treated like celebrities from the moment we arrived. We were offered tea and complimentary sandwiches, and the concierge director sat with us and explained all the hotel had to offer - it was lovely! The hotel is built in an old Turkish home, and that is reflected in the hallways, with gorgeous wood floors and paneling. The only downside was that our room was a bit small, and looked out to a wall - there was quite a bit of traffic noise below. If we were to stay longer than one night, we would probably have upgraded to a higher room category. We had a chance to glimpse and sample the breakfast buffet on our way to the airport, and it was bountiful and beautiful - the food was delicious. And the service, from the moment we arrived to the moment we left, was impeccable. I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul : a week with a difference”
Reviews.Author: MariaSilvia
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a week in Istanbul with my husband and for the benifit of other travellers, I would like to warmly recommed our hotel, the Sirkeci Konak. We have been to Istanbul several times before and stayed at very good hotels, but this time, we found our stay very special. The room decor was elegant and descrete with great attention payed to details , bed and pillows wonderfully confortable. The breakfast table was a feast for the eyes and the palate with food rich in variety ad of high quality.The service at the table and in the room impeccable. Most of all we appreciated the courtesy and attention of all the staff. Their advice, suggestions and help made a real difference to our holiday and enabled us to discover aspects and sights of Istanbul we had neither experienced nor seen before. Thank you all very much indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality beyond expecations”
Reviews.Author: davidgardi
Reviews.Content: This hotel scores high because of its staff. While it is not comparable to a Four Seasons or other five star properties in terms of structure and luxury, the attention, kindness and homely caring that we received from the staff is something that I have never experienced anywhere else in the world. We arrived on the day of my birthday. They noticed this on my passport upon check-in. A couple of hours later, after a short walk in the city, we returned to the hotel to find that they had a cake with candles and birthday music. After blowing the candles, they gave me a present. The cake was then cut, and everybody had a piece including one of the guests that happened to be sitting on the couch in the reception. They had offered us dinner on the first night, then on the third night they took us down to the kitchen and taught us how to cook. We were then served the food in the main dining room. Again, no extra charge. The hotel is located approximately 10 minutes uphill away from the Sophia structure. The room was satisfactory for a short stay and the shower extremely powerful. The breakfast buffet was what one would expect to receive in a homely hotel. Upon checking out of the hotel, we received yet another present wrapped in paper. It was a book on Byzantine art. At this stage a thank you is not sufficient. One more thing. We forgot our hot water bottle in the hotel. I called the hotel, and they sent it by post the next day without asking for money. I normally don't write reviews, but this time it was worth the effort.

Reviews.Title: “More like staying with friends than being in a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Travellers_all
Reviews.Content: Booked a week at Sirkeci Konak for our honeymoon based on reports on TripAdvisor and others. Beautiful hotel in interesting location. Booked a top floor deluxe room with a balcony which looked directly into the gardens of the Topkapi Palace. Views up the street to Hagia Sofia, down the street to the Bosphorus. The staff could not have been more friendly or helpful. We were the 'guinea pigs' for the chef's cooking lessons now featured on the hotel's website! We would have no hesitation in returning to this fabulous hotel - if they were all like this, we would not need Trip Adviser! Many thanks to everyone especially Menekse & Pelin. Nigel & Yvonne

Reviews.Title: “it was wonderful to be there”
Reviews.Author: heinenroelien
Reviews.Content: When we arrived people welcomed us very friendly and we loved our stay there. The hotel is a good location for all touristic attractions and was very clean . Food was ok and breakfast was typical turkish.

Reviews.Title: “The best!”
Reviews.Author: SouthATravel
Reviews.Content: Great location, rooms and facilities. Exellent staff who supported us in every way. Service is very good. I am will stay here again and I will recommend the hotel to all!

Reviews.Title: “Yes... It's true!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mauricio_Prado
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Sirkeci Konak from December 30th to January 5th. And the mainly reason I've booked this hotel was the reviews from TripAdvisor... And I must say: Everything that everybody writes... It's TRUE!!! - Absolutely fantastic staff - Comfortable and modern rooms - Simply the best shower I've ever tried (I really like water pressure) - Great restaurant - Nice and cozy lobby for having teas even at 4 in the morning - Perfect location For MenekÅŸe and all the staff from Sirkeci Konak: "TeÅŸekkÃ¼r Ederim" (thank you - in turkish)

Reviews.Title: “Best ever hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: bobhYorkshire
Reviews.Content: For my job i travel the world and stay in the best hotels, i can honestly say i have never had a better hotel experience anywhere than the Sirkeci Konak in Istanbul. The staff are amazing, so welcoming , helpful and friendly, they even lay on an afternoon tea free to let you meet other guests enjoying the Istanbul adventure. Menekse the guest relations manager was actually coming to us with suggestions of what trips or visits we might enjoy nothing was too much trouble. The location is perfect for seeing all there is to see, the rooms are very clean and comfortable and Breakfast is great. As it was january we couldnt enjoy breakfast on the roof terrace but we will return to enjoy this experience which will only add to the Hotels attraction. i wouldnt hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sirkeci Konak A Great Find !!!”
Reviews.Author: efloydatty
Reviews.Content: Sirkeci Konak , Istanbul Posted Jan 6, 08 WONDERFUL FIND! This is a lovely little hotel and the staff is the most caring, friendly you can wish for. Mr. Agan and Mr. Cihan at the front office, Miss Pelin and Miss Merekse, were so helpful and made everyone feel so special. The waiters, waitresses and the porters, all great. Everyone went way beyond their duties. Now to our room - it was not large, I know they have bigger rooms, but it was neat and clean and we had a little balcony, the beds were very comfortable and we loved the bathroom - it had not only a heated towel rack, a whirlpool bath, magnifying mirror, bathrobes and slippers, the floor was heated too, which was so nice since we were there from December 23 to January 2, 2008. The hotel has a nice Hamami in the basement, where one can also have very reasonable and good massages, work out in the gym or enjoy the sauna. I want to mention Miss Pelin and Miss Merekse again, because they are untiring in making arrangements for their guests, getting reservations, making suggestions about day trips, etc. and always smiling and cheerful. It is the perfect small hotel in a convenient location and I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for families”
Reviews.Author: Eddie_Zoom
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel in Istanbul recently, and I would give the hotel an excellent rating for the following reasons: - above all, a friendly staff who go out of their way to help guests. - great facilities for families: we have a 15 yr old son and 18 yr old daughter. They loved the pool (a rarity in the neighborhood), and we appreciated having the family room layout, with the children's room (2 single beds) connected to our room (queen sized bed). This avoided having to pay for two separate rooms, a suite or having to squeeze all of us into one room - breakfast is included in the price of the room - location is 30 meters from tram stop. We found the Istanbul trams, ferries and funiculars to be the best way to get around town - proximity to key attractions in Sultanahmet district. You're within walking distance of Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Grand Bazaar, etc, as well as numerous good restaurants and cafes. There are a couple of minuses: - hotel decor is modern, boutique-style, rather than Ottoman, if this matters - hotel is located on a quiet street, but surrounded by auto parts and hardware stores. However, this is typical of properties in Sultanahmet, where neighborhoods are checkerboard. If you want glitz and modern, try Beyoglu. All in all, a great base from which to explore the many attractions of Istanbul. Hope this helps...

Reviews.Title: “Great service, room & location”
Reviews.Author: shoresofgermany
Reviews.Content: Like others we loved this hotel. Our standard rooms was very comfortable, the shower was amazing, and the location was perfect. We celebrated our 10 year anniversary with 4 nights here and loved it. The hotel restaurant served us our best meal of the entire visit, and we always enjoyed a late night drink downstairs. Can't recommend it and its staff more highly!

Reviews.Title: “deserves number1 rating!”
Reviews.Author: m0M0K
Reviews.Content: Great all round, staff, food, room, location etc Very nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul starts here!”
Reviews.Author: vandermonde
Reviews.Content: Our experience in this hotel was wonderful. From the very beginning they greeted us and made us feel comfortable. The staff was always very friendly, polite and helpful. We stayed there for a whole week and we didn't feel like strangers, actually we were very pleased to know that staying there we were always among friends. This is how they made us feel. The hotel's facilities and rooms are excellent. It's location couldn't be better, we were walking distance from the Topkapi, Hagya Sophia, and the Blue Mosque. It's also in the old part of the city so everywhere you look there's something to see. ... And don't forget about the breakfast, it's superb!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: canelle7
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews on Trip Advisor, we chose to stay at this hotel for our entire stay of a week in Istanbul. We arrived very late in the night but were welcomed by two staff members and placed in a room facing the back of the hotel. We always have the windows open for fresh air but there was a large air conditioning unit right outside the room so it made for a noisy night. Given the lenght of our stay, we requested a change of rooms and were placed in the front of the hotel. I'm not sure which was worse as we were then subjected to traffic sounds and people yelling/talking throughout the night, especially early morning. On the other hand, the staff do go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. Nothing was ever too difficult. Their sense of hospitality is over and above what we've experienced in other hotels. I had a bad case of food poisoning and asked for toast to be delivered to the room twice during our stay. Even though room service is not normally available, they happily obliged and even gave us many more pieces than we required. I would ask for 3 and receive 6, or for 2 and receive 4! The location is great. Very close to the Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Castle in one direction and the Spice Market and main bridge in the other. There is also a tram stop right outside so it is very convenient to get to Istiklal Cadesi.

Reviews.Title: “incredible service!”
Reviews.Author: smoh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sirkeci Konak on my way out of Turkey, after a weeklong stay. it was only a 24 hour visit, but the service provided was impeccable. Initally, I had stayed at the Ottoman Imperial, only a few avenues over. This location is better than advertised on the website-great local restaurants and shopping. The rooms were clean and larger than most. The value was excellent. Our reception manager personally walked us to a restaurant for lunch. I was traveling with friends and family and we arrived on my birthday. According to one of my companions, Menekse Goker (guest relations) arranged a cake, and a present from the hotel, something my travelling buddies forgot! (thanks guys). Ms. Goker is clearly born to do this job-her attention to detail and service was at the level of a five star hotel. The restaurant is actually fantastic, and our service continued to be warm and personal thorughout our stay. It was a very good experience, and I will return to the Sirkeci Konak when I visit Turkey again.

Reviews.Title: “The place to be in Istanbul !”
Reviews.Author: LeonN2EURO
Reviews.Content: As a regular business traveller to Istanbul, I used to stay at the top fivestar hotels around Taksim or Besiktas; but this time decided to stay on the other side of the Golden Horn, close to Topkapi and the Mosks. I selected Sirkeci Konak, and recommend this hotel to anyone traveller to Istanbul who appreciates quality rooms, good services, and friendly staff. The hotel is located opposite to Topkapi park, a very quiet location at night, and yet in walking distance to all known places that side of the Golden Horn. Sirkeci Konak is an experience I will never forget ! Leon.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: d0uglas
Reviews.Content: Although our stay was short, my wife and I had a fantastic experience at the Sirkeci Konak. The hotel is centrally located - only minutes on foot to the main tourist attractions (Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Spice Bazaar), but also on a side street, so not noisy at all. Service was incredible, especially the guest relations manager Menekse GÃ¶ker - we really felt at home and well looked after. The restaurant was also very good, especially when we didn't feel like wandering out into the cold for dinner (November in Istanbul isn't very warm...) All in all, a great experience, very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: zikkiyaman
Reviews.Content: We - my husband, myself and two boys ages 11 and 10 - have just returned from a week long stay at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel in Istanbul. We have never had a better time anywhere. Our stay at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel made our vacation truly special. We have never encountered such a friendly and accomodating staff, from the managers to the waiters. We felt as though we were staying with friends rather than simply paying for accomodations in a hotel. We had a family suite - two rooms with a connecting door. Each bathroom had a jacuzzi. The rooms were beautifully furnished giving them a very warm feeling. In addition, the little amenities were very nice - a dish of lokum, small vases of flowers, wonderful soaps, etc. The location could not be better for visiting the sights of old Istanbul - it is a short walk from the Topkapi Palace, Aya Sofia and the Blue Mosque, and similarly convenient to Galata Bridge, the grand bazaar and the Spice Market. Public transportation is readily available - the trolley stop is two minutes away and of course all of the water transportation is about a 5 minute walk away. If you need a taxi the hotel staff will order one for you - free of charge - and tell the driver where you need to go. They provide information and advice about what to see, restaurants, shops, etc. When my husband and I decided to go out one night to a hamam, the man at reception insisted upon calling to confirm the opening hours and the price for us. We ate at the restaurant in the hotel several times and enjoyed Turkish cuisine freshly prepared and beautifully presented. The breakfasts included a selection of freshly prepared pastries and breads, vegetables, delicious olives, fruit salad, cheeses, cold meats, jams, eggs and several hot dishes, yoghurt, cereal and other offerings. Every afternoon tea is served and the hotel staff joins the guests and provides information and answers questions. It also provides an opportunity for those guests so inclined to talk to one another. Our sons enjoyed talking to the staff and learned quite a bit of Turkish from them. They also enjoyed the pool and we enjoyed the sauna facilities. Our stay in Istanbul was greatly enhanced by staying at Sirkeci Konak Hotel - it was the most delightful hotel experience we have ever had. I would highly recommend the Sirkeci Konak to anyone planning a trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Aliciacch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sirkeci twice. the people are fantastic and the attention excelent. it is well located, close to the Aya Sofia, and the one of the train stops. Breakfast buffet is fantastic and in the afternoon you can take enjoy a free chay (cay) and canapes in the small lobby at the back. We did book a day earlier as we were arriving very early in the day. The reservation mistook 7am for 7pm the night before and sent to pick us up at the airport the night before. After the initial confusion, they placed us in a temporary room to be refreshed until our room was ready. The hotel is full of small details, the handmade soap, few turskish deligths in the evening in your room, free access to internet and delightul attention. The hotel is set on a run down street, a block away from a larger road. they can also put you in touch with a travel agency and are sure to follow up on the well being of their guests. it has a sauna and turkish bath but we never tried it. it also has a roof top restaurant but it was cold and rainy all the days we were there. We stayed in a suite with a terrace. The decoration is very pretty.

Reviews.Title: “A Jem in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: TiffanyLA
Reviews.Content: The only other thing better than seeing the sites of Istanbul, is coming home to a comfortable hotel at the end of the day. And by home, I mean the Sirkeci Konak. The boutique hotel boasts 50 beautifully furnished rooms, each with exquisite attention to detail. The bedding is plush, the facilities are immaculate, and they don't forget a personal touch with a tin of Turkish delights to welcome you on your first day. There is a complimentary morning buffet full of Turkey's bountiful offerings, including an assortment of cheeses, cold cuts, preserves, pastries, quiche and fruits...far more delectable than your traditional continental breakfast. And during afternoon tea, the owner of the Sirkeci hotels visits with each guest personally. He shares with you his philosophy that each visitor to Istanbul is a student...of culture, of history, of life. There is a full library of books available to supplement your journey, and I truly enjoyed sipping my apple tea flipping through the glossy pages of a book on Turkish architecture. Finally, nothing makes a travel experience more enriching than meeting wonderful people. The staff at the Konak are beyond friendly. They always greet you with a smile and attend to your every need without hesitation. Menekse, the Guest Relations Manager deserves special mention. She was indispensable and truly became a part of our family. I can honestly say that the Konak was one of the most enjoyable and memorable parts of my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of clothing space”
Reviews.Author: thumbelina2
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to staying at the hotel due to the other TA reviews. From my research it looked as though the Sirkeci would provide a superior stay to other hotels in the Sultanhamet area. STANDARD ROOMS The rooms are certainly newly done up but the standard rooms are very small. Approx 1 ft on one side of the bed, 1/2 ft at the end and about 3 ft the other side. For a couple it would feel very cramped. There was a small shelf on which one could fit one suitcase which halved the size of the corridor to the bathroom and a tiny cupboard with some hanging space and a safe. The only shelf was well over six ft high so not much help and apart from two small bedside tables there were no other drawers for clothing which wasn't helpful. The bed was comfortable with nice linen and synthetic pillows (other types were available on request) and a synthetic duvet. There was a small desk/vanity unit with a mirror and power socket and stool and a small chair and table and a mini bar. The bathroom was well appointed with a small marble surround for the sink and a glass screen on the bath so you could also use it as a shower. The flat screen tv had the Halmark film channel, BBC Prime and Al Jazeera (news) as the English language channels. The complimentary turkish delight was a nice touch but I was surprised to find out that the two small complimentary water bottles were for the entire duration of my six day stay!! Not particularly helpful when the tap water isnt safe to drink. Although the sheets were changed daily I noticed that bits of mud on the floor stayed throughout my stay! BREAKFAST The breakfast wasnt as extensive as I had been led to expect from the reviews. It was rather poor in comparison to other places I have stayed in. Slightly stale pastries, cereals with UHT milk, olives, yogourt, cheese and meats. I was longing for freshly cooked to order fried eggs. The only cooked breakfast was scrambled eggs with vegetables mixed in. LOCATION The hotel is down a rather decrepid side street but it is nice and quiet and only about 30 secs walk from the Gulhane tram stop. It's about 15 mins walk from the Grand Bazaar and 10 mins uphill to the Hagia Sofia and Topkapi Palace. The view from the bedroom was disappointing - straight out onto the back of another building. QUIET Fortunately the double glazing in the hotel works well and the call to prayer never woke me up although once during the day, when i had the window open, the noise was mind blowing! STAFF The staff were extraordinary welcoming and helpful. The check-in was very pleasant with a glass of apple tea and suggestions on what to see. As others have said, they treat you like family which is a nice change from other larger more impersonal hotels. Having said that, I had to wait for a week to get confirmation by e-mail that they had received my reservation. And trying to obtain confirmation that I could have a room with a bathtub instead of just a shower was a nightmare involving numerous emails, faxes and telephone calls. There is free internet in the lobby too which was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: FriscoTripper
Reviews.Content: Having heard of and read various horror stories of foreign travelers being hustled and mistreated in Turkey, I had my fair share of hesitation and anxiety upon my arrival in Istanbul for the first time. This wasn't helped by the fact that the customs agent who processed my visa at the airport reached behind her chair and put the money I gave her for my visa into her own purse and cheated me on my change. Oh great, I thought. I haven't even left the airport yet, and I've already been ripped off. How comforting it was then to emerge into the arrivals hall and see my name on a placard and a friendly smile greeting me. "Mr King? Welcome to Istanbul. I am from the Sirkeci Konak Hotel. Your car is waiting for you. Please allow me to help you with your bags." Reaching the old town and seeing the ancient city walls, the towering mosques and blue waters of the bosphorus I began to get excited. Maybe I got off to a rough start, I thought to myself. But let's hope the hotel makes up for it. Boy did it! All my cares and concerns melted away upon reaching the hotel where the staff practically fell over themselves introducing themselves and welcoming me. The hotel manager, the guest services manager, the restaurant manager, the bellman, the front desk clerk --- all made a point of coming over to me and introducing themselves, making it very clear that they were here to help make my stay comfortable and personal. Disney should send people here to learn customer care. The hotel is great. It is an old building that has been completely transformed with all the modern amenities you'd desire, plus a few extras, especially the hamam (turkish bath and pool) downstairs where I had an amazing massage. All the jet lag started to melt away... Since I booked my stay directly trough their website, they treated me to a fabulous 4-course dinner on the house. I live in San Francisco, arguably one of the world's greatest food towns, but I am telling you the cuisine of the hotel's restaurant was unreal. The meal was so good I never ate dinner anywhere else during my entire stay in Istanbul. The rooms can seem a little small at first, but they are lovely with first rate baths and turkish touches like a brass dish full of turkish delights (little nut-flavored gum drops covered in powdered sugar that are totally addictive!). The bed is every bit as comfy as a Westin Heavenly bed and the brass lamps and chandeliers combined with the muted color scheme really give you a cozy, "wow I am really in Turkey" feeling. Extra touches include a big turkish breakfast buffet with exotic cheeses, yogurts and fruits, egg dishes and a plethora of baked goods plus afternoon tea. The hotel is located in a transitional area overlooking the palace walls, a stone's throw away from the tram and within easy walking distance of the citiy's principle sights. You can't go wrong with this place. I didn't want to leave. And I credit the hotel, and principally the staff, for making me fall in love with Istanbul. The only thing I would have liked to have would be internet in the rooms, but they did have WiFi in the lobby. If your plans take you to Turkey, make sure you plan on staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: funky_cheff
Reviews.Content: I together with my girlfriend stayed at Sirkeci Konak, Deluxe room for 5 days. It was an unforgettable stay in addition to our good mood made by ourselves Sirkeci Konak and its staff added extra feeling of a small family-like atmosphere. Everyday's evening we came back to hotel like we did it at home. Staff is extremly polite and helpful. I dealed with many requests, such as restaurant booking, event inquiry and air ticket booking at 3 am. Staff always helped me without delay. Deluxe room is interiored with a taste, calm green color of bedspreads and carpet with subdued light, small table and two chairs on balcony with cats as well:). Whereas, Doubles are to small for two adults I think. Breakfast is quite diverse, and you will always find an edition of Sirkeci Konak daily news leaflet on your table with weather, main events happening this day and some new essential phrases in Turkish. We had no time to lift down to swimming pool and saunas, we just glanced over it, impression was good anyway. As I have noticed the majority of stayers at Sirkeci are Europeans, no big tourist groups, mainly couples and families. Thumbs up for Sirkeci Konak! You won't find better place to stay in Istanbul, be sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a tourist in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: msandman
Reviews.Content: The Konak Sirkeci is a small, comfortable very freindly hotel with excellent amenities, and it's perfectly located for visitors to Istanbul. It's on a narrow side street, so print a map before you leave home and show it to the taxi driver. The staff is exceptionally welcoming and helpful. If the Konak is booked, the same owners have other hotels nearby. The Konak is a 10 - 15 minute walk to Topkapi, and a bit further to Hagia Sofia and the Bue Mosque. Go right on the main road and walk to the Bosphorus ferries; walk another 10 minutes to the Galata Bridge. It's about 100 yards from the Gulhane tram stop, and the tram is a great way to get around if you don't mind crowds. The hotel has fully modern fittings -- nice bathrooms, flat screen TV, A/C. It has free WiFi, but the bandwidth is about the diameter of a straw -- it's very slow handling files, so it's not the best choice for business travelers who want fast Internet access. I had a small double, which was fine for 1 person, but couples should ask for a larger, slightly more expensive room. The hotel restaurant is quite good, with beautifully presented Turkish food.

Reviews.Title: “A cut above”
Reviews.Author: brianchang100
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin...the Sirkeci Konak is a hidden gem off of a main street in the Sultanahmet area that intimately exposes guests to the legendary hospitality of the Turkish people. Yes, it has all of the amenities that one would expect from a high end hotel, a great location, a sumptuous atmosphere, and a terrific complimentary breakfast. However, it's the personal service, fine attention to detail, and a mantra to make their guests feel at home that sets them apart from other hotels. When I had tea at the hotel (which occurs daily, for free!), the owner approached two of his guests and introduced himself. Not only did he try to get to know them, but when he learned of their itinerary, he got out maps and other materials to help them plan their time in Istanbul. It's a little sad to say that I am unaware of hotel owners who have that kind of initiative, interest, or pay that kind of attention to their guests. The hotel reception staff, servers, and other employees are uniformly skilled in what they do and always willing to help. The hotel's concierge is particularly strong, especially Menekse and Okyay. If you are tired of being treated like a number at a large hotel chain, and want to have a different and memorable experience in a cozy, warm setting, the Sirkeci Konak is it. The Sirkeci Konak is, quite simply, bÃ¼yÃ¼k (great)!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: gucio
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Clean, comfortable, new, and in good location with a tram stop 1 minute walk away. Breakfast was good but nothing out of the ordinary. The staff was welcoming and we were greeted with Turkish apple tea. The pool, sauna, and Turkish bath located in the hotel basement were really nice and it was ideal for relaxation after a long day walking around town. Two elevators service the hotel. WiFi is available, althought coverage was spoty in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Turkish Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: riever07
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in November and were most impressed by this hotel: the location overlooking the gardens of Topkapi Palace is within easy reach of the main sites in Sultanahmet, the hotel amenities and the service are excellent, the generous buffet breakfast was delicious, afternoon tea with the Guest Relations Manager, Menekse, was a welcome bonus and dinner superb. However, it is the staff who are all so amazingly helpful and friendly that make staying here such a memorable experience - real Turkish hospitality! We look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “finest hospitality”
Reviews.Author: patrick023
Reviews.Content: From the moment you walk into this new hotel, you are greeted with warmth and personal attention. It is perfectly situated for those who wish to explore the sights of Sultanahmet. The breakfast is excellent and tea is provided in the lobby at 4pm. Staff could not be more friendly or helpful. A Guest Relations Manager really does care about guests and their experience of both the hotel and the city. The rooms are very comfortable. This is an exceptionally well priced hotel - part of the group that owns the Orient Express Hotel where i stayed a few years ago which I also enjoyed but this is even better. I could not recommend a better base for an exploration of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel In Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Rarasadie
Reviews.Content: Hands down, if you're traveling to Istanbul, this is the ONLY place to stay. Aside from all the great ammenities, the staff here are most gracious & accomodating, and they made our entire group feel right at home from the moment we arrived. In particular, Ms. Menekse Goker had a very warm & welcoming way about her which is so seldom seen in the larger hotels and we were very grateful for all the assistance she provided us in making our trip to Istanbul an unforgettable one.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Isabel08
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely wonderful from the rooms to the fantastic breakfast. We had a deluxe room which was quite large and a huge bathroom which you don't usually find in Europe. The price included the breakfast and it was great. What makes this hotel special in addition to price, etc. in my opinion is their customer service. They cannot do enough for you. The entire staff was warm considerate and made us feel so welcome . It was such an enjoyable experience. and one we won't forget. . The hotel is located in close proximity to all attractions which is a plus. Everything including the Topacki Palace and the Grand Bazaar are within a short 10 minute walk. Overall I would definitely reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: RubyGooyer
Reviews.Content: Just back from the wedding of a friend in istanbul. In search of a hotel I came along Sirkeci. Looked very nice.. and it was! First thought it was full but on Expedia it still could be booked. Very good service, nice people. All hard working. Great beds! In the center of the "nice and easy" part of Istanbul. By foot all is within reach. After a long day walking/seeing/etc. relaxing in the lobby. Even took the full body massage (very much needed after so many walks in such a crowded city). Also nice pool. Taxi drivers are all crazy (but handy if you want to be on time), even at night they go full throttle through the crowds. Be sure they put on the meter! And I wouldn't be Dutch to not critisize the coffee. Maybe Nespresso next time? Maybe some Dutch cheese too? Rest me to wish the new couple all the best and all of the team Sirkeci; Thank You. (Ofcourse special thanks to Ms. MenekÅŸe GÃ¶ker) Ruby Gooyer

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hydester
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel whose main qualities are the warmth of the welcome, the new, clean & happy atmosphere in a very busy city that can seem oppressive & proximity to the main tourist attractions (Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque & Haghia Sophia mosque ). For mid-range budget I can't imagine a better place to stay

Reviews.Title: “An honest review”
Reviews.Author: Dtomlinson
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Sirkeci Konak. A free transfer from the airport was offered for bookings of 3 nights or more. We booked a deluxe balcony room on the 4th floor. The room was beautiful, clean and well equipped with some extras (bottled water, tea pot, robes etc.). The balcony is a good size and overlooks Gulhane park. A very comfortable rollaway bed was provided for our son and there was still plenty of space in the room. Friends had a double and a twin room. These rooms are nicely furnished, but much, much smaller. Go with the deluxe rooms here. The restaurant has excellent food. The chef offered us a complimentary cooking class one evening. The pool is small, but adequate. The hot tub was not operating during our visit. The Turkish bath is nice. The guest relations personnel are friendly and welcoming. Tea and light snacks are offered nightly from 5pm to 6pm, but juice for the children is not included. Restaurant recommendations were limited and focused on sister hotels rather than local restaurants. The hotel is convenient to the Gulhane tram stop and about a 10 minute walk uphill to Sultanhamet. The neighborhood felt safe day and evening.

Reviews.Title: “The one place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: joeyjojo_23
Reviews.Content: We were on a cheap holiday and were originally booked into a 'sister' hotel. Upon arrival at the sister hotel we were told we were upgraded to th Sirkeci Konak - not only were we up graded but we were in one of their premier suites! My husband and I loved it - the staff were amazing, the food was astounding - a huge range of traditional foods were on offer. It was a wonderful menu. The rooms were perfect, beautifully designed and incredibly clean. We loved the Sirkeci Konan and next time we are in Istanbul will be the only place we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Yes. This is a truly excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: CupCaketheBold
Reviews.Content: What others have written about the Sirkeci Konak is true - excellent facilities and amenities, warm hospitality, friendly and helpful staff, good rooms with everything you could wish, totally magnificent and amazing breakfast. The restaurant serves a range of Turkish ethnic foods from across the country. We ate there on four out of our seven nights, because it offered some beautifully cooked and presented food, in a range of styles and types - we prefer that variety. The location on an ordinary road opposite shops selling engine parts in not wonderful, but that is a bonus because the road outside is relatively quiet, and once inside what is on offer is as good as it is possible to imagine for the reasonable price. However the general location of the hotel opposite the walls of the park around the Topkapi Palace, near the station, and at the heart of one of the most interesting areas is excellent. Nearby tram stop, and easy walking distance of most of the top ten sites. Any cautions or hesitations? No. The only thing to watch is that the wall between our bathroom and the next door bathroom was VERY thin. So while in the bathroom (but not in the room) there was an interesting range of conversation coming through the wall, plus other "bathroom" noises!! But we rather liked this!

Reviews.Title: “Excellence at its Best!”
Reviews.Author: FijidiverOntario
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Istanbul and our stay at Sirkeci Konak Hotel made it that much more special. The service provided by everyone in the hotel was top-notch, our room was beautiful and the hotel location could not be better. We knew we had made the right choice when, upon entering the hotel, we were directed to a comfortable lounge where we were offered some snacks and delicious apple tea, instead of having to stand in line for the next available check in agent. We were checked in without having to leave the lounge - an excellent service when you consider we had just travelled from Canada and were a bit weary. Thank you to all the staff at Sirkeci Konak Hotel for making our stay extremely special. CM - Toronto

Reviews.Title: “superb service = sirkeci konak hotel”
Reviews.Author: mr_los_angeles
Reviews.Content: well here is the hotel low-down, it's great! good location. good accommodations. good price. and the most remarkable asset of the hotel, is the staff. they are incredible! they are all very friendly, exceptionally knowledgeable, and always helpful in every way....especially menekse, the superb guest relations manager. this hotel is a gem and i highly recommend it for a stay in istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A superb guest experience”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaOnTheGoGal
Reviews.Content: I was in Turkey on business and decided to stay one night in Istanbul to see the sghts. Since I was on my own, I wanted to find a location that was in close walking proximity to major attractions, had a good restaurant, and work out/pool/sauna facilites. Given that the property was a top Trip Advisor selection, I knew this would be a good choice. Sirkeci Konak not only met, but exceeded my expectations. I am in hotels well over 150 days per year, so I have a base for comparison. The staff was professional, informative and friendly. The warmth and personal attention was far beyond a standard surface level of politeness one experiences on average. These folks really make you feel comfortable. As a solo traveler, they made me feel right at home. Luxury service and accomodations within my budget. Of particular note is A Okay at the desk, who arranged my airport pick up and provided a smooth check in and out. Upuk Galiskan, wait staff in the restaraun, assisted me with my menu selection and provided suggestions on what to see in the city. A true example of the hospitality and attention was a bell staffer, Sukre Araz, who walked with me to a local electronics store to find an adaptor. Because of his assistance, I was able to quickly recharge my camera and phone (essentials). The food was very good. (dinner and breakfast). Service excellent. I loved the polished, elegant look and feel to this hotel. My room was comfortable and elegant with hardwood floors, quality linens with lavender sachets, olive oil soaps, tasteful wall coverings, and a flat screen TV. My room had a wonderful view of the palace grounds. I also am very sensitive to room and street noise, and this room was very quiet. The location of other hotels looked to be troublesome for sounds. A short walk to all the sights. You can take a short cut through a cobblestone path to the palace entrance. I spent the evening utilizing the pool, turkish bath and sauna. The facilites were well supllied and very clean. My only regret was my stay was too short. I plan to return soon. Of f the charts in my view.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem of a hotel to visit Istanbul from”
Reviews.Author: Sasitraveller
Reviews.Content: Family with 2 teenage girls, we wanted a hotel that gave us the service of a big hotel but not the prices! The Sirkeci Konak was all that and more. Friendly efficient staff, fab facilities as the Turkish bath and swimming pool are in house and more than comfortable rooms with lovely bathrooms. We intially had a problem with our rooms the day we arrived, but the situation was dealt with extremely professionally by Jehan at Reception. Guest relations lady is very friendly, competent and always has a good address for you, be it a restaurant or an outing. The food at the in-house restaurant is very tasty. Centrally located in the Old City, the hotel is a 10 min walk from the Hagia Sophia. Deluxe rooms are highly recommended. Only area for improvement would be the cleanliness of the street on which the hotel is and perhaps providing customers new to Istanbul with more support if they're using public transport (have some tram, metro and funicular jetons handy). All in all, we'd happily return to the Sirkeci Konak when next in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service at 3 Star Prices!”
Reviews.Author: Experience_Bliss
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 days in fabulous Istanbul, and one of the highlights was the lovely Sirkeci Konak hotel. It is centrally located, within walking distance or short tram ride to the major sites (Palace, Blue Mosque). Upon entering the hotel, you are greeted warmly by the friendly bell staff and given some hot apple tea (fabulous on a cold day). The staff then carries your bags to your room (a luxury that we did not experience in more expensive hotels). The room itself was beautiful - the hotel must have been recently refurbished - very comfortable bed, nice crown molding, comfortable and updated bath, and beautiful rich gold wall paper. Lovely. But there's more. The friendly and helpful guest relations manager - Menekse - goes out of her way to learn about you and what you would like to experience in Istanbul. She then helps you with all the arrangements or directions, and checks up each day to see if the service you received was good and how she can help with additional plans. In all of my travels, Menekse stands out as the best conceriege I have experienced. There's even more - all of the add-on services that are no additional charge: best breakfast in Istanbul, afternoon tea with snacks, free internet in your room, plus an additional laptop that guests can use in the lovely "tea" area, a Turkish bath (hammam), steam room and work out area. I loved this hotel and would definately stay here again in the future. One piece of advice - ask the hotel for directions from the airport - our cab driver had a hard time finding it. Istanbul is amazing. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding and Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: yogazone
Reviews.Content: I just got back from staying at this wonderful hotel in Istanbul. I travelled there with my husband and three children. I can only say that this hotel is a must! The staff are incredibly helpful, friendly and generous. They helped organise tours, and helped us navigate around the city. The hotel itself is gorgeous and the rooms are beautiful. The breakfast was fantastic and my son enjoyed all the Turkish delight and halva each and every morning!! The location is great and very accessible to the trams and walking distance to all the sights. If you are planning a trip to Istanbul I would highly recommend this hotel! We are already planning our next trip back to Istanbul and will be staying at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel and Hospitality in its location”
Reviews.Author: MineKrdl
Reviews.Content: I must tell you about the most Magnificent trip I have ever taken, my husband and I decided to travel Ä°stabul. We wanted to stay in the old city as its closed to the TopkapÄ± Palace, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia etcâ€¦ Everything was absolutely fantastic from the start. During our checked in we had an apple tea and then the guest relation manager greeted like she had known us for many years with a warm smile. She gave us the map of Historical Peninsula and some great recommendations for the area. The pictures on the website meet the reality. Staying in a Sirkeci Konak is a unique feeling that you feel like you are at your home. All of the staff are so friendly and went out of their way to please us. Especially special thanks to Mrs Menekse, the guest relation manager, she is so helpful and knowledgeable about everything. She is always ready to help you. I also would like to mention the breakfast they serve in the hotel is great. I would like to thank you to this hotel for making my dream come true and I would definetely canâ€™t wait for my stay in Sirkeci Konak again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service & Position”
Reviews.Author: Stewartl
Reviews.Content: Date 14 October 2007 I was in Istanbul on business accompanied by my wife and spent 2 night at an airport conference hotel (a totaly different experience) . Extending our stay we had booked the Erboy hotel off the internet. Based on reviews and location. We arrived at the Erboy on Thursday early afternoon to be told we had been upgraded and relocated. (same price). Panic time!!! However when a bell boy was summoned to carry our cases we knew it could not be too far - relief!. We were then taken to the Sirkeci Konak. Checking in involved tea and meeting the 'Customer Service Manager' The facilties were described - free sauna, pool, turkish bath (massage extra reservation required). Internet was available in the lobby with wi fi in the rooms. The room we were allocated was one of the smaller and with no view but this did not bother us. Much better rooms were apparantly available for a small charge. Service was very friendly if not quite 'joined up' It would however be difficult to fault for effort. Breakfast was extensive with attentive service. This was, I understand, the top of the range of the groups hotels but if the service we received reflected the groups philopsophy then they may have got it right. There was room for improvements but to raise them after our return would be petty.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - A+ Service and Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Synthizen
Reviews.Content: Not all 5 star hotels are created equal. There are good ones, and there are *great* ones. Quality of service almost always makes the difference. This holds true for the Sirkeci Konak, a cozy and comfortable boutique elevated to â€œGreat 5 Starâ€� status by its kind and helpful staff. Highlights of the recently renovated Konak are its attractive interior design (mixing historic with modern), strong attention to detail, high-quality craftsmanship, well appointed rooms with designer-tiled bathrooms, flavorful menu, a long list of amenities for a boutique (including onsite Turkish bath), and excellent location close to the best historic monuments -- and all without so much as a hint of stuffiness. Yet, it is the staff and their unwavering hospitality, professionalism and graciousness that elevate the Konak to greatness. This is a team that has mastered the art of the welcome. They not only made my hotel stay effortlessly enjoyable, they were instrumental in making my trip to this immense, historic treasure-trove of a city unforgettable. Tip: Immediately after you check in, seek out Menekse Goker, the hotelâ€™s guest relations manager. As Iâ€™m sure many on TripAdvisor have pointed out before me, Menekse is a travelerâ€™s dream come true. Her warm smile puts you immediately at ease, and her expert recommendations on where to go, what to see, and what to eat will -- within minutes -- have your itinerary packed full of the greatest Istanbul has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “D.McDonald, Dublin, Ireland."Best Hotel to Sample Turkish Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: IrishMosafer
Reviews.Content: We were picked up at Ataturk Airport by Hotel transport. The Hotel is located on a quite side street five minutes walk to Topkapi Palace. It is brand new but has old world traditional atmosphere and decor. Comfy furnishings in the lobby and restaurant. Beautiful colour glass atrium in the lounge area. We got a warm reception on arrival. Our spotless room was very spacious - wooden floors, Turkish rug, and pretty drapes with pristine white bed linen. Marble and tile bathroom with powerful shower and Jacuzzi-bath, fluffy white towels, bathrobes and slippers. Great selection of quality toiletries. If you really want to relax try the Sauna, Jacuzzi and Hotel Pool. Dinner then in the stylish restaurant. Tasty food and friendly helpful staff. Start the morning with a huge buffet breakfast. The proprietor Mr: Faruk is very much in attendance and his gracious hospitality went way and beyond the call of duty. We wish him every success with the Sirkeci Konak Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My appreciation of Konak hotel and the staff”
Reviews.Author: UDOGERTHILDKOSEL
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had booked into the Sirkeci Konak Hotel through a German travel agency sÃ­nce we had no experience with Turkish hotels so far. Sailing the Turkish coast from Bodrum to Kemer and in this year to Cypress and back to Antalya I felt tempted to visit the approx. 3000 year old city Istambul something we had planned for years. This year we made it happen and my wife flew into Istambul from Germany to meet me for some 10 days Â´stay in this fantastic historical place - once East Rome, then Byzantion, and finally since 1453 the Islamic Centre - one of the trade hubs of the world- a treasure of culture. The first contact after managing the transfer from the airport was the Konak Hotel where we were welcomed very cordially and extremely well serviced: All persons of the staff did a wonderful job to make us feel at home. In particular the guest relations manager Menekse Goker - a young lady talented to combine her oriental charme with an english style education gave us ample information and insight in the city and its historical and other important places. Given this chance we collected a multitude of experiences and dare say we got more than a first sight impression. We found it extremely nice and thoughtful of Miss Goker to present us with a cooking book of "Turkish Cuisine" since we showed interest in different meals of the local type - as we always do when abroad. Also- the top manager - Mr. Faruk - spared much time to indoctrinate us in so many interesting things of Istambul life. We appreciated the many talks we had together. And we followed the advices given to see museums, to do special tours etc. Not to mention that the hotel is excellent, the room, the facilities incl. a turkish bath .... and all persons of the hotel we learned to like very much. So this our first visit to Istambul was a real highlight -much of the glory goes to the hotel and we like express our gratitude. Thank you all! The next years we plan to come to Istambul with all our 3 daughters provided they accept our invitation and have no other plan. And then it is 100 % clear that we book your hotel again. As soon as we have recovered the photos we made we send you some. best regards Gerthild & Udo Kosel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jarovnice
Reviews.Content: I can say SIRKECI KONAK HOTEL is the best boutigue hotel I have ever stayed in Turkey. Once we arrived at the hotel, everything was absolutely perfect. From the doors to the front desk we were greeted by employees like they had known us for many years. / Welcome Home / Especialy we would like to thank Miss MENEKSE GOKER for her kindness and assistance during our stay. It felt as though we were in our home, such was the helpfulness and warmth with which she greeted us and was available for every query. Sirkeci Konak Hotel is situated in the heart of an area, the hotel is within 10 minutes walking distance from the main attractions of the historical peninsula as Topkaky Palace, Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia so it was very convenient for myself and my husband to walk around. The service in Sirkeci Konak is also magnificent. Staff are so friendly, courteous, they are ready to help you. Inside the hotel you should definitelly try the real Turkish cousine. I must say the food was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Anthea09
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in Sirkeci Konak Hotel during the last week of september 2007. The hotel is excellent located to visit several important tourist attractions. The surrounding of the Gulhanepark is very peaceful compared with other parts of the city. We have much appreciation for the support, dedication and enthousiasm of Menekse, the guest manager and Faruk, the hotelowner. During long talks they showed their big love for the City of Istanbul, her citizens and guests. We can strongly recommend this hotel for everybody who wants to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: rae45
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Sirkeci-Istanbul, we were warmly welcomed, seated, served Turkish or Apple Tea. Menekse and her assistant explained what was available to us in the hotel and as tourist sites. That set the tone for our entire stay. Hason was always ready with information and help for computer needs. He could not have been nicer. While we did not get to spend time with the front desk people, they were always courteous and helpful. Each room was beautiful. The Sirkeci was our favorite hotel of the trip ( 5 others) and our favorite hotel ever. Again we cannot say enough complimentary things about Menekse, her assistant and Hason. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Goes Above and Beyond to Provide a Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: LuluSF
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sirkeci Konak for five days when we first arrived in Turkey and for the last three days at the end of our travel time in Turkey. It was a great stay. The rooms are very pretty with fresh flowers and turkish delight as an extra treat. The beds are super comfortable. Their breakfast buffet was by far the best that we had during our three week trip in Turkey. It was so substantial that you could skip lunch, if you wanted. But really what sets this hotel apart is the staff. They are warm, welcoming and helpful. Meneske, the customer service manager, goes above and beyond, to make your trip special. I am a knitting fanatic and really wanted to buy some yarn in Turkey. I mentioned this to Meneske when we first arrived and when I returned for my second visit, she had researched places for me to go. But not only researched them, but she took me to them. This involved a trip to the yarn district near the Spice Bazaar and then when they didn't have what I wanted, she spoke to the yarn vendors and off we on a tram to the industrial part of Istanbul. It was a great adventure where I gained an entire suitcase full of yarn. Many thanks to Meneske for her translation and negotiating skills.

Reviews.Title: “You Feel at Home at Sirkeci Konak”
Reviews.Author: KimmiG
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sirkeci Konak for 6 nights during my first trip to Turkey and was absolutely amazed by the service and attentiveness of the entire staff. The hotel itself is quite nice - it offers all modern amenities but still maintains that feel at home charm; a perfect balance of east and west. But what makes your stay extremely special is that they have the best guest relations manager ever! Meneske, the guest relations manager, and Petek (the previous Guest Relations Manager) made me feel like I was family, instead of a guest. I had numerous questions and requests prior to arrival, and I got thorough detailed responses to each and every one of them in a prompt manner. Then when I arrived at the hotel, Meneske went out of her way to show me Istanbul "off the beaten path" - and I had a blast! Everyone else at the hotel was also committed to ensuring both myself and my mom were comfortable and taken care of. We had the hotel arrange dinner reservations and their recommendations were always fantastic. Lastly, they also offer a breakfast spread that is unmatched anywhere else, as well as tea and snacks around 4/430! My only complaint would be that they work with a tour company which offers tours and not all the guides have mastered English (though they are extremely nice, you dont get the full history and understanding you would have hoped for). However, other than that, I would rate this hotel a 10 out of 10 every time - esp. as long as Meneske is the Guest Relations Manager! I would recommend it to anyone going to Istanbul..as it is everything you could want in a hotel and then some (and its close to the sights!).
